Description Join a world class organization in a new role as ACS IT Effectiveness Leader within Honeywell Automation & Control Solutions (ACS) Division. Honeywell was once again listed on Fortune magazine March 2010 edition as one of the most admired and inventive companies. Learn more about us at www.honeywell.feedroom.com Honeywell Automation and Control Solutions (ACS) is an automation and control company providing customers with solutions that are responsive to their expectations for quality and delivery. Our products and solutions deliver productivity, comfort, safety and reliability to customers around the world in industry, retail and residential settings. ACS is 1 of 4 divisions of Honeywell International with annual revenues of $14 billion. As ACS IT Effectiveness Leader, you will be in a highly visible, collaborative, and strategic position. You will partner with the ACS SBU IT Effectiveness Leaders, Honeywell Information Technology Services (HITS), and Corporate functions to develop and implement common processes, tools, solutions, training materials, and strategic programs that enable IT to deliver increasing value as a business partner. To be successful in this role, you will demonstrate the following behaviors: The preferred location is the ACS corporate headquarters in Golden Valley, Minnesota; however, this position can be based near a major ACS location within the United States. - Solid relationship management and collaboration skills - Results orientated self starter - Ability to influence others to achieve desired / agreed solution - Ability to conceptualize and communicate problems and solutions - Strong business partnering mindset - Excellent process mindset - Solid communication skills (verbal & written) - Continuous improvement mindset Responsibilities in this role include: You will partner with the SBU (strategic business units) ITE Leaders and CP/S organization to implement recommendations from the Hackett Benchmark study and the "Improving the Customer Experience" VOC. Areas of focus: CP/S Deployments, Service Delivery, Communications, and Innovative & Value Added Solutioning - Co-lead / Support the Software Lifecycle Management and Application Rationalization Programs. - Develop on-line training material for the IT Function that increases the skill sets of IT Employees and value provided to the business - Ensure process alignment with CP/S and integration into the IT Common Processes - Review and revise IT Common Processes to ensure desired business benefits and objectives are being realized - Lead the One-Stop-Shop web site re-design. Partner with HITS to leverage their portal where possible to eliminate redundancy - Develop and implement an effective IT communication strategy that provides timely and effective communications - Lead and participate in efforts to improve the IT Customer Experience. Support targeted 15% year-over-year improvement - Support IT Functional Transformation initiative via overall Program Management. Prepare monthly and quarterly status reports - Support the development of the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and Five Year Strategic Plan (STRAP) - Maintain application monitoring metrics. Partner with the application owner to identify root causes and corrective action plans - Represent ACS at Corporate IT Effectiveness Council - Support ACS in achieving compliance with Corporate on-line training programs Key Success Factors: Specific expectations during next 6 months: - Develop working relationships with SBU / SBG IT Effectiveness Leaders - Develop an understanding of the IT landscape in ACS and opportunities to drive improvement initiatives Please note: Relocation benefits are not included with this position. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: - Bachelors degree in Business or Management Information Systems. - 8 or more years of experience in information technology with global focus. - 5 or more years of experience in successfully leading six sigma or lean initiatives. Preferred Qualifications: - Graduate degree preferred - Certification in at least two of the following areas: Project Management, Six Sigma, and Lean - Demonstrated results in leading complex programs and developing solutions to complex business problems - Results orientated self starter - Solid understanding of Six Sigma, Lean, Project Management, and VOC tools and methodologies - Strong business partnering and collaboration mindset - Effective communication skills (verbal & written) - Solid PC skills, (Excel, Access, Power Point) - Effective leadership, influencing, and mentoring skills - Ability to develop solutions to complex problems and obtain approval - Ability to work effectively in a matrix environment with virtual teams, and to influence action. - Continuous improvement mindset - Ability to synthesize vast amounts of data into actionable information To apply for the position, please visit www.careersathoneywell.com and enter requisition 00154714. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Honeywell is committed to a diverse workforce. Keywords: "organizational effectiveness", lean, "six sigma", IT, "information technology", global Job : Information Technology Primary Location : USA-MN-Golden Valley Other Locations : USA-IL-Chicago, USA-NJ-Morristown, USA-AZ-Phoenix Education Level : Bachelors Degree Travel : Yes, 10% of the time Relocation Available : No

Description We are building a world thats safer and more secure . . . More comfortable and energy efficient . . . More innovative and productive? We are Honeywell. Honeywell International is a $30-billion diversified technology and manufacturing global leader. Honeywell has more than 120,000 employees in 95 countries around the world. Honeywell has a demonstrated heritage of both innovation and achievement. The Automation & Control Solutions (ACS) Division of Honeywell is driving the revolution of its business and the industry. ACS provides products and services that give their customers the power to create and control efficient, safe, comfortable environments. This $10-Billion enterprise offers controls for heating, ventilating, and air conditioning; security systems, fire alarm systems, and energy management systems for all indoor environments. From home thermostats to large commercial building management systems, services, and controls, Honeywell ACS is clearly a global leader. The Alerton/Trend Dealer business is worth about $55 million and has approximately 200 Dealers throughout the world. The role of Customer Service Lead is an exciting opportunity to join an expanding team focused on the delivery of exceptional customer support to our Dealer Channels The Customer Service Lead is responsible for providing exceptional customer service for the Alerton/Trend Dealer Business for Honeywell Environmental & Combustion Controls (ECC). In this role your responsibilities will include: - Respond to customer calls, emails, faxes regarding order inquiry as to ship dates, problems, order changes, repairs and RMAs. Communicate with other departments such as Repair Technicians, Shipping, Manufacturing, Regional Sales Managers, Product Managers, etc., to resolve customer issues. Recommend improvements in work-flows and procedures. Create, maintain and document work-flow processes - Enter customer orders into ERP system from a variety of sources such as faxes and web orders. Maintain order accuracy with changes to ship dates, order contents, ship method, etc. Recommend improvements in work-flows and procedures. Create, maintain and document work-flow processes - Administer letters of credit, wire transfers and other forms of foreign payments. Prepare proper documentation for International orders to include pro-forma invoices, shipping documents, packing lists, and letter of credit required documents - Enter Return Material Authorization requests into ERP system from a variety of sources such as faxes and emails. - Answer overflow calls from automated attendant and direct to appropriate person or department. - Write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. - Present information and respond to questions from groups of managers and customers. - Sufficient skills in writing, speaking and listening to communicate moderately complex topics clearly and concisely. - Occasionally deal with difficult individuals or situations with calmness and professionalism. - Work with sensitive corporate information with high degree of discretion and professionalism. - Work with fundamental mathematical concepts. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios and proportions to practical situations. - Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form. Think with and demonstrate sound analytical reasoning and problem solving - Make progress on (and complete) multiple projects, some under supervision, others without significant supervision; negotiate and meet deadlines. Create and maintain well-organized documentation. - Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: - High school diploma. - 3 years minimum of Customer Service experience in a manufacturing environment. Additional Qualifications: - Associates Degree or higher preferred. - Excellent verbal and written communication skills. - Excellent attention to detail . - Must work well with others; both individually and in groups. - Ability to analyze and report preparation with current versions of MS Office (Excel, Word, Outlook). - SAP experience preferred. Honeywell has been selected as one of the Most Admired Companies in the world by Fortune magazine. To apply for this position, please go to www.careersathoneywell.com, and enter requisition #00145682 As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Honeywell is committed to a diverse workforce. Honeywell has been selected as one of the Most Admired Companies in the world by Fortune magazine. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Honeywell is committed to a diverse workforce. *About the Role:* * * As a "Trusted Advisor", a Resident Support Account Manager will foster strong relationships between McAfee and its customer and will be relied upon to provide advice and recommendations, based upon their own experience and expertise, for McAfee products across all levels of an organization. The RSAM will be an on-site McAfee resource, dedicated to the needs of one customer. They serve as a customer advocate to support the proper functioning of McAfee products deployed throughout the organization. They coordinate the McAfee team and resources needed to resolve issues that prevent the proper operation of products in production. With a goal to support continued renewals and product purchases, they will think strategically and recognize opportunities for revenue generation and competitive displacement, and share that information with their Sales team. *Key Responsibilities:* * Customer Advocacy o Monitor and manage each of their customers' issues daily with emphasis on progressing cases towards resolution and having the appropriate resources involved o Collaborate, communicate and coordinate with customers, Product Specialists, Tier III, Development and Management as required to ensure customers' satisfaction o Provide weekly status update summary to the customer for all of their current open issues and copy the customer's sales representative on those updates o Represent customers' interest when they need a patch, hotfix or FMR at all levels within our organization o Provide customer with proactive communication regarding program information, supportability issues and strategic product plans. o Help identify, recommend, and implement improvements in existing processes and procedures related to the proper functioning of McAfee products. * Business Advocacy o Provide information to update the Customer Hotlist / Watchlist entries weekly or as status changes o Ensure internal and customer service level agreements are met for all issues o Assist in maintaining effective and efficient communication between customers, sales, McAfee management, and Product Specialists o Provide customers with monthly and quarterly Executive Summary Reports and host conference calls as needed for the customer and McAfee virtual team to discuss past or current issues. Work with the customer during these sessions to establish customer agreement with severity and impact assigned to issues. o Communicate customer's case escalations after theses sessions to management so they can be presented to Tier III for inclusion on escalations to development o Maintain personal technical competency level of McAfee products deployed suitable to clearly understand customer issues and to facilitate effective resolution o Work with the customer and provide product reports as required. o Review product configuration and advise on best practices when required * Must Have Experience Supporting McAfee Product Line. * Minimum five years applicable experience, of those three years must be experience in relationship or customer management in a technical environment with named or dedicated accounts. * Experience in management of technical projects requiring coordination of various resources for successful outcome. * Strong working knowledge of the McAfee Security product line. * Bachelors Degree from an accredited institution, especially in computer science, mathematics, or a related field, is required * CompTIA Security, CISSP, PMP, and/or CISM Certification preferred and possibly required for continued employment * Strong knowledge of data security hardware, software, and management platforms with an understanding and emphasis on installation, troubleshooting, upgrading, integration, and maintenance of client/server operations is desired * Excellent written and verbal communication skills * Strong personal interaction, presentation and telephone interaction skills at the business professional services level * Strong personal computing skills in Windows 2000/XP and Windows Server 2003. * Ability to multitask and prioritize job requirements in a dynamic environment. * Ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance may be required **Job:** **General* **Title:** *Resident Support Account Manager - Honeywell* **Location:** *Arizona, Phoenix* **Requisition ID:** *773328*

About Dallas Airmotive Tracing its origins to 1932 at Dallas Love Field, Dallas Airmotive, a BBA Aviation company, got its start repairing and overhauling aircraft piston engines. Today Dallas Airmotive focuses on servicing turbine engines used by business and general aviation, government, military, airline and rotor wing operators around the world. As a leading independent OEM-authorized turbine engine repair and overhaul organization, we have forged bonds with turbine engine manufacturers that go back more than 60 years. Working with these OEMs, we are proud to have developed many of the repair and overhaul techniques that are standard in the industry today. Over the years, we have continued to add engine authorizations, services and capabilities that encompass the majority of turbine-powered business and general aviation aircraft flying today, with support that extends to every corner of the globe. If you are looking for a rewarding career with a time-tested leader in the aviation industry, we encourage you to apply for this challenging and gratifying career opportunity by clicking APPLY ONLINE above. Job Summary: This position is responsible for senior level sales support activities, preparation of engine proposals, technical knowledge, and customer coordination in support of the Regional Engine Managers sales efforts for the Honeywell program. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: (Not listed in order of importance. Other duties may be assigned.) 1. Provides technical review of engine logs in order to accurately asses the requirements in order to prepare sales proposals for Honeywell engines. 2. Maintain appropriate files, both electronically (CRM) and paper, in order to track status and report data to Territorial Sales Directors for forecasting purposes. 3. Maintain positive and effective contact with customers, brokers, agents and others to enhance opportunities for new and continuing business development. 4. Tracks and prepares appropriate documentation for fuel concessions on a monthly basis. 5. Coordinates activities for certain major accounts as directed by appropriate sales director. 6. Provide technical support for the Honeywell program regarding specifics to service bulletins, life limited component status and other technical questions as they arise. 7. Provide technical data, from sales proposals, to operating groups to ensure proper workscopes are maintain through out the process. 8. Assist in training of other team members ensuring best practice standards are maintained. 9. Identify opportunities for improvement processes, in working practices and team efficiency. 10. Adhere to the Company's proprietary information protection policies. 11. Maintain positive working relationships with all internal departments and attend meetings if requested, when department representation is required 12. Assist customers with obtaining satisfactory information as delegated/authorized. 13. Provide coordination of customer visits to ERO facilities and entertainment while customers are on site. Formal Education/Training: College degree (Associates or Bachelor's) or high school graduate with technical/sales training and knowledge normally achieved through graduation from a university or vocational program. Direct /Indirect Experience: Should have a minimum of three to five (3-5) years sales/service related experience in the aviation services industry. Qualifications: (Including Licenses and Certifications) Must possess effective written and verbal communications skills, especially since a great deal of contact is by telephonic or electronic means. Must be able to demonstrate PC proficiency in MS Word and Excel as well as to learn any corporate or industry software used by the position, such as CHAMPS or equivalent systems. Should have a good working knowledge of sales and customer service techniques. Accounts Payables and/or purchasing experience is helpful. Fluency in Spanish is a plus. Physical And Mental Demands: Normal work is performed in an office environment: may exert up to (50-70) pounds of force infrequently to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects. Work involves walking, sitting, or standing for various periods of time. Near clarity of vision required for close up chart/document analysis. Reaching: extending hands and arms in any direction. Handling: seizing, holding, grasping, turning or otherwise working with hand(s). Talking: expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word to impart oral information to convey detailed spoken instruction to other workers, customers or agents accurately, loudly or quickly. Hearing: effectively perceiving the nature of sounds by ear. Mental: The job requires diligence/attention in performing duties under normal mental stresses commonly associated with detailed, often high value sales work, solving various customer issues, often in a time sensitive environment using sound knowledge of products and industry practices. Work Environment : (The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.) Most work is performed in an office environment. However, the environment includes occasional outside exposure, to hangars, ramps and engine shop environments, including: hoists, heavy parts, chemicals and fluids with use of precision instruments, stringent housekeeping and work area safety regulations and practices to observe. Limited travel may be required, but usually on a local, inter-facility basis. Dallas Airmotive, Inc. is a Military Friendly employer. The team member in this position is responsible for managing the day to day activities of their recruiting teams in order to meet current and forecasted staffing needs. The desired candidate must possess strong management skills, industry knowledge; be able to direct a team of 10  15 Recruiters, RCs, and Sourcers. Recruiting managers should understand strategic organizational initiatives and cascade those goals to their direct reports. In addition, Recruiting Managers should be familiar with and proficient on applicant tracking software, major job boards, and niche recruitment sites. The manager is responsible for developing and implementing recruitment strategies for their teams and business groups. Mentoring, training and developing team members are expected to ensure adherence to the recruiting process and for exceeding delivery expectations. Recruiting managers are responsible for ensuring all team members are held accountable for reaching and exceeding recruiting goals. The Recruiting Manager manages escalations between candidates in process, recruiters/RCs, and company designated hiring representatives. Recruiting Managers are also responsible for day to day recruiter productivity and escalations from either the candidates and/or hiring managers. The Recruiting Manager will develop and maintain a positive working relationship with Honeywell and SRS leadership. Leader by example, the RM is expected to implement strategies to capture market share; budget accountability; goals and objectives management; and maintain communication with key staffing leaders to ensure successful business development. Job Requirements: KEY BEHAVIORS: The following critical behaviors must be exhibited by Recruiting Managers: Creative Sourcing Subject Matter expert in recruiting processes Exceptional communication skills Ability to analyze reports Leadership skills such as influencing, coaching, and mentoring Help transform recruiters into Talent Advisors EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: 5 years of end to end recruiting experience 9 months experience supporting RPO account Previous experience managing teams of 5  15 Demonstrated recruiting experience, ie: productivity, efficiency, meeting SLAs Prior experience with applicant tracking systems, preferably Taleo Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills Demonstrated experience managing large, complex accounts or projects Experience describing and documenting project or client requirements EDUCATION: College degree preferred If you are qualified & interested in this position  please do the following: Email your updated resume to michellewoods@sourceright.com . Please note Honeywell Recruiting Manager-Ref in the subject line. Employment Type: Full-Time Industry: Employment - Recruiting - Staffing, Energy - Utilities - Gas - Electric, Defense - Aerospace

Under general supervision, the Production Supervisor II directs and coordinates the development and implementation of activities in the production area(s) to meet production goals, quality, and cost objectives. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Meets revenue plans and production schedules. Manages cycle time and overtime expenses. Develops process improvements that improve quality and on time delivery. Makes recommendations regarding products, processes and specifications in conjunction with Engineering. Ensures that work instructions are followed. Makes recommendations regarding efficient area layout, material flow and devises fabrication methods. Establishes the team's short-term needs for manpower, equipment and facilities. Assists in preparation of team budgets. Ensures effective maintenance and good housekeeping practices. Trains, develops and motivates staff and ensures that all employees and visitors observe ESD and safety practices. Performs other related duties as required. Description We are seeking candidates for Senior IT Business Systems Analyst, an opportunity located in our Golden Valley location At Honeywell, we look for people driven by a desire to contribute, be challenged and grow. Our people make Honeywell a special company and are a key competitive advantage. Honeywell Automation and Control Solutions (ACS) is a $12 billion strategic business group applying sensing and control expertise that helps create safer, more comfortable, more secure, and more energy efficient and productive environments. ACS provides customers controls for heating, ventilating, and air conditioning, security systems, fire alarm systems, and energy management solutions. A pioneer in automation control, ACS also monitors and controls processes to improve productivity of complex industrial plants around the world. From home thermostats and integrated security systems to commercial building management systems, Honeywell ACS is a global leader. To learn more about our initiatives, go to http://honeywell.feedroom.com/. Key Responsibilities: - Act as a liaison between the business, operating organizations and IT and are responsible for the collection, analysis and documentation of customer processes and requirements. - Optimize customer work processes through participation in business planning, needs analysis and business risk assessment by leading process redesign and consulting with users on how to best support the business through effective use of technology. - Involvement in the buy vs. build decision and in all phases of the systems/applications development life cycle. - Solid understanding of the customers business processes, supporting applications, key drivers of success, and the short-term direction of their processes. - High level understanding of the overall IT applications architecture, business process reengineering skills and understanding of business modeling concepts using Six Sigma methodology. - Primary background in the business area they support and be equally aligned with the customers and I/S success. - Focus on improving business processes at all times, not necessarily with technology implications; analyze impact of work practice change on a business function and systems supporting the business process to ensure site integration. Qualifications Basic qualifications: - Bachelors degree in Information Technology or similar discipline Preferred qualifications: - Strong written and oral communications skills - Team player - Self directed - Results driven, yet highly team-oriented - Open-Minded - Ability to work in a matrix environment - Ability to deal with ambiguity - Organizational Skills - Can operate in a multi-cultural, global environment - Ability to communicate at all levels in the organization - Excellent time management and multi tasking skills - Good English communication skills Honeywell International is a diversified technology and manufacturing leader of aerospace products and services; control technologies for buildings, homes and industry; automotive products; power generation systems; specialty chemicals; fibers; plastics and advanced materials. The company is committed to providing quality products, integrated system solutions and services to customers around the world. Honeywell products touch the lives of most people everyday, whether youre flying on a plane, driving a car, heating or cooling a home, furnishing an apartment, taking medication for an illness or playing a sport. Based in Morris Township, NJ, Honeywell employs approximately 125,000 people in 120 countries. Its shares are traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol HON, as well as on the London, Chicago and Pacific Stock Exchanges. It is one of the 30 stocks that make up the Dow Jones Industrial Average and is also a component of the Standard & Poors 500 Index. To apply for this position, please go to www.careersathoneywell.com and enter requisition 00141306. If you are interested in applying for employment with Honeywell and need special assistance or an accommodation to apply for a posted position, please contact our Human Resources department via email. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to a diverse workforce. Description Consider Honeywell in the next step of your career! At Honeywell, we look for people driven by a desire to contribute, be challenged and grow. Our people make Honeywell a special company and are a key competitive advantage. Honeywell International is a $36 billion diversified technology and manufacturing global leader. Honeywell has more than 125,000 employees in 120 countries around the world and has a demonstrated heritage of innovation and achievement. Honeywell Safety Products (HSP) represents a significant piece of the Honeywell Life Safety strategic business unit within the Automation and Control Solutions (ACS) portfolio. HSP is the global leader in the personal protective equipment business. Our quality products, integrated system solutions, and services make life safer, more comfortable, more secure, and more productive in every corner of the world. Learn more about us at http://www.honeywelllifesafety.com/ . This is an exciting manufacturing engineering position with our San Diego, CA, facility. As a top candidate, you will have the capability to: Manage work assignments in staffing, scheduling, coordinating, and planning of personnel engaged in manufacturing engineering activities. Organize and coordinate sections of the engineering department (Manufacturing and Industrial). Plan and establish engineering schedules and follows up performance against goals and objectives. Supervise assembly of cost control and statistical data. Supervises development of material selection standards. Approves process specification and design standards. Prepares and controls departmental annual budget. Your primary responsibilities for this position will be to: Lead Manufacturing and Industrial Engineering-related improvement projects throughout the facility. Assure continuous improvement of process effectiveness (throughputs, yields, and costs) in manufacturing by improving: methods and processes equipment and tooling documentation Training and product design, by working with site manufacturing leaders and design engineers. Process capability and capacity to meet current and future demands. Select, develop and evaluate personnel to ensure efficient operations. Develop department standards and procedures and be responsible for manufacturing engineering performance. Be responsible for identifying, planning, acquiring, and implementing new manufacturing technologies to establish and extend competitive advantages. Process capability and capacity to meet current and future demands. Develop and track project plans, budgets and schedules for technical improvements. Prioritize schedules and workload for manufacturing engineers based on current product throughput as well as new product introductions. Plan for and assure that the necessary engineering resources are in place to support the development of new processes and the modification of existing processes to improve the effectiveness of manufacturing operations. Provide annual budgetary estimates including capital equipment and personnel requirements. Provide technical and manufacturability guidance to design engineers for new product development and for value engineering projects. You will also serve as a manufacturing and industrial engineer, providing the most effective ways to use the basic factors of production-people, machines, materials, information, and energy-to make products. Qualifications Basic Qualifications * Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar, scientific discipline. * 3 years of engineering experience including design, integration and process development in electro-mechanical assemblies. Additional Qualifications: * Knowledge of Six Sigma Tools, eg Green Belt, and Lean Enterprise concepts and methods. * Knowledge of tooling design. * Strong computer skills with working knowledge of MS Office and MS Projects. * Strong process management skills/methodologies. * Familiarity with the manufacturing aspects of industrial and retail grade products. * Proven experience in performing complex engineering calculations and relating results of controlled tests, including statistical analysis and tolerance analysis. * Ability to innovate and drive change. * Ability to manage effectively interdepartmental and large projects. * Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate at several levels of the organization. * Must be able to handle difficult, high stress situations effectively and diplomatically. To view and apply for this position, please visit http://www.careersathoneywell.com/ and reference job number 219638. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Honeywell is committed to a diverse workforce. Interested in Honeywell but this isn't the right job for you? Join Honeywell's Talent Network to receive updates on other Honeywell employment opportunities, news and more. Click here to sign up: http://careersathoneywell.com/en/Newsletternew.aspx . Job : Engineering Primary Location : USA-CA-San Diego Education Level : Bachelor's Degree Travel : Yes, 10 % of the Time Relocation Available : No SBG : ACS University Relations Requisition : No

Description Consider Honeywell in the next step of your career! We are seeking qualified candidates for Engineering Project Leader for Environmental and Combustion Controls (ECC). This position will be based in Golden Valley, Minnesota. ECC is a strategic business unit in Automation and Control Solutions (ACS). ECC provides integrated product solutions in heating and heating processes, ventilation, cooling and refrigeration, air purification, zoning, humidification, air conditioning, water controls and processes, electrical devices and systems, lighting control, switches, sensors and controllers. Our technologies are found in more than 150 million homes, 10 million buildings, and a multitude of manufacturing plants around the world. Customers include original equipment manufacturers, commercial, homeowners, contractors, retail, trade building managers, consulting engineers and distributors. As an Engineering Project Leader, you will lead product development teams within the framework of the Honeywell engineering development process. You will be responsible for energizing a highly skilled team located around the world to develop products faster, more reliably, and more Your key responsibilities will include: - Manage multiple, concurrent projects (up to 3 projects) while providing leadership, technical work direction and mentoring for global teams - Lead the development of combustion control - Track and analyze critical program parameters to improve product development processes and quality products and other control products utilizing global located resources - Collaborate with marketing, product management, sales, and engineering to gather voice of the customer data to generate crisp product requirements specifications for new product introduction - Develop and execute comprehensive new product introduction plans for high-volume, low-cost, highly producible control products - Responsible for all aspects of product development from planning to implementation Qualifications Basic Qualifications: - Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering or other relevant degree - Minimum 5 years developing high volume electromechanical products Preferred Qualifications: - Project Management Professional Certification (PMP) desired - High volume electromechanical products - Experience managing a multiple project priorities - Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) background is desired - Six Sigma certification and application of tools preferred - Familiarity of certification standards is a plus - Demonstrated ability to gain commitment from the supply chain, production, marketing, and customers - Strong communication, verbal and written, skills required. To apply for this position, please go to www.careersathoneywell.com and enter requisition #00150532. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Honeywell is committed to a diverse workforce. Job : Engineering Primary Location : USA-MN-Golden Valley Education Level : Bachelors Degree Travel : Yes, 10% of the time Relocation Available : Yes

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world''s economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact. Lead the SAP Account Team . Senior level resource dedicated 1:1 as the General Manager for the account . Coordinate activities and drive accountability across all SAP line of business segments and country subsidiaries . Ensure communication, consistency and a common SAP voice across the customers initiatives . Provide visibility and regular reviews with SAPs executive board around the customers progress . Develop and maintain account plan and strategy document including executive engagement strategy Elevate Relationships to a Strategic Level . Ensure SAP is taking a long-term view of the account . Maintain and Develop LOB executive alignment to SAP . Establish joint roadmaps and monitor progress against long-term objectives, aligned to the customers strategic goals . Act as the customers trusted advisor and primary advocate within SAP . Promote transparency and visibility into the objectives, plans and constraints across both companies . Active member of the customers extended management team in executive steering councils and strategic planning sessions Drive Industry Innovation & Design Thinking . Develop a deep understanding of the customers business objectives, pain points and competitive goals . Evangelize and facilitate Design Thinking practices across the customers initiatives . Envision new solutions leveraging game-changing technologies (in-memory, mobile, cloud) . Leverage SAP Innovation programs to enable rapid solution prototyping and realization . Drive customer adoption of SAP NPI/D solutions in account Ensure Mutually Shared Success . Drive sustained growth of both organizations objectives over a long-term horizon . Ensure appropriate governance models and clear escalation paths are put in place across all initiatives . Collaborate with partners to ensure alignment and success . Leverage SAP Value Realization programs to measure the impact of SAP solutions to the customers business . Protect and promote both companys brands throughout the industry . Previous success in handling large transactions and projects over lengthy discovery, evaluation and implementation periods in a fast-paced and competitive market and managing P&L over multiple revenue streams . 7 to 10 years software sales experience . Experience managing large Global transformation projects/programs . Experience integrating Partners, Consulting, Global Support and Development on behalf of a Global customer. . Extensive network and understanding of each area and how to drive collaboration. . Bachelors degree or higher strongly preferred . Strong oral and written communication skills . Willingness to travel as required (20%50%) . Strong experience required in one or more of the following domains: Controls, Aerospace, Transportation, Chemicals . Experience managing large complex customer accounts. . Proven leadership of large extended account teams with ability to drive and hold VAT members accountable for results across SAP lines of business . Proven ability to internally communicate and coordinate with executives and peers to accounts goals and needs . Ability to build credibility and trust with LOB and IT executive stakeholders . Ability to be trusted advisor to the C-level, ability to build trust and transparency. . Ability to think strategically and connect to the customers business objectives . Proven sales track record, software and/or services sales overachievement . Ability to establish long-term sales plans and growth strategies . Strategic planning and business case development experience . Demonstrated capability to position SAP benefits to LOB leadership . Relevant Industry Experience, ideally worked in the industry of the customer . Ability to lead innovation discovery efforts including Design Thinking expertise . Industry Business Network relative to the customers business . In-depth knowledge of SAPs global organizations and extensive SAP internal network including AGS, Development, Services and Sales . Ability to champion the customers needs across SAPs executive team

<description>About Dallas Airmotive   Tracing its origins to 1932 at Dallas Love Field, Dallas Airmotive, a BBA Aviation company, got its start repairing and overhauling aircraft piston engines. Today Dallas Airmotive focuses on servicing turbine engines used by business and general aviation, government, military, airline and rotor wing operators around the world. As a leading independent OEM-authorized turbine engine repair and overhaul organization, we have forged bonds with turbine engine manufacturers that go back more than 60 years. Working with these OEMs, we are proud to have developed many of the repair and overhaul techniques that are standard in the industry today. Over the years, we have continued to add engine authorizations, services and capabilities that encompass the majority of turbine-powered business and general aviation aircraft flying today, with support that extends to every corner of the globe.   If you are looking for a rewarding career with a time-tested leader in the aviation industry, we encourage you to apply for this challenging and gratifying career opportunity by clicking APPLY ONLINE above.   Job Summary:  This position is responsible for senior level sales support activities, preparation of engine proposals, technical knowledge, and customer coordination in support of the Regional Engine Managers sales efforts for the Honeywell program.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities: (Not listed in order of importance. Other duties may be assigned.) 1.       Provides technical review of engine logs in order to accurately asses the requirements in order to prepare sales proposals for Honeywell engines. 2.       Maintain appropriate files, both electronically (CRM) and paper, in order to track status and report data to Territorial Sales Directors for forecasting purposes. 3.       Maintain positive and effective contact with customers, brokers, agents and others to enhance opportunities for new and continuing business development. 4.       Tracks and prepares appropriate documentation for fuel concessions on a monthly basis. 5.       Coordinates activities for certain major accounts as directed by  appropriate sales director. 6.       Provide technical support for the Honeywell program regarding specifics to service bulletins, life limited component status and other technical questions as they arise. 7.       Provide technical data, from sales proposals, to operating groups to ensure proper workscopes are maintain through out the process. 8.       Assist in training of other team members ensuring best practice standards are maintained.  9.       Identify opportunities for improvement processes, in working practices and team efficiency. 10.    Adhere to the Company's proprietary information protection policies. 11.    Maintain positive working relationships with all internal departments and attend meetings if requested, when department representation is required 12.    Assist customers with obtaining satisfactory information as delegated/authorized.  13.    Provide coordination of customer visits to ERO facilities and entertainment while customers are on site.   Job Requirements Formal Education/Training: College degree (Associates or Bachelor's) or high school graduate with technical/sales training and knowledge normally achieved through graduation from a university or vocational program.   Direct /Indirect Experience: Should have a minimum of three to five (3-5) years sales/service related experience in the aviation services industry.     Qualifications: (Including Licenses and Certifications) Must possess effective written and verbal communications skills, especially since a great deal of contact is by telephonic or electronic means. Must be able to demonstrate PC proficiency in MS Word and Excel as well as to learn any corporate or industry software used by the position, such as CHAMPS or equivalent systems. Should have a good working knowledge of sales and customer service techniques. Accounts Payables and/or purchasing experience is helpful. Fluency in Spanish is a plus.   Physical And Mental Demands:   Normal work is performed in an office environment: may exert up to (50-70) pounds of force infrequently to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects. Work involves walking, sitting, or standing for various periods of time. Near clarity of vision required for close up chart/document analysis. Reaching:  extending hands and arms in any direction. Handling:  seizing, holding, grasping, turning or otherwise working with hand(s).  Talking:  expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word to impart oral information to convey detailed spoken instruction to other workers, customers or agents accurately, loudly or quickly. Hearing:  effectively perceiving the nature of sounds by ear.   Mental: The job requires diligence/attention in performing duties under normal mental stresses commonly associated with detailed, often high value sales work, solving various customer issues, often in a time sensitive environment using sound knowledge of products and industry practices.   Work Environment : (The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.)  Most work is performed in an office environment. However, the environment includes occasional outside exposure, to hangars, ramps and engine shop environments, including: hoists, heavy parts, chemicals and fluids with use of precision instruments, stringent housekeeping and work area safety regulations and practices to observe. Limited travel may be required, but usually on a local, inter-facility basis. Dallas Airmotive, Inc. is a Military Friendly employer. <description>Honeywell Entry Agent DHL Erlanger, KY 9/4/2014 Job Description Honeywell Entry Agent Ref: req1435 What makes DHL great? Our People!We know each employees individual contributions make us the #1 Express Deliveries and Logistics Company and the 7th largest employer in the world. DHL Express is committed to maintaining an environment that empowers every team member to make the greatest possible impact on our business. Our corporate culture is about personal commitment to our business, to each other and to our global communities. DHL is dedicated to being a great place to work. In addition to competitive compensation packages, our employees enjoy a range of programs, services and benefits that bring the best to their personal lives. In fact, Business Week just named DHL one of the best companies to launch a career. Start YOUR career with DHL today We are currently hiring aBTOCoordinationAgentat our Erlanger, Kentucky location. This position will be responsible for ensuring the successful handling of BTO shipments from several different gateways, processing all aspects of transfers, distributing work amongst agents, and the regular duties of a BTO Notification Agent as needed (reviewing documents, researching customer instructions, and carrying out document turnover notifications). He/She will network between Origin, Destination, Brokers and DHL Express parties including Customer Service, Clearance Production, and Compliance. Tasks & Accountabilities Participates in processing inbound freight for clearance through US Customs. Effectively processes shipments to gain clearance information while staying compliant with all government agency rules and regulations. Responsible for contacting DHL customers who are experiencing clearance delays with their shipments. Provides information to, and communicates with, DHL Origin and destination stations on the status of the shipments being delayed. Examines invoices, bills of lading and shipping documents to ensure compliance with federal regulations. Communicates the shipment status and any special handling and delivery processes to all involved parties. Ensures that all customers requested instructions are followed for the entry of their shipments. Creates new Customer Master Files and updates existing files as warranted. Skills & Qualifications HS diploma or equivalent required Senior level service, production, or support role having greater responsibility to perform all of the standard work within the function. Specialized skill training/certification may be required such as Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel), data entry, customer service, and import knowledge 1 year experience in customer service or imports. Please note a resume is required to apply for all DHL positions. <description>Under general supervision, the Production Supervisor II directs and coordinates the development and implementation of activities in the production area(s) to meet production goals, quality, and cost objectives. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Meets revenue plans and production schedules. Manages cycle time and overtime expenses. Develops process improvements that improve quality and on time delivery. Makes recommendations regarding products, processes and specifications in conjunction with Engineering. Ensures that work instructions are followed. Makes recommendations regarding efficient area layout, material flow and devises fabrication methods. Establishes the team---s short-term needs for manpower, equipment and facilities. Assists in preparation of team budgets. Ensures effective maintenance and good housekeeping practices. Trains, develops and motivates staff and ensures that all employees and visitors observe ESD and safety practices. Performs other related duties as required. Job Requirements Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent work experience required. Minimum of 4 years previous supervisory experience in an electronics manufacturing environment required. Ability to act as a liaison between engineering and manufacturing and demonstrated leadership skills required. Experience working with MS Office. SAP experience highly desired. Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills required. Must be able to interact effectively with internal and external customers and in a team environment.</description>

<description>I. Job Description ? Janitor/Day Person and Night Porter Positions **TWIC Card Required** II. Responsible for general oversight, cleaning and stocking supplies in all public areas inside and outside of assigned building, including restroom as needed. Respond to business management needs in a timely and effective manner. May need to clean any secured areas which cannot be cleaned at night: A. Job Duties*: t Respond to building requests as instructed. t Monitor entire lobby areas and plaza for cleanliness. t Monitor and maintain escalators and elevator cabs, including floors, as required. If carpeted, floors in elevators, cabs to be vacuumed and spots to be removed, as required. t Empty trash containers. t Wipe down counter tops. t Remove debris from floor. t Clean toilets/sinks as needed. t Check modes dispensers for supplies and refill as needed, empty modes receptacle if needed. t Fill paper towel, toilet paper and soap dispensers as needed. t Clean any spills as needed. t Set out rain mats on rainy days; keep in clean condition. t Spot clean fingerprints / marks on doors / mirrors. t Clean fingerprints / marks from glass doors / mirrors. t Perform high / low detail dusting / vacuuming. t Vacuum carpets as needed. t Continuous walking and standing. t Properly maintain exterior of the Building from ground level, monitor all garden areas. t Change light bulb in the common areas and tenant suites; light bulbs to be supplied by Owner. t Exposure to dust, gas, fumes, extremes in temperature and or humidity. t Follow all safety and personnel rules and regulations. *Job duties may be modified at any time. B. Essential Job Functions/Qualifications: t Must be able to function as main contact for client and tenants in building, using high level of professionalism and communication skills. t Must have ability to work with little to no supervision and be able to independently determine tasks to complete on a daily basis. t Must be able to perform all physical aspects of the above job duties. t Must be able to speak and communicate effectively with management and customer. t Must be able to speak / understand written English. t Previous experience preferred but not required. t TWIC CARD REQUIRED EEO/M/F/D/V</description>

STATUS: Finance JOB CATEGORY: Transportation WORK EXPERIENCE: At least 1 year(s) COMPANY: DHL Report this job Job Number:125869 See all jobs at this company Save this job Email this job Printer-Friendly Version Honeywell Customs Brokerage Entry Agent - Evenings What makes DHL great? Our People! We know each employees individual contributions make us the #1 Express Delivery and Logistics Company in the world. DHL Express is committed to maintaining an environment that empowers every team member to make the greatest possible impact on our business. Our corporate culture is about personal commitment to our business, to each other and to our global communities. DHL is dedicated to being a great place to work. In addition to competitive compensation packages, our employees enjoy a range of programs, services and benefits that bring the best to their personal lives. In fact, Business Week just named DHL one of the best companies to launch a career. Start YOUR career with DHL today We have an immediate career opportunity for a qualified Honeywell Entry Agent at our Erlanger, KY location. As a Honeywell Entry Agent, you will ensure compliance with federal and foreign regulations governing the shipment, receipt, and documentation of imported/exported products. You will also compute duties, tariffs, price conversions, as well as calculating the weight and volume of merchandise exported/imported from foreign destinations. In addition you will also be asked to examine various documents including invoices, bills of lading, and shipping statements and may contact customs officials to obtain release of incoming freight and resolve delays. Key Accountabilities: Participates in planning and directing the flow of traffic to/from foreign destinations Effectively classifies dutiable import/export shipments to ensure compliance with all government agency rules and regulations Processes all requests for extensions, expiration, cancellation and all government entries Communicates with origin and destination locations regarding shipment status and special handling and delivery processes Applies for Import/Export Permits and Certificates of Eligibility Maintains open line of communication with department of foreign affairs May receive and distribute all incoming and outgoing mail and correspondence Position Requirements: High School Diploma or Equivalent (Associate degree preferred) 1 year experience in transportation or customs preferred Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook), database and web-based applications Good oral and written communication, problem solving and interpersonal skills; courteous and clear telephone voice Proficiency on a 10 key calculator Please note a resume is required to apply for all DHL positions. <description>Description This is an exciting new opportunity with Honeywell Labs for a Sr. Scientist focused on Connected Home technologies. Honeywell International is a $40 billion diversified Fortune 100 leader with more than 131,000 employees in 100 countries around the world. We invent and manufacture technologies that address some of the world s toughest challenges linked to global macro trends like energy efficiency, clean energy generation, safety and security, globalization and customer productivity. We are building a world that s safer and more secure, more comfortable and energy efficient, more innovative and productive. For more information, please visit Honeywell.com or follow us @HoneywellNow. Honeywell Automation and Control Solutions (ACS) is a $15.9 billion global business that is increasing the productivity of people at work, and the safety, security and energy efficiency of our homes, buildings, and industrial plants around the world. Honeywell environmental controls, life safety, security, sensing, scanning, and mobility products, as well as building and process solutions, are at work in homes, buildings, industrial facilities, and public and private facilities around the world. ACS Global Labs is an enterprise focused on sensor and wireless technology developments which are leveraged across Honeywell s ACS businesses. Our teams utilize advanced research in materials, new sensing principles, micro- and nano-fabrication, signal processing and wireless communications to create leading edge technologies. We work with the various ACS businesses to transition the appropriate technologies into next generation products. We are looking for a dynamic Scientist to develop technologies for the Connected Home. You will be responsible for the execution of strategic research and development programs and platforms that will enable Honeywell Automation and Control Systems products for residential homes to be part of the Internet of Things (IoT) ecosystem. Main Responsibilities: * Working with a global team of scientists, engineers, and technicians to create and execute research and development programs related to Internet of Things. * Developing cutting-edge solutions in wireless networking that will enable ubiquitous connectivity for ACS products to the Internet. * Designing and implementing prototypes that can be used for conducting voice of customer surveys. * Transferring technology into ACS products and support new product introduction. * Working closely with peers, business leaders, and internal and external collaborators to drive project success. Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status. Qualifications Basic Qualifications: * Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science. * 5 years experience in the design and development of wireless sensor networks or machine-to-machine (M2M) communication. YES!!!!! then a job as a Support Worker with Lifeways may just be up your street. We help all different types of people with learning disabilities and/or autism and other complex needs that may include a physical disability, who would like support either on a 24 hour basis within their own homes, within supported living accommodation, or to access the community on a daily basis dependent on their needs and wishes - we feel that there is nothing better than seeing people happy in their own homes as we give them the support they need to live happy and fulfilled lives. So, if you are professional, caring and supportive, and eager to train and develop your skills, we would like to hear from you. We are looking for committed individuals and team players with a desire to care and a willingness to learn, to deliver direct support to our customers, assisting them with all aspects of their lives, from taking part in leisure and learning activities to supporting them in their homes with everyday living. Previous experience is not necessary as all staff receive training tailored to the needs of the customer they support. Having a driving license and access to your own vehicle would be beneficial but is not essential. Lifeways provide their employees with local work, an 8 day paid induction training programme, paid holidays, a company pension scheme, and employee supervision and recognition. We provide long term career prospects for anyone seeking a career with development opportunities. If you are interested then please apply, and forward your cv to Tracy Fisher, Regional Recruitment Coordinator by using the apply link All successful candidates will be subject to an enhanced DBS check and reference checks. Lifeways Community Care is an Equal Opportunities Employer Job Type: Permanent Required education: - High school or equivalent</description>

<description>Goucher College, a small, selective liberal arts college located twenty minutes north of Baltimore, and the first college in the nation to require students to study abroad, seeks a part-time secretary/medical receptionist to report to the director of Student Health and Counseling Services. Responsibilities include, but are not limited scheduling appointments, discharging patients, preparing documentation for patient visits, entering data into Neusoft medical software regarding patient visits, making follow-up appointments, assisting with referral information including the necessary insurance forms, and answering phones. The secretary/medical receptionist will also manage current patient charts while ensuring the highest standards of confidentiality for all patient medical records; maintain current files and files for students that have withdrawn/graduated for five years after date of departure; review all new student records for complete medical history, physical, and immunization information; type and file as necessary; sort daily mail; pull charts for incoming patients and file charts of patients seen; receive lab results and distribute accordingly to clinicians for review; assist patients in self-care clinic; and dispense over-the-counter medications. The secretary/medical receptionist will provide back-up for the clinic coordinator when it is necessary for the clinic coordinator to be away from the front desk; receive and review incoming medical records and mail; and answer/return phone calls during the summer months when the health center is closed. Requirements: Qualified applicants will have the ability to act independently and confidently, yet function as a member of a team. High school diploma required; college education and/or established work history in a medical setting preferred. Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook are also required. The secretary/medical receptionist will work 20 hours per week during the Fall and Spring semesters (5 days per week, 29 weeks) and 8 hours per week during the Summer months (2 days per week, 12.5 weeks). The successful candidate will be subject to a background check as a condition of employment. Additional Information: Interested applicants must apply online by May 18, 2012. Application Instructions: Please submit the following application materials online: * Cover letter with salary requirements * Resume Goucher College is an Equal Opportunity Employer.</description>

<description>CT/MRI Customer  Service Engineer - Philadelphia, PA           Due to rapid growth, a  major medical imaging service  organization is looking for a GE trained CT/MRI  Service Engineer for the  Philadelphia, PA  area.   Qualified individuals must have at least  5 years of experience in servicing GE  CT  systems in a hospital and/or medical imaging  environment.   Company Profile       Our client is a well established and growing service  organization specializing in GE, Siemens,  Toshiba, Philips and Hitachi  CT, MRI and  X-ray service and they are growing VERY fast.  They are a provider of both sales and service utilizing highly trained service engineers, leveraging  their in house parts/repair capability and offering personalized customer service which is what  makes them  a highly attractive alternative to the manufacturer.     Requirements *    5-7 years of GE CT  equipment service experience. *   Excellent customer service and communication skills. *   Must be able to take service calls as needed on a daily basis traveling throughout the  Philadelphia  region as  necessary.   There may be some  minimal  overnight travel.  All traveling expenses will be covered by the company. *   Must have a valid driver's license for travel. *   Must be able to pass a  background check. Location Philaelphia, PA.   Our client is open to relocating the right candidate. Our Client Will Offer *   An excellent base salary, $65,000 - $85,000 plus paid overtime. *   A generous company car allowance. *   Company bonuses $5-$10K every year. *   Excellent opportunity for advancements. *   Excellent health benefits including health, dental and vision. *   A 401K with matching. *   10 days of vacation per year *   Supplemental life insurance. *   Relocation assistance if necessary to the right individual.         If you feel that you meet these qualifications and would like to work for a  stable and growing  organization, please submit a Word document  resume to Jamie Sova at jsova@cox.net or call 402-452-3262 for any further information .     Apply</description><education>Some High School Coursework</education>

<description>City: Peoria Essential Functions (Responsibilities): Build your career and experience the advantages that come with working for the World's Most Admired Company (Fortune Magazine) offering significant opportunities for growth and career advancement! In this role, the Field Engineer will be responsible for meeting the daily service repair needs of the Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) or Computed Tomography (CT) Diagnostic Imaging equipment and driving customer satisfaction through Service Excellence. Responsibilities include: * Completing Preventative Maintenance on designated equipment * Managing repair parts cycle times * Performing Functional Management Inspections * Maintaining customer service logs and internal service records * Maintain daily communications with customers to ensure resolution and proper follow-up, leading to customer satisfaction * Maintaining tools and test equipment properly and ensuring they are calibrated * Meeting Health and Human Services and Environment Health and Safety requirements * Managing vendors service delivery processes in compliance with GE Healthcare policies * Utilizing the escalation process to resolve customer service delivery issues and conducting root cause analysis that will lead to effective problem solving * Participating in sales opportunities such as contract renewals and assist with promoting and implementing revenue programs * Working as a member of the local team to provide efficient service delivery to all accounts with assigned area Qualifications/Requirements: * Bachelor's degree, Electrical Engineering, Electrical Engineering Technology, equivalent military education or Associates Degree with 6 years experience servicing electronic equipment, or a High School Diploma/GED and 12+ years experience servicing electronic equipment. * You must be willing to submit to a background investigation, including for example, verification of your past employment, criminal history and educational background. * Willingness to travel 90% within your specified geographic region * Willingness to take a drug test * You must be eligible to be legally authorized to work in the United States * You must be willing to work out of a home office located in Peoria, IL area * Must have a valid driver's license * This position may, in the future, support GEHC contracts with the U.S. government. At that time, pursuant to law, the successful candidate must submit to and clear a governmental background check. The employee must also submit to GEHC's standard background check at the time of hire. * To the extent you are applying for a position that requires you to operate a GE owned/leased, privately owned/leased or rental vehicle for company business, you must be willing to submit to a check of your driving record Desired: * Experience with Siemens or Philips or Hitachi CT or MRI equipment * Excellent analytical and communication skills with the ability to communicate complex technical issues in an easy to understand manner * Experience interfacing with both internal team members and external customers as part of a solution based service process * Experience diagnosing and repairing mechanical, electromechanical, and/or electronic equipment in the Healthcare Industry * Experience troubleshooting and responding to customer concerns * Exceptional interpersonal skills * Change agent and process oriented General: Field Engineers are required to complete all Quality and EHS assigned training. These trainings are tracked and monitored to assure that all of Global Service is compliant with Quality Regulations and EHS Requirements.</description><benefits>A benefit package may or may not be available. Request specific information from the employer.</benefits>

In this role, the Field Engineer will be responsible for meeting the daily service repair needs of the Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) or Computed Tomography (CT) or X-Ray (XR) or Nuclear Medicine (NM) Diagnostic Imaging equipment and driving customer satisfaction through Service Excellence. Responsibilities include: * Completing Preventative Maintenance on designated equipment * Managing repair parts cycle times * Performing Functional Management Inspections * Maintaining customer service logs and internal service records * Maintain daily communications with customers to ensure resolution and proper follow-up, leading to customer satisfaction * Maintaining tools and test equipment properly and ensuring they are calibrated * Meeting Health and Human Services and Environment Health and Safety requirements * Managing vendors service delivery processes in compliance with GE Healthcare policies * Utilizing the escalation process to resolve customer service delivery issues and conducting root cause analysis that will lead to effective problem solving * Participating in sales opportunities such as contract renewals and assist with promoting and implementing revenue programs * Working as a member of the local team to provide efficient service delivery to all accounts with assigned area Qualifications * Bachelor's degree, Electrical Engineering, Electrical Engineering Technology, equivalent military education or Associates Degree with 6 years experience servicing electronic equipment, or a High School Diploma/GED and 12+ years experience servicing electronic equipment. * You must be willing to submit to a background investigation, including for example, verification of your past employment, criminal history and educational background. * Willingness to travel 90% within your specified geographic region * Willingness to take a drug test * You must be eligible to be legally authorized to work in the United States * You must be willing to work out of a home office located in the specified geographic area * Must have a valid driver's license * This position may, in the future, support GEHC contracts with the U.S. government. At that time, pursuant to law, the successful candidate must submit to and clear a governmental background check. The employee must also submit to GEHC's standard background check at the time of hire. * To the extent you are applying for a position that requires you to operate a GE owned/leased, privately owned/leased or rental vehicle for company business, you must be willing to submit to a check of your driving record Desired * Experience with Siemens or Philips or Hitachi CT or MRI or XR or NM equipment * Excellent analytical and communication skills with the ability to communicate complex technical issues in an easy to understand manner * Experience interfacing with both internal team members and external customers as part of a solution based service process * Experience diagnosing and repairing mechanical, electromechanical, and/or electronic equipment in the Healthcare Industry * Experience troubleshooting and responding to customer concerns * Exceptional interpersonal skills * Change agent and process oriented General Field Engineers are required to complete all Quality and EHS assigned training. These trainings are tracked and monitored to assure that all of Global Service is compliant with Quality Regulations and EHS Requirements. GE is an equal opportunity employer, offering a great work environment, challenging career opportunities, professional training and competitive compensation. The United States has regulations that govern the hiring of current or former U.S. Government employees. If you currently work for (or have in the past) the U.S. Government (in any capacity), you may have certain responsibilities under these regulations and certain restrictions may apply to your potential employment with GE. Therefore, if you are contacted by GE regarding a position of employment, and you have worked for the U.S. Government at any time, please immediately inform the GE representative of this fact. High volume Gastroenterology practice seeking an experienced medical billing specialist who is detail oriented and possesses exceptional organizational skills. As a medical billing specialist you will serve as the liaison between patients and the insurance companies. Applicants should have strong written and communication skills.
