Maintains two-way communication and promotes understanding from end user to project team.  Jason Centrella [_] jcentrel@gmail.com, Medstar Solutions Devorah Holan Devorah@gmed.com Gmed Inc. Adrian Vega [_] adrianv@gmed.com Gmed Inc. Lewis Dodson [_] Mednax

Responsibilities included faxing, scanning, and electronic filing in Gmed EHR software of labs, pathologies, procedures, authorizations and financial documents Ensuring electronically received labs, pathologies, and procedures were reviewed, signed by physicians, and properly filed in EHR system Collected co-payments, reviewed patient forms, submitted patient follow-up care authorization requests using NAUTALIS electronic authorization system, and scheduled office appointments using Athena scheduling software Assisted with implementing meaningful use workflows in the outpatient clinic setting to meet Medicares EHR incentive program goals As needed utilization of Allscripts and Anziolite/Medical Manager software to retrieve patient information for healthcare operations Managed voicemails and directing incoming office phone calls to the proper department (s)

* Managed care for up to 30 patients in a peri-operative setting * Supervised a staff of up to 25 including both medical and business office staff, staff scheduling, facilitated staff education, and orientation of new employees * Planned and implemented quality improvement projects resulting in increase efficiency in workflow and improved patient satisfaction * Conducted chart reviews and coordinated physician peer reviews * Assisted survey readiness team ahead of JCAHO and AAAHC accreditation surveys * Functioned as liaison between EHR vendor and staff and physicians during implementation and upgrades of EHR system * Super User for gMed EMR

Using computer programs like windows (word, excel) and EHR such as EPIC, Mindscape, Sorian, Centricity, and gMed. Answering telephones, generating referrals, setting up appointments in multiple facilities, data entry, associating diagnosis codes (ICD-9, ICD-10, CPT) and many other office skills including high organization skills, and ability to be efficient while multitasking. Obtaining prior authorizations through numerous health insurance companies. Retrieving medical records from other facilities for continuation of care. My clinical skills used in this position include; obtaining vital signs, triage, educating patient on how to prepare for their procedures and what to expect, refilling medication and explaining how to take certain medications. While maintaining Reliability, dependability, customer service, team player, efficiency, organization, excellent multi-tasking, problem solving, time management, communication, professionalism, fast learning HIPPA compliance, and following facility procedures and protocols.

Scottsdale, AZ a subdivision of Arizona Gastrointestinal Associates, PLC Assistant Practice Administrator/Front Office Manager - Supervise and coordinate activities of all office personnel. - Facilitate staff training and development. - Provide highest level of patient customer service and confidentiality. - Utilize Electronic Health Record (EHR) software to automate and streamline workflow and increase organization and accuracy of patient information. - Optimize patient flow by using effective customer service communication skills utilizing professionalism, tact and courtesy to ensure a positive patient response to service. - Responsible for scheduling patients, procedures and physician appointments, in office, endoscopy center, and hospitals. - Perform registration process, verify insurance coverage and obtain authorization notification. - Accurately document information and perform date-entry to ensure maximum reimbursement. - Enter charges/payments for services delivered and perform daily reconciliation in a timely and accurate manner. - Review and correct medical transcription ensuring accuracy and completeness. - Assist in obtaining pre-certification, referrals from physicians, authorizations, prescriptions refills and other medical testing as necessary. - provide support to include, answering phones, returning messages, distributing mail, purchase requests, ordering supplies. - Coordinate staff meetings and training. - Prepare patients for exam and treatment. Obtain vital signs, weight, blood pressure, symptoms, medications, and chief complaint. Properly record information into patients chart. - Compliant with all HIPAA laws and regulations. - Electronic Health Records specialist. Liaison with EHR software gMED/gGastro and practice.

Accounts payrollpayable, accounts receivable, ,profit sharing distribution, Insurance contract negotiation, Personnel/Human Resources,Communication ad Development, Implemention of EHR gMed, successful implementation of meaningful use, ERX incentive. implementation of new practice Managment system NetPractice, Reaccreditation of AAAHC, in process of credit align for ASC.

<description>Head of Oncology, Global Medicines Development (GMed) AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven, integrated biopharmaceutical company. Their mission is to make a meaningful difference to patient health through great medicines that improve patients lives and add value for their stakeholders and society. Oncology at AstraZeneca Even as research and development continues to break boundaries in how we understand and fight cancer, there are still more than eight million lives lost every year to the disease. AstraZeneca is committed to advancing the science of oncology to deliver life-changing medicines to patients most in need. With a combination-focused pipeline that exploits the power of four scientific platforms to help address unmet clinical needs in a host of cancers. AstraZeneca is motivated by a dedication to the scientific discovery and collaboration that will one day help eliminate cancer as a cause of death. Immuno-oncology - using the body's immune system to help fight cancer Tumor drivers and resistance - developing therapies that target specific mutations to attack cancer cells DNA damage repair - targeting the DNA repair process to block tumor cells ability to reproduce Antibody-drug conjugates - arming antibodies with cancer- killing agents for specific tumor targeting AstraZeneca's robust Oncology pipeline includes investigational therapies in varied stages of clinical development, from recently approved products to earlier-stage molecules in clinical trials. We aspires to transform the lives of cancer patients, working to eliminate cancer as a cause of death in the future. As of February, 2016 there were 17 Phase 3/registration studies, 12 Phase 2 studies and 26 Phase 1 studies. For more on AstraZeneca/MedImmune Oncology and to view their pipeline, please visit: https://www.astrazeneca.com/our- focus-areas/oncology.html The Opportunity AstraZeneca have a rare and exciting opportunity to lead the Oncology Global Medicines Development (Oncology GMed) organization globally, with colleagues located in the U.S. (Gaithersburg, MD) and Europe (Cambridge, UK). Global Medicines Development (GMD) is the science engine room for AstraZeneca's late stage development and our mission is to transform clinical concepts into medicines that deliver patient health benefits. GMD works closely with AstraZeneca's two autonomous discovery and early development organizations; IMed (small molecules) and MedImmune (biologics), and the Global Product and Portfolio Strategy (GPPS) organization to understand where there is unmet medical need, and in turn invent, develop, and deliver medicines to patients around the world. To learn more about the Global Medicines Development organization, please visit: https://www.astrazeneca.com/our- science/global-medicines-development.html Reporting to the EVP, Global Medicine Development & CMO, the Head of Oncology GMed will be accountable for defining, implementing, and executing the holistic strategy for the late-stage development of AstraZeneca's robust and innovative Oncology portfolio. He/She will also serve as a member of AstraZeneca's Cancer Enterprise Leadership Team, along with senior colleagues from IMED and MedImmune, and GPPS. Together this enterprise group will ensure focus and alignment across all functions, and seek to accelerate and maximize the company's industry leading Oncology portfolio. Additionally, as a key member of the GMD Leadership Team, the Head of Oncology GMed will play an integral role in fuelling alignment and setting broader strategy across AstraZeneca's core therapeutics areas: Cardiovascular and Metabolic Diseases, Oncology, and Respiratory, Inflammation and Autoimmunity, with an opportunity-driven approach to Infection, Neuroscience and Gastrointestinal diseases. For an exploratory conversation please connect with Paul Oldham (Global Recruitment Lead) on paul.oldham1@astrazeneca.com. All discussion will be held in complete confidentiality. To find out more please visit... http://jobs.astrazeneca.com/jobs/details/l1r1450090850-head-of-oncology-gmed-vice-president</description><education>BC/BE Medical Oncologist , MD</education>

Stockport NHS Foundation TrustThere are lots of good reasons to choose to come and work at Stockport NHS Foundation Trust.A dynamic integrated Trust with integrity and vision.Exactly the same qualities youll see in yourself.Stockport NHS Foundation Trust aims to be the organisation of choice for patients and an employer of choice for staff.In order to continually improve all aspects of our patient experience, we rely upon having a highly skilled, motivated, diverse, productive and patient focused workforce.Stockport Foundation Trust is one of four specialist hospital sites in Greater Manchester.Being a specialist hospital will enhance our general surgery, anaesthetics, critical care and emergency medicine for the benefit of people in Stockport, High Peak, Cheshire and across Greater Manchester. Our values  Quality and Safety, Communication, Service are at the heart of everything we do and come from our Your Health. Our Priority promise. Every day they drive the behaviour and actions for every person in our organisation. JUNIOR CLINICAL FELLOW Medicine Business Group We are expanding our body of Junior Clinical Fellows across the Medicine Business Group at Stepping Hill Hospital.We are offering 4 positions rotating through specialty areas on a 6 monthly basis enabling valuable exposure and experience in a variety of specialties and service settings.The hours of work are 40 hours per week but applications for part time and job share arrangements will be considered. These posts offer excellent experience for those planning a career in medicine. Although not an accredited training post, post holders are supported to participate in the training and educational programs provided and post holders will be allocated an educational supervisor. Currently we haveJunior Clinical Fellows in posts within the Business Group across General & Specialty Medicine, Rehab & Enablement, Acute Medicine & Emergency Department. The Rotations Rotational JCF 1 Rotational JCF 2 Rotational JCF 3 Rotational JCF 4 Respiratory Medicine Gastroenterology Department of medicine for older people Diabetes & Endocrinology Diabetes & Endocrinology Respiratory Medicine Gastroenterology Department of medicine for older people Department of medicine for older people Diabetes & Endocrinology Respiratory Medicine Gastroenterology Gastroenterology Department of medicine for older people Diabetes & Endocrinology Respiratory Medicine Out Of Hours Working Opportunities to participate in the General Internal Medicine on call rota will be considered for suitable post holders who are able to fulfill the expectations of the duty. The TrustStockport NHS Foundation Trust;one the first-wave NHS Foundation Trusts in April 2004, one of 4 named specialist hospitals in Greater Manchester in 2015, an associate teaching hospital and a thriving District General Hospital with most major clinical specialties.The hospital is based in a highly attractive part of the North-West, with appealing residential areas boasting some of the best schools in the country.At Stepping Hill Hospital we are proud of our associate teaching hospital status and we have a strong emphasis on Postgraduate training for all via close links with the University of Manchester.The hospital has an active Postgraduate Centre with a comprehensive programme of clinical meetings, MRCP teaching, seminars and excellent library facilities. For an informal discussion about the roles or to arrange an informal visit, please contact Dr Ngai Kong, Clinical Director, on 0161 4195477 or email Willing to accomodate Skype interviews*The Trust is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children,young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment and promote safeguarding by implementing the Trusts policies and procedures,acting promptly on concerns, communicating effectively and sharing information appropriately. If successful this vacancy will require an enhanced DBS check at a cost of 48.43. This cost will be deducted from your first Trust salaryApplicants are encouraged to read the documents attached to this vacancy before applying,including the job description and person specification and the information for applicants which includes useful information to assist you in completing your application.From time to time we may need to close a vacancy early when in receipt of a sufficient number of applications.If you are interested in this post and wish to be considered, we strongly advise you to complete and submit your application as soon as possible.Please note that all correspondence will be via your NHS Jobs account.Unfortunately we are not able to acknowledge each application. If you do not hear from us within four weeks of the closing date, please consider that you have not been shortlisted on this occasion.Stockport NHS Foundation Trust is committed to promoting and championing a culture of diversity, fairness and equality for all applicants and employees.Applications are welcomed from all backgrounds and we strive to reflect the community we serve in our diverse workforce.Our "two tick" kite mark guarantees a candidate with a disability, who fulfills the essential criteria, an interview at the Trust. We can make reasonable adjustments, and offer support and advice in a variety of ways on request. Disclosure and Barring Service CheckThis post is subject to the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (Exceptions Order) 1975 and as such it will be necessary for a submission for Disclosure to be made to the Disclosure and Barring Service (formerly known as CRB)to check for any previous criminal convictions. Tier 2 Certificate of Sponsorship (formerly a Work Permit)Applications from job seekers who require Tier 2 sponsorship to work in the UK are welcome and will be considered alongside all other applications.However, non-EEA candidates may not be appointed to a post if a suitably qualified, experienced and skilled EU/EEA candidate is available to take up the post as the employing body is unlikely,in these circumstances, to satisfy the Resident Labour Market Test.The UK Border Agency requires employers to complete this test to show that no suitably qualified EEA or EU worker can fill the post. For further information please visit UK Border Agency website. UK Registration Applicants must have current UK professional registration.For further information please see applying from overseas .

Ensures any issues are reviewed in a timely manner. * Manage the Senior Physician Management team to ensure departmental goals and targets are achieved and the performance of individuals is managed effectively. * Oversee the implementation of tactical leadership decisions in order for the business to achieve its objectives * Performance manage senior managers and identify development opportunities for direct reports, together with appropriate succession planningExperience Required* MD with subspecialty training in Oncology. * Demonstrated scientific, clinical, and medical expertise, and a proven ability to drive results. * Recognized as scientific opinion leader with significant experience spanning of all stages of drug development and exposure to multiple product modalities (eg small and large molecules, immunotherapies, etc.). * A deep and broad understanding of the global pharmaceutical industry and of the key value creating processes within the industry. * Significant experience as senior strategic leader, adept at utilizing financial, commercial and scientific/ technical information to enhance organizational performance. * Leveraged strong understanding of future trends in scientific and drug development, business development, portfolio planning, analytics, compliance, regulatory and commercial aspects within the therapeutic area into competitive advantage and results. * Experience in building high performing organizations and teams in dynamic fast paced global environment. * Demonstrated records in leading cross functional and global teams, managing incremental and/or large change, building organization capability within therapeutic area. AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven, integrated biopharmaceutical company. Their mission is to make a meaningful difference to patient health through great medicines that improve patients' lives and add value for their stakeholders and society.

AstraZeneca discovers, develops, manufactures and markets small molecules and biologics for important areas of healthcare, which include some of the world's most serious illnesses: oncology, cardiovascular, infection, autoimmune, respiratory, and inflammation. We work with strategic partners to combine complementary skills, resources and science to strengthen our platform for success in meeting a common goal of improved healthcare. Active in over one hundred countries with a growing presence in emerging markets including China, Brazil, Mexico and Russia. We employ over 50,000 people and invests over $4 billion in R&D each year.

Oncology at AstraZeneca

Even as research and development continues to break boundaries in how we understand and fight cancer, there are still more than eight million lives lost every year to the disease. AstraZeneca is committed to advancing the science of oncology to deliver life-changing medicines to patients most in need. With a combination-focused pipeline that exploits the power of four scientific platforms to help address unmet clinical needs in a host of cancers.

AstraZeneca is motivated by a dedication to the scientific discovery and collaboration that will one day help eliminate cancer as a cause of death.

  • Immuno-oncology - using the body's immune system to help fight cancer
  • Tumor drivers and resistance - developing therapies that target specific mutations to attack cancer cells
  • DNA damage repair - targeting the DNA repair process to block tumor cells' ability to reproduce
  • Antibody-drug conjugates - arming antibodies with cancer- killing agents for specific tumor targeting

AstraZeneca's robust Oncology pipeline includes investigational therapies in varied stages of clinical development, from recently approved products to earlier-stage molecules in clinical trials. We aspire to transform the lives of cancer patients, working to eliminate cancer as a cause of death in the future. As of February, 2016 there were 17 Phase 3/registration studies, 12 Phase 2 studies and 26 Phase 1 studies.

For more on AstraZeneca/MedImmune Oncology and to view their pipeline, please visit: ~~~- focus-areas/oncology.html

The Opportunity

AstraZeneca have a rare and exciting opportunity to lead the Oncology Global Medicines Development (Oncology GMed) organization globally, with colleagues located in the U.S. (Gaithersburg, MD) and Europe (Cambridge, UK). Global Medicines Development (GMD) is the science engine room for AstraZeneca's late stage development and our mission is to transform clinical concepts into medicines that deliver patient health benefits. GMD works closely with AstraZeneca's two autonomous discovery and early development organizations; IMed (small molecules) and MedImmune (biologics), and the Global Product and Portfolio Strategy (GPPS) organization to understand where there is unmet medical need, and in turn invent, develop, and deliver medicines to patients around the world.

To learn more about the Global Medicines Development organization, please visit:

~~~- science/global-medicines-development.html

Reporting to the EVP, Global Medicine Development & CMO, the Head of Oncology GMed will be accountable for defining, implementing, and executing the holistic strategy for the late-stage development of AstraZeneca's robust and innovative Oncology portfolio. He/She will also serve as a member of AstraZeneca's Cancer Enterprise Leadership Team, along with senior colleagues from IMED and MedImmune, and GPPS. Together this enterprise group will ensure focus and alignment across all functions, and seek to accelerate and maximize the company's industry leading Oncology portfolio.

Additionally, as a key member of the GMD Leadership Team, the Head of Oncology GMed will play an integral role in fuelling alignment and setting broader strategy across AstraZeneca's core therapeutics areas: Cardiovascular and Metabolic Diseases, Oncology, and Respiratory, Inflammation and Autoimmunity, with an opportunity-driven approach to Infection, Neuroscience and Gastrointestinal diseases.

Scope and Key Responsibilities

  • Define and implement the Oncology GMed therapeutic area strategy in alignment with AstraZeneca's broader objectives.
  • Develop an effective high performing Oncology GMed function and foster collaboration across functions to ensure successful delivery of business priorities with focus on innovation, expediency, and quality.
  • Deliver the global late stage portfolio and lifecycle management programs within the agreed scope at optimal speed, cost, and quality.
  • Responsible for the credible and articulate communication of AstraZeneca's strategy to ensure goal alignment.
  • Deliver the perspective of key external stakeholders into the thinking and decision making of AstraZeneca's senior leadership, executive management team, and brand teams.
  • Direct the development and implementation of the company's strategic Physician Management plan.
  • Oversee the Physician's processes and standards to ensure their appropriateness and guarantee compliance to all internal and external processes. Ensures any issues are reviewed in a timely manner.
  • Manage the Senior Physician Management team to ensure departmental goals and targets are achieved and the performance of individuals is managed effectively.
  • Oversee the implementation of tactical leadership decisions in order for the business to achieve its objectives
  • Performance manage senior managers and identify development opportunities for direct reports, together with appropriate succession planning

Experience Required

  • M.D. with subspecialty training in Oncology.
  • Demonstrated scientific, clinical, and medical expertise, and a proven ability to drive results.
  • Recognized as scientific opinion leader with significant experience spanning of all stages of drug development and exposure to multiple product modalities (e.g. small and large molecules, immunotherapies, etc.).
  • A deep and broad understanding of the global pharmaceutical industry and of the key value creating processes within the industry.
  • Significant experience as senior strategic leader, adept at utilizing financial, commercial and scientific/ technical information to enhance organizational performance.
  • Leveraged strong understanding of future trends in scientific and drug development, business development, portfolio planning, analytics, compliance, regulatory and commercial aspects within the therapeutic area into competitive advantage and results.
  • Experience in building high performing organizations and teams in dynamic fast paced global environment.
  • Demonstrated records in leading cross functional and global teams, managing incremental and/or large change, building organization capability within therapeutic area. Astute, broad ability to influence strategically and persuade tactfully across stakeholder groups.
  • Established external networks and effective relationship with key stakeholders, such as external scientific experts, medical and scientific organizations, governmental bodies and officials, and patient organizations within the therapeutic area.
  • Experience managing significant risk and/or developmental budget, and can systematically build a risk management mind-set and mechanism within the therapeutic area. Experienced in running a function or part of a function including contingency planning, and budget planning.
  • Track record of delivering overall results with quality and cost across the therapeutic area by driving strategic, financial and people performance.
  • Proven ability to get things done and deliver in a complex environment.

Skills, Capabilities and Values

  • Strong leadership; adept in building a shared vision, setting direction, shaping culture and inspiring commitment and followership. Strong influencing and conflict management skills.
  • Self-aware, able to engage stakeholders with varied needs to achieve common set of goals. Able to express complex ideas and strategies in clear and compelling ways. Excellent ability to build trust and be credible with stakeholders internally and externally.
  • Enable individual and team performance. Able to attract, develop & retain diverse talent across cultures/functions. Able to drive high productivity within function (cost, quality, time).
  • Demonstrates high level of integrity in dealing with others and in decision making. High level of ethics and driven by what is in the best interest for patients.
  • Strong business and financial acumen to assess and drive portfolio value. High learning orientation and adaptability. Deep understanding of AZ and competitor strategy within the therapeutic area to continuously adapt and shape results in implementing global strategy which delivers business value within the therapeutic area. Able to balance longer term thinking with short term execution to achieve the optimal quality, speed and cost.
  • Results-driven, innovative with rapid decision making ability balancing risk/reward in adapting to rapidly changing environment.
  • Global and enterprise mind-set, able to lead and engage across multiple, complex organizations and geographies. Organizational knowledge, understanding the nature of all the functional areas and how the functions relate to each other, from early science to operation and to commercial regions.

For an exploratory conversation please connect with Paul Oldham (Global Recruitment Lead) on ~~~. All discussion will be held in complete confidentiality.

AstraZeneca welcomes applications from all sections of the community.

An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity 2adeeeb56315459e9e6e66e978ce9c69

Scope and Key Responsibilities

Define and implement the Oncology GMed therapeutic area strategy in alignment with AstraZeneca's broader objectives.

Develop an effective high performing Oncology GMed function and foster collaboration across functions to ensure successful delivery of business priorities with focus on innovation, expediency, and quality.

Deliver the global late stage portfolio and lifecycle management programs within the agreed scope at optimal speed, cost, and quality.

Responsible for the credible and articulate communication of AstraZeneca's strategy to ensure goal alignment.

Deliver the perspective of key external stakeholders into the thinking and decision making of AstraZeneca's senior leadership, executive management team, and brand teams.

Direct the development and implementation of the company's strategic Physician Management plan.

Oversee the Physician's processes and standards to ensure their appropriateness and guarantee compliance to all internal and external processes. Ensures any issues are reviewed in a timely manner.

Manage the Senior Physician Management team to ensure departmental goals and targets are achieved and the performance of individuals is managed effectively.

Oversee the implementation of tactical leadership decisions in order for the business to achieve its objectives

Performance manage senior managers and identify development opportunities for direct reports, together with appropriate succession planning

Experience Required

M.D. with subspecialty training in Oncology.

Demonstrated scientific, clinical, and medical expertise, and a proven ability to drive results.

Recognized as scientific opinion leader with significant experience spanning of all stages of drug development and exposure to multiple product modalities (e.g. small and large molecules, immunotherapies, etc.).

A deep and broad understanding of the global pharmaceutical industry and of the key value creating processes within the industry.

Significant experience as senior strategic leader, adept at utilizing financial, commercial and scientific/ technical information to enhance organizational performance.

Leveraged strong understanding of future trends in scientific and drug development, business development, portfolio planning, analytics, compliance, regulatory and commercial aspects within the therapeutic area into competitive advantage and results.

Experience in building high performing organizations and teams in dynamic fast paced global environment.

Demonstrated records in leading cross functional and global teams, managing incremental and/or large change, building organization capability within therapeutic area. Astute, broad ability to influence strategically and persuade tactfully across stakeholder groups.

Established external networks and effective relationship with key stakeholders, such as external scientific experts, medical and scientific organizations, governmental bodies and officials, and patient organizations within the therapeutic area.

Experience managing significant risk and/or developmental budget, and can systematically build a risk management mind-set and mechanism within the therapeutic area. Experienced in running a function or part of a function including contingency planning, and budget planning.

Track record of delivering overall results with quality and cost across the therapeutic area by driving strategic, financial and people performance.

Proven ability to get things done and deliver in a complex environment.

Skills, Capabilities and Values

Strong leadership; adept in building a shared vision, setting direction, shaping culture and inspiring commitment and followership. Strong influencing and conflict management skills.

Self-aware, able to engage stakeholders with varied needs to achieve common set of goals. Able to express complex ideas and strategies in clear and compelling ways. Excellent ability to build trust and be credible with stakeholders internally and externally.

Enable individual and team performance. Able to attract, develop & retain diverse talent across cultures/functions. Able to drive high productivity within function (cost, quality, time).

Demonstrates high level of integrity in dealing with others and in decision making. High level of ethics and driven by what is in the best interest for patients.

Strong business and financial acumen to assess and drive portfolio value. High learning orientation and adaptability. Deep understanding of AZ and competitor strategy within the therapeutic area to continuously adapt and shape results in implementing global strategy which delivers business value within the therapeutic area. Able to balance longer term thinking with short term execution to achieve the optimal quality, speed and cost.

Results-driven, innovative with rapid decision making ability balancing risk/reward in adapting to rapidly changing environment.

Global and enterprise mind-set, able to lead and engage across multiple, complex organizations and geographies. Organizational knowledge, understanding the nature of all the functional areas and how the functions relate to each other, from early science to operation and to commercial regions.

For an exploratory conversation please connect with Paul Oldham (Global Recruitment Lead) on ~~~. All discussion will be held in complete confidentiality.

<description>Head of Oncology, Global Medicines Development (GMed) AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven, integrated biopharmaceutical company. Their mission is to make a meaningful difference to patient health through great medicines that improve patients lives and add value for their stakeholders and society. Oncology at AstraZeneca Even as research and development continues to break boundaries in how we understand and fight cancer, there are still more than eight million lives lost every year to the disease. AstraZeneca is committed to advancing the science of oncology to deliver life-changing medicines to patients most in need. With a combination-focused pipeline that exploits the power of four scientific platforms to help address unmet clinical needs in a host of cancers. AstraZeneca is motivated by a dedication to the scientific discovery and collaboration that will one day help eliminate cancer as a cause of death. Immuno-oncology - using the body's immune system to help fight cancer Tumor drivers and resistance - developing therapies that target specific mutations to attack cancer cells DNA damage repair - targeting the DNA repair process to block tumor cells ability to reproduce Antibody-drug conjugates - arming antibodies with cancer- killing agents for specific tumor targeting AstraZeneca's robust Oncology pipeline includes investigational therapies in varied stages of clinical development, from recently approved products to earlier-stage molecules in clinical trials. We aspires to transform the lives of cancer patients, working to eliminate cancer as a cause of death in the future. As of February, 2016 there were 17 Phase 3/registration studies, 12 Phase 2 studies and 26 Phase 1 studies. For more on AstraZeneca/MedImmune Oncology and to view their pipeline, please visit: https://www.astrazeneca.com/our- focus-areas/oncology.html The Opportunity AstraZeneca have a rare and exciting opportunity to lead the Oncology Global Medicines Development (Oncology GMed) organization globally, with colleagues located in the U.S. (Gaithersburg, MD) and Europe (Cambridge, UK). Global Medicines Development (GMD) is the science engine room for AstraZeneca's late stage development and our mission is to transform clinical concepts into medicines that deliver patient health benefits. GMD works closely with AstraZeneca's two autonomous discovery and early development organizations; IMed (small molecules) and MedImmune (biologics), and the Global Product and Portfolio Strategy (GPPS) organization to understand where there is unmet medical need, and in turn invent, develop, and deliver medicines to patients around the world. To learn more about the Global Medicines Development organization, please visit: https://www.astrazeneca.com/our- science/global-medicines-development.html Reporting to the EVP, Global Medicine Development & CMO, the Head of Oncology GMed will be accountable for defining, implementing, and executing the holistic strategy for the late-stage development of AstraZeneca's robust and innovative Oncology portfolio. He/She will also serve as a member of AstraZeneca's Cancer Enterprise Leadership Team, along with senior colleagues from IMED and MedImmune, and GPPS. Together this enterprise group will ensure focus and alignment across all functions, and seek to accelerate and maximize the company's industry leading Oncology portfolio. Additionally, as a key member of the GMD Leadership Team, the Head of Oncology GMed will play an integral role in fuelling alignment and setting broader strategy across AstraZeneca's core therapeutics areas: Cardiovascular and Metabolic Diseases, Oncology, and Respiratory, Inflammation and Autoimmunity, with an opportunity-driven approach to Infection, Neuroscience and Gastrointestinal diseases. For an exploratory conversation please connect with Paul Oldham (Global Recruitment Lead) on paul.oldham1@astrazeneca.com. All discussion will be held in complete confidentiality. To find out more please visit... http://jobs.astrazeneca.com/jobs/details/l1r1450090850-head-of-oncology-gmed-vice-president</description><education>BC/BE Medical Oncologist , MD</education>

Stockport NHS Foundation TrustThere are lots of good reasons to choose to come and work at Stockport NHS Foundation Trust.A dynamic integrated Trust with integrity and vision.Exactly the same qualities youll see in yourself.Stockport NHS Foundation Trust aims to be the organisation of choice for patients and an employer of choice for staff.In order to continually improve all aspects of our patient experience, we rely upon having a highly skilled, motivated, diverse, productive and patient focused workforce.Stockport Foundation Trust is one of four specialist hospital sites in Greater Manchester.Being a specialist hospital will enhance our general surgery, anaesthetics, critical care and emergency medicine for the benefit of people in Stockport, High Peak, Cheshire and across Greater Manchester. Our values  Quality and Safety, Communication, Service are at the heart of everything we do and come from our Your Health. Our Priority promise. Every day they drive the behaviour and actions for every person in our organisation. JUNIOR CLINICAL FELLOW Medicine Business Group We are expanding our body of Junior Clinical Fellows across the Medicine Business Group at Stepping Hill Hospital.We are offering 4 positions rotating through specialty areas on a 6 monthly basis enabling valuable exposure and experience in a variety of specialties and service settings.The hours of work are 40 hours per week but applications for part time and job share arrangements will be considered. These posts offer excellent experience for those planning a career in medicine. Although not an accredited training post, post holders are supported to participate in the training and educational programs provided and post holders will be allocated an educational supervisor. Currently we haveJunior Clinical Fellows in posts within the Business Group across General & Specialty Medicine, Rehab & Enablement, Acute Medicine & Emergency Department. The Rotations Rotational JCF 1 Rotational JCF 2 Rotational JCF 3 Rotational JCF 4 Respiratory Medicine Gastroenterology Department of medicine for older people Diabetes & Endocrinology Diabetes & Endocrinology Respiratory Medicine Gastroenterology Department of medicine for older people Department of medicine for older people Diabetes & Endocrinology Respiratory Medicine Gastroenterology Gastroenterology Department of medicine for older people Diabetes & Endocrinology Respiratory Medicine Out Of Hours Working Opportunities to participate in the General Internal Medicine on call rota will be considered for suitable post holders who are able to fulfill the expectations of the duty. The TrustStockport NHS Foundation Trust;one the first-wave NHS Foundation Trusts in April 2004, one of 4 named specialist hospitals in Greater Manchester in 2015, an associate teaching hospital and a thriving District General Hospital with most major clinical specialties.The hospital is based in a highly attractive part of the North-West, with appealing residential areas boasting some of the best schools in the country.At Stepping Hill Hospital we are proud of our associate teaching hospital status and we have a strong emphasis on Postgraduate training for all via close links with the University of Manchester.The hospital has an active Postgraduate Centre with a comprehensive programme of clinical meetings, MRCP teaching, seminars and excellent library facilities. For an informal discussion about the roles or to arrange an informal visit, please contact Dr Ngai Kong, Clinical Director, on 0161 4195477 or email Willing to accomodate Skype interviews*The Trust is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children,young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment and promote safeguarding by implementing the Trusts policies and procedures,acting promptly on concerns, communicating effectively and sharing information appropriately. If successful this vacancy will require an enhanced DBS check at a cost of 48.43. This cost will be deducted from your first Trust salaryApplicants are encouraged to read the documents attached to this vacancy before applying,including the job description and person specification and the information for applicants which includes useful information to assist you in completing your application.From time to time we may need to close a vacancy early when in receipt of a sufficient number of applications.If you are interested in this post and wish to be considered, we strongly advise you to complete and submit your application as soon as possible.Please note that all correspondence will be via your NHS Jobs account.Unfortunately we are not able to acknowledge each application. If you do not hear from us within four weeks of the closing date, please consider that you have not been shortlisted on this occasion.Stockport NHS Foundation Trust is committed to promoting and championing a culture of diversity, fairness and equality for all applicants and employees.Applications are welcomed from all backgrounds and we strive to reflect the community we serve in our diverse workforce.Our "two tick" kite mark guarantees a candidate with a disability, who fulfills the essential criteria, an interview at the Trust. We can make reasonable adjustments, and offer support and advice in a variety of ways on request. Disclosure and Barring Service CheckThis post is subject to the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (Exceptions Order) 1975 and as such it will be necessary for a submission for Disclosure to be made to the Disclosure and Barring Service (formerly known as CRB)to check for any previous criminal convictions. Tier 2 Certificate of Sponsorship (formerly a Work Permit)Applications from job seekers who require Tier 2 sponsorship to work in the UK are welcome and will be considered alongside all other applications.However, non-EEA candidates may not be appointed to a post if a suitably qualified, experienced and skilled EU/EEA candidate is available to take up the post as the employing body is unlikely,in these circumstances, to satisfy the Resident Labour Market Test.The UK Border Agency requires employers to complete this test to show that no suitably qualified EEA or EU worker can fill the post. For further information please visit UK Border Agency website. UK Registration Applicants must have current UK professional registration.For further information please see applying from overseas .

AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven, integrated biopharmaceutical company. Their mission is to make a meaningful difference to patient health through great medicines that improve patients' lives and add value for their stakeholders and society.

AstraZeneca discovers, develops, manufactures and markets small molecules and biologics for important areas of healthcare, which include some of the world's most serious illnesses: oncology, cardiovascular, infection, autoimmune, respiratory, and inflammation. We work with strategic partners to combine complementary skills, resources and science to strengthen our platform for success in meeting a common goal of improved healthcare. Active in over one hundred countries with a growing presence in emerging markets including China, Brazil, Mexico and Russia. We employ over 50,000 people and invests over $4 billion in R&D each year.

Oncology at AstraZeneca

Even as research and development continues to break boundaries in how we understand and fight cancer, there are still more than eight million lives lost every year to the disease. AstraZeneca is committed to advancing the science of oncology to deliver life-changing medicines to patients most in need. With a combination-focused pipeline that exploits the power of four scientific platforms to help address unmet clinical needs in a host of cancers.

AstraZeneca is motivated by a dedication to the scientific discovery and collaboration that will one day help eliminate cancer as a cause of death.

  • Immuno-oncology - using the body's immune system to help fight cancer
  • Tumor drivers and resistance - developing therapies that target specific mutations to attack cancer cells
  • DNA damage repair - targeting the DNA repair process to block tumor cells' ability to reproduce
  • Antibody-drug conjugates - arming antibodies with cancer- killing agents for specific tumor targeting

AstraZeneca's robust Oncology pipeline includes investigational therapies in varied stages of clinical development, from recently approved products to earlier-stage molecules in clinical trials. We aspire to transform the lives of cancer patients, working to eliminate cancer as a cause of death in the future. As of February, 2016 there were 17 Phase 3/registration studies, 12 Phase 2 studies and 26 Phase 1 studies.

For more on AstraZeneca/MedImmune Oncology and to view their pipeline, please visit: ~~~- focus-areas/oncology.html

The Opportunity

AstraZeneca have a rare and exciting opportunity to lead the Oncology Global Medicines Development (Oncology GMed) organization globally, with colleagues located in the U.S. (Gaithersburg, MD) and Europe (Cambridge, UK). Global Medicines Development (GMD) is the science engine room for AstraZeneca's late stage development and our mission is to transform clinical concepts into medicines that deliver patient health benefits. GMD works closely with AstraZeneca's two autonomous discovery and early development organizations; IMed (small molecules) and MedImmune (biologics), and the Global Product and Portfolio Strategy (GPPS) organization to understand where there is unmet medical need, and in turn invent, develop, and deliver medicines to patients around the world.

To learn more about the Global Medicines Development organization, please visit:

~~~- science/global-medicines-development.html

Reporting to the EVP, Global Medicine Development & CMO, the Head of Oncology GMed will be accountable for defining, implementing, and executing the holistic strategy for the late-stage development of AstraZeneca's robust and innovative Oncology portfolio. He/She will also serve as a member of AstraZeneca's Cancer Enterprise Leadership Team, along with senior colleagues from IMED and MedImmune, and GPPS. Together this enterprise group will ensure focus and alignment across all functions, and seek to accelerate and maximize the company's industry leading Oncology portfolio.

Additionally, as a key member of the GMD Leadership Team, the Head of Oncology GMed will play an integral role in fuelling alignment and setting broader strategy across AstraZeneca's core therapeutics areas: Cardiovascular and Metabolic Diseases, Oncology, and Respiratory, Inflammation and Autoimmunity, with an opportunity-driven approach to Infection, Neuroscience and Gastrointestinal diseases.

Scope and Key Responsibilities

  • Define and implement the Oncology GMed therapeutic area strategy in alignment with AstraZeneca's broader objectives.
  • Develop an effective high performing Oncology GMed function and foster collaboration across functions to ensure successful delivery of business priorities with focus on innovation, expediency, and quality.
  • Deliver the global late stage portfolio and lifecycle management programs within the agreed scope at optimal speed, cost, and quality.
  • Responsible for the credible and articulate communication of AstraZeneca's strategy to ensure goal alignment.
  • Deliver the perspective of key external stakeholders into the thinking and decision making of AstraZeneca's senior leadership, executive management team, and brand teams.
  • Direct the development and implementation of the company's strategic Physician Management plan.
  • Oversee the Physician's processes and standards to ensure their appropriateness and guarantee compliance to all internal and external processes. Ensures any issues are reviewed in a timely manner.
  • Manage the Senior Physician Management team to ensure departmental goals and targets are achieved and the performance of individuals is managed effectively.
  • Oversee the implementation of tactical leadership decisions in order for the business to achieve its objectives
  • Performance manage senior managers and identify development opportunities for direct reports, together with appropriate succession planning

Experience Required

  • M.D. with subspecialty training in Oncology.
  • Demonstrated scientific, clinical, and medical expertise, and a proven ability to drive results.
  • Recognized as scientific opinion leader with significant experience spanning of all stages of drug development and exposure to multiple product modalities (e.g. small and large molecules, immunotherapies, etc.).
  • A deep and broad understanding of the global pharmaceutical industry and of the key value creating processes within the industry.
  • Significant experience as senior strategic leader, adept at utilizing financial, commercial and scientific/ technical information to enhance organizational performance.
  • Leveraged strong understanding of future trends in scientific and drug development, business development, portfolio planning, analytics, compliance, regulatory and commercial aspects within the therapeutic area into competitive advantage and results.
  • Experience in building high performing organizations and teams in dynamic fast paced global environment.
  • Demonstrated records in leading cross functional and global teams, managing incremental and/or large change, building organization capability within therapeutic area. Astute, broad ability to influence strategically and persuade tactfully across stakeholder groups.
  • Established external networks and effective relationship with key stakeholders, such as external scientific experts, medical and scientific organizations, governmental bodies and officials, and patient organizations within the therapeutic area.
  • Experience managing significant risk and/or developmental budget, and can systematically build a risk management mind-set and mechanism within the therapeutic area. Experienced in running a function or part of a function including contingency planning, and budget planning.
  • Track record of delivering overall results with quality and cost across the therapeutic area by driving strategic, financial and people performance.
  • Proven ability to get things done and deliver in a complex environment.

Skills, Capabilities and Values

  • Strong leadership; adept in building a shared vision, setting direction, shaping culture and inspiring commitment and followership. Strong influencing and conflict management skills.
  • Self-aware, able to engage stakeholders with varied needs to achieve common set of goals. Able to express complex ideas and strategies in clear and compelling ways. Excellent ability to build trust and be credible with stakeholders internally and externally.
  • Enable individual and team performance. Able to attract, develop & retain diverse talent across cultures/functions. Able to drive high productivity within function (cost, quality, time).
  • Demonstrates high level of integrity in dealing with others and in decision making. High level of ethics and driven by what is in the best interest for patients.
  • Strong business and financial acumen to assess and drive portfolio value. High learning orientation and adaptability. Deep understanding of AZ and competitor strategy within the therapeutic area to continuously adapt and shape results in implementing global strategy which delivers business value within the therapeutic area. Able to balance longer term thinking with short term execution to achieve the optimal quality, speed and cost.
  • Results-driven, innovative with rapid decision making ability balancing risk/reward in adapting to rapidly changing environment.
  • Global and enterprise mind-set, able to lead and engage across multiple, complex organizations and geographies. Organizational knowledge, understanding the nature of all the functional areas and how the functions relate to each other, from early science to operation and to commercial regions.

For an exploratory conversation please connect with Paul Oldham (Global Recruitment Lead) on ~~~. All discussion will be held in complete confidentiality.

AstraZeneca welcomes applications from all sections of the community.

An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

SUMMARY: Jobs in this family are responsible for developing, testing, maintaining, installing, and/or deploying of applications and related information technologies. In addition, they are responsible for the establishment, development, and promotion of standard architectures, as well as hardware and software components. This role provides consulting services regarding how to integrate information technologies into clinical and business processes and the effective application of industry and organizational technology standards. This position is an emerging information technology professional within the Systems Analyst family. This position participates in the implementation, testing, installation and support of clinical and business applications. Expected activities include but are not limited to: modification of applications as needed to meet user requirements, the definition and development of reports, participation in application upgrades, participation in the resolution of problems and issues associated with installed applications and related information technologies, diagnosis of failures encountered in application software and related technologies, quality control of all application implementations/enhancements prior to release to customers, maintains an awareness of vendor and industry developments/plans in area(s) of responsibility, communication and documentation of all relevant items and activities. QUALIFICATIONS: Position requires at least 3 years of direct experience and a high school diploma or equivalent. May have an equivalent combination of education and/or experience in lieu of education and/or experience. Position requires at least 3 years of direct experience with AthenaClinicals A BA/BS degree in IS or Business is preferred. EOE/AA, M/F/Disability/Vet

<description>athenahealth is transforming the US health care industry by helping doctors better manage their practices, their patients, their clinical outcomes, and their cash flow. Our innovative cloud-enabled services have become the premier choice for tens of thousands of medical practices and health systems across the United States. We offer a fresh, friendly, and fun work environment where creativity is nourished and cultivated. We are a successful, stable global company ready for the challenge of new growth and new products. And we need your help. Our Team Our cloud-based approach (athenaClinicals) to electronic medical records drives efficiency by offering more than just EMR software. Athena combines a web-based electronic health record (EHR) with clinical content and a unique service offering that helps manage our clients clinical documentation. The service component of athenaClinicals acts as a virtual clinical back office for patient records by managing all incoming and outgoing faxes and clinical document management by utilizing a complex, dynamic business process and a very large team including relationships with several business partners (BPO). Roles & Responsibilities The Manager, Clinical Operations will be responsible for building and leading a focused team from our Chennai office that will play a critical role in helping to enhance the success of our processing partners. The Manager and his/her team will drive cross-functional operations and R&D projects and initiatives designed to maximize the impact and efficiency of our business partners while leveraging process innovation and automation opportunities. The Chennai-based team will work in concert with business partner teams across India as well as a small US-based operations team. The Manager, Clinical Operations will have a dual reporting relationship to both the Chennai-based Director of Operations as well as the US-Based Director of Clinical Operations. Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to Drive enhanced business partner quality and productivity through direct and open collaboration, metrics monitoring and analytics, and relationship strategy / governance; Drive increased automation opportunities and business impact through rigorous monitoring, analysis, and management reporting; Develop and manage the team responsible for several production oriented client escalation workflows; Influence and collaborate with internal stakeholders on process design decisions driving measurable service quality and/or efficiency gains; Provide data-driven analysis and project prioritization of project trade-offs; Test, tune and approve major workflow/process changes prior to production release; Manage the large scale training effort and BPO rollout related to meaningful business process changes and service expansion. Qualifications Bachelors degree with 8-10 years related experience preferred; Previous knowledge of the US healthcare industry and clinical documentation; Previous management experience and track record of measurable business results; Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with a geographically disperse cross-functional team; Excellent planning, process innovation and execution skills; Mastery of all Microsoft Office applications, including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint; Excellent communication skills; Willing/excited to work in a fast-paced, but sometimes intense, rapidly expanding company; Exceptional organizational skills and maniacal attention to detail; Technically proficient able to participate in technical project discussions. Interested candidates may send resumes to jnarayana@athenahealth.com / ahirecruiting@athenahealth.com Salary Not Disclosed by Recruiter Industry IT-Software / Software Services Functional Area Medical , Healthcare , R&D , Pharmaceuticals , Biotechnology Role Category R&D Role Clinical Research Manager</description><requirement>Clinical Research Clinical Operations Clinical Monitoring Pharma and Clinical Research</requirement><experience>8 - 10 Years</experience><education>Any Graduate</education>

In addition, they are responsible for the establishment, development, and promotion of standard architectures, as well as hardware and software components. This role provides consulting services regarding how to integrate information technologies into clinical and business processes and the effective application of industry and organizational technology standards. This position is an emerging information technology professional within the Systems Analyst family. This position participates in the implementation, testing, installation and support of clinical and business applications. Expected activities include but are not limited to: modification of applications as needed to meet user requirements, the definition and development of reports, participation in application upgrades, participation in the resolution of problems and issues associated with installed applications and related information technologies, diagnosis of failures encountered in application software and related technologies, quality control of all application implementations/enhancements prior to release to customers, maintains an awareness of vendor and industry developments/plans in area(s) of responsibility, communication and documentation of all relevant items and activities. QUALIFICATIONS: Experience with AthenaClinicals highly preferred. RN or LVN highly preferred. Position requires at least 3 years of direct experience and a high school diploma or equivalent. A BA/BS degree in IS or Business is preferred. May have an equivalent combination of education and/or experience in lieu of education and/or experience stated above.

EOE/AA, M/F/Disability/Vet

JOB DETAILS:

SUMMARY:

Jobs in this family are responsible for developing, testing, maintaining, installing, and/or deploying of applications and related information technologies. In addition, they are responsible for the establishment, development, and promotion of standard architectures, as well as hardware and software components. This role provides consulting services to application development teams and/or customers regarding how to integrate information technologies into clinical and business processes and the effective application of industry and organizational technology standards. This position is an entry level information technology professional within the Business Analyst family. This position will quickly learn, through on-the-job experiences and formal training, about the applications and related technologies in their area of responsibility Expected activities include but are not limited to: assisting in the modification of applications as needed to meet user requirements, assisting in the definition and development of reports, participation in application upgrades, participation in the resolution of problems and issues associated with installed applications, assist in the diagnosis of failures encountered in application software and related technologies, communication and documentation of all relevant items and activities.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Position requires at least a Bachelors degree in an Information Technology, Business or related Healthcare field and limited experience OR at least 1 year of experience with athenaClinicals.

EOE/AA, M/F/Disability/Vet

<description>athenahealth is transforming the US health care industry by helping doctors better manage their practices, their patients, their clinical outcomes, and their cash flow. Our innovative cloud-enabled services have become the premier choice for tens of thousands of medical practices and health systems across the United States. We offer a fresh, friendly, and fun work environment where creativity is nourished and cultivated. We are a successful, stable global company ready for the challenge of new growth and new products. And we need your help. Our Team Our cloud-based approach (athenaClinicals) to electronic medical records drives efficiency by offering more than just EMR software. Athena combines a web-based electronic health record (EHR) with clinical content and a unique service offering that helps manage our clients clinical documentation. The service component of athenaClinicals acts as a virtual clinical back office for patient records by managing all incoming and outgoing faxes and clinical document management by utilizing a complex, dynamic business process and a very large team including relationships with several business partners (BPO). Roles & Responsibilities The Manager, Clinical Operations will be responsible for building and leading a focused team from our Chennai office that will play a critical role in helping to enhance the success of our processing partners. The Manager and his/her team will drive cross-functional operations and R&D projects and initiatives designed to maximize the impact and efficiency of our business partners while leveraging process innovation and automation opportunities. The Chennai-based team will work in concert with business partner teams across India as well as a small US-based operations team. The Manager, Clinical Operations will have a dual reporting relationship to both the Chennai-based Director of Operations as well as the US-Based Director of Clinical Operations. Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to Drive enhanced business partner quality and productivity through direct and open collaboration, metrics monitoring and analytics, and relationship strategy / governance; Drive increased automation opportunities and business impact through rigorous monitoring, analysis, and management reporting; Develop and manage the team responsible for several production oriented client escalation workflows; Influence and collaborate with internal stakeholders on process design decisions driving measurable service quality and/or efficiency gains; Provide data-driven analysis and project prioritization of project trade-offs; Test, tune and approve major workflow/process changes prior to production release; Manage the large scale training effort and BPO rollout related to meaningful business process changes and service expansion. Qualifications Bachelors degree with 8-10 years related experience preferred; Previous knowledge of the US healthcare industry and clinical documentation; Previous management experience and track record of measurable business results; Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with a geographically disperse cross-functional team; Excellent planning, process innovation and execution skills; Mastery of all Microsoft Office applications, including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint; Excellent communication skills; Willing/excited to work in a fast-paced, but sometimes intense, rapidly expanding company; Exceptional organizational skills and maniacal attention to detail; Technically proficient able to participate in technical project discussions. Interested candidates may send resumes to jnarayana@athenahealth.com / ahirecruiting@athenahealth.com Salary Not Disclosed by Recruiter Industry IT-Software / Software Services Functional Area Medical , Healthcare , R&D , Pharmaceuticals , Biotechnology Role Category R&D Role Clinical Research Manager</description><requirement>Clinical Research Clinical Operations Clinical Monitoring Pharma and Clinical Research</requirement><experience>8 - 10 Years</experience><education>Any Graduate</education>

Seeking a Dynamic Physical Therapist or PT Assistant with a strong desire to grow as a professional! Our office is a well established, small, profitable outpatient therapy practice in beautiful Tucson, Arizona. Mountains, hiking and warm temperatures. We have a reputation in Tucson for excellence. The owner has 36 years experience and another full time therapist with 34 years experience. Ours is a unique practice that does not employ aids or technicians. This allows for the highest quality assessment and treatment for 45-60 minutes for each and every patient.We serve a wide variety of patient's, primarily orthopedic and musculoskeltal in nature.We do have a high ratio of Medicare age patients.Treatment programs encourage manual therapy skills and an emphasis on functional training exercises and activities which are constantly re-assessed and modified to maximize patient response and progression. Ours is definitely not a "cookbook practice." We encourage our employees to have fun with each other and with our patients. We believe in a high quality, truly professional setting that promotes and encourages creativity and innovation. We will be moving into a brand new office in August and look forward to adding to our practice! Benefits: Clinicient EMR Documentation System APTA annual dues reimbursement Generous Continuing Education allowance Malpractice Insurance Maximum 10 patients per Day Competitive Compensation Package Requirements: Current Arizona State license, or in the process of attaining an Arizona license Minimum 2 years experience, must have manual therapy experience Curriculum Vitae with a Resume

Medical Receptionist intern needed to join our Physical Rehabilitation and Pain Management office! The hours are flexible. This is a very fast paced office and you must be able to work independently. Responsibilities Confirm, cancel and reschedule appointments for patients. Greet patients in a friendly and professional manner. Check patients in and out. Answer high volume phone calls. Collect co-pays when required. Communicate with clinical staff, specialist offices and diagnostic facilities. Issue necessary referrals and obtain prior authorization based on insurance requirements. Organize and monitor provider's daily schedule. Maintain timely patient flow. Prepare charts for future appointments. Process incoming/outgoing correspondence. Bilingual (Spanish is mandatory; written and oral). Must be self motivated and be able to multitask. High attention to detail required. Computer literacy required. Ability to use interpersonal skills to establish and maintain relationships with patients, families, physicians and coworkers. Medical Receptionist intern needed to join our Physical Rehabilitation and Pain Management office! The hours are flexible. This is a very fast paced office and you must be able to work independently. Responsibilities Confirm, cancel and reschedule appointments for patients. Greet patients in a friendly and professional manner. Check patients in and out. Answer high volume phone calls. Collect co-pays when required. Communicate with clinical staff, specialist offices and diagnostic facilities. Issue necessary referrals and obtain prior authorization based on insurance requirements. Organize and monitor provider's daily schedule. Maintain timely patient flow. Prepare charts for future appointments. Process incoming/outgoing correspondence. Index and categorize scanned documents for EMR. Communicate any patient concerns or complaints to Site Manager. Qualifications High School graduate or currently enrolled in College/University. Must be Available in office 30-35 hours per week, during the weekday . 0-1 year knowledge of medical terminology and office procedures. Experience with EMR and ADS MedicsPremier a plus. Bilingual (Spanish is mandatory; written and oral). Must be self motivated and be able to multitask. High attention to detail required. Computer literacy required. Ability to use interpersonal skills to establish and maintain relationships with patients, families, physicians and coworkers. Job Type: Internship Salary: $0.00 /year Job Location: New York, NY 10002 Required language: Spanish

JOB TITLE: Echo Vascular Sonographer 3 GENERAL SUMMARY OF DUTIES: Responsible for performing all Cardiac Echo and Vascular studies as outlined below. LOCATION: Gainesville, Lake City, StarkeS UPERVISON RECEIVED: Director, Non-Invasive Services; Lead Vascular Sonographer Echo Technical Director ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: The Sonographer will be responsible for proficiently performing Echocardiograms , Carotid Duplex, Segmental Pressure Exams, Exercise Treadmill Stress Tests, Stress (and Chemical) Echocardiograms, Abdominal Aorta Duplex, Arterial Duplex, Renal Duplex and Venous Duplex Studies following the established ICAEL and ICAVL standard protocols created by TCAVI. Accurately inputs all pertinent information and measurements in the Intergy EHR system to create complete and accurate procedure reports. Accurately charges for all exams performed in the Intergy EHR system. Appropriately interacts in person and via telephone with patients or their representative regarding test instructions, questions and results. Will assist in the training of students and newly hired techs. Continually cleans and stocks exam rooms with supplies and linens. Maintains equipment by properly cleaning and brings to the attention of the Manager any discrepancies. Performs other duties as assigned. Assists with ICAEL I ICAVL accreditation applications as needed.

Intergy Clinical Coordinator HealthLinc is a network of Federally Qualified Health Centers in Northern Indiana. Currently, HealthLinc has 6 fixed sites plus a mobile health unit and serves a large service area that includes the counties of Lake, Porter, La Porte, St. Joseph, Jasper and Starke Counties. The service area includes a mixture of urban and rural landscapes with a wide variety of medically underserved areas, populations and provider shortage areas. The diversity and culture of each community is unique and reflected in the staffing and services at each of our sites. The Intergy Clinical Coordinator plays a key role in maintenance and enhancement of HealthLincs Intergy EHR System, providing technical expertise and ongoing training and support for staff using Intergy EHR. The Clinical Coordinator will also take part in the team effort of creating and maintaining the PCMH site designation from NCQA. This position will participate and support the Patient Centered Medical Home model in coordinating the care needs of patients focusing on the continuity of care. Job Duties: Assist with all facets of the maintenance of the Intergy EHR software, taking leadership of different areas as needed and as directed by the CIO, who will determine priorities for tasks below Utilize project management abilities to help lead and coordinate implementation of new functionality, upgrades, and Intergy EHR processes Lead or participate in HealthLinc task force or expert committees as the Intergy expert Help develop needed EHR content in cooperation with the Intergy EHR team members through workflow analysis Research and bring new ideas to the table in response to Intergy EHR issues Coordinate, as needed, with the Greenway Intergy Customer Support Develop training materials and the training plan for new process/functionalities of Intergy EHR. Perform trainings in groups and with individuals, eg new hires Develop and perform trainings to improve our efficiency with Intergy EHR. Update and maintain accuracy of the Intergy EHR training manual as processes change Identify and correct any gaps in performance of clinical data requirements Assist with HealthLincs help desk and field support questions from staff When needed a service request will be filed with Greenway support and will be responsible to follow through to an adequate resolution of the problem Trouble shoots technical issues that arise Assure ongoing data integrity of the EHR system through maintenance of scheduled reports and data clean-up as needed. Management of the Patient Portal as needed and directed and generate and understand the affiliated reports that come with Meaningful Use and Patient Centered Medical Home Monitor and improve patient registration, financial and billing operations outcomes. Understand on a basic level the use of Practice Analytics to provide custom reports to key leaders in support of billing and financial programs, grants, and other reporting needs - such as and managed care reports. Coordinate the implementation of functionality enhancements to the EHR as needed by the health center and its programs Category: JN023 Salary: 0.00

Application System Analyst I, Come join our well-established dynamic and innovative Child Service Agency providing services throughout the NYC metro area. The IT Applications team supports 1000+ users. <description>Pediatric Partners of the Southwest is looking for a highly experienced biller and coder who can assist with billing systems analysis. Pediatric Partners uses Office Practicum, a pediatric EHR with an integrated practice management system. PPSW is a physician owned financially thriving pediatric practice in Durango, CO serving the Four Corners region. We see over 25,000 patients annually in our open-access pediatric medical home. Job duties include: claims processing, payment posting, daily deposits, reconciliation of payments, auditing of insurance payments to assure compliance with contractual obligations, managing patient accounts, as well as collections. Experience in reviewing Explanations of Benefits from payors, evaluating denied claims, filing appeals and insurance follow-up is required. This is a full-Time position with Benefits. Salary Compensation is determined based upon experience. Required experience: - Medical Biller Analyst: 2 years</description>

POSITION DESCRIPTION The NY Foundling (NYF) is in the process of becoming more involved with providing healthcare than ever before with our participation in the Collaborative for Children & Families (CCF; a health home for children in NY State comprised of 33+ member agencies). As such, NYF is seeking a highly motivated and experienced systems analyst to help with process improvement, designing end-user forms and reports, and implementation support and troubleshooting of healthcare systems and databases. The scope of this persons knowledge should include Clinical Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems, Behavioral & Therapeutic EHR Systems and Health Home Care Management Systems. The Healthcare Systems Analyst is part of the Application Support team, the group within the IT Department responsible for supporting over 1200 users working with programs ranging from the New York State child welfare computer system (Connections), to EHR Applications (such as myEvolv  a behavioral health record system by Netsmart Technologies  and Office Practicum  a clinical health record system for Pediatrics). Candidates must understand healthcare systems and ideally will be comfortable with databases operations to create basic tables, views, stored procedures, and gather data from multiple sources. Knowledge of New York State & City child welfare systems (CCRS, WMS, LTS, Connections, Promise, etc.) is a very big plus. Knowledge of NY State Health Homes (particularly Childrens Health Home issues) and software such as the new Medicaid Analytics Patient Portal (MAPP) is a big plus. Priorities and projects will be determined by the office of the CIO, but the successful candidate will have a demonstrated track record of taking initiative in identifying technical gaps and areas for improvement to implement new solutions and procedures. POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES: Maintains key application vendor relationships (eg Netsmart, OfficePracticum, etc.) Tracks key City, State & Federal healthcare related systems and acts as the primary IT liaison (eg Promise, Connections, MAPP, etc.) Learns and develops a thorough understanding of the agencys practices and work flows for each individual program and service to better design, implement
