POSITION DESCRIPTION The NY Foundling (NYF) is in the process of becoming more involved with providing healthcare than ever before with our participation in the Collaborative for Children & Families (CCF; a health home for children in NY State comprised of 33+ member agencies). As such, NYF is seeking a highly motivated and experienced systems analyst to help with process improvement, designing end-user forms and reports, and implementation support and troubleshooting of healthcare systems and databases. The scope of this persons knowledge should include Clinical Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems, Behavioral & Therapeutic EHR Systems and Health Home Care Management Systems. The Healthcare Systems Analyst is part of the Application Support team, the group within the IT Department responsible for supporting over 1200 users working with programs ranging from the New York State child welfare computer system (Connections), to EHR Applications (such as myEvolv  a behavioral health record system by Netsmart Technologies  and Office Practicum  a clinical health record system for Pediatrics). Candidates must understand healthcare systems and ideally will be comfortable with databases operations to create basic tables, views, stored procedures, and gather data from multiple sources. Knowledge of New York State & City child welfare systems (CCRS, WMS, LTS, Connections, Promise, etc.) is a very big plus. Knowledge of NY State Health Homes (particularly Childrens Health Home issues) and software such as the new Medicaid Analytics Patient Portal (MAPP) is a big plus. Priorities and projects will be determined by the office of the CIO, but the successful candidate will have a demonstrated track record of taking initiative in identifying technical gaps and areas for improvement to implement new solutions and procedures. Medical Biller Coder Ability Plus Therapy is looking for an experienced and certified Medical Biller/Coder to join our team. This position is full-time, Monday-Friday, with competitive pay and benefits. Job responsibilities include but are not limited to Answering phones and forwarding messages to appropriate parties either verbally or via message slip Checking voicemail periodically throughout the day Checking emails periodically throughout the day. Emails must be forwarded to appropriate parties Maintaining current billing records Checking insurance eligibility Enter Medicaid patients into eQSuite for authorization. Billing 3 rd party payers using PT Practice Pro, either through electronic remittance or paper claims Billing Early Steps using their forms and mailing them at the beginning of each month Billing clients for their payment portion, including co-pay and coinsurance Collecting payments Rate negotiation with insurance companies Therapist credentialing Investigate rejected claims Posting payments from clients and 3 rd party payers on PT Practice Pro Follow up on pending payments 30 days overdue Job Requirements: The perfect candidate for this position will: be driven, self-disciplined and organized. Being organized is essential since you will be dealing with patient files and documents. Just as important as organization in this field is attention to detail. Typos and inaccuracies can happen easily when using medical coding as a means of communication. When dealing with medical files however, there is no room for error because it can disrupt the whole billing process. Working primarily with files and computers doesn't mean that people skills aren't important, however. Proper face to face and phone etiquette is necessary since contact with patients and/or parents and phone conversations with patients and insurance carriers will be frequent. Working with private documents also means that you must be able to practice anonymity inside and outside the workplace. Only certified biller coders need apply. To apply, please click 'apply now'. Industry: Healthcare - Health Services, Exercise - Fitness

85712   When I started working for this company I acted as the assistant to the owner/operator, where I was responsible for ordering and maintaining all office supplies, photocopying, faxing, and preparing bank deposits, errands and form preparation. I was also the back up for our bank courier. When leaving Professional Medical Management to make the move to Portland my position was a medical biller and account manager for a physical therapy practice that consists of two locations with multiple physical therapists and one occupational therapist.  Data entry, billing multiple insurance companies, follow-up calls and appeals until all fees were collected on insurance and patient accounts.  Phone contact and written correspondence with doctors and patients regularly to complete necessary processing.  Transfer all patient data into a billing software called Medisoft from an EHR system online called Practice Pro.  Familiar with special rules for billing all major insurance companies and workers comp.  Handled a primary care account and an assisting surgeon account.  Supervised another physical therapy biller I assigned specific tasks to her and I supervised another colleague who provides follow up on claims over 45 days old.  Familiar with a multi-lined telephone system and answering, transferring, overhead paging, and parking calls for 13 employees.  Trained new hires that start out in follow up (calling insurances to find out claim status, refile and appeal claims) and answering/transferring phones  In the past, I have occasionally been: a front office employee for a pediatric office and an OB/GYN office. This job included; checking in patients, collecting copays, verifying eligibility, pulling and filing charts. I also had to room patients and clean rooms after each visit.

Familiar with special rules for billing all major insurance companies and workers comp.  Handled a primary care account and an assisting surgeon account.  Supervised another physical therapy biller I assigned specific tasks to her and I supervised another colleague who provides follow up on claims over 45 days old.  Familiar with a multi-lined telephone system and answering, transferring, overhead paging, and parking calls for 13 employees.  Trained new hires that start out in follow up (calling insurances to find out claim status, refile and appeal claims) and answering/transferring phones  In the past, I have occasionally been: a front office employee for a pediatric office and an OB/GYN office. This job included; checking in patients, collecting copays, verifying eligibility, pulling and filing charts. I also had to room patients and clean rooms after each visit.

<description>Mercer University's College of Pharmacy and Health Sciences, Physical Therapy program invites applications for a full-time non-tenure track position for the Director of the Physical Therapy Clinic, beginning August 1, 2010 at the rank of Assistant/Associate Professor. Responsibilities include the development and comprehensive direction of the program's physical therapy clinic, including development of a new practice, marketing, and public relations. The ideal candidate will have specialty certification through ABPTS, excellent patient/care skills, and demonstrated success in physical therapy practice administration and management. Teaching experience in physical therapist education at the professional and/or post-professional level is preferred. Teaching, scholarly activity, and service will be determined based on the clinic's growth and the candidate's development plan. Teaching will concentrate on the applicant's area of clinical expertise. Must possess a PT degree from an accredited university/college, and either hold or be eligible for a license to practice physical therapy in the state of Georgia. A doctoral degree (eg, DPT, PhD, DHS) and ABPTS certification is preferred. Applicants should have prior experience in managing a PT clinic and have evidence of successfully directing a comprehensive PT practice. Applicants should have the ability to work collaboratively with fellow faculty and students. Mentoring of entry-level DPT and post-professional residents is expected. Applicants should have potential for success in research and publishing, and experience in supervising students, preferably with experience at the doctoral level. Review of applications will begin immediately. This new position will be based at Mercer's Atlanta, GA campus, conveniently located near all the amenities of the city. More information can be found at http://www.mercer.edu. Interested candidates will need to complete the brief online application at www.mercerjobs.com and attach 1) a current curriculum vitae, 2) a physical therapy practice pro forma, 3) brief description of research interests, and 4) names and contact information for three references.</description>

<description>Description: It's a new day at Merrimack Valley Hospital. Our vision for the valley is to build regional reputation for providing exceptional patient care and state-of-the-art medical services: one employee, one physician, and one patient - one day at a time. We are delivering on our promise. The hospital added new employees, physicians, and services. We purchased new cutting edge medical equipment and emergency management software, and completed a $3.3 million dollar renovation project to vastly improve our Outpatient Services division. And, in 2005, we will begin construction on a new 85,000 square foot medical office building adjacent to the hospital. We are committed to you and your good health. Merrimack Valley Hospital maintains 108 acute care beds, 15 transitional care beds, and 17 adult behavioral medicine beds. All are private rooms. The hospital features many clinical strengths, including an award winning emergency department, orthopedic, endoscopic and general surgery, oncology, adult behavioral medicine care with a focus on geriatric issues, and transitional care. We also provide a wide range of outpatient services, including surgical day services, x-rays, MRI exams, PET-Scans, CT-Scans, mammography, bone density testing, dysphasia testing, nuclear medicine, physical therapy, and occupational health services. ASSISTANT ADMINISTRATOR OF PHYSICIAN SERVICES-Full time Administrative oversight and responsibility for planning, organizing, and directing Physician recruitment and practice managment. Responsibilites include: liasion between Physicians and Administration, Physician Recruiting, Physician service development, Practice Pro-Forma Development, Practice Start-up assistance, Monitoring of Start-ups, generating candidates for open positions, central scheduling oversight, MOB oversight, Primary Care Network development, and Physician data link management. Competitive wages, Medical, Dental, 401-K, and tuition reimbursement hr@merrimackvalleyhospital.com Requirements: Experience in Physician Recruitment/service development and Practice management. Bachelors degree required, Masters preferred Contact: Human Resources 140 Lincoln Ave Haverhill, MA 01830 Phone: 978 521-8150 Fax: 978 521-8220</description>

<description>Busy downtown chiropractic clinic in Brooks, Alberta is seeking a pleasant, presentable, energetic and hard-working individual with a caring and positive attitude able to perform both reception and therapy assistant duties within the role of Chiropractic Assistant/Clinic Manager. Qualifications: - Service-oriented, reliable, and organised - Willing to work as part of the clinic team - Attention to detail with outstanding telephone skills - Excellent reading/writing/grammar skills and an intermediate level of Microsoft Word, Excel and the Internet - Have the skills needed to manage insurance and WCB claims, working with company representatives and allied healthcare professionals - Must be in good physical condition and maintain a positive outlook towards a healthy lifestyle Visit www.softclinic.ca To apply, email director@softclinic.ca. You may also deliver in person to 212 2nd Ave W. in Brooks. No phone calls, please.</description>

<description>Soft Health and Healing Clinic has an immediate opening for a Chiropractic Assistant on a part-time basis. We are looking for pleasant, presentable and hard-working individual with a caring and positive attitude able to perform both reception and therapy assistant duties. The ideal candidate is service-oriented, reliable, and organised; attention to detail with outstanding telephone skills is required. Excellent reading/writing/grammar skills and an intermediate level of Microsoft Word, Excel and the Internet are essential. Must be in good physical condition and maintain a positive outlook towards a healthy lifestyle. Primary responsibilities include: - Answering the telephone and receiving clients - Managing patient flow - Verifying patient information by interviewing patient; recording medical history; confirming purpose of visit. - Preparing charts, intake and consent forms. - Discussing treatment outcomes with both patient and doctor to help determine protocol and treatment schedule - Assisting doctor and patients with nutritional information - Electronic scheduling and data entry and patient/insurance billing - Making reminder phone calls - Maintaining a clean and tidy clinic environment at all times - Handling paperwork and telephone correspondence related to WCB, MVA and other insurance claims - Maintaining filing system - Assisting with maintaining office supplies and equipment - Keeping equipment in good operating condition through consistent cleaning/disinfection and by following operating instructions; troubleshooting breakdowns; maintaining supplies; performing preventive maintenance - Light cleaning of the office on a continual basis - Being able to adapt to changing work loads, priorities and schedules The successful candidate must possess physical strength, agility and stamina to assist with manual chiropractic therapies. The ability to learn all procedures and demonstrate proficiency is required. Preference will be given to those applicants with knowledge of anatomy and/or physiology. To apply, email director@softclinic.ca. You may also deliver in person to 212 2nd Ave W. in Brooks. No phone calls, please.</description>

<description>REQUIREMENTS You must be proficient in JavaScript and very familiar with common frameworks; very skilled in front-end web technologies: HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Experience with building SaaS applications Experience working through difficulties arising from cross-browser compatibility issues. Understand the balance between scrappiness and long term code quality. If outside Birmingham, experience working remotely is required Using Git/Github with a team An eye for great design Experience working with Backbone (our legacy framework, although you may be working with newer frameworks). Nice to Have Skills Know extension languages like SASS A technical background in Computer Science, Engineering, or Math is a plus Front end design skills About TheraNest TheraNest is a fast growing software company dedicated to developing software products and tools to help mental and behavioral health professionals improve outcomes for their clients while managing and growing their practices more effectively. Our clients include large non-profits, universities, large and smalltherapy and counseling practices and other mental and behavioral health organizations. We believe that by providing well designed, easy to use and well supported applications, we can help create better outcomes for both the practices and organizations we serve, and their clients. TheraNest serves thousands of clinicians, and tens of thousands of their clients throughout North America and beyond. BENEFITS Competitive salary Generous vacation and sick days Best tools you need for the job from MacBook Pros on. Health and Dental 401k Gym Reimbursement plus Fitbit (if you want one) Generous Book purchase stipend</description>

Job Description:Are you ready to be in private practice? Make your own schedule. Be your own boss. Need to take some time off? You don't need anyone's permission. Determine your worth by setting your own fees. See only the clients you want to see using best practice methods and treatment approach you alone get to choose. This is a part-time (10-30 hours per week) contract therapist position. We're looking for a therapist who has a mindfulness background and compliments our team of mindfulness-based therapists. The ideal candidate would be experienced in how to lead and teach meditation and other mindfulness practices and have passion for creating opportunities for outreach.?Responsibilities will include scheduling, billing, and documenting via the TheraNest practice management system. Candidate will be fully licensed and willing to take insurance. Candidate can commit to contributing occasional blogs or other social media content to help promote their work in the Austin community. Compensation: AMC offers a generous revenue-based commission of up to 75% of weekly revenue. If you saw 30 clients per week at $100 each, with a two week vacation, your annual salary would be $112,500 before taxes. Therapists are paid weekly via direct deposit. No taxes are withheld from payroll as contractors are responsible for paying their own taxes. A 1099 will be issued in January for the previous year's taxes.Company Description:We believe mindfulness is the key to living vitally and with purpose. We aim to be a community resource that promotes healing and education through mindfulness and compassion. We believe that mindfulness should be accessible to everyone, so we are dedicated to offering affordable rates and creating new ways of getting mindfulness out to the public. As healers, we are also dedicated to making mindfulness a daily part of our own lives and we strive to be present with ourselves and with our clients every day.

Technology Director/Leadership Position JTC Academy is seeking a well-qualified, competent and experienced Technology Director. The candidate we are seeking wants to be part of a hardworking and amazing team and can maintain the existing technology program currently in place while researching, planning and implementing various types of relevant educational technology, trouble shooting both teacher and student technology issues, and overseeing and maintaining all technological aspects of the school and serve as the technological "Guru" to the entire school of professionals already competent in basic educational technology requirements. The successful candidate for the position, will have a sound knowledge base stemming from holding both a Bachelor's in Mathematics or Technology and a Master's Degree in Technology, at least 5 years of experience as a technology director, have excellent leadership skills and be competent and knowledgeable enough to expand on an existing technology program while serving as the technology leader and support contact person for teachers, students and administration. J TC Academy's Current Technology Program Includes the following: PCs, Tablets, Ipads, Smart Boards School management programs including RenWeb, Theranest and SchoolsinSites Web based instruction including the ILIT Program, IReady, Reading A to Z and other various web-based programs, software and apps The ideal candidate will hold the following qualifications: Proficient in Mathematics from advanced algebra to calculus and statistics, probability and data analysis. Hold a Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics Hold a Master's Degree in Educational Technology or comparable degree Hold an excellent work ethic, is responsible, positive, reliable and competent enough to develop, plan and implement programming, troubleshoot problems and issues as they arise and serve as an excellent role-model for faculty. Has a great attitude, can work and think on the fly and does not need constant supervision and direction. Again, this is a leadership position that the entire faculty will count on as our technology leader. We need a leader!!

Company Description

We believe mindfulness is the key to living vitally and with purpose. We aim to be a community resource that promotes healing and education through mindfulness and compassion. We believe that mindfulness should be accessible to everyone, so we are dedicated to offering affordable rates and creating new ways of getting mindfulness out to the public. As healers, we are also dedicated to making mindfulness a daily part of our own lives and we strive to be present with ourselves and with our clients every day.

<description>JTC Academy is a therapeutic day school that comprises two campuses that are both approved by the states of Ilinois and Missouri. JTC Coed Academy is located in Centreville and is a campus serving K through grade 12. The second campus is for boys in grades K through 12, also located in Centreville about 3 miles from JTC Boys Academy, holding the same mission and goals, while retaining its own intimate atmosphere. At both Centreville campuses, we have a highly committed group of leaders, teachers, counselors, teacher assistants and support staff that make the schools a warm and welcoming environment for students, staff members and parents alike. JTC Academy is seeking an Instructional Technology Coordinator to assist in all technology related areas in the school. This is mainly a non-teaching, technology position with at most 1 class per day taught per semester. However, during the Fall, this position is for technology coordination only. In January, the teaching of one class per day will begin. The ideal candidate will have the following: Bachelors Degree required; Master's Degree preferred in a field appropriate for this position (Management Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science,Systems Management, Educational Technology or other equivalent disciplines), preferred. Master's degree in Ed Tech will take priority in hiring. Minimum 3-5 years progressively responsible experience in the development, installation and maintenance of information systems. Minimum of 3-5 years of technology leadership experience with progressively-increasing responsibility in a K-12 environment with professional level staff High ethical standards with the use of school-wide data systems, cameras, student and staff information while following FERPA and JTC Academys Confidentiality Agreement Deep knowledge of computer systems, school servers, web design and school data management systems. At JTC Academy, we use the following: IPADS, Tablets, PC Desktop, keyless school entry, server, Renweb school data system, Theranest, IReady Math and IReady Reading, SWIS Data collection, and many software and web-based educational programs. We also have cameras, DVD recorders, and live camera footage applications that are also the technology coordinator's responsibility. Salary is very competitive. We also offer medical benefits, 401 K, Company IPhone and IPAD. If interested in this position, please send resume to apolt@jtc-academy.com or fax to Amy Polt at (618)398-2582. Please review our website at jtcacademy.com for further information.</description>

Work with Theranest Software, updates of clients, create appointments and notification for patients.

<description>Therapeutic Sessional Worker Job Description Job Title: Therapeutic Sessional Worker  After school and Weekends Responsible to: Manager Sam Gately, Deputy Manager Harriett Franklin-Pugh Work Location base: Smooth Starts Plus Centre based at Walnut Tree Farm, St Brides, Newport (community work will be at separate addresses as required) Smooth Starts Plus expects all employees to have a full commitment to the Equal Opportunities Policy and acceptance of personal responsibility for its practical application. All employees are required to comply with and promote the policy and to ensure that discrimination is eliminated in this service. JOB PURPOSE  To support individuals, and their families, aged 0-25years who have additional pervasive, neurological or developmental needs.  To facilitate individual and group programmes designed to meet the therapeutic needs of children/ young people, working in partnership with other professionals. JOB ACTIVITIES 1.To work as part of the Smooth Starts Plus team providing quality support for children/young people and their families. 2.To ensure all company policies and procedures are read and understood. 3.To attend training, team meetings, supervision and link worker meetings as set out by management. 4. To read each individuals active support plan and understand the objectives of each individuals program and directly apply in sessions under management guidance. No change should be made without prior agreement form management unless to ensure safety of individual or worker. 5. To transport individuals and support them in accessing sessions at the centre or in the community. 6. To ensure the environment is appropriate for each individual session. 7. To ensure that all equipment used during sessions is restored appropriately. 8. To be prepared and punctual for all sessions at the centre or in the community. 9. To be familiar with the online portal Theranest recording and rota system. To check rota for own case load and inform management immediately of any problems. 10.To document observational and factual accounts of each individual session and record on Theranest within 48 hours. 11.To maintain a high degree of confidentiality in accordance Smooth Starts Plus Policy. 12.To report all incidents / accidents to management and record as necessary using set format. 13.To show respect and sensitivity for the cultural and religious beliefs of families attending or accessing services. 14.To contribute to the evaluation and effectiveness of the services and activities provided 15.To report all concerns to the designated responsible person (Management) in accordance with Child Protection Procedures & POVA. 16.To implement and follow clear health and safety procedures and any associated risk assessments. 17.When transporting to ensure the vehicle is fit for the individual with appropriate harnesses booster seats according to transport care plan. 18.To ensure the car is covered for business use and complies with all Road Safety Regulations. 19.To be responsible for completing time sheets in accordance with the set template by 12pm on the 11 th of every month and forwarded to management. (Late timesheets will not be processed for that month and be paid the following month) 20. To record any unavailability for sessions in the Red Book at least one month in advance. 21. Sessions that cannot be attended due to emergency/sickness must be reported to management as soon as possible. 22. Any issues that arise during sessions should in the first instance be reported to person ON CALL. 23. A mobile phone and ID must be on person during every session. (Mobile phones are not to be used during sessions except if work related.) Refer to Mobile phone policy. 24. Any other task as specified by management. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY None. SUPERVISION RECEIVED From the delegated manager SPECIAL CONDITIONS This job description sets out the main duties of the post at the date when it was drawn up. Such duties may vary from time to time without changing the general character of the post or the level of responsibility entailed. Such variations are a common occurrence and cannot of themselves justify a reconsideration of the grading of the post. Dated: September 2015</description><experience>None</experience><education>GCSE / Scottish or equivalent</education>

Creating/submitting claims, following up on claims, verifying benefits; most knowledgeable in Mental Health. Extensive knowledge with Office Ally, Therapy Appointment and Therabill billing software as well as learning TheraNest and CarePaths.

Provide bi-lingual (Polish-English) counseling to individuals. Co-lead group counseling,Specialization in teen counseling. Working with teens and their families to reduce the stress and anxiety that arises in the formative years. Administration includes answering phone, matching clients to therapists, using Theranest data system, billing, insurance inquires, and over all business management.

Manage scheduling client sessions with six mental health therapists in Theranest database.  Verify insurance coverage and mental health benefits for new intakes.  Interact with clients as they wait for their session with their psychotherapist to begin.  Engage in activities with children that are coming into therapy.

Completed 575 hours (400 direct service) of advanced training in Marriage and Family Therapy Delivered bilingual, relational therapy to individuals, couples, and families at sliding-scale agency Evaluated problems according to a trauma-informed, attachment-oriented, strength-based lens Integrated techniques from multiple modalities (i.e., solution focused, cognitive behavioral) Facilitated goal development, generated ideas, guided skill acquisition, and tracked progress Formulated systemic hypotheses, assessments, treatment plans; implemented interventions Observed live by agency staff and colleagues using one-way mirrors Engaged in 140 hours of supervision; reviewed session tapes to assess clinical competencies Conducted phone intakes, assigned new clients, and maintained online records using Theranest

Provide individual clinical counseling sessions to high school aged clients Provide individual clinical counseling sessions to high school aged clients Develop and facilitate psychotherapy groups for high school aged clients Facilitate psycho-educational groups for high school aged students to promote mental, physical, emotional and social wellbeing Provide crisis management to individuals, clients, and school communities as needed Maintain accurate and timely client case notes, assessments, treatment plans, and contact notes through Theranest Collaborate and communicate with teachers, administrators, parents and other mental health professionals to ensure client needs are met Participate in weekly individual supervision sessions toward LCSW licensing

JOB ACTIVITIES 1.To work as part of the Smooth Starts Plus team providing quality support for children/young people and their families. 2.To ensure all company policies and procedures are read and understood. 3.To attend training, team meetings, supervision and link worker meetings as set out by management. 4. To read each individuals active support plan and understand the objectives of each individuals program and directly apply in sessions under management guidance. No change should be made without prior agreement form management unless to ensure safety of individual or worker. 5. To transport individuals and support them in accessing sessions at the centre or in the community. 6. To ensure the environment is appropriate for each individual session. 7. To ensure that all equipment used during sessions is restored appropriately. 8. To be prepared and punctual for all sessions at the centre or in the community. 9. To be familiar with the online portal Theranest recording and rota system. To check rota for own case load and inform management immediately of any problems. 10.To document observational and factual accounts of each individual session and record on Theranest within 48 hours. 11.To maintain a high degree of confidentiality in accordance Smooth Starts Plus Policy. 12.To report all incidents / accidents to management and record as necessary using set format. 13.To show respect and sensitivity for the cultural and religious beliefs of families attending or accessing services. 14.To contribute to the evaluation and effectiveness of the services and activities provided 15.To report all concerns to the designated responsible person (Management) in accordance with Child Protection Procedures & POVA. 16.To implement and follow clear health and safety procedures and any associated risk assessments. 17.When transporting to ensure the vehicle is fit for the individual with appropriate harnesses booster seats according to transport care plan. 18.To ensure the car is covered for business use and complies with all Road Safety Regulations. 19.To be responsible for completing time sheets in accordance with the set template by 12pm on the 11 th of every month and forwarded to management. (Late timesheets will not be processed for that month and be paid the following month) 20. To record any unavailability for sessions in the Red Book at least one month in advance. 21. Sessions that cannot be attended due to emergency/sickness must be reported to management as soon as possible. 22. Any issues that arise during sessions should in the first instance be reported to person ON CALL. 23. A mobile phone and ID must be on person during every session. (Mobile phones are not to be used during sessions except if work related.) Refer to Mobile phone policy. 24. Any other task as specified by management. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY None. SUPERVISION RECEIVED From the delegated manager SPECIAL CONDITIONS This job description sets out the main duties of the post at the date when it was drawn up. Such duties may vary from time to time without changing the general character of the post or the level of responsibility entailed. Such variations are a common occurrence and cannot of themselves justify a reconsideration of the grading of the post. Dated: September 2015</description><experience>None</experience><education>GCSE / Scottish or equivalent</education>

Responsible for the occupational therapy of patients under the direction & supervision of the Rehabilitation Services.Essential Functions:- Evaluates patients, interprets evaluation findings to determine the nature & extent of dysfunction.- Establishes treatment goals & plans treatment to achieve established goals.- Initiates discharge planning for occupational therapy.- Implements the treatment program through direct treatment of the patient.- May delegate a portion of the treatment program to the appropriate supportive personnel.- Coordinates the treatment program w/ other health care personnel as appropriate.- Provides advice & education to patient & family.- Regularly assesses clinical signs & symptoms to determine effectiveness of treatment, progress of patient towards goals, the need for modifying goals & treatment.- Discharges patient from occupational therapy when the patient has received maximum benefit from occupational therapy.- Provides accurate, timely documentation of occupational therapy patient management.- Demonstrates progress toward meeting the criteria for professional practice.Qualifications: This is a repost of 100359Basic Qualifications:- Previous inpatient/outpatient experience, preferred. Job Description

A well-established private psychology practice is currently seeking a bilingual (Spanish, English), experienced, motivated, and conscientious front desk coordinator to join our team. Candidate MUST have experience working or studying in the mental health field or a medical field to be considered for this position. Additionally, candidate must have excellent interpersonal skills, know how to multitask in a very busy office, be an independent worker, highly organized, flexible and deadline oriented. Duties include but are not limited to: patient intakes over the phone, confirming appointments, overseeing office supplies, collecting payments, preparing patient information packets, and filing. Additionally, Candidate must possess excellent verbal and written communication and customer service skills, be able to handle confidential patient information, and be able to interact with diverse patients with extreme sensitivity, patience, and consideration. SKILLS / QUALIFICATIONS: Must have at least two years experience working or studying in the field of mental health or in a medical field. A minimum of 1 year of front office experience handling the duties mentioned above. Must have customer service experience. Must be computer literate with knowledge of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel. Experience with Quickbooks is a plus. Experience with medical software a plus (e.g., Psyquel, TherapyNotes, Availity). Knowledge of ICD-9, CPT coding and insurance billing is a plus. 3 references required. Job will require 40 hours a week. Compensation: Position pays $12-$14/hr depending on experience. Gradual pay raises & bonuses, sick days, vacation days and 2 paid holidays! Position open immediately. Reply to this ad with your resume and cover letter. Please note: Both are required in order to be considered. We will only be contacting those candidates who we choose for a follow-up interview.

Job SummaryThe Scheduler provides support to the Director of Operations and the Variable Staffing team. The employee is responsible for scheduling Variable staff nurses into various assignments and handles the daily scheduling issues that arise in collaboration with the PCMs and Triage Manager. Maintains accuracy of time logs and ensures compliance with education and in service requirements.Essential ResponsibilitiesSpecific Functional ResponsibilitiesReviews all absences and daily scheduling needsFollows up on any changes to current variable staff schedules / assignmentsMaintains accurate assignments of Variable staff in ShiftBoardCreates and maintains the AOC scheduleMaintains all shifts across all disciplines in ShiftboardPerforms other related job duties as assigned by SupervisorGeneralAlert / Text Variable staff of any schedule changesProblem solve vacancies in the scheduleReviews timelogs for accuracyFollow up with Variable Staff, in cooperation with the Triage Manager, regarding compliance paperworkAll field staff vacation requests are gathered, organized and coverage maintained in Shiftboard.Gives evaluation input to Triage/Variable Staffing Manager for performance evaluationsProvides support to Administrative StaffProvides back-up to CAAs, Hospice Aide Scheduler, Palliative Care/Transitions, and Reception Compliance:Ensures all HIPAA Privacy and Security Regulations, Medicare Conditions of Participation, and all other regulatory/compliance requirements are understood and followedRequirementsEducation/ExperienceHigh School Diploma1-3 years of administrative experienceMedical office experienceSkills RequiredStrong knowledge of various computer systems: MS Office, including Word, Excel, Outlook, Internet and Medical office database systems.Certifications, Licenses, Registrations:Pass OIG/GSA review and all required background checksPhysical DemandsStrength to lift and carry materials weighing up to 10 poundsVision to read printed materials and a computer screenHearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephoneWork Environment/Environmental ConditionMust possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer

Job Summary

The Scheduler provides support to the Director of Operations and the Variable Staffing team. The employee is responsible for scheduling Variable staff nurses into various assignments and handles the daily scheduling issues that arise in collaboration with the PCMs and Triage Manager. Maintains accuracy of time logs and ensures compliance with education and in service requirements.

Essential Responsibilities

Specific Functional Responsibilities

Reviews all absences and daily scheduling needs

Follows up on any changes to current variable staff schedules / assignments

Maintains accurate assignments of Variable staff in ShiftBoard

Creates and maintains the AOC schedule

Maintains all shifts across all disciplines in Shiftboard

Performs other related job duties as assigned by Supervisor

General

Alert / Text Variable staff of any schedule changes

Problem solve vacancies in the schedule

Reviews timelogs for accuracy

Follow up with Variable Staff, in cooperation with the Triage Manager, regarding compliance paperwork

All field staff vacation requests are gathered, organized and coverage maintained in Shiftboard.

Gives evaluation input to Triage/Variable Staffing Manager for performance evaluations

Provides support to Administrative Staff

Provides back-up to CAAs, Hospice Aide Scheduler, Palliative Care/Transitions, and Reception Compliance:

Ensures all HIPAA Privacy and Security Regulations, Medicare Conditions of Participation, and all other regulatory/compliance requirements are understood and followedRequirements

Education/Experience

High School Diploma

1-3 years of administrative experience

Medical office experience

Skills Required

Strong knowledge of various computer systems: MS Office, including Word, Excel, Outlook, Internet and Medical office database systems.

Certifications, Licenses, Registrations:

Pass OIG/GSA review and all required background checks

Physical Demands

Strength to lift and carry materials weighing up to 10 pounds

Vision to read printed materials and a computer screen

Hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone

Work Environment/Environmental Condition

Must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer

<description>Team Leader - Administration Epworth Rehabilitation & Mental Health (Camberwell) Permanent Full Time - Newly created position - Take the next step in your career - Located in Camberwell, close to public transport Epworth Rehabilitation and Mental Health is one of the largest private sector rehabilitation and mental health services in Australia, with a total of 319 beds across four sites  Richmond, Hawthorn, Camberwell and Brighton. We are seeking persons interested in taking the next step in their career as a Team Leader: Outpatients Coordinator, Medical Consulting and Day Patients located at Camberwell. Working in this newly created role and being part of the leadership team you will play an essential role in creating a culture in which team members thrive and deliver consistently superior customer experience. Initial priorities of this role will be: - In consultation with team members review and update position descriptions to accurately reflect role responsibilities - In consultation with team members review and update administration manuals and develop education materials and processes - Drive and embed Epworth Excellence initiatives to ensure superior customer experience (measured by Press Ganey and Employee Engagement) Key responsibilities of this role include: - Providing day to day operational leadership and supervision (measured by employee engagement) - Collaborating with team leaders to ensure efficient and effective administrative support and superior patient experience (as measured by Press Ganey) - Fostering an environment of continuous learning and improvement - Assisting in the recruitment and orientation of new staff - Ensuring compliance with HR KPIs including mandatory training and completion of PDPs - Managing staffing and labour hours (including leave cover) In return we offer a commitment to supporting you in your professional development and career aspirations. Epworth HealthCare is a world class not-for-profit private provider of acute medical, surgical, obstetric, rehabilitation and mental health services to the Victorian community across eight sites. Epworth is committed to becoming a major provider of teaching and research activities. It comprises of more than 1200 beds, 5000 staff and 2500 visiting medical officers across four operating divisions: Epworth Richmond, Epworth Eastern, Epworth Freemasons and Epworth Rehabilitation and is supported by a full range of corporate services. Epworth HealthCare offers its employees: - Clinical excellence - A dynamic team environment - Attractive benefits including salary packaging - Extensive professional development and education programs - Strong research activity and expertise - Flexibility and support To obtain more information please refer to the attached position description. Please direct your enquiries to the contact person listed below. Applications must be submitted online  to apply for this position click Apply Now Enquiries: Deidre McLaren Ph: (03) 9809 2444 Applications Close: 07/09/2015 To view the position description or submit your application please click the Apply Now button below.</description>

<description>- Associate's Degree - 5 Years of Experience Required - Primary Responsibilities: Responsible for providing secretarial support at monthly Medical Executive Committee meetings, monthly Board Quality Committee meetings, weekly nursing leadership and director meetings, and weekly Regional Market meetings. Support includes timely & accurate meeting agenda and materials preparation, mailing of meeting materials at least 7 days in advance of the meeting, minute taking/preparation/editing, meeting calendar management for attendees, meeting notices, and meeting preparation. Serves as an appropriate reference source to Administrative Team for information helpful to the effective functioning of the Executive Offices and the organization. Assists Administrative Team with any project as assigned and is available for attendance at meetings or functions as necessary. Provides clerical support to administrative staff including, transcription, filing, calendar support and other clerical support as requested. Responsible for all incoming mail for Vice Presidents, including sorting according to importance and priority, answering and/or drafting responses as appropriate. Answers telephone for main Administration line and Vice Presidents (when they are not available). Assists in phone coverage for other administrative staff and secretaries when they are unavailable. Supports coordination of Vice Presidents calendars, schedules, and appointments, as needed. Acts as liaison between department directors and other employees to administration to maintain good employee-employer relationships. Administers and coordinates patient grievance process with oversight from the Vice President/Chief Quality Officer. Responsible for completing the application for the State Hospital Licensure annually and HFAP certification tri-annually, providing ongoing support to Vice Presidents regarding changes to HFAP standards, setting up team meetings, etc. Assists Executive Assistant and other administrative secretaries in the performance of their duties and relieves in their absence. Cooperates with others to balance the workload and meet project deadlines for all of the administrative staff. Coordinates administrative functions of patient experience reporting, including acting as the Press Ganey coordinator with report development and writing, administration of the Physician Report Cards through Statit, and development of patient experience reports and presentations for the Board and Leadership meetings. Handles and follows up on patient complaints when appropriate. Other duties as assigned, requested and/or necessary. Qualifications: Associate degree in business or other related secretarial course of study and/or a minimum of five years experience as an executive secretary or office manager. Must demonstrate excellent secretarial skills, human relations and communications skills, be highly organized and have the ability to work effectively with the governing board, administrative staff, medical staff, employees and public. Should be a self-starter with the ability to complete assigned projects independently in a timely fashion. Must demonstrate proficiency in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Proficiency or willingness to become proficient in Visio also required. Must demonstrate excellent written communication skills with an ability to prepare minutes and reports. Ability and willingness to routinely work in excess of 45 hours per week on a flexible and "as needed" basis. Additional Information:</description><workingconditions>Hours: 40 hours weekly Shift: Day Shift</workingconditions>

<description>Job Description The Director of Growth Strategy & Planning will be responsible for developing and supporting the companys growth strategies as it expands into new markets and new lines of business. A key role that bridges the companys corporate development and strategy functions, this role will be front and center of the consumer revolution in U.S. healthcare and is ideal for candidates looking to apply their skills to drive innovation in an industry in desperate need of disruption. A pioneer in providing more efficient and more convenient access to emergency care, Adeptus (NYSE: ADPT) is one of the fastest growing companies in the U.S. health services industry. Adeptus is partnering with major health systems to bring its patient-centric approach to acute care offerings across the U.S. Key responsibilities of this role will include developing tactical market entry / partnership strategies, supporting the companys corporate development efforts as it seeks to partner with large health systems across the U.S. and coordinating the companys post-closing efforts following the completion of a joint venture or partnership. About Adeptus: Adeptus Health (NYSE: ADPT) is a publicly owned holding company that primarily operates in the ambulatory acute care space. First Choice Emergency Room (FCER) is an Adeptus Health company that owns, builds, and operates more than 60 free-standing emergency rooms across TX, CO and AZ. Adeptus also owns an emergency physician staffing business called National Medical Professionals (NMP) and is an owner and operator of acute care hospitals that are either fully owned or partially owned through its joint ventures with large health systems. Adeptus offers unparalleled clinical care and patient experience. It has been awarded the prestigious Press Ganey Award for two consecutive years, placing it among the top 1% of emergency care providers for patient satisfaction in the U.S. Adeptus is also a committed employer with a strong and energetic culture. It was voted among the Top 10 in the Best Companies to Work for in Texas employee poll in 2015. - Develop market entry strategies for key target markets across the U.S., including: - Working with law firms to understand the regulatory landscape - Working with industry experts to determine the political landscape - Conducting research on market dynamics, including local provider systems, consumer trends, benefit design trends and other - Supporting corporate development team to meet business growth objectives, including: - Developing and customizing corporate development collateral - Supporting corporate development executives in key client meetings - Collaborating with real estate team to identify key target locations for Adeptus facilities and supporting rationale - Lead competitive research analysis, including: - Mapping industry growth by market, with breakdown by competitor - Conducting SWOT analyses on industry competitors - Providing recommendations for competitive response (including M&A) - Coordinate company post-closing efforts following the completion of a joint venture or partnership, including: - Act as key client touch-point for coordinating post-closing activities (spanning legal, managed care, EMR integration, licensing, financial planning, strategic planning_) - Engage executive team as appropriate to ensure a smooth transition / kick-off to an engagement - Act as a liaison between local JV employees and corporate employees to help with a smooth transition (in collaboration with JV leadership) - Prepare and deliver executive-level presentations to share insights and recommendations Key competencies: - Strong relationship skills  An executive-level presence, especially in high pressure environments; effective communicator, both verbal and written - Strong project management skills  Proven track record for managing projects on time and on budget; great attention to detail - Strategic thinker with strong problem solving skills - Financial analysis expertise  Ability to modify financial models and customize as needed - Energetic team player  a consensus-building thought leader - Confident self-starter with positive attitude and drive - Ability to multi-task and consistently meet deadlines - Innovator/thought leader  Ability to look through challenges to identify opportunities - Successful candidates will have interest and strengths in competitive strategy and innovation Work Environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works in an office setting. Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle, feel or operate objects, tools or controls, and reach with hands and arms. The employee is frequently required to stand, talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk, sit, climb stairs, and stoop. Qualifications: - Completed Bachelors Degree with a strong record of academic achievement - MBA is highly preferred - Minimum of 10 years of work experience in business development, strategy and/or finance - Experience in a top-tier management / strategy consulting firm is a plus - Experience in healthcare a plus but not a requirement Apply Now</description>

Press Ganey Project Manager - Services Excellence (35954)

  • Category:Professional

  • Job Type:Full Time

  • Schedule:Days

  • Facility:Palo Alto

  • Req:35954

Job Description

The Press Ganey Project Manager supports the Manager, Patient Experience Reporting & Analysis by managing the vendor relationship with the selected vendor(s) for Stanford Hospital & Clinic's (SHC's) patient satisfaction survey administration, analyzing patient experience data at a high-level organizational level as well as specific departmental level, identifying common themes and trends in the results, and monitoring department-level goals and objectives related to the patient experience scores.

Essential Functions:

Drive sustained, measurable improvements in the patient and employee experience at Stanford Hospital & Clinics (SHC)

Facilitate and inform significant improvement decisions affecting the patient and employee experience, and teach SHC employees about the dimensions of the survey methodology, identification of key drivers affecting the survey results, and the framework for the reports

Serve as primary liaison and point of contact between SHC and selected vendor for patient satisfaction surveys

Manage vendor relationship for patient satisfaction survey administration

Manage oversight of SHC IT needs to support the data extract submission to the selected vendor for the surveys, and warehousing of survey data as necessary

Provide ad hoc reports on patient experience results as needed

Prepare presentation reports that provide senior management and physician constituencies with information about trends in patient experience results and progress to-date on action plans addressing progress in enhancing the results.

Analyze opportunities for departmental and high-level organizational enhancement of the patient experience.

Serve as a primary resource for data reporting, data analysis, and data interpretation

Identify opportunities from performance improvement exercises; recognize and use synergies from other projects to design creative solutions for technological and non-technological problems

Research and analyze data from internal and external (benchmark) sources

Train, coach, and mentor project owners; consistently transfer skills

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's degree in business, health care, or industrial engineering or equivalent from an accredited college or university. Masters degree in business administration or health care related field is preferred.

Experience: Four (4) years of progressively responsible and "hands-on" operational experience in a service industry (healthcare, leisure, hospitality, banking, airline, etc.)

Licensure/Certification: None Required.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Ability to communicate effectively at all organizational levels and in situations requiring instructing, persuading, negotiating, conflict resolution, consulting and advising as well as to prepare clear, comprehensive written and oral reports and materials

Knowledge of methods of data collection, manipulation, interpretation and presentation of information, as well as knowledge of rigorous statistical analytics, survey design, research methodology and metrics

Top-notch data analysis, presentation skills, problem solving, attention to detail and accuracy, operations, project management, interviewing, consulting, and team-facilitation expertise is assumed

Strong quantitative skills (advanced Excel, Access, statistical packages such as SPSS, SAS, and/or Minitab) as well as comfort with advanced features of Word and PowerPoint

Able to quickly learn new tools and theories in change management, and use information technology to drive process changes

Demonstrate insatiable curiosity to enter unfamiliar areas of the organization, and learn about the processes used

Incumbents will possess high personal energy, the ability to energize team members, strong, positive interpersonal and leadership skills, and ability to work comfortably with staff who have various levels of education and expertise (physicians through high-school graduate) and understand their work patterns

Demonstrated success in independently planning and managing multiple projects and reevaluating priorities in a self-directed manner and meeting challenging deadlines, and be willing to work long and flexible hours during peak project times to get the job done

Reviews, interprets, utilizes, and presents data to key stakeholders, including administration, department heads and clinical and non-clinical managers. Identifies trends and opportunities. Develops educational sessions and other communication tools that educate and support change. Supports the development and implementation of best practices and process improvements. Upholds the standards of the system-wide customer service program. Required Bachelor's Degree in Business, Analytics, Health Care Administration or healthcare-related field 1-2 years progressive analytical experience Proficiency and familiarity with computer programs such as Internet, Excel, Access, Word, Adobe, PowerPoint Knowledge of data analysis techniques, data base structure and demonstrated ability to compile, analyze and interpret and graph statistical data and develop effective measurement tools/studies Strong analytical, strategic thinking, and problem solving skills with the proven ability to plan, initiate, and manage multiple projects while performing at a high level in a demanding, fast-paced environment Preferred Master's Degree in related field Experience in health care 1-2 years experience with HCAHPS, patient experience surveys, data and interpretation Experience with Press Ganey surveys and systems Experience with statistical analysis software Experience in survey statistics and research 142431</description><industry>Hospital & Health Care</industry>

<description>Graham Health System has a long standing tradition of being the community's choice for an exceptional healthcare experience. Graham continues to be a leader in providing healthcare through great employees and cutting edge technology. Graham Health System's Advocacy an Regulatory Services Department is seeking a friendly, outgoing, well organized individual to fulfill the new role of Patient Experience Coordinator. The Patient Experience Coordinator will be responsible for ensuring: - Patient Satisfaction Information including Press Ganey Surveys - All CMS requirements are abided by - HIPAA as the organization's HIPAA Compliance Officer - All Patient Satisfaction Teams are efficient - Timely responses to guest complaints, suggestions and grievances - along with other duties... Applicant must have a Bachelor's degree in a health related field. Experience in the hospital environment is a definite plus! Graham Health System offers a very accomodating benefits package including: - Education Reimbursement - Flexible Scheduling - Health Insurance - Dental & Vision Insurance - Legal Insurance - Matching 401k - Reduced Cost Childcare Services - On Campus Workout Facilities - Outstanding Wellness Program - Paid Time Off - Employee Social Activities and many more... Graham Health System is a nicotine free employer.</description>

The Director of Patient Experience will develop and implement programs to increase service excellence and oversee patient care experience function and all related programs, strategies, initiatives, policies and procedures. Monitor and track progress throughout the organization for accountability, identify areas for opportunity and drive success in patient care experience by reaching and/or exceeding Press-Ganey goals. RESPONSIBILITIES: In partnership with senior leaders and stakeholders, determine goals and priorities and lead all programs, initiatives, policies and procedures for patient care experience including metrics and service recovery efforts. Develop strategic development/business plan which ensures patient-centered care and continued performance improvement related to goals and overall patient satisfaction. Responsible for the development of customer service strategy, goals, setting direction and the implementation of programs to advance the goals of the organization. Establish effective patient satisfaction policies, procedures and guidelines. Provide management education and serve as a resource to management for improving customer service within offices. Monitor progress and oversee ongoing activities of Press Ganey. Provide monthly analytical and trending reports to senior leaders and stakeholders to support performance improvement recommendations. Responsible for the integration of complaint and service improvement process. Communicates to managers any potential service problem areas and assists with the resolution. Identify risk management concerns and communicate findings to the appropriate individuals as it relates to safety effectiveness and delivering services. Additional duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelors degree in business or healthcare preferred Minimum 8-10 years of experience managing in a service related industry, preferably in healthcare Experience in service standards development Press-Ganey knowledge and/or training Knowledge of process improvement theory and techniques Experience in developing and implementing customer service experience programs and establishing policies and procedures to support programs. Demonstrated success in leading multiple initiatives and programs to achieve service goals and customer/patient satisfaction. Demonstrated ability to coach and mentor leaders and staff for service excellence. Strong verbal and written communications skills, including consultation, facilitation, and making presentations. Experience in leading by influence and ability to inspire others. Proven project management, implementation and process improvement skills. Ability to conduct and interpret quantitative/qualitative analysis.

<description>QUALIFICATIONS: Required, 5-7 years of program management experience in strong customer service environment with demonstrated commitment to improving the patient experience. Bachelor Degree. Facilitation / Project Management of change initiatives across various levels of an organization. Solid presentation skills with a high level of energy and enthusiasm. Proven software competencies (Excel, Power Point, Access); highly skilled in Excel. Flexible/adaptable - ability to work with diverse group of healthcare professionals in a matrix environment. Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills. Desired, previous experience with patient satisfaction vendors, Press Ganey and / or other. Knowledge of patient loyalty as a strategic growth initiative. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Data Analysis, create and distribute patient satisfaction survey and comment reports on a weekly / monthly / ad-hoc basis utilizing NMPG and vendor reporting tools (Press Ganey Online, Enterprise Data Warehouse, etc.). Provide detailed data analysis of patient satisfaction data and comments to identify and prioritize systemic and clinic level opportunities to improve the delivery of patient services. Pro-actively monitor patient satisfaction survey data and comments to identify trends, changes, and continuous improvement opportunities. Manage key driver analysis reports, communications, and presentations to executive leadership and clinics. Manage custom report content and delivery from vendor. Consolidate and manage patient feedback mechanisms to create data to drive patient experience improvements. Program Management, create detailed work plans for the system and clinics to achieve patient satisfaction goals. Complete ad-hoc patient satisfaction educational presentations to internal customers and departments. Coordinate all training programs (new employees, management, continuing education, etc.) on tools and tactics to use and act-on patient satisfaction initiatives. Partner with clinical managers to identify improvement opportunities and functions as a hands-on resource. Develop systems to share and recognize best practices across the organization to sustain current level of service and patient satisfaction. Daily management of the Patient Satisfaction feedback mechanisms (phone, website, Facebook). Coordinate the service recovery program within NMPG. Collaborate with clinical managers to identify opportunities to recognize and reward demonstrations of exceptional customer service by employees. Influence and communicate with all levels of management. Provide administrative ownership over Leadership and AIDET rounding programs including scheduling, attendance tracking, feedback data collection format, and communication of action plans. Create and maintain department purchase orders and processing of invoices for payment. Embody leadership, team building and group facilitation skills. Build trust with internal and external customers and team members. Perform other responsibilities as designated in support of organizational priorities. <description>When you join Huntington Hospital in Pasadena, CA, you are aligning yourself with an organization whose values drive our philosophy of care. Our focus on delivering quality, service, and cutting edge care, enables Huntington Hospital to be an organization committed to patient outcomes-not the bottom line. More importantly, it empowers you to enact change and deliver the results that continuously improve our ability to provide our community with care. The Patient Experience Data Specialist is the primary contact person for hospital employees for Press Ganey and CAHPS data. This position is involved in all aspects of the patient experience data management process, which includes uploading patient data to Press Ganey, monitoring survey responses, interpreting and analyzing improvement data, and educating staff on how to use the Press Ganey portal and reports. Bachelors Degree preferred. Must have strong analytical and interpretive skills, be customer service oriented, and be an organized individual with excellent communication skills. Must have strong computer literacy and software experience - Word, PowerPoint, Excel, with a strong knowledge of CAHPS and Press Ganey portal functionality. Innovating the delivery of healthcare as the San Gabriel Valley region's only Level II Trauma Center and Level III NICU, Huntington Hospital is a 635-bed non-profit regional medical center. We deliver nationally recognized care across over 90 service areas to our community and beyond. Located in downtown Pasadena, you'll find yourself among charming neighborhoods and a relaxed community that is still close enough to all that L.A. has to offer. So join us, and find out what it's like to discover Careers at a Higher Level. No Minimum</description><experience>Entry level</experience>

Chief Patient Experience Officer, Boca Raton Regional Hospital. Care and Innovation happen here every day. Lead a dynamic team in a rewarding setting. Position Summary: Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the Chief Patient Experience Officer acts as the system champion dedicated to creating a world-class culture of excellence in patient experience. The Chief Patient Experience Officer coordinates planning and execution of hospital-wide patient experience and service excellence programs at Boca Raton Regional Hospital. In this position, the Chief Patient Experience Officer collaborates with senior leadership on a strategic vision of service excellence that will be cascaded down to all staff members; communicates progress on service excellence initiatives to key team members, including executives, department of Patient and Guest Relations employees, and key Committees; oversees a data driven program collecting, tracking, and analyzing patient experience trends for optimizing service outcomes. The Chief Patient Experience Officer coaches Hospital employees to maximize the use of customer service tools and programs for an enhanced patient experience. The Chief Patient Experience Officer supervises the Director of Patient and Guest Relations. Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following: Leads the Patient Experience Council in the development of patient experience service initiatives and establishment of Hospital-wide patient satisfaction goals. Ensures the integration and alignment of patient experience strategies with teams across the organization. Assists in leading organizational cultural transformation with patient experience at the center to ensure all touch points meet and exceed patients needs. Researches, develops, and coordinates the implementation of strategic plans, policies, and standards that promote the patient/customer experience. Responsible for oversight of Press Ganey patient satisfaction database, including patient survey questions, related annual budgeting, and running of reports as needed. Provides guidance regarding patient experience data collection, tracking, distribution, and communication. Drives analytics to measure patient experience strategic goals. Identifies areas for improvement, using Press Ganey and HCAHPS patient experience data. Focuses the organization on reforming management and employee behavior and retooling operational processes to better align them with patient needs. Leads efforts to hardwire management and employee practices to ensure exceptional service. This includes the emphasis on behavior standards and usage of key words at key times. Oversees training of multidisciplinary teams to use customer service tools and principles in daily activities. Collaborates with external experts to implement evidence-based service excellence tools and processes throughout the organization. Plans, organizes, and directs the provision of services within the department to assure compliance with the organization's policies and procedures as well as The Joint Commission and appropriate regulatory agencies. Coordinates with the Director of Patient and Guest Relations to ensure timely review and follow up of patient concerns and grievances. Minimum Education and/or Experience: Bachelor's degree in a related area (Master's degree strongly preferred), and Four to ten years of management experience in a related field, and Successful track record in leading a house wide patient experience program Licensure/Regulation/Certification: N/A Incumbent may be required to perform emergency duty before, during and/or beyond normal work hours or days in the event of an emergency, crisis situation or disaster (man-made or natural) including evacuation sites. The person in this position will work in a smoke-free location, and is expected to adhere to all smoking restrictions. In the spirit of wellness for both our employees and patients, Boca Raton Regional Hospital has instituted a mandatory influenza prevention vaccination program. Current employees must receive the influenza prevention vaccination free of charge during the recognized flu season. As a condition of employment, new hires will be required to comply with all program rules. This is a mandatory program with the exception of documented medical or religious reasons for not receiving the vaccine. For further information on this progressive program, please contact Boca Raton Regional Hospitals Human Resources Department at 561-955-4075.

<description>Overview: Under the direction of the Chief Operating Officer and in collaboration with the Directors of Operation, the Manager of Patient Experience will develop and manage strategy for the patient experience within Willamette Dental Group. Develop and implement programs and initiatives centered on best practice standards, patient rating / feedback reporting, customer service / communication skills training, and policies and procedures. Monitor and track progress throughout the organization for accountability, identifies areas for opportunity and drive success in patient care experience by reaching and/or exceeding Press-Ganey goals. RESPONSIBILITIES In partnership with senior leaders and stakeholders, determine goals and priorities and lead all programs, initiatives, policies and procedures for patient care experience including metrics and service recovery efforts. Develop a strategic development/business plan which ensures patient-centered care and continued performance improvement related to goals and overall patient satisfaction. Responsible for the development of customer service strategy, goals, setting direction and the implementation of programs to advance the goals of the organization. Establish effective patient satisfaction policies, procedures and guidelines. Provide management education and serve as a resource to management for improving customer service within offices. Monitor progress and oversee ongoing activities of Press Ganey. Provide monthly analytical and trending reports to senior leaders and stakeholders to support performance improvement recommendations. Responsible for the integration of complaint and service improvement process. Communicates to managers any potential service problem areas and assists with the resolution. Identify risk management concerns and communicate findings to the appropriate individuals as it relates to safety effectiveness and delivering services. Additional duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration or other related field. Masters degree preferred. Minimum 4-6 years of related and progressively responsible experience in a healthcare setting or 4 years healthcare experience with additional experience in customer service or project management Experience in service standards development Experience in developing and implementing customer service experience programs and establishing policies and procedures to support programs. Experience in leading by influence and ability to inspire others. Press-Ganey knowledge and/or training desirable Knowledge of process improvement theory and techniques Knowledge of relevant computer systems/applications. Demonstrated success in leading multiple initiatives and programs to achieve service goals and customer/patient satisfaction. Demonstrated ability to coach and mentor leaders and staff for service excellence. Strong verbal and written communications skills, including consultation, facilitation, and making presentations. Strong leadership attributes. Proven project management, implementation and process improvement skills. Conduct and interpret quantitative/qualitative analysis. Analyze and solve problems. Think critically and uncover root-causes of issues. Relate with others in a respectful, constructive manner. Embrace and promote companys model of practicing dentistry. Uphold and exemplify the companys core values. Represent the company in a professional manner to customers, employer groups, brokers, professional associations, and the public. Not ready to apply? Connect with us for general consideration.</description>

<description>PATIENT EXPERIENCE COORDINATOR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Exemplify the highest standards of customer service and mission throughout the hospital and community. Facilitate/Negotiate problem resolution of all patient/family complaints. May include referral to departmental leadership or administration, communication with involved caregivers, mediation of parties involved with patient, and follow-up after discharge, if necessary. Initiate proactive Service Recovery efforts when appropriate. Coordinate and teaches the SHARE program at CTMC. Provide support for language assistance needs (ASL and non-English) throughout the organization. Document and/or ensure documentation of patient grievances as defined in policy and per CMS regulations. Review/Analyze trends relative to patient grievances an d propose/facilitate corrective actions on a more global level. May include referrals to defined patient satisfaction teams, discussion with Administrative Director of Performance Improvement, Director of Patient Experience & Quality, and/or Administration, coordination with department directors, etc. Respond to requests by hospital personnel and/or physicians to facilitate patient problem resolutions. Inform and/or involve Director of Patient Experience & Quality of potentially litigious situations. Assist in communication and assurance of patient rights. Educate patients/families about their rights as well as responsibilities. Act as a facility liaison with TAPS. Assist with patient and staff education relative to Customer Service and Advance Directives. Assist CTMC associates with understanding data trends relevant to the patient experience. Provide support for hospital personnel on patient satisfaction surveys: HCAHPS and Press Ganey. Maintain confidentiality of all verbal and written facility information as part of daily responsibilities. Answer, screen, and route telephone calls as appropriate. Other duties as assigned by Director of Patient Experience & Quality. Education & Experience: Bachelor degree preferred; high school diploma or general education degree (GED) required, and three to six months related experience and/or training in customer service, patient relations or risk management. Spanish speaking preferred.</description>
