Patient Experience Data Analyst Tracking Code 34021 Job Description General Summary: Under the general supervision of the Vice President & Chief Experience Officer, understands, utilizes and maintains patient experience data from various sources. Supports the Office of Patient Experience by managing the intake of requests, production of reports, and responses to internal customers. Prepares and reviews all primary (eg, Press Ganey/HCAHPS/ patient and family complaints) and secondary (eg, National Hospital Compare database) patient experience data regularly, producing weekly, monthly and quarterly reports, as well as identifying and tracking change requests for survey process amidst system expansion. Duties and Responsibilities: 1 Manages, maintains, and disseminates internal and external patient experience data and information to the WellSpan Health team. 2 Produces regular updates from patient experience data from HCAHPS, Press Ganey, patient complaints and other data sources and distributes to the appropriate groups as directed. 3 Provides support and training for current and new users of the HCAHPS and Press Ganey reporting sites, reports and available resources. 4 Presents patient experience results and findings using written and narrative descriptions, charts, graphs and tables and/or presentation form. 5 Supports user access requests to Press Ganey and the Customer Reporting System under the direction of the database administrator for the Customer Reporting System and the Press Ganey databases. 6 Extracts, verifies, compiles, and formats data at aggregate and patient-level for formal data and internal leading interventions that align to patient perception data for the use of leadership strategic planning and progress assessment. May require use and access to electronic data warehouse (EDW), CRS, Powerchart, and other relevant databases. 7 Researches best practices internally and externally, as well as, assists with managing projects around improvement for patient experience initiatives. 8 Responds to routine and custom data requests from various levels of the organization. 9 Supports the translation of data into actionable information for WellSpan leaders and staff. 10 Develops user-friendly reports from patient survey comments, outlining actionable information for leaders. 11 Supports patient experience improvement efforts by providing comparative and reporting support to all WellSpan leaders and internal coaches. 12 Provides support through dissemination of patient experience information, trends and best practices to WellSpan leaders, internal coaches and teams to guide patient experience improvement strategies. 13 Assists the Office of the Patient Experience with patient experience improvement projects and initiatives through tasks including, but not limited to, data collection and basic data analysis. 14 Maintains professional growth and development through seminars, workshops, and professional affiliations to keep abreast of latest trends in field of expertise. 15 Provides outstanding service to all customers; fosters teamwork; and practices fiscal responsibility through improvement and innovation. About WellSpan: WellSpan Health is an integrated health system that serves the communities of central Pennsylvania and northern Maryland. The organization is comprised of a multispecialty medical group of more than 660 providers, a home care organization, four respected hospitals, more than 11,000 employees and 93 patient care locations. WellSpan is consistently recognized by SDI as one of the Top 100 Integrated Health Networks in the United States and has been recognized by Health Imaging and IT as one of the nation's "Top 25 Connected Healthcare Facilities." The Community: WellSpan Health facilities are located in multiple counties across south central Pennsylvania and northern Maryland, all offering an ideal living environment to match the quality of work-life balance youre seeking. The area offers abundant outdoor and cultural activities, including restaurants, theatre, golf courses, hiking trails, water sports and historic tours. Additionally, our communities are a short drive from several, large metropolitan areas including the Baltimore/DC metro area and Philadelphia. Required Skills Bachelor's Degree Required Required Experience 1-3 years experience preferred Job Location York, Pennsylvania, United States Position Type Full-Time/Regular Schedule Days Additional Scheduling Info N/A Additional Requirements N/A

<description>Director - Patient Experience Location: NewYork-Presbyterian/NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens Lead Care Coordination at New Yorks #1 hospital. It has grown to become a 519-bed acute care hospital that last year admitted more than 35,000 patients, had more than 139,000 outpatient visits, and treated 115,000 people through the emergency department. The hospital maintains specialty care centers and clinics throughout the borough of Queens and offers world-class health care services. Under the direction of the Chief Patient Experience Officer, The Director will lead and monitor targeted patient experience improvement initiatives. The Director will collaborate with and actively coach hospital leaders, department managers, and front-line staff to implement evidence-based strategies to improve the patient experience. Evaluates progress, synthesizes patient feedback, and identifies barriers to success; collaborates with Chief Patient Experience Office and hospital leaders to develop and implement interventions to mitigate / remove barriers and achieve patient experience goals. Monitors and evaluates the results of HCAHPS and Press Ganey Patient Satisfaction surveys. Maintains reporting system including aggregation, correlation, and analysis of data to identify opportunities for operational improvements. The Director will also have oversight for Language Services and Spiritual Care, as well as assisting the CXO with human resources and budgeting responsibilities. Role models the mission, vision, and values of NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. Join a hospital where employee engagement is at an all-time high. Enjoy competitive compensation along with benefits such as tuition reimbursement, hospital retirement contributions, and financial planning assistance. DUTIES: JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Required: 5-7 years of program management experience in strong customer service environment with demonstrated commitment to improving the patient experience. Bachelors Degree. Facilitation / Project Management of change initiatives across various levels of an organization. Solid presentation skills with a high level of energy and enthusiasm. Proven software competencies (Excel, Power Point, Access); highly skilled in Excel. Flexible/adaptable; ability to work with diverse group of healthcare professionals in a matrix environment. Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills. Desired: Previous experience with patient satisfaction vendors, Press Ganey and / or other. Knowledge of patient loyalty as a strategic growth initiative. ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Patient Satisfaction Data Analysis: Works with NM Analytics department to develop and distribute automated patient satisfaction reporting and dashboards through the EDW. Creates, distributes, and analyzes monthly patient satisfaction reports utilizing NMHC and vendor reporting tools (Press Ganey Online, EDW, etc.). Creates and completes ad-hoc patient satisfaction reports and presentations as requested by internal customers and departments. Works closely with Press Ganey to pro-actively maintain accurate account maintenance including but not limited to census based sampling, data processing, survey customizations, special report requests, and onsite training and consulting. Patient Experience Programs Management: Provides administrative ownership for Service Recovery program including staff training, tracking, distribution, and ordering of all Service Recovery resources. Provides administrative ownership over Leadership Rounds program including session scheduling, attendance tracking, coding feedback forms, and collecting information from internal departments. Works with NMHC system functions to implement programs and initiatives that support improving the patient experience (NM Academy, HR, Process Improvement, Analytics, etc.). Administrative Duties: Creates and maintains department purchase orders and processing of invoices for payment. Provides leadership on other departmental projects as assigned. Acts as a technical and informational resource for the department. AA/EOE

Duties and Responsibilities: 1 Manages, maintains, and disseminates internal and external patient experience data and information to the WellSpan Health team. 2 Produces regular updates from patient experience data from HCAHPS, Press Ganey, patient complaints and other data sources and distributes to the appropriate groups as directed. 3 Provides support and training for current and new users of the HCAHPS and Press Ganey reporting sites, reports and available resources. 4 Presents patient experience results and findings using written and narrative descriptions, charts, graphs and tables and/or presentation form. 5 Supports user access requests to Press Ganey and the Customer Reporting System under the direction of the database administrator for the Customer Reporting System and the Press Ganey databases. 6 Extracts, verifies, compiles, and formats data at aggregate and patient-level for formal data and internal leading interventions that align to patient perception data for the use of leadership strategic planning and progress assessment. May require use and access to electronic data warehouse (EDW), CRS, Powerchart, and other relevant databases. 7 Researches best practices internally and externally, as well as, assists with managing projects around improvement for patient experience initiatives. 8 Responds to routine and custom data requests from various levels of the organization. 9 Supports the translation of data into actionable information for WellSpan leaders and staff. 10 Develops user-friendly reports from patient survey comments, outlining actionable information for leaders. 11 Supports patient experience improvement efforts by providing comparative and reporting support to all WellSpan leaders and internal coaches. 12 Provides support through dissemination of patient experience information, trends and best practices to WellSpan leaders, internal coaches and teams to guide patient experience improvement strategies. 13 Assists the Office of the Patient Experience with patient experience improvement projects and initiatives through tasks including, but not limited to, data collection and basic data analysis. 14 Maintains professional growth and development through seminars, workshops, and professional affiliations to keep abreast of latest trends in field of expertise. 15 Provides outstanding service to all customers; fosters teamwork; and practices fiscal responsibility through improvement and innovation. About WellSpan: WellSpan Health is an integrated health system that serves the communities of central Pennsylvania and northern Maryland. The organization is comprised of a multispecialty medical group of more than 660 providers, a home care organization, four respected hospitals, more than 11,000 employees and 93 patient care locations. WellSpan is consistently recognized by SDI as one of the Top 100 Integrated Health Networks in the United States and has been recognized by Health Imaging and IT as one of the nation`s "Top 25 Connected Healthcare Facilities." The Community: WellSpan Health facilities are located in multiple counties across south central Pennsylvania and northern Maryland, all offering an ideal living environment to match the quality of work-life balance youre seeking. The area offers abundant outdoor and cultural activities, including restaurants, theatre, golf courses, hiking trails, water sports and historic tours. Additionally, our communities are a short drive from several, large metropolitan areas including the Baltimore/DC metro area and Philadelphia. Required Skills Bachelor`s Degree Required Required Experience 1-3 years experience preferred Job Location York, Pennsylvania, United States Position Type Full-Time/Regular Schedule: Days Additional Scheduling Info: N/A Additional Requirements: N/A Apply Share Return To Job Listings

<description>Job Title Manager, Patient Experience Programs Job # 25266 Department Name Performance Excellence Job Type Full Time Schedule M-F Bargaining Unit NONE Job Description: The Manager of Patient Experience Programs provides leadership, expertise, coaching, and facilitation of C-I-CARE and patient experience related activities to support the Stanford Hospital & Clinics (SHC) and University Healthcare Alliance (UHA) mission and vision. The focus of this role includes management and continuous improvement of the C-I-CARE program, measurement and communication of patient experience related feedback (e.g. Press Ganey, HCAHPS, Real-time Feedback), integration of behavioral standards with improvement work and day-to-day operations across SHC/UHA, and partnership development with organization-wide departments and external experts on patient experience initiatives. Essential Functions: 1. Manages the organizational strategy and goals for patient experience and ensures the development and outcomes of programs that support those strategies and goals 2. Partners with various clinical, technical, and operational departments within SHC and UHA to align and integrate patient experience initiatives and facilitate the development of an enhanced patient experience and culture of excellence 3. Partners with Performance Excellence Director to maintain collaborative relationships with senior leaders, directors, managers, physicians, School of Medicine, and external stakeholders to meet and exceed patient experience goals 4. Manages the design and implementation of patient experience assessment tools (C-I-CARE Application, Dashboard, patient satisfaction surveys and observations) for SHC and UHA 5. Develops and manages C-I-CARE training curriculum for staff & physicians. 6. Collaborates with Training & Organizational Development to ensure all staff receive appropriate on-boarding and refreshers on expectations, skills, and evaluation of C-I-CARE practices 7. Develops communications plans and relevant collateral materials (templates, standard work, intranet) to support the C-I-CARE program and other patient experience initiatives 8. Facilitates monthly C-I-CARE Management Rounds (daytime and evening) 9. Facilitates patient experience related forums (e.g. C-I-CARE Steering Committee, Patient Experience Planning Committee, Service Medical Directors) and projects (e.g. Physician Coaching Model, C-I-CARE Spring Training) 10. Acquires and adapts patient experience best practices from external professional organizations and experts 11. Performs supervisory functions by interviewing, selecting and providing training for new staff; by approving or disapproving recommendations from subordinate staff on personnel actions; by evaluating subordinates' performance; by hearing and resolving employee grievances; and by determining the need for and initiating disciplinary action in order to ensure adequate and competent staffing for the agency, program, division or institution. Job Qualifications: Minimum Qualifications Education: Master s Degree in a work related field Experience: Five (5) years of directly related work experience Licensure/Certification: N/A Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities * Knowledge of patient experience best practices and government regulatory requirements * Ability to act as both a thought leader and operational expert around process and patient experience transformation * Skilled in development of training curriculum and materials * Ability to communicate effectively at all organizational levels and in situations requiring instructing, persuading, negotiating, conflict resolution, consulting and advising, as well as flawless written communication * Ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with widely diverse groups, including individuals at all levels both within and outside the organization and gain their cooperation * Ability to manage multiple changing priorities and work effectively in a team or independent setting * Skills in information systems management and report design * Ability to plan, organize, prioritize, work independently and meet deadlines * Ability to provide leadership and influence others * Ability to resolve conflicts and/or negotiate with others to achieve positive results; establish and maintain * Ability to have effective interpersonal relationships * Knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Access, Project, Outlook, and C-I-CARE Application Complete Application</description>

A Refreshing Perspective: When you work at Willamette Dental Group, the organization's progressive approach frees you to do what matters to you-and our patients. What makes this multi-specialty group practice unique, and better, is a commitment to proactively facilitating the best possible health outcomes. Combined with a dedication to leveraging scientific data, skill, and the experience to make them happen, when you embrace the organization's guiding philosophy, you free yourself to facilitate healthy outcomes-and open yourself up to a world of professional growth and success. Learn more about Willamette Dental Group: #findyourfreedomwdg Overview: The Director of Patient Experience will develop and implement programs to increase service excellence and oversee patient care experience function and all related programs, strategies, initiatives, policies and procedures. Monitor and track progress throughout the organization for accountability, identify areas for opportunity and drive success in patient care experience by reaching and/or exceeding Press-Ganey goals. RESPONSIBILITIES * In partnership with senior leaders and stakeholders, determine goals and priorities and lead all programs, initiatives, policies and procedures for patient care experience including metrics and service recovery efforts. * Develop strategic development/business plan which ensures patient-centered care and continued performance improvement related to goals and overall patient satisfaction. * Responsible for the development of customer service strategy, goals, setting direction and the implementation of programs to advance the goals of the organization. * Establish effective patient satisfaction policies, procedures and guidelines. * Provide management education and serve as a resource to management for improving customer service within offices. * Monitor progress and oversee ongoing activities of Press Ganey. Provide monthly analytical and trending reports to senior leaders and stakeholders to support performance improvement recommendations. * Responsible for the integration of complaint and service improvement process. * Communicates to managers any potential service problem areas and assists with the resolution. * Identify risk management concerns and communicate findings to the appropriate individuals as it relates to safety effectiveness and delivering services. * Additional duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS * Bachelor's degree in business or healthcare preferred * Minimum 8-10 years of experience managing in a service related industry, preferably in healthcare * Experience in service standards development * Press-Ganey knowledge and/or training * Knowledge of process improvement theory and techniques * Experience in developing and implementing customer service experience programs and establishing policies and procedures to support programs. * Demonstrated success in leading multiple initiatives and programs to achieve service goals and customer/patient satisfaction. * Demonstrated ability to coach and mentor leaders and staff for service excellence. Strong verbal and written communications skills, including consultation, facilitation, and making presentations. * Experience in leading by influence and ability to inspire others. * Proven project management, implementation and process improvement skills. * Ability to conduct and interpret quantitative/qualitative analysis.

<description>Position Summary: The Patient Experience Data Analyst supports the Patient Experience department by designing, implementing and managing a program for the robust collection and analysis of patient satisfaction data from various sources and databases. Produces and maintains statistical graphs, along with reporting the measurement of data trends. Reviews, interprets, utilizes, and presents data to key stakeholders, including administration, department heads and clinical and non-clinical managers. Identifies trends and opportunities. Upholds the standards of the system-wide customer service program.</description><requirement>Requirements Required: Bachelor's Degree in Business, Analytics, Health Care Administration or healthcare-related field 1-2 years progressive analytical experience Proficiency and familiarity with computer programs such as Internet, Excel, Access, Word, Adobe, PowerPoint Knowledge of data analysis techniques, data base structure and demonstrated ability to compile, analyze and interpret and graph statistical data and develop effective measurement tools/studies Strong analytical, strategic thinking, and problem solving skills with the proven ability to plan, initiate, and manage multiple projects while performing at a high level in a demanding, fast-paced environment Preferred: Master's Degree in related field Experience in health care 1-2 years experience with HCAHPS, patient experience surveys, data and interpretation Experience with Press Ganey surveys and systems Experience with statistical analysis software Experience in survey statistics and research</requirement><education>Bachelor's Degree</education>

<description>Unidine is a great company with exceptional benefits and a remarkable corporate culture. Every member of the Unidine team is driven to deliver the highest level of customer and client service and shares a belief that our approach to fresh food is fundamentally linked to health and wellness, human interaction and social responsibility. From this common foundation, we deliver the best food and dining management services in the industry and exceed our customers and clients expectations every day. Patient Services Manager As the Patient Services Manager, you will be responsible for improving patient satisfaction for all food and dining services within a healthcare environment. Our goal is to promote healing and wholeness working with and through improved nutritional methodologies. As a leader on the food services team, this person will be the catalyst for change and responsible for improving the patient satisfaction experience. Essential Functions and key tasks: Assessment of current dining services program. Seek and evaluate industry best practices that can be incorporated into Unidine and the hospital's best practices for creating an exception patient dining experience. Improving menu and meal selection and the assembly and delivery of meal service. Assessing meal rounds and developing criteria to evaluate performance. Developing protocols for patient interaction during meals. Improving meal delivery to ensure correct temperatures and dietary requirements are met. Develop a training process and module directed at process, procedures, products actions and services that create a positive patient experience as it pertains to dining services. Implement training all food & dietary team members. Integrating guest dining services into the Hospital model of patient care, service and treatment. Fosters and Develops Positive Client Relationships Develop relationships with Nursing Leadership and act as a Liaison between patient care and dining services. Understand and evaluate Press Ganey information. Education and Experience : An undergraduate (BS/BA) degree in Food Science, Nutrition, Culinary Arts or Hotel/Restaurant Management is required RD or CDM preferred. . In absence of a bachelor?s degree, a candidate must have an Associate?s Degree and have completed the Certified Dietetic Manager program (or state equivalent). 5+ years related experience and/or training at Dining Services Director level or equivalent level (preferably in a Long Term Care or Acute Care environment); or equivalent combination of education and experience. Unidine Corporation is an equal opportunity employer .</description>

Job Req ID: 120199Position Number: 00132091Employment Type: Full TimeShift: DayShift Details: Monday-Friday, 8:30am-5:00pmStandard Hours: 40.00Department Name: Patient Experience/SupportLocation: CHS Corporate OperationsLocation Details: East Morehead StreetJob SummaryEssential Functions* Maintains System-wide responsibility for production and maintenance of monthly patient satisfaction dashboards and the quarterly patient experience dashboards.* Trains individuals and groups System-wide on accessing data and reports in patient satisfaction databases.* Develops and maintains supporting training materials for patient satisfaction database training.* Administers access for team members to their respective patient satisfaction databases.* Provides technical assistance and user support regarding Patient Satisfaction databases.* Analyzes information gathered from patient satisfaction surveys to assist Patient Experience leadership with recommendations for improvements to ensure a high level of customer service.* Assists with initiatives and activities including data solutions and ongoing system updates.* Supports team members in serving as additional liaison for the Press Ganey patient satisfaction survey.* Assists with maintaining and updating Patient Experience website.* Works as necessary to develop electronic tools to improve the collection, analysis and display of data to improve consistency and efficiency.* Assists with annual Physician Satisfaction survey process, including initial set-up (gathers lists of physicians from administration, ensures accuracy of physician lists), provides technical support to physicians, and creates presentations of the results.* Serves on the Service Recovery Advisory Committee; prepares, analyzes and presents quarterly Service Recovery data and offers recommendations to improvements in the reporting and capturing of the data.* Creates surveys using a variety of tools.Physical RequirementsWorks in an office environment. Involves walking, standing, sitting and driving. Must speak and understand English fluently. Intact sense of sight and hearing required.Education, Experience and CertificationsHigh School Diploma or GED required; Associates degree or Bachelors degree preferred. Extensive experience in the use of computer software applications required. Data analysis, critical thinking and communication skills are essential. Previous healthcare experience preferred. Possess a good logical thought process. Must be a self-starter with the ability to manage several projects at one time.At Carolinas HealthCare System, our patients, communities and teammates are at the center of everything we do. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion allows us to deliver care that is superior in quality and compassion across our network of more than 900 care locations.As a leading, innovative health system, we promote an environment where differences are valued and integrated into our workforce. Our culture of inclusion and cultural competence allows us to achieve our goals and deliver the best possible experience to patients and the communities we serve.Posting Notes: Not ApplicableCarolinas HealthCare System is an EOE/AA Employer

Chief Patient Experience Officer, Boca Raton Regional Hospital. Care and Innovation happen here every day. Lead a dynamic team in a rewarding setting. Position Summary: Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the Chief Patient Experience Officer acts as the system champion dedicated to creating a world-class culture of excellence in patient experience. The Chief Patient Experience Officer coordinates planning and execution of hospital-wide patient experience and service excellence programs at Boca Raton Regional Hospital. In this position, the Chief Patient Experience Officer collaborates with senior leadership on a strategic vision of service excellence that will be cascaded down to all staff members; communicates progress on service excellence initiatives to key team members, including executives, department of Patient and Guest Relations employees, and key Committees; oversees a data driven program collecting, tracking, and analyzing patient experience trends for optimizing service outcomes. The Chief Patient Experience Officer coaches Hospital employees to maximize the use of customer service tools and programs for an enhanced patient experience. The Chief Patient Experience Officer supervises the Director of Patient and Guest Relations. Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following: Leads the Patient Experience Council in the development of patient experience service initiatives and establishment of Hospital-wide patient satisfaction goals. Ensures the integration and alignment of patient experience strategies with teams across the organization. Assists in leading organizational cultural transformation with patient experience at the center to ensure all touch points meet and exceed patients' needs. Researches, develops, and coordinates the implementation of strategic plans, policies, and standards that promote the patient customer experience. Responsible for oversight of Press Ganey patient satisfaction database, including patient survey questions, related annual budgeting, and running of reports as needed. Provides guidance regarding patient experience data collection, tracking, distribution, and communication. Drives analytics to measure patient experience strategic goals. Identifies areas for improvement, using Press Ganey and HCAHPS patient experience data. Focuses the organization on reforming management and employee behavior and retooling operational processes to better align them with patient needs. Leads efforts to hardwire management and employee practices to ensure exceptional service. This includes the emphasis on behavior standards and usage of "key words at key times". Oversees training of multidisciplinary teams to use customer service tools and principles in daily activities. Collaborates with external experts to implement evidence-based service excellence tools and processes throughout the organization. Plans, organizes, and directs the provision of services within the department to assure compliance with the organization's policies and procedures as well as The Joint Commission and appropriate regulatory agencies. Coordinates with the Director of Patient and Guest Relations to ensure timely review and follow up of patient concerns and grievances. Minimum Education and or Experience: Bachelor's degree in a related area (Master's degree strongly preferred), and Four to ten years of management experience in a related field, and Successful track record in leading a house wide patient experience program Licensure Regulation Certification: NA *Incumbent may be required to perform emergency duty before, during and or beyond normal work hours or days in the event of an emergency, crisis situation or disaster (man-made or natural) including evacuation sites. *The person in this position will work in a smoke-free location, and is expected to adhere to all smoking restrictions. *In the spirit of wellness for both our employees and patients, Boca Raton Regional Hospital has instituted a mandatory influenza prevention vaccination program. Current employees must receive the influenza prevention vaccination free of charge during the recognized flu season. As a condition of employment, new hires will be required to comply with all program rules. This is a mandatory program with the exception of documented medical or religious reasons for not receiving the vaccine. For further information on this progressive program, please contact Boca Raton Regional Hospital's Human Resources Department at 561-955-4075. Excellent written and verbal communications skills Bachelors Degree Required

Provide monthly analytical and trending reports to senior leaders and stakeholders to support performance improvement recommendations. * Responsible for the integration of complaint and service improvement process. * Communicates to managers any potential service problem areas and assists with the resolution. * Identify risk management concerns and communicate findings to the appropriate individuals as it relates to safety effectiveness and delivering services. * Additional duties as assigned.QUALIFICATIONS* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration or other related field. * Master's degree preferred. * Minimum 4-6 years of related and progressively responsible experience in a healthcare setting or 4 years healthcare experience with additional experience in customer service or project management* Experience in service standards development * Experience in developing and implementing customer service experience programs and establishing policies and procedures to support programs. * Experience in leading by influence and ability to inspire others. * Press-Ganey knowledge and/or training desirable* Knowledge of process improvement theory and techniques * Knowledge of relevant computer systems/applications. * Demonstrated success in leading multiple initiatives and programs to achieve service goals and customer/patient satisfaction. * Demonstrated ability to coach and mentor leaders and staff for service excellence. Strong verbal and written communications skills, including consultation, facilitation, and making presentations. * Strong leadership attributes. * Proven project management, implementation and process improvement skills. * Conduct and interpret quantitative/qualitative analysis. * Analyze and solve problems. * Think critically and uncover root-causes of issues.* Relate with others in a respectful, constructive manner.* Embrace and promote company's model of practicing dentistry.* Uphold and exemplify the company's core values.* Represent the company in a professional manner to customers, employer groups, brokers, professional associations, and the public. Job Description The Customer Care/Patient Experience Coordinator is responsible for oversight of all aspects of the customer service program and the evaluation of the patient experience that arise from all aspects of health system operations. As such, the Customer Care Coordinator reports directly to the Senior Director of Marketing & Communications and has matrix reporting requirements to the Director of Quality Management. The Customer Care Coordinator maintains collaborative and cooperative relationships with both internal and external customers including; risk management, department directors, providers, managers, employees, patients and their families regarding customer satisfaction issues as they arise. The Coordinator develops consistent messaging and training to create and maintain a patient and family-centered culture as well as provides measurement, tracking, trending and improvement initiatives related to the patient and family's experience of care. Responsibilities: Provide customer service orientation, education and program development for all employees of Huggins Hospital as a regular participant in the hospital orientation program. Work directly with customers to resolve issues promptly and in a satisfactory manner to the patients and to the hospital in compliance with CMS CoP's for Critical Access Hospitals. Act as point of contact for patients, families and community members to assist with questions, concerns, and to engage in both positive and negative feedback. Refine the patient complaint/grievance/feedback process throughout the organization including analysis of trends and recommendations for changes in staff training, policy and/or program development to better meet the needs of the customers. Demonstrate the capacity to communicate effectively with medical staff, hospital personnel, state and federal professionals and the public. Work closely with hospital leadership and clinical departments to ensure optimal effectiveness and efficiency of the Customer Care program. Develops subject matter expertise and gathers data from appropriate sources for the measurement of the patient experience (Press Ganey) and for the reporting of the patient experience via the Hospital Consumer Assessment for Healthcare Providers (HCAHPS) and the Clinician and Group Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems (CGCAHPS) for CMS. Analyze data from multiple sources for trends and opportunity for program improvements, service delivery and customer satisfaction. Report findings to the Executive and Senior Management teams and the Board of Trustees on a quarterly basis. Chairs the HCAHPs committee and coordinates all initiatives to improve the patient experience and HCAHPs /CGCAHPS scores. Develop program for Patient and Family centered care. Maintain and update ADA compliance and policies for communication with special populations (deaf, hearing impaired, language needs, patients utilizing service animals, special populations). Participate in state and federal meetings related to improving the patient and family experience. Participate in ongoing readiness activities for periodic CMS accreditation surveys. Perform other duties and professional responsibilities as required by the facility. Company Info Other Info View Company Profile Huggins Hospital 240 South Main Street Wolfeboro, New Hampshire 03894 Carroll Website: https://www.hugginshospital.org/Careers.aspx Post on site: From 5/15/2015 until 7/28/2015 Categories: Customer Service Healthcare - Administrative Healthcare - General Job Type: Regular Full/Part Time: Full Time Salary: Hourly Wage Job Requirements 3 - 5 years experience to include: Experience with Health Care Customer Service, Press Ganey patient experience surveys, data analysis, customer service/service excellence programming, measuring/reporting customer satisfaction (HCAHPS, CGCAHPS), LEAN processes, leading organizational change; an understanding of medical terminology and electronic health records; and experience in staff development and public speaking is desired. Education Requirements Bachelor's degree in Communication, Sociology, Social Work or a related field. A healthcare degree or licensed healthcare worker is preferred Contact Info Cayleen Phinney Human Resources Specialist Huggins Hospital Wolfeboro, NH, New Hampshire Phone: 603.569.7649 Email: HumanResources@hugginshospital.org How to apply: Apply Online

<description>We are currently seeking qualified candidates for a Senior Patient Experience Improvement Coach position that will be based in our Office of Clinical Effectiveness department. This position is based in the west Florida area with the potential to work with our campuses in Tampa Bay and Sebring. This position has the opportunity to be responsible for overseeing service excellence projects, course development and delivery, and improvement coaching for hospital team members, physicians and executives. This role leads or participates in patient experience best practice initiatives and site visits, requiring solid knowledge of best practices and critical thinking related to how to best influence others in process improvement. This role requires solid experience in adult learning concepts, a strong track record implementing improvements in a hospital setting, along with project management, organization and communication skills. Additionally, this position plans or assists in planning core content for major system events including conferences and strategic forums. As a leader in implementing improvements in patient experience, this role requires a working knowledge of effective reporting and interpretation of patient survey results, along with an understanding of statistical concepts. This position serves as a change agent for Adventist Health System and requires experience in process improvement, along with a proven track record of effective presentations to all levels. Specific job duties include: Is knowledgeable about and stays current on CMS CAHPS requirements and Value Based Purchasing, and is able to articulate them in a written or oral mode to all levels of the organization. Demonstrates an understanding and working knowledge of the Press Ganey & CAHPS survey processes. Demonstrates an understanding and working knowledge of patient experience survey results and statistical significance, and can effectively convey this to others. Effectively coaches leaders and hospital staff on best practices to improve patient experience. Leads or participates in educational site visits at hospitals Partners with hospitals, and recommends appropriate interventions based on current status. Plans site visits accordingly, working with the hospital leadership team to develop agendas. Trains and mentors internal patient experience coaches and leaders. Leads the region wide planning, development and deployment of best practices at multiple campuses. Experience Requirements: Minimum three to five years of experience in a hospital setting leading or actively involved in patient experience improvement. Minimum three to five years of experience in nursing management. Minimum 10 years of experience as a nurse. Minimum one to two years patient experience coaching experience. Experience in adult learning concepts and curriculum design. Strong project management/organizational skills. Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) with a proven track record of effectively presenting information to all levels of the organization, including senior executives. Strong ability to train and mentor other coaches and leaders in best practice for the teaching of patient experience concepts. Flexibility and adaptability to change. Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to interface effectively with physicians and nursing leadership. Strong attention to detail and ability to problem-solve effectively. Process improvement abilities are preferred - Lean, Six Sigma Black or Green Belt Preferred Education Requirements: Four-year college degree in nursing or related field required. Masters in Nursing, Masters in Business Administration or Masters in Health Administration, preferred. Licensed Registered Nurse, Required. Software: Microsoft Office Suite required Press Ganey Reporting Tools preferred NetLearning or Other Course Development Tools preferred Travel: This position is based in the west Florida area (office location flexible) with the potential to work with our campuses in Tampa Bay and Sebring Occasional travel to Corporate office in Altamonte Springs If this position sounds like a great match for your skills set and experience, please apply online now! Job Snapshot Employment Type Full-Time Job Type Health Care, Nurse, Training Education Not Specified Experience Not Specified Manages Others Not Specified Industry Healthcare - Health Services Required Travel Up to 50% Job ID 218168 Apply on Company Website</description>

<description>**The following information in red applies only to Northwestern Memorial Hospital and Northwestern Memorial Physician Group applicants for staff level positions. ** ******As part of completing the application process, you will be required to complete an online-assessment which will be sent to your e-mail following the submission of your resume. This questionnaire should take you approximately 45 minutes to 1 hour to complete. Please note that your application will not be considered until there is a finalized assessment on file. If you have previously taken this assessment, you will not be required to take it again. We appreciate your interest in Northwestern Memorial HealthCare. ** **Northwestern Lake Forest applicants will not be required to take the assessment at this time.** QUALIFICATIONS: Required, 5-7 years of program management experience in strong customer service environment with demonstrated commitment to improving the patient experience. Bachelor Degree. Facilitation / Project Management of change initiatives across various levels of an organization. Solid presentation skills with a high level of energy and enthusiasm. Proven software competencies (Excel, Power Point, Access); highly skilled in Excel. Flexible/adaptable - ability to work with diverse group of healthcare professionals in a matrix environment. Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills. Desired, previous experience with patient satisfaction vendors, Press Ganey and / or other. Knowledge of patient loyalty as a strategic growth initiative. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Data Analysis, create and distribute patient satisfaction survey and comment reports on a weekly / monthly / ad-hoc basis utilizing NMPG and vendor reporting tools (Press Ganey Online, Enterprise Data Warehouse, etc.). Provide detailed data analysis of patient satisfaction data and comments to identify and prioritize systemic and clinic level opportunities to improve the delivery of patient services. Pro-actively monitor patient satisfaction survey data and comments to identify trends, changes, and continuous improvement opportunities. Manage key driver analysis reports, communications, and presentations to executive leadership and clinics. Manage custom report content and delivery from vendor. Consolidate and manage patient feedback mechanisms to create data to drive patient experience improvements. Program Management, create detailed work plans for the system and clinics to achieve patient satisfaction goals. Complete ad-hoc patient satisfaction educational presentations to internal customers and departments. Coordinate all training programs (new employees, management, continuing education, etc.) on tools and tactics to use and act-on patient satisfaction initiatives. Partner with clinical managers to identify improvement opportunities and functions as a hands-on resource. Develop systems to share and recognize best practices across the organization to sustain current level of service and patient satisfaction. Daily management of the Patient Satisfaction feedback mechanisms (phone, website, Facebook). Coordinate the service recovery program within NMPG. Collaborate with clinical managers to identify opportunities to recognize and reward demonstrations of exceptional customer service by employees. Influence and communicate with all levels of management. Provide administrative ownership over Leadership and AIDET rounding programs including scheduling, attendance tracking, feedback data collection format, and communication of action plans. Create and maintain department purchase orders and processing of invoices for payment. Embody leadership, team building and group facilitation skills. Build trust with internal and external customers and team members. Perform other responsibilities as designated in support of organizational priorities. EOE/AA.</description>

<description>The Patient Experience Manager is responsible for administering, directing, planning and coordinating all activities within the assigned medical offices. Works collaboratively with the medical group physicians and WESTMED administrators to ensure efficient, high quality, cost effective service to our patients. Schedule for position is Monday through Friday and varies between 7:30am to 4:30pm or 8:00am to 5:00pm. Job responsibilities include: - Manages daily operations in the Medical Offices and coordinates the work activities and schedules. - Manages personnel in the Medical Office including, but not limited to, interviewing, hiring, training, coaching, mentoring, and evaluating their performance. Selects top talent, utilizing motivational interviewing techniques, choosing the 'right people'. - Administers office policies and procedures in a consistent and timely manner. - Develops guidelines for prioritizing work activities, evaluating effectiveness and modifying activities as necessary. - Has budgetary responsibility for their assigned workgroups. - Maintains compliance with approved budgets, ensuring effective staff and resource utilization. - Manages overtime effectively and accurately justifies appropriate variation. - Proactively manages inventory and supplies utilizing par levels and inventory count management. - Works collaboratively with the Billing Department to ensure timely and accurate bill processing and payment. - Maintains the Medical Office facility. Oversees and recommends improvements including renovations, expansion and purchase of equipment. - Works collaboratively and actively communicates with other patient experience managers and administrative personnel to ensure consistent organizational efficiency, productivity and positive patient outcomes. - Promotes high quality patient care and a patient-centric experience. - Monitors clinical staff dashboard progression. - Proactively addresses Press Ganey deficiencies by developing, implementing and monitoring a remedial course of action. - Promotes a culture of confidence, integrity, pride and passion in the workplace. - Monitors staff plan compliance in a consistent manner and takes corrective action. - Holds monthly staff meetings to promote open communication. - Supports an environment of constant learning. - Meets monthly with individual staff members to discuss performance progression. - Works collaboratively and actively with other patient experience managers and administrative personnel to ensure maximum organizational efficiency and productivity. - Adheres to all WMG Compliance Program Policies and Procedures. - Manages assigned projects as directed. Performs other duties as requested. Job requirements include: - Current New York State professional license as a Registered Nurse - BSN Degree - Management experience preferred - Strong computer skills, EMR experience preferred - Excellent customer service skills</description>

<description>Clinical Specialist - Patient Experience - Orlando Clinical Specialist - Patient Experience - Orlando (216564) Clinical Specialist - Patient Experience - Orlando Florida Hospital seeks to hire a Clinical Specialist who will embrace our mission to extend the healing ministry of Christ. Florida Hospital Facility Profile Located on a lush tropical campus, our flagship hospital, 1,107-bed Florida Hospital Orlando, serves as the major tertiary facility for much of the Southeast, the Caribbean and South America. Florida Hospital Orlando houses one of the largest Emergency Departments and largest cardiac catheterization labs in the country. We are already one of the busiest hospitals in the nation, providing service excellence to more than 32,000 inpatients and 125,000 outpatients each year. Department Profile: The mission of the Florida Hospital Patient Experience Department is to develop a patient and family centered experience by building trust, creating belonging and delivering hope to every person, every time. Our team of clinical and non-clinical healthcare professionals serve as subject matter experts for patient and family experience strategies and initiatives across the Florida Hospital 8 campus system. We serve leadership, physicians, and frontline staff by providing strategic support, evidenced-based best practices, voice of the customer feedback, training and education, and data intelligence. Our offices are located on the Orlando campus at 2301 N. Orange Ave, Orlando, FL 32803. Work Hours/Shifts: Mon - Fri; 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. Job Summary: Patient Experience Clinical Specialist will work collaboratively with administrators, physicians, and other clinical team members to support clinical and non-clinical areas in the consulting, planning, development, implementation and evaluation of a comprehensive patient and family experience strategy for the Florida Hospital System, campuses and departments. Works with campus clinical areas and leadership team to ensure that the organization is in a constant state of implementing patient experience improvements behaviors and best practices to improve patient satisfaction. Adheres to all Florida Hospital policies/ procedures and rules / regulations when involved with consulting, research and educational functions related to Patient Experience initiatives or projects. Actively participates in outstanding customer service and accepts responsibility in maintaining relationships that are equally respectful to all. Knowledge, Skills, Education & Experience Required: Bachelor's degree (BSN) or three years clinical nursing experience Proven experience in behavioral coaching and leadership Clinical nursing experience Demonstrated computer proficiency, particularly in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook Proficient English oral and written communication skills Ability to present, create and edit presentations Able to work with people of diverse backgrounds Strong organizational skills, self directed and able to manage multiple priorities/projects Ability to speak publicly effectively to frontline, physician & executive levels Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to facilitate, consult, research and educate Understands and has the ability to translate and interpret patient survey data as a tool to enhancing patients experience. Experience or participation with ability to educate, mentor, counsel effectively ( Preferred ) Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to coach, mentor, and motivate ( Preferred ) Problem solving and listening skills ( Preferred ) Effective in building relationships and gaining credibility ( Preferred ) Process improvement skills ( Preferred ) Knowledge and expertise in superior/quality patient service, patient safety, patient/family centered care, Press Ganey/HCAHPS and evidence-based best practices ( Preferred ) License, Certification or Registration Required: Registered Nurse State of Florida valid driver's license Valid, current State of Florida licensure as a registered professional nurse ( Preferred ) Certification in training and/or human performance improvement ( Preferred ) Job Responsibilities: Demonstrates, through behavior, Florida Hospital's core values of Integrity, Compassion, Balance, Excellence, Stewardship, and Teamwork Collaborate with all FH campuses in training presentations and facilitating the patient experience culture and curriculum. Lead, change and develop relationships with hospital leaders and physicians to assist them in removing experience obstacles, coach and mentor them/their staff on behaviors. Lead department observations and assessments for all shifts and each job class within department. Write reports of findings; consult department leaders on needed cultural change and next steps with executive leadership. Research and present evidence-based best practices that impact our patients experience and improve patient satisfaction scores (Press/Ganey/HCAHPS) to top quartile. Consult and present patient satisfaction results and findings using written and narrative descriptions, charts, graphs and tables, and/or presentation form to departments and access patient experience strategies effectiveness. Analyze, and understand patient satisfaction data and the voice of our customers (letters, comments, phone calls) and be able to proficiently educate and communicate to executives, physicians, leaders and staff. Educate & Orientate new and current staff to patient experience behaviors and standards. The above statements reflect the general duties and responsibilities necessary to describe the principal functions of the job, as identified, and shall not be considered an exhaustive list of job responsibilities which may be inherent in the job. Responsibilities are subject to change. If you want to be a part of a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest quality in patient care, we invite you to explore the Clinical Specialist opportunity with Florida Hospital Orlando and apply online today. Job Keywords: Clinical Specialist, Patient Experience</description><experience>3 to 20+ years</experience>

Company: VCU Health System (Medical College of Virginia) Facility: VCU Health System - MCV Hospitals at Richmond Department: Patient Centered Services VCU Health Systems Patient Centered Services is seeking a full time Manager of Patient Experience to drive and foster a culture of patient and family centered care and service excellence, while improving patient and family experience and patient relations across the Health System. Works directly with Health Systems leadership team to assess and communicate performance and to create change at all levels of the organization. The Manager has primary accountability for the management of the following operational areas that support the patient experience: Information Desk, Patient Relations, Language Services, Concierge Services and the STAR Service Program which includes Service Recovery and Patient Satisfaction. He/she will be responsible for compliance with CMS/ TJC standards in the areas of grievances, patients rights and patient centered communication standards. The Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining a data driven program to effectively manage all patient experience/service excellence activities, including benchmarked patient satisfaction management, complaint management, grievance tracking and supports education programs focused on service excellence and service recovery. The Manager will lead and monitor targeted patient experience improvement initiatives. Collaborates with and actively coaches hospital leaders, department managers, and frontline staff to implement evidence-based strategies to improve the patient experience. Evaluates progress, synthesizes patient feedback, and identifies barriers to success; collaborates with hospital leadership to develop and implement interventions to mitigate/remove barriers and achieve patient experience goals. Monitors and evaluates the results of HCAHPS and Press Ganey Patient Satisfaction surveys. Maintains reporting system including aggregation, correlation, and analysis of data to identify opportunities for operational improvements. Responsibilities All day-to-day operations are handled independently. Advice and guidance are sought from Director on an as needed situational basis and when there is a major impact on activity. Actions that are taken without prior approval include daily operational functions and leadership of staff. With guidance from the Director, advice and guidance are sought for termination of employees, handling employee grievances, review of annual unit goals and budget, approval on unit guidelines and procedures and review of staff annual performance evaluations. Has full authority and accountability for actions and decisions within the scope of the position description and hospital policies and procedures. Supervisory responsibilities for Patient Centered Services, Language Services and Star Service. While the job is generally Monday Friday, 8 am to 5 pm, work may be necessary on evenings and weekends depending on the project and any on-call duties. Qualifications Required Bachelors Degree in Health Care Administration, Business Administration, Nursing or other healthcare related field from an accredited program Minimum of five (5) years of progressive leadership/management experience with a focus on patient/customer satisfaction. Advanced knowledge of various CAHPS surveys, CMS data requirements, patient satisfaction tools, the field of consumer research and complaint/grievance management. Proven experience in setting goals, designing, implementing and monitoring plans for improvement in the patient experience. P class=MsoNormal Full time 1: Days Bachelors degree is required Computer skills are required Customer service skills are required Excellent communication skills are required

Add To Basket Apply Now JavaScript enabled browser required. ## Description Job Title Director, Patient Experience Department Patient Experience Location DCH 03323 Work Unit Description Work Schedule, Hours, FTE, Salary Range This is a full time (1.0) FTE unclassified administrative position. Schedule will be Monday - Friday. Salary commensurate with qualifications and experience.This position is located on the Marquam Hill campus in Portland Oregon. Functions/Duties of Position This position is instrumental to the successful implementation of OHSU's mission, vision, goals, and objectives in providing an exceptional patient experience. The Director of Patient Experience designs, develops, implements and monitors patient experience and strategic initiatives through project work, facilitation, consultation, education and reporting. This person functions as a change agent for the organization. The focus of the work is on improving the patient experience through cultural and process improvement initiatives. These performance initiatives often extend beyond the hospitals and clinics to university wide initiatives and will include both internal and external stakeholders. The Director of Patient Experience leads the Patient Experience team and serves as a subject matter expert for the organization. As the expert for the organization on the patient experience, the director will serve as a content expert and often provide guidance to process improvement projects. It is imperative for this employee to be able to work independently and effectively with all levels of employees in the organization. The Director of Patient Experience will coordinate program development and delivery across department and organization lines; establishing interdisciplinary teams, and identifying and recommending a cost-effective infrastructure to support roll-out and maintenance, including but not limited to coordinating training and education; establishing metrics of performance; developing tracking, analysis and performance reporting systems; and, in concert with appropriate stakeholders, developing new or modifying existing systems for recognizing and reinforcing performance. The Director also has responsibility for operational and budgetary oversight for Volunteer Services, Concierge Services and Language Services. Job Requirements **REQUIRED: * Master's Degree in Healthcare Administration, Public Administration, Business Administration, Organizational Development, or other related field. * Minimum of five years' experience with a large complex health care organization- experience in an academic medical center setting. * Minimum of five years' experience managing and/or developing patient experience initiatives. * Must demonstrate outstanding verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrate customer-focused and problem solving abilities. Pleasant, outgoing demeanor, and able to work with individuals at all levels of the organization. * Leadership and operational management experience in health care setting. * Demonstrate through either previous position responsibilities or academic preparation: * Strong training skills and facilitation experience. * Public speaking skills, both for internal groups as well as external conferences. * Critical thinking and independent decision making abilities. * Ability to work as team member and with multidisciplinary teams. * Detail oriented and superb organization skills. * Strategic thinking and planning. * Expertise in Microsoft Office, building presentations and trending models. * Ability to facilitate collaboration and cooperation among various constituencies and service areas. * Comprehensive understanding of patient experience best practices. * Comprehensive understanding of patient experience statistical and data analytics, including various CAHPS surveys and trend identification. * Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines. * Ability to work in a fast paced and fluid environment. * Budgeting experience with budgets exceeding at least $1 million. **PREFERRED: * Experience with process improvement/Lean principles and/or project management. * Formal experience in training and coaching. * Experience as a manager or director of patient experience service line. * Experience with Epic or other patient information software. * Experience with Press Ganey programs and surveys strongly preferred. * Management of operational customer service related departments (Language Services, Concierge/Guest Services, Volunteer Services). * Experience presenting in conference at a national level. Additional Details **WORKING CONDITIONS:** * Normal office environment. * Generally follows M-F salaried workweek with a meeting schedule, typically between 0800-1700 with variability depending on project needs. **PHYSICAL DEMANDS & EQUIPMENT USAGE: ** * Extensive computer use. * Frequent traveling between buildings on campus and to remote locations. *LI-DM1 OHSU is an equal opportunity, affirmative action institution. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability or protected veteran status. Applicants with disabilities can request reasonable accommodation by contacting the Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Department at 503-494-5148. How To Apply Apply here online.
