Are you a current nurse manager who is ready for a change? Do you enjoy teaching others how to improve the experience of patients and familes? We are currently seeking qualified candidates for a Regional Patient Experience Manager position that will be based in our Patient Experience department. This position is based in the west Florida area and covers Florida Hospital North Pinellas. This position provides the opportunity to be responsible for directly managing the operations and improvement program of AHS Patient Experience in the West Florida Region. Working with the Vice President, the manager is key in the continued development and implementation of strategy for deploying best practices in the most effective manner within the region. This role oversees the site visit program for West Florida, leveraging Press Ganey Advisor resources to provide appropriate education across the continuum of care. This role provides senior level consulting and coaching to executives, middle and front line leaders in the best practices for patient experience, requiring solid knowledge of functional best practices and critical thinking related to how to best influence the field in process improvement. Additionally, this position leads or participates in the planning of regional and major system events including conferences and strategic forums. As a leader in implementing improvements in patient experience, this role requires a strong working knowledge of effective reporting and interpretation of survey results, along with an understanding of statistical concepts. This position is also involved in the improvement of patient flow and throughput within our emergency departments. This position serves as a change agent for Adventist Health System and requires strong experience in process improvement, along with a proven track record of leading others in the improvement of patient experience. Specific job duties include: Manages the patient experience program within the West Florida region, demonstrating strategic planning capabilities and negotiation skills in working with multiple C-Suite executives regarding the needs of each hospital. Works closely with the Vice President and executive leaders in the field to ensure that we are most effectively meeting the needs of each facility and regional progress as a whole, while creatively leveraging limited resources. Effectively manages the consulting and coaching program to best leverage both self and external coaches/advisors with the most effective coverage within the region. Evolves coaching models as necessary to best meet needs and drive improvement. Seeks executive and Coach input and engages them in changes to our model over time. Actively leads and/or participates in strategic planning for patient experience system-wide. Demonstrates strong project management skills, and effectively develops and monitors project workplans and team members in assigned hospitals. Develops strategies and leads committees/efforts to engage hospitals as a region and leverage best practices across West Florida Assesses the strengths/opportunities of hospital based Patient Experience Leaders in the field, and makes recommendations on development strategies for these roles to the Vice President Trains and mentors internal patient experience coaches and leaders, as well as Press Ganey patient experience advisors. Consults with senior leadership, and coaches leaders and staff at all levels in best practices for patient experience. Working with the Vice President and System Manager, identifies strategic approach to balancing site visits from both internal and external resources to make the most impact in the region. Leads the system wide planning, development and execution of high profile, more complex initiatives, requiring heavy interaction and influence with physician and nursing leaders. Participates in the pro-active planning of all major monthly and quarterly AHS strategy calls. Ensures that topics are timely, and that best practices are shared across the organization. Effectively strategizes to use these calls as a springboard from the annual Summit to entrench the content. Develops strategic recommendations for curriculum necessary to support patient experience improvement initiatives in the field, including innovative approaches for delivery. Working with the Vice President and System Manager, participates in the annual planning of the Patient Experience Summit. Understands and stays current on CMS CAHPS requirements, Value Based Purchasing, Press Ganey & CAHPS survey processes, results and statistical significance, and is able to articulate them in a written or oral mode to all levels of the organization. Understands the relationship between ED/hospital patient flow/throughput and patient experience, and actively seeks out opportunities to impact improvement in throughput. Develops strategic recommendations for curriculum necessary to support patient experience improvement initiatives in the field, including innovative approaches for delivery. Using adult learning concepts, develops education content appropriate to various audiences in the field. Contributes ideas and effective content to regular webinar forums for various Patient Experience strategy calls/meetings. Works collaboratively with Press Ganey and internal team members to develop education content for site visits. Takes a lead role in the planning of annual conferences. Conducts training classes and meetings as needed in support of key initiatives. Develops tools for use in the field as needed, including NetLearning CBLs, brochures, printed training materials and other resources. Experience Requirements: Minimum five years of experience as a Nurse Manager or above in an acute care setting Minimum ten years of experience as a RN Minimum five years of experience in a hospital setting leading or actively involved in patient experience improvement. Demonstrated history of leading strong improvement results in patient experience Strong project management/organizational skills Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) with a proven track record of effectively presenting information to all levels of the organization, including senior executives Flexibility and adaptability to change Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to interface effectively with physicians and nursing leadership Strong attention to detail and ability to problem-solve effectively. ED/hospital throughput improvement experience preferred Educational Requirements: Four-year college degree in nursing or related field required. Masters in Nursing, Masters in Business Administration or Masters in Health Administration, preferred. Licensed Registered Nurse, Required. Software: Press Ganey Reporting Tools, Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Project or other project planning software Certification: Process improvement abilities are strongly preferred  Lean, Six Sigma Black or Green Belt Preferred If this position sounds like a great match for your skills set and experience, please apply online now!

This position is instrumental to the successful implementation of OHSUs mission, vision, goals, and objectives in providing an exceptional patient experience. The Director of Patient Experience designs, develops, implements and monitors patient experience and strategic initiatives through project work, facilitation, consultation, education and reporting. This person functions as a change agent for the organization. The focus of the work is on improving the patient experience through cultural and process improvement initiatives. These performance initiatives often extend beyond the hospitals and clinics to university wide initiatives and will include both internal and external stakeholders. The Director of Patient Experience leads the Patient Experience team and serves as a subject matter expert for the organization. As the expert for the organization on the patient experience, the director will serve as a content expert and often provide guidance to process improvement projects. It is imperative for this employee to be able to work independently and effectively with all levels of employees in the organization. The Director of Patient Experience will coordinate program development and delivery across department and organization lines; establishing interdisciplinary teams, and identifying and recommending a cost-effective infrastructure to support roll-out and maintenance, including but not limited to coordinating training and education; establishing metrics of performance; developing tracking, analysis and performance reporting systems; and, in concert with appropriate stakeholders, developing new or modifying existing systems for recognizing and reinforcing performance. The Director also has responsibility for operational and budgetary oversight for Volunteer Services, Concierge Services and Language Services. Job Requirements ***Please upload any licenses, certifications or registrations that are listed in the required qualifications*** REQUIRED:  Masters Degree in Healthcare Administration, Public Administration, Business Administration, Organizational Development, or other related field.  Minimum of five years experience with a large complex health care organization- experience in an academic medical center setting.  Minimum of five years experience managing and/or developing patient experience initiatives.  Must demonstrate outstanding verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrate customer-focused and problem solving abilities. Pleasant, outgoing demeanor, and able to work with individuals at all levels of the organization.  Leadership and operational management experience in health care setting.  Demonstrate through either previous position responsibilities or academic preparation: o Strong training skills and facilitation experience. o Public speaking skills, both for internal groups as well as external conferences. o Critical thinking and independent decision making abilities. o Ability to work as team member and with multidisciplinary teams. o Detail oriented and superb organization skills. o Strategic thinking and planning. o Expertise in Microsoft Office, building presentations and trending models. o Ability to facilitate collaboration and cooperation among various constituencies and service areas. o Comprehensive understanding of patient experience best practices. o Comprehensive understanding of patient experience statistical and data analytics, including various CAHPS surveys and trend identification. o Ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines. o Ability to work in a fast paced and fluid environment. o Budgeting experience with budgets exceeding at least $1 million. PREFERRED:  Experience with process improvement/Lean principles and/or project management.  Formal experience in training and coaching.  Experience with Epic or other patient information software.  Experience with Press Ganey programs and surveys strongly preferred.  Management of operational customer service related departments (Language Services, Concierge/Guest Services, Volunteer Services).  Experience presenting in conference at a national level. Additional Details WORKING CONDITIONS:  Normal office environment.  Generally follows M-F salaried workweek with a meeting schedule, typically between 0800-1700 with variability depending on project needs. PHYSICAL DEMANDS & EQUIPMENT USAGE:  Extensive computer use.  Frequent walking between buildings and to remote locations. *LI-DM1 OHSU is an equal opportunity, affirmative action institution. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability or protected veteran status. Applicants with disabilities can request reasonable accommodation by contacting the Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Department at 503-494-5148.

Johns Hopkins Health System employs more than 20,000 people annually. Upon joining Johns Hopkins Health System, you become part of a diverse organization dedicated to its patients, their families, and the community we serve, as well as to our employees. Career opportunities are available in academic and community hospital settings, home care services, physician practices, international affiliate locations and in the health insurance industry. If you share in our vision, mission and values and also have exceptional customer service and technical skills, we invite you to join those who are leaders and innovators in the healthcare field. Under the direction of the Chief Patient Experience Officer, the Lead Patient Experience Data Analyst oversees all aspects of the patient satisfaction measurement process and reporting, ensures data integrity and is primary liaison between JHHS and the patient satisfaction survey vendor. Works closely with senior leadership on planning, designing and implementing system level reporting strategies. An expert in patient satisfaction and data analysis, this position works in partnership with management, hospital staff, researchers, and physicians to ensure the organization meets or exceeds the service goals as measured by the JHHS voluntary survey as well as the federal and state required patient experience surveys. (Press Ganey, CAHPS) The Lead Patient Experience Data Analyst is responsible for providing in-depth, proactive consultation and direction to managers and staff based on meaningful data analysis and visualization of the data. Works independently and with researchers to produce academic papers based on improvements and our data. Supports hospital presidents, vice presidents, functional unit directors, clinical administrators, directors and managers with accurate data, electronic dashboards and Board level reports. Assists leadership in the development of unit, division and hospital action plans to improve performance. Provides coaching to all leadership levels on service data retrieval, analysis and usage. Prepares regular and special reports regarding hospital service performance for leadership meetings at all levels including the Board of Trustees. Education : Master's degree public health, health administration, social sciences or a related field is required. Ph.D. preferred. Work Experience : Minimum7-10 years in health administration, group facilitation, healthcare and/or survey data analysis reporting, and academic writing. Knowledge: Statistical analysis, survey methodology and strategy of health care data. Process improvement, human resources management and health care related customer service methods. Knowledge of data visualization software required. Ability to write for peer reviewed journals and to support researchers in patient experience. Skills: Data analysis and interpretation related to patient satisfaction surveys. Experience in the use of standard word processing, power point, statistical analysis software such as SPSS, and spreadsheet software. Strong project management, public speaking, problem identification and resolution skills. Excellent interpersonal and communications skills required to work with a diverse group of people. Experience with data visualization software such as Tableau is a plus. Johns Hopkins Health System and its affiliates are Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, sex, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, and or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.

Date: Dec 20, 2016 Location: Charlotte, NC, US, 28203 Company: Carolinas HealthCare System Job Req ID: 120199 Position Number: 00132091 Employment Type: Full Time Shift: Day Shift Details: Monday-Friday, 8:30am-5:00pm Standard Hours: 40.00 Department Name: Patient Experience/Support Location: CHS Corporate Operations Location Details: East Morehead Street Job Summary Essential Functions + Maintains System-wide responsibility for production and maintenance of monthly patient satisfaction dashboards and the quarterly patient experience dashboards. + Trains individuals and groups System-wide on accessing data and reports in patient satisfaction databases. + Develops and maintains supporting training materials for patient satisfaction database training. + Administers access for team members to their respective patient satisfaction databases. + Provides technical assistance and user support regarding Patient Satisfaction databases. + Analyzes information gathered from patient satisfaction surveys to assist Patient Experience leadership with recommendations for improvements to ensure a high level of customer service. + Assists with initiatives and activities including data solutions and ongoing system updates. + Supports team members in serving as additional liaison for the Press Ganey patient satisfaction survey. + Assists with maintaining and updating Patient Experience website. + Works as necessary to develop electronic tools to improve the collection, analysis and display of data to improve consistency and efficiency. + Assists with annual Physician Satisfaction survey process, including initial set-up (gathers lists of physicians from administration, ensures accuracy of physician lists), provides technical support to physicians, and creates presentations of the results. + Serves on the Service Recovery Advisory Committee; prepares, analyzes and presents quarterly Service Recovery data and offers recommendations to improvements in the reporting and capturing of the data. + Creates surveys using a variety of tools. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion allows us to deliver care that is superior in quality and compassion across our network of more than 900 care locations. Patient Experience Manager Here at WESTMED Medical Group, a largely growing multi-specialty medical group in Westchester County, New York, we look for individuals who are interested in and seek a challenging, growth-oriented, dynamic and friendly environment. Individuals with a strong work ethic along with a caring personality are who we find to be most successful here, fitting into our not so basic mantra of simply being "Smart" & "Nice". Our organization is constantly looking to bring on like-minded people who have a genuine interest in helping people and possess an intellectual curiosity to try and do things better and more efficiently. We strive to bring out the best in all of our team members and provide individuals with the support they need to achieve their career aspirations while providing the best quality care to our patients. The Patient Experience Manager is responsible for administering, directing, planning and coordinating all activities within the assigned medical offices. Works collaboratively with the medical group physicians and WESTMED administrators to ensure efficient, high quality, cost effective service to our patients. Manages daily operations in the Medical Offices and coordinates the work activities and schedules. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: *Manages daily operations in the Medical Offices and coordinates the work activities and schedules. *Manages personnel in the Medical Office including, but not limited to, interviewing, hiring, training, coaching, mentoring, and evaluating their performance. Selects top talent, utilizing motivational interviewing techniques, choosing the 'right people'. *Administers office policies and procedures in a consistent and timely manner including the Front Desk Patient Experience Policy *Develops guidelines for prioritizing work activities, evaluating effectiveness and modifying activities as necessary. *Develops and submits a complete annual operational and capital budgets in-line with corporate goals and policies *Reviews and responds to quarterly budget variances analysis with detailed explanations *Manages overtime effectively and accurately justifies appropriate variation. *Reviews monthly staffing levels with Site Director with appropriate sign off *Proactively manages inventory and supplies utilizing par levels and inventory count management. *Completes capital requests with a detailed business plan and return on investment analysis to senior management *Reviews monthly supply expenses with Site Director with appropriate sign off *Works collaboratively with the Billing Department to ensure timely and accurate bill processing and payment. *Maintains the Medical Office facility. Oversees and recommends improvements including renovations, expansion and purchase of equipment. *Works collaboratively and actively communicates with other patient experience managers and administrative personnel to ensure consistent organizational efficiency, productivity and positive patient outcomes. *Promotes high quality patient care and a patient-centric experience. *Monitors clerical staff dashboard progression *Proactively addresses Press Ganey deficiencies by developing, implementing and monitoring a remedial course of action. *Promotes a culture of confidence, integrity, pride and passion in the workplace. *Monitors staff plan compliance in a consistent manner and takes corrective action. *Champions and engages staff to adhere to the standards of excellence in the WESTMED Front Desk Patient Experience Policy. *Holds monthly staff meetings to promote open communication *Supports an environment of constant learning *Meets monthly with individual staff members to discuss performance progression *Works collaboratively and actively with other patient experience managers and administrative personnel to ensure maximum organizational efficiency and productivity. *Adheres to all WMG Compliance Program Policies and Procedures. *Manages assigned projects as directed. Performs other duties as requested. *Champions the standards of excellence in the WESTMED Front Desk Patient Experience Policy. *Acts as a role model to others in providing excellence in patient satisfaction. Is emblematic of the high standards of a patient centric model of health care delivery. *Serves as an escalation point of contact in the resolution of all any patient experience related issues, autonomously will take action where and when needed to address issues. *Flawlessly executes and oversees all front desk policies, procedures, and initiatives.

Addresses concerns and manages complaint process as defined by policy for the system. Responsible for performing job duties in accordance with the mission, vision, values of Holzer Health System and all other duties as assigned. Facilitation / Project Management of change initiatives across various levels of an organization. Solid presentation skills with a high level of energy and enthusiasm. Proven software competencies (Excel, Power Point, Access); highly skilled in Excel. Flexible/adaptable; ability to work with diverse group of healthcare professionals in a matrix environment. Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills. Desired: Previous experience with patient satisfaction vendors, Press Ganey and / or other. Creates, distributes, and analyzes monthly patient satisfaction reports utilizing NMHC and vendor reporting tools (Press Ganey Online, EDW, etc.). Creates and completes ad-hoc patient satisfaction reports and presentations as requested by internal customers and departments. Partners with departments across the system to improve on patient satisfaction priority issues. Attends staff or leadership meetings when applicable, rounds regularly on patients and staff. Works with NMHC system functions to implement programs and initiatives that support improving the patient experience (NM Academy, HR, Process Improvement, Analytics, etc.). Administrative Duties: Creates and maintains department purchase orders and processing of invoices for payment. Provides leadership on other departmental projects as assigned. Coordinates the sourcing and acquisition of specialty items upon request. Handles interdepartmental communications and administrative issues. DescriptionUnder the direction of the System President Hospitals, System President Physicians and Ambulatory and System Vice President Nursing, CNO, the Director of Patient Experience is responsible to support the systematic approach for organizational improvement as we transform the experience for patients/customers served. The System Experience Steering Team will the define the strategic direction for leaders in relation to the patient experience and the Director Patient Experience is responsible to partner with operational leaders to deploy and monitor the outcomes. The position will work closely with the System VP Nursing/CNO and System Experience Steering Team to provide guidance on prioritization of improvement efforts based on evaluation of current initiatives and presentation support for communication and implementation of organizational changes to address identified needs.Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:* Research on evidence-based improvements inside and outside of health care and potential application within SSM* Development of consistent data management processes and tools* Best practice sharing and entity/regional resource development for hospitals, medical group and ambulatory platform.Qualifications* Master's degree in business, health care, public health or related field required.* Minimum of three years of increasingly responsible experience in health care, preferably in a provider environment.* Previous experience with: Press Ganey patient, physician and employee tools/data; A large, matrix organization; And track record of successful system, hospital and physician organization relationships.

Under the direction of the Chief Operating Officer and in collaboration with the Directors of Operation, the Manager of Patient Experience will develop and manage strategy for the patient experience within Willamette Dental Group. Develop and implement programs and initiatives centered on best practice standards, patient rating / feedback reporting, customer service / communication skills training, and policies and procedures. Monitor and track progress throughout the organization for accountability, identifies areas for opportunity and drive success in patient care experience by reaching and/or exceeding Press-Ganey goals. RESPONSIBILITIES * In partnership with senior leaders and stakeholders, determine goals and priorities and lead all programs, initiatives, policies and procedures for patient care experience including metrics and service recovery efforts. * Develop a strategic development/business plan which ensures patient-centered care and continued performance improvement related to goals and overall patient satisfaction. * Responsible for the development of customer service strategy, goals, setting direction and the implementation of programs to advance the goals of the organization. * Establish effective patient satisfaction policies, procedures and guidelines. * Provide management education and serve as a resource to management for improving customer service within offices. * Monitor progress and oversee ongoing activities of Press Ganey. Provide monthly analytical and trending reports to senior leaders and stakeholders to support performance improvement recommendations. * Responsible for the integration of complaint and service improvement process. * Communicates to managers any potential service problem areas and assists with the resolution. * Identify risk management concerns and communicate findings to the appropriate individuals as it relates to safety effectiveness and delivering services. * Additional duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS * Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration or other related field. * Master's degree preferred. * Minimum 4-6 years of related and progressively responsible experience in a healthcare setting or 4 years healthcare experience with additional experience in customer service or project management * Experience in service standards development * Experience in developing and implementing customer service experience programs and establishing policies and procedures to support programs. * Experience in leading by influence and ability to inspire others. * Press-Ganey knowledge and/or training desirable * Knowledge of process improvement theory and techniques * Knowledge of relevant computer systems/applications. * Demonstrated success in leading multiple initiatives and programs to achieve service goals and customer/patient satisfaction. * Demonstrated ability to coach and mentor leaders and staff for service excellence. Strong verbal and written communications skills, including consultation, facilitation, and making presentations. * Strong leadership attributes. * Proven project management, implementation and process improvement skills. * Conduct and interpret quantitative/qualitative analysis. * Analyze and solve problems. * Think critically and uncover root-causes of issues. * Relate with others in a respectful, constructive manner. * Embrace and promote company's model of practicing dentistry. * Uphold and exemplify the company's core values. * Represent the company in a professional manner to customers, employer groups, brokers, professional associations, and the public.

<description>Listing Info Reporting to the Assistant Vice President of Experience and Access, the Patient Experience Analyst will manage all aspects of patient experience measurement and reporting. The analyst will work closely with the survey vendor to maintain the patient experience survey process and survey data, and ensure that key stakeholders have timely access to valid patient experience information. The analyst will also ensure that various internal and external milestones and their corresponding timelines are met (including but not limited to the weekly and monthly updates to organizational scorecards; and the quarterly updates to regulatory bodies) Primary Duties And Responsibilities - Manage working relations with the patient experience survey vendor (monitor data uploads, reconcile vendor invoices to services received, resolve any billing / payment issues, oversee contract renewals and fulfilment of contracted services) - Work with the patient experience survey vendor to manage all survey administration activities (configuring departments /individuals for surveying, creating sampling rules, monitoring surveying and response rates, validating survey data, etc.) - Provide oversight to patient experience data from various internal and external data sources and ensure that the data being reported is valid and accurate - Prepare and distribute routine and ad-hoc patient experience reports and scorecards that identify trends, performance to goals, and improvement opportunities - Support patient experience initiatives by performing various analytics (e.g., correlation studies, cause-effect studies, etc.) and providing information summaries that can be presented to various levels of the organization - Create and deploy automated dashboards that present intuitive and timely information summaries to various stakeholders in an easy-to-understand manner - Lead ongoing efforts to educate employees and leaders across the organization on the surveying process and how to access and interpret the patient experience data - Create and deploy a patient experience curriculum to ensure that patient experience education is provided on an ongoing basis to new and existing employees - Keep abreast of developments concerning the external reporting of patient experience data (HCAHPS, CGCAHPS, etc.) to accreditation and regulatory bodies. Advise the organization on changes necessary to comply to external reporting requirements - Perform all other duties /special projects as assigned - Demonstrated experience in analyzing and interpreting patient experience data (prior experience working with Press Ganey is desirable) - Strong analytical skills with demonstrated experience in interpreting and analyzing patient experience data to create meaningful reports and presentations - Excellent communication skills (oral, written and interpersonal) with experience in communicating with individuals and groups across all levels of the organization - Good understanding of statistics and experience working with data sets, conducting qualitative /quantitative research and interpreting customer feedback - Project Management experience required (managing multiple projects to achieve goals and desired results within given timeframes). - Excellent skills using Microsoft Office tools, especially Excel, Access and PowerPoint - BA/BS degree required, Master's preferred. Experience working in healthcare desired</description><experience>Entry level</experience>

Member of the Aramark leadership team within Main Line Health (MLH) system. System facilitator of the "I Am The Patient Experience" to managers and employees. Serves as the senior leader responsible for the entire patient and family experience including supporting and enabling a culture of patient/family centered care;oversight of the patient/family advisory councils and oversight of the visitor, volunteer and patient relations staff. Also responsible for the development and implementation of the patient and family experience strategy; including the role the patient experience plays in advancing The Christiana Care Way.- Deployed new innovations to create world-class educational opportunities to advance the organizations culture which includes - the nations first fully accredited Patient Experience Academy in partnership with the University of Delaware and simulation training for nurse managers utilizing Google glass with standardized patients and post follow-up observations in real-time.- Implemented multiple programs to improve patient engagement to include; Emergency Department Support Rounds; Christiana Care Way Rounds (Schwartz Rounds); iRounds; Volunteer Ambassador Rounds; and Department Support Rounds.- Partnered with the Learning Institute and increased Christiana Care Way behavior training by 700% at new employee orientation. This new training segment includes patient-family advisor engagement and behavior simulation.- Successfully launched a mobile rounding application to collect real-time patient feedback and service opportunities. Since inception in June 2014, the program has surpassed 70,000 rounds.- Recognized as a National Expert Speaker on Patient Experience/Patient Engagement: IQPC: Achieving Patient Experience Excellence Key-Note Speaker  2013, Press Ganey National Client Conference: Engineering a Patient Family Centered Care Experience  2014, Advisory Board: Lessons from the Best  2014, Advisory Board: Innovative Training Programs  Best of the Cohort  2015, and Health Media Leaders National Webcast: The New Patient Engagement Game Plan  2015.

Educate and coach hospital leaders to drive performance in employee engagement and the patients perception of their care. Equip hospital leaders with tools and patient experience data to create action plans for improvement and drive accountability extracting data from Press Ganey database. In the past four years, improved HCAHPS (Hospital Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems) Patient Experience rating from 63% to 80% (top box)  from the 15th percentile to 85th percentile nationally. Improved the Emergency Department rating from 64% to 69% (top box)  from the 44th percentile to 64th percentile nationally  in the same time frame. Worked with the Clinical Leader, Discharge Coordinator, and frontline caregivers to improve patient preparation for discharge. Improved HCAHPS Discharge Domain result from 82.7% to 92.6% (top box) in seven months. Partnered with director and frontline caregivers in the Emergency Department to enhance patient experience  improved Press Ganey patient results from 65.4% to 69.2% (top box) between October 2014 and October 2015. Collaborated with the Director and frontline leadership in the Emergency Department on the consistency of the completion of the patient communication boards. Results of patients feeling more informed during their Emergency Department stay moved from 43% to 55.1% (top box) in 30 days. Encouraged relationships with all departments in assisting and supporting a Bedside Hand-off between Emergency Department and Inpatient Services to ensure patient safety. Reduced handoff time from 260 minutes to 199 in the first five months, and then to 90 minutes in 12 months. Developed bedside handoff expectations with learning and development for Inpatient Services. Improved rating of Hospital and Communication with Nurses Domain from 64.5% to 84% (top box) in seven months on the Medical Surgical and Orthopedic unit. Planned and executed eight Leader Development Institutes for 40+ employees.
Oversee the VCU STAR Service patient experience program Manage internal patient satisfaction reporting Manage Press Ganey relations

<description>Client Services Director - Press Ganey Apply now Date: Oct 28, 2011 Location: CLEVELAND CLINIC FOUNDATION (MAIN CAMPUS) This is a position working for Press Ganey Associates but located at the Cleveland Clinic. To learn more about Press Ganey please go to our website at www.pressganey.com This person is responsible, as an on-site resource, for leading the improvement strategies for Cleveland Clinic in Cleveland, OH. This is accomplished though applying proven quality improvement strategies and methodologies, influencing hospital CEO s, and effectively directing Press Ganey resources to positively impact and achieve sustainable results in the following: patient satisfaction, quality, service delivery, productivity, revenue, costs, patient safety, and customer satisfaction. The Client Services Director will bring expertise and experience to the organization, partnering with system and hospital senior leadership to improve organizational outcomes and meet strategic goals. Position Responsibilities: In partnership with the system-wide CEO and Executive Leadership Team, develops and implements the quality improvement strategy for the entire enterprise. Develops and recommends project plans, resource and capability needs, accountability measures, and budget in alignment with the quality improvement strategy. Presents all recommendations at the client s executive level. Determines resource requirements and allocation from Press Ganey and manages teams through influence in order to fulfill project milestones. Influences enterprise leadership and hospital CEO s in order to achieve target improvements in quality, clinical metrics, patient outcomes, and customer service. Leads the implementation of process improvement and effective business/management practices with all hospitals within the system to positively impact and achieve sustainable results. Tracks performance indicators and project milestones, and prepares and delivers regular updates to the client s executives. Interprets data, leads discussions, and formulates recommendations to ensure that initiatives are on track. Compiles and manages high level requirements from all stakeholders and serves as the stakeholder advocate throughout the contract lifecycle. Acts as the first tier of support for any client issues that are escalated. Directs the resolution of complex business problems and communicates solutions and opportunities across functions. Provides leadership and effective communication to PG resources to ensure that all service obligations are fulfilled and that client expectation are met. Acts as the liaison between the client and Press Ganey. Position Qualifications: A minimum of 10 years in quality improvement leadership and project management within healthcare. An executive with advanced business acumen, with extensive experience at influencing CEO s at the enterprise and hospital levels. Ability to set strategy and to develop project plans to achieve the vision. Proven ability to interpret and synthesize complex statistical data. Demonstrated achievement of quality management, quality and patient process improvement in a hospital setting, and strategic project management. Experience in managing key client relationships at the senior leadership level with complex healthcare systems. Excellent organizational, facilitation, communication, and presentation skills. Proven ability to manage teams and to achieve results through influence and persuasion. Ability to quickly be recognized as a strategic quality improvement partner in the Cleveland Clinic culture at the leadership level. Familiarity with Press Ganey patient satisfaction process is preferred. Education: RN or BSN Degree and MPH/MBA preferred Nearest Major Market: Cleveland Job Segments: Business Manager, Business Process, Customer Service, Management, Manager, MBA, Project Manager, Quality, Quality Manager, Technology Apply now</description>

Delivering world-class health care to our community, one patient at a time_

At Citrus Valley Health Partners our family of dedicated nurses and other health care professionals live out a mission to heal people in body, mind and spirit. With services ranging from family-centered maternity care and high level neonatal care to technologically advanced cardiac services and an innovative palliative care program, our work touches people at every stage of their lives. Citrus Valley Health Partners is about caring for our community and caring about our employees by giving them the opportunity to make a difference every day.

Share our vision. Live our mission. Learn about CVHP.

Patient Satisfaction Analyst

The Patient Satisfaction Analyst provides trending reports and analysis of the organizations performance on survey data; support for many of the strategic and business initiatives by providing Service Line analysis and interpretation of the patient satisfaction data; and project management of the survey process by Press Ganey and the CMS mandated surveys. The Patient Satisfaction Analyst serves as a resource to Managers across the Health system including reporting and analysis at the unit level. Strong collaboration across all parts and levels of organization is required.

Requirements:

Qualified candidate will have a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration or related field, as well as a minimum of 3 years experience in healthcare data collection and analysis. Excellent customer service skills and proficient in excel is required.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits in a supportive work environment. Please apply online at:

~~~. To learn more, you may call Angela Bernacki, Vice President, Talent Acquisition & Patient Experience at ~~~. EOE/drug-free workplace.

- 1-2 years experience is required - Customer service skills are required The Patient Satisfaction/Sr. Data Analyst coordinates administration, calculation, distribution and analysis of patient and family feedback. Position serves on various committees, and makes presentations to management on patient satisfaction analysis, trending and performance improvement. Meets with appropriate individuals to discuss and explain satisfaction data. Provides on-going support for questions related to interpretation of the data. Located in the Guest Relations Department, the position will have working knowledge of the guest relations complaint process to better utilize data and also to provide assistance if needed. Requirements: Bachelors degree with course content in statistics and/or statistical analysis, including SPSS. The position also requires 1-3 years experience creating and maintaining statistical databases; The successful candidate will have experience with patient satisfaction surveys, preferably Press Ganey, and HCAHPS. Microsoft Office Suite, SPSS, Internet applications are required. Experience in presentations, spreadsheets and responding to requests for ad hoc reporting is necessary. This detail oriented contributor works independently, and as part of the Guest Relations Department, plays an important role in supporting a key function of the hospital. This detail oriented contributor works independently, and as part of the Guest Relations Department, plays an important role in supporting a key function of the hospital. Under the direction of the Patient Services Workforce Strategist and the Senior VP, Patient Services, provides assessment, design, support and coordination for achieving and sustaining Medical General Medical Center Patient Satisfaction goals. This role serves as a key liaison with Press Ganey and manages the tracking, interpreting and communicating patient satisfaction data, as well as training and facilitation of programs designed to enhance patient satisfaction. Utilizes education in multiple disciplines to deliver initiatives related to patient satisfaction to affect systems that promotes cooperation and success in this endeavor. Additionally, the Patient Satisfaction Specialist assists with the development, coordination and implementation of patient satisfaction orientated programs including, but not limited to Relationship Based Care, Patient Family Centered Care and evaluate and advise on patient satisfaction best practices. Requirements: Minimum of 3 years of directly related work experience. Patient Customer satisfaction or performance improvement experience in healthcare preferred. Data management and analysis experience strongly desired. Associate's degree in a business related field required or a level of knowledge usually acquired through the completion of an Associate's degree; Bachelor's degree in a business or healthcare related field is preferred. Valid State of Maine Driver's license. Valid Maine Driver's License required Minimum 3 years experience required

The Patient Satisfaction Analyst provides trending reports and analysis of CVHPs performance on survey data. Provides project management of the survey process by Press Ganey and the CMS mandated surveys. <description>Cleveland Clinic is one of the largest and most respected hospital systems in the country. Ranked as one of America's top four hospitals by U.S.News and World Report, we have been delivering exceptional, innovative medicine since our founding in 1921. Caregivers seeking a career with us will discover countless opportunities in more than eight community hospitals, family health centers, a children's hospital for rehabilitation and one affiliate hospital. Our care extends far beyond the Cleveland area with facilities throughout Northeast Ohio, Florida and Canada, the Cleveland Clinic Lou Ruvo Center for Brain Health in Las Vegas, and in 2013 our new Cleveland Clinic Abu Dhabi. More importantly, those who come to work at Cleveland Clinic will discover a hospital system that seamlessly integrated advanced medical care with an emphasis on research and education, all while offering employees the competitive benefits packages and professional growth programs they require to achieve their fullest potential. We are a community of compassionate individuals, tirelessly working to honor our history, our reputation and our guiding principal of putting patients and their care before all else. Join us and experience the difference in their lives that we can make together. Be a world class caregiver. <description>Company: University of California - San Diego Job Title: #61485 Patient Satisfaction Senior Analyst Jobid: ucsd-61485 Job Location: San Diego, CA, 92108, USA Description: #61485 Patient Satisfaction Senior AnalystFiling Deadline:Wed 7/4/2012 UCSD or UC San Diego Health System Layoff from Career Appointment or Special Selection:Apply by 07/03/12 for consideration with preference for rehire. Eligible UCSD ACCES clients should contact their Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor for Special Selection; UCSD Health System Special Selection applicants must contact Linda Morgan. UCSD Layoff applicants must leave a message at (858) 534-6333 or call your assigned Sr. Employment Advisor; UCSD Health System Layoff applicants must contact Diane Schmidt to exercise preferential rehire status.DESCRIPTION: The Patient Satisfaction Senior Aanalyst plays a lead role in the patient satisfaction survey project management and other patient satisfaction activities for the Medical Center including the Press Ganey surveys, the HCAHPS survey, other internal surveys, development of Customer Service Standards, and other projects as identified internally or required via external regulations. The analyst actively advances UCSD's patient satisfaction/customer service program through team leadership and membership, data analysis and proactive problem solving. The analyst designs strategies for extracting and managing patient satisfaction/patient complaint data from disparate sources; aggregating and analyzing it to meet organization-wide patient satisfaction goal requirements and to identify areas for improvements; and disseminating patient satisfaction information medical center-wide including over 60 ambulatory practices, the Emergency Department, Inpatient Specialties and 15 Inpatient units at both the UCSD Medical Center Hillcrest and Thornton campus. The Patient Satisfaction analyst is the primary medical center contact for using patient satisfaction data to analyze data and determine if organization-wide and individual departmental patient satisfaction goal requirements have been met and to identify performance improvement opportunities. . The analyst responds to complex patient inquiries and exercises appropriate judgment in complex situations. . Supports Patient Rights and Responsibilities. . Role models excellent interpersonal communication skills and problem solving with a focus on teamwork and collaboration. . Serves as the database administrator and technical support person for the department. . Designs, manages, and maintains databases and computer systems which are vital to supporting department and Medical Center reports and programs at both sites. . Insuring HIPAA compliance for the database and department activitiesREQUIREMENTS: * A minimum of (3) three years of directly related analytical experience. * Bachelor' s degree in health, public administration or a related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience. * Excellent analytical, project management and independent problem-solving skills. * Ability to communicate effectively with management, staff, physicians, and outside organizations. * Ability to exercise professional judgment in handling sensitive and confidential issues. * Ability to lead interdisciplinary teams. * Excellent organizational skill. * Experienced and knowledgeable with spreadsheets and database skills. * Have excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly both verballyand in writing and be able to articulate complex ideas for all levels of audiences. * Be a self-starter who is accountable and requires minimal direction and supervision; a person who is open to new ideas; and a creative and flexible individual who is comfortable working in a large, complex organization. * Possess the personal characteristics of professionalism, credibility, commitment to high standards, innovation, discriminating judgment and accountability.PREFERRED: * Master degree preferred. * Previous experience in an acute care hospital system. * Must be willing to work various hours and locations based on business needs. University of California, San Diego (UCSD) Health System is the only university-based medical facility in San Diego, providing leading-edge care in patient care, biomedical research, education, and community service. We have two university hospitals, a National Cancer Institute-designated Comprehensive Cancer Center, Shiley Eye Center, the Sulpizio Family Cardiovascular Center, and several outpatient clinics. UCSD Medical Center, Hillcrest is also a designated Level I Trauma Center and has the only Burn Center in the county. U.S. News and World Report's 2010-2011 annual America's Best Hospitals report ranks UC San Diego Health System among the best in the nation in five specialty areas: Diabetes & Endocrinology, Geriatrics, Orthopedics, Psychiatry, and Pulmonary. Title: CPMC-Data Analyst/Patient Satisfaction Information Specialist-Customer Service* Location: California-San Francisco-San Francisco Other Locations: California-San Francisco-San Francisco PRIMARY PURPOSE: (Position Summary) Under minimal supervision, the Patient Satisfaction Information Specialist provides technical and analytic support to the Department of Customer Service with respect to the Press Ganey Patient Satisfaction survey process, as well as other Customer Service initiatives. In addition, the Specialist proactively identifies patient satisfaction trends and reports such to senior leadership. The Specialist also works with other managers and staff members to provide training on the related tools and reports. The scope of the services offered includes all survey areas; Inpatient, ED, Ambulatory Surgery, Outpatient, Obstetrics and Newborn Intensive Care Nursery. In conjunction with the vice president, the specialist is responsible for oversight of the survey process from sampling to the analysis and reporting of aggregated and unit-specific data. The Specialist supports, monitors and evaluates the systems for sample selection, data transfer, ad hoc (custom) analysis and related support. This position currently oversees the administration of two other annual surveys; physician satisfaction with Press Ganey and the Culture of Safety survey with the Patient Safety Group. This includes analyzing the data and preparing reports for the appropriate audience including the CEO, COO and other members of senior leadership. This position is responsible for producing a weekly patient satisfaction comment report for distribution to a diverse group of staff for review and research. This is the focus of a weekly meeting that is scheduled and coordinated by this position. This includes planning the agenda and preparing an annual schedule for the areas that will report each week. We discuss patient satisfaction trends and strategies to contribute to the ultimate patient experience. As part of Patient Relations this position prepares quarterly reports to monitor and summarize patient complaints. This person must understand and create reports in Midas. As part of Customer Service this position is a member of the reward and recognition team that reviews and approves nominations for staff or groups that perform far above their normal job duties. In addition there are ongoing levels of employee recognition that are prepared and presented at a weekly meeting. This position is also on the committee involved in the planning and execution of facility wide employee recognition events to include design and delivery of Holiday parties and Safety Fairs. SUPERVISION: (Reporting Relationship) Reports to Vice President of Customer Service Education: Bachelors Degree from accredited college or university or equivalent experience. Courses on or self-study of survey research methods and statistics preferred. Knowledge: Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and Outlook. Ability to translate tables of numbers into graphs for distribution and presentations. A working knowledge of Press Ganey survey process, including use of Press Ganey Improvement Portal a plus. Basic knowledge of health care administration preferred. Experience: At least one year experience working in a health care setting, preferably in providing training and reports to staff and management.

Summary

Patient Satisfaction Specialist is responsible for communicating SCMG Patient Satisfaction goals and quarterly progress reports to SCMG physicians, their staff and SCMG''s Management Team. Works closely with SCMG physicians and their staff to understand their Press Ganey Patient Satisfaction scores and identify areas of opportunity for improvement. Assists physicians/ office staff develop action plans to address low scoring areas. Assist physicians in building a culture of service excellence within SCMG physician practices. Provides on-site training on patient satisfaction improvement techniques to physicians and their staff. Coordinates and facilitates patient satisfaction workshops for physicians and office managers. Maximum class size is 25 individuals. Assist in identifying patient satisfaction tools and reference material for SCMG''s patient satisfaction page on the SCMG website. Responsible for accurate suvey report interpretation and problem-solving.

The role of the Sharp Community Medical Group (SCMG) Network Management Specialist is to be the liaison to SCMG physicians and their staff for all health plans administered by SCMG. Patient Satisfaction is one way that the Network Management Department supports the SCMG physician practices. The Patient Satisfaction Specialist is responsible for communicating SCMGs Patient Satisfaction goals though out the SCMG network and internal SCMG staff. This position will work with the physician practices to improve their patient satisfaction scores.

Sharp Community Medical Group, San Diegos largest group of private-practice physicians, is dedicated to providing high-quality, affordable medical care. The Sharp Community network includes more than 200 primary-care physicians and 500 specialists who practice independently in offices that are conveniently located throughout San Diego County to serve families in all communities.

Sharp Community doctors admit to all Sharp hospitals and Rady Childrens Hospital. In addition, Sharp Community patients have access to urgent care centers throughout the county.

<description>Full-time 8:00am-5pm Day shift Under the direction of the Patient Services Workforce Strategist and the Senior V.P., Patient Services, provides assessment, design, support and coordination for achieving and sustaining Medical General Medical Center Patient Satisfaction goals. This role serves as a key liaison with Press Ganey and manages the tracking, interpreting and communicating patient satisfaction data, as well as training and facilitation of programs designed to enhance patient satisfaction. Utilizes education in multiple disciplines to deliver initiatives related to patient satisfaction to affect systems that promotes cooperation and success in this endeavor. Additionally, the Patient Satisfaction Specialist assists with the development, coordination and implementation of patient satisfaction orientated programs including, but not limited to Relationship Based Care, Patient Family Centered Care and evaluate and advise on patient satisfaction best practices. Requirements: Minimum of 3 years of clinical experience in a healthcare related field or 3 years or more of work related experience in the area of patient satisfaction, performance improvement or process improvement. Bachelor's degree in a healthcare or business related field or a level of knowledge usually acquired through the completion of a Bachelor's degree. Experience in da ta management, and analytics is strongly desired. Valid State of Maine Driver 's license required.</description>

<description>Client Services Director - Press Ganey Apply now Date: Jun 16, 2012 Location: CLEVELAND CLINIC FOUNDATION (MAIN CAMPUS) This is a position working for Press Ganey Associates but located at the Cleveland Clinic. To learn more about Press Ganey please go to our website at www.pressganey.com This person is responsible, as an on-site resource, for leading the improvement strategies for Cleveland Clinic in Cleveland, OH. This is accomplished though applying proven quality improvement strategies and methodologies, influencing hospital CEO s, and effectively directing Press Ganey resources to positively impact and achieve sustainable results in the following: patient satisfaction, quality, service delivery, productivity, revenue, costs, patient safety, and customer satisfaction. The Client Services Director will bring expertise and experience to the organization, partnering with system and hospital senior leadership to improve organizational outcomes and meet strategic goals. Position Responsibilities: In partnership with the system-wide CEO and Executive Leadership Team, develops and implements the quality improvement strategy for the entire enterprise. Develops and recommends project plans, resource and capability needs, accountability measures, and budget in alignment with the quality improvement strategy. Presents all recommendations at the client s executive level. Determines resource requirements and allocation from Press Ganey and manages teams through influence in order to fulfill project milestones. Influences enterprise leadership and hospital CEO s in order to achieve target improvements in quality, clinical metrics, patient outcomes, and customer service. Leads the implementation of process improvement and effective business/management practices with all hospitals within the system to positively impact and achieve sustainable results. Tracks performance indicators and project milestones, and prepares and delivers regular updates to the client s executives. Interprets data, leads discussions, and formulates recommendations to ensure that initiatives are on track. Compiles and manages high level requirements from all stakeholders and serves as the stakeholder advocate throughout the contract lifecycle. Acts as the first tier of support for any client issues that are escalated. Directs the resolution of complex business problems and communicates solutions and opportunities across functions. Provides leadership and effective communication to PG resources to ensure that all service obligations are fulfilled and that client expectation are met. Acts as the liaison between the client and Press Ganey. Position Qualifications: A minimum of 10 years in quality improvement leadership and project management within healthcare. An executive with advanced business acumen, with extensive experience at influencing CEO s at the enterprise and hospital levels. Ability to set strategy and to develop project plans to achieve the vision. Proven ability to interpret and synthesize complex statistical data. Demonstrated achievement of quality management, quality and patient process improvement in a hospital setting, and strategic project management. Experience in managing key client relationships at the senior leadership level with complex healthcare systems. Excellent organizational, facilitation, communication, and presentation skills. Proven ability to manage teams and to achieve results through influence and persuasion. Ability to quickly be recognized as a strategic quality improvement partner in the Cleveland Clinic culture at the leadership level. Familiarity with Press Ganey patient satisfaction process is preferred. Education: RN or BSN Degree and MPH/MBA preferred Nearest Major Market: Cleveland Job Segments: Business Manager, Business Process, Customer Service, Management, Manager, MBA, Project Manager, Quality, Quality Manager, Technology Apply now</description>

Delivering world-class health care to our community, one patient at a time_ At Citrus Valley Health Partners our family of dedicated nurses and other health care professionals live out a mission to heal people in body, mind and spirit. With services ranging from family-centered maternity care and high level neonatal care to technologically advanced cardiac services and an innovative palliative care program, our work touches people at every stage of their lives. Citrus Valley Health Partners is about caring for our community and caring about our employees by giving them the opportunity to make a difference every day. Share our vision. Live our mission. Learn about CVHP. Patient Satisfaction Analyst The Patient Satisfaction Analyst provides trending reports and analysis of the organizations performance on survey data; support for many of the strategic and business initiatives by providing Service Line analysis and interpretation of the patient satisfaction data; and project management of the survey process by Press Ganey and the CMS mandated surveys. The Patient Satisfaction Analyst serves as a resource to Managers across the Health system including reporting and analysis at the unit level. Strong collaboration across all parts and levels of organization is required. Qualified candidate will have a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration or related field, as well as a minimum of 3 years experience in healthcare data collection and analysis. Excellent customer service skills and proficient in excel is required. We offer competitive compensation and benefits in a supportive work environment. Please apply online at: http://jobs.cvhp.org/california/human-resources/jobid8224845-patient-satisfaction-analyst-jobs . To learn more, you may call Angela Bernacki, Vice President, Talent Acquisition & Patient Experience at (626) 858-8517. EOE/drug-free workplace.

Title: CPMC-Data Analyst/Patient Satisfaction Information Specialist-Customer Service* Location: California-San Francisco-San Francisco Other Locations: California-San Francisco-San Francisco PRIMARY PURPOSE: (Position Summary) Under minimal supervision, the Patient Satisfaction Information Specialist provides technical and analytic support to the Department of Customer Service with respect to the Press Ganey Patient Satisfaction survey process, as well as other Customer Service initiatives. In addition, the Specialist proactively identifies patient satisfaction trends and reports such to senior leadership. The Specialist also works with other managers and staff members to provide training on the related tools and reports. The scope of the services offered includes all survey areas; Inpatient, ED, Ambulatory Surgery, Outpatient, Obstetrics and Newborn Intensive Care Nursery. In conjunction with the vice president, the specialist is responsible for oversight of the survey process from sampling to the analysis and reporting of aggregated and unit-specific data. The Specialist supports, monitors and evaluates the systems for sample selection, data transfer, ad hoc (custom) analysis and related support. This position currently oversees the administration of two other annual surveys; physician satisfaction with Press Ganey and the Culture of Safety survey with the Patient Safety Group. This includes analyzing the data and preparing reports for the appropriate audience including the CEO, COO and other members of senior leadership. This position is responsible for producing a weekly patient satisfaction comment report for distribution to a diverse group of staff for review and research. This is the focus of a weekly meeting that is scheduled and coordinated by this position. This includes planning the agenda and preparing an annual schedule for the areas that will report each week. We discuss patient satisfaction trends and strategies to contribute to the ultimate patient experience. As part of Patient Relations this position prepares quarterly reports to monitor and summarize patient complaints. This person must understand and create reports in Midas. As part of Customer Service this position is a member of the reward and recognition team that reviews and approves nominations for staff or groups that perform far above their normal job duties. In addition there are ongoing levels of employee recognition that are prepared and presented at a weekly meeting. This position is also on the committee involved in the planning and execution of facility wide employee recognition events to include design and delivery of Holiday parties and Safety Fairs. SUPERVISION: (Reporting Relationship) Reports to Vice President of Customer Service Education: Bachelors Degree from accredited college or university or equivalent experience. Courses on or self-study of survey research methods and statistics preferred. Knowledge: Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and Outlook. Ability to translate tables of numbers into graphs for distribution and presentations. A working knowledge of Press Ganey survey process, including use of Press Ganey Improvement Portal a plus. Basic knowledge of health care administration preferred. Experience: At least one year experience working in a health care setting, preferably in providing training and reports to staff and management.

<description>Full-time 40 hrs/week; primarily days Day shift Valid Maine Driver's License required Minimum 3 years experience required Under the direction of the Patient Services Workforce Strategist and the Senior V.P., Patient Services, provides assessment, design, support and coordination for achieving and sustaining Medical General Medical Center Patient Satisfaction goals. This role serves as a key liaison with Press Ganey and manages the tracking, interpreting and communicating patient satisfaction data, as well as training and facilitation of programs designed to enhance patient satisfaction. Utilizes education in multiple disciplines to deliver initiatives related to patient satisfaction to affect systems that promotes cooperation and success in this endeavor. Additionally, the Patient Satisfaction Specialist assists with the development, coordination and implementation of patient satisfaction orientated programs including, but not limited to Relationship Based Care, Patient Family Centered Care and evaluate and advise on patient satisfaction best practices. Requirements: Minimum of 3 years of directly related work experience. Patient/Customer satisfaction or performance improvement experience in healthcare preferred. Data management and analysis experience strongly desired. Associate's degree in a business related field required or a level of knowledge usually acquired through the completion of an Associate's degree; Bachelor's degree in a business or healthcare related field is preferred. Valid State of Maine Driver 's license.</description>

<description>If you are a first-time visitor, please click the Apply Now button to begin the application process. Patient Satisfaction Specialist - Network Management ID# 55602 Entity Sharp Community Medical Group City San Diego Department Provider Services Category Business Operations Jobs Type Full Time Shift Days Location This position is located in Kearny Mesa, San Diego County. Hours 8-hour shift, weekends as needed. Required Skills and Qualifications Associates degree (A.A.) or equivalent from two year college or technical school Valid California driver's license Three years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Must be proficient in basic computer skills and Microsoft Office. Effectively present information and respond to questions from office managers, physicians and general public in a calm and professional manner. Ability to present in front of large groups, audiences can range from 1-150 individuals. Ability to multi-task and manage frequent deadlines. Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills Excellent communication skills (oral and written) and interpersonal skills Preferred Skills and Qualifications IPA or Medical Group experience Summary Patient Satisfaction Specialist is responsible for communicating SCMG Patient Satisfaction goals and quarterly progress reports to SCMG physicians, their staff and SCMG's Management Team. Works closely with SCMG physicians and their staff to understand their Press Ganey Patient Satisfaction scores and identify areas of opportunity for improvement. Assists physicians/ office staff develop action plans to address low scoring areas. Assist physicians in building a culture of service excellence within SCMG physician practices. Provides on-site training on patient satisfaction improvement techniques to physicians and their staff. Coordinates and facilitates patient satisfaction workshops for physicians and office managers. Maximum class size is 25 individuals. Assist in identifying patient satisfaction tools and reference material for SCMG's patient satisfaction page on the SCMG website. Responsible for accurate suvey report interpretation and problem-solving. The role of the Sharp Community Medical Group (SCMG) Network Management Specialist is to be the liaison to SCMG physicians and their staff for all health plans administered by SCMG. Patient Satisfaction is one way that the Network Management Department supports the SCMG physician practices. The Patient Satisfaction Specialist is responsible for communicating SCMGs Patient Satisfaction goals though out the SCMG network and internal SCMG staff. This position will work with the physician practices to improve their patient satisfaction scores. Sharp Community Medical Group, San Diegos largest group of private-practice physicians, is dedicated to providing high-quality, affordable medical care. The Sharp Community network includes more than 200 primary-care physicians and 500 specialists who practice independently in offices that are conveniently located throughout San Diego County to serve families in all communities. Sharp Community doctors admit to all Sharp hospitals and Rady Childrens Hospital. In addition, Sharp Community patients have access to urgent care centers throughout the county. Physical Requirements may be discussed at the time of interview Sharp HealthCare is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/D/V). Each new hire candidate who is offered employment must pass a physical evaluation, urine drug screen and pre-employment background checks before starting work. Keywords: 55602, Patient Satisfaction Specialist - Network Management</description>

<description>Job Description: Apply Now This is a position working for Press Ganey Associates but located at the Cleveland Clinic. To learn more about Press Ganey please go to our website at www.pressganey.com This person is responsible, as an on-site resource, for leading the improvement strategies for Cleveland Clinic in Cleveland, OH. This is accomplished though applying proven quality improvement strategies and methodologies, influencing hospital CEO's, and effectively directing Press Ganey resources to positively impact and achieve sustainable results in the following: patient satisfaction, quality, service delivery, productivity, revenue, costs, patient safety, and customer satisfaction. The Client Services Director will bring expertise and experience to the organization, partnering with system and hospital senior leadership to improve organizational outcomes and meet strategic goals. Position Responsibilities: - In partnership with the system-wide CEO and Executive Leadership Team, develops and implements the quality improvement strategy for the entire enterprise. - Develops and recommends project plans, resource and capability needs, accountability measures, and budget in alignment with the quality improvement strategy. Presents all recommendations at the client's executive level. - Determines resource requirements and allocation from Press Ganey and manages teams through influence in order to fulfill project milestones. - Influences enterprise leadership and hospital CEO's in order to achieve target improvements in quality, clinical metrics, patient outcomes, and customer service. - Leads the implementation of process improvement and effective business/management practices with all hospitals within the system to positively impact and achieve sustainable results. - Tracks performance indicators and project milestones, and prepares and delivers regular updates to the client's executives. Interprets data, leads discussions, and formulates recommendations to ensure that initiatives are on track. - Compiles and manages high level requirements from all stakeholders and serves as the stakeholder advocate throughout the contract lifecycle. Acts as the first tier of support for any client issues that are escalated. - Directs the resolution of complex business problems and communicates solutions and opportunities across functions. - Provides leadership and effective communication to PG resources to ensure that all service obligations are fulfilled and that client expectation are met. - Acts as the liaison between the client and Press Ganey. Position Qualifications: -A minimum of 10 years in quality improvement leadership and project management within healthcare. -An executive with advanced business acumen, with extensive experience at influencing CEO's at the enterprise and hospital levels. -Ability to set strategy and to develop project plans to achieve the vision. -Proven ability to interpret and synthesize complex statistical data. -Demonstrated achievement of quality management, quality and patient process improvement in a hospital setting, and strategic project management. -Experience in managing key client relationships at the senior leadership level with complex healthcare systems. -Excellent organizational, facilitation, communication, and presentation skills. -Proven ability to manage teams and to achieve results through influence and persuasion. -Ability to quickly be recognized as a strategic quality improvement partner in the Cleveland Clinic culture at the leadership level. -Familiarity with Press Ganey patient satisfaction process is preferred. Education: -RN or BSN Degree and MPH/MBA preferred Apply Now</description>

Interprets data, leads discussions, and formulates recommendations to ensure that initiatives are on track. - Compiles and manages high level requirements from all stakeholders and serves as the stakeholder advocate throughout the contract lifecycle. Acts as the first tier of support for any client issues that are escalated. - Directs the resolution of complex business problems and communicates solutions and opportunities across functions. - Provides leadership and effective communication to PG resources to ensure that all service obligations are fulfilled and that client expectation are met. - Acts as the liaison between the client and Press Ganey. Position Qualifications: -A minimum of 10 years in quality improvement leadership and project management within healthcare. -An executive with advanced business acumen, with extensive experience at influencing CEO's at the enterprise and hospital levels. -Ability to set strategy and to develop project plans to achieve the vision. -Proven ability to interpret and synthesize complex statistical data. -Demonstrated achievement of quality management, quality and patient process improvement in a hospital setting, and strategic project management. -Experience in managing key client relationships at the senior leadership level with complex healthcare systems. -Excellent organizational, facilitation, communication, and presentation skills. -Proven ability to manage teams and to achieve results through influence and persuasion. -Ability to quickly be recognized as a strategic quality improvement partner in the Cleveland Clinic culture at the leadership level. -Familiarity with Press Ganey patient satisfaction process is preferred. Education: -RN or BSN Degree and MPH/MBA preferred Additional Requirments / Information Job Capacity: Employee (full-time) Minimum Education Level: See Job Description Visa Sponsorship: No Related Industries: Other</description><education>See Job Description</education>
