Patient Satisfaction Specialist - Network Management ID# 54346 Entity Sharp Community Medical Group City San Diego Department Provider Services Category Business Operations Jobs Type Full Time Shift Days Location This position is located in Kearny Mesa, San Diego County. Hours 8-hour shift, weekends as needed. Required Skills and Qualifications * Associates degree (AA) or equivalent from two year college or technical school * Valid California driver's license * Three years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. * Must be proficient in basic computer skills and Microsoft Office. * Effectively present information and respond to questions from office managers, physicians and general public in a calm and professional manner. * Ability to present in front of large groups, audiences can range from 1-150 individuals. * Ability to multi-task and manage frequent deadlines. * Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills * Excellent communication skills (oral and written) and interpersonal skills Preferred Skills and Qualifications * IPA or Medical Group experience Summary Patient Satisfaction Specialist is responsible for communicating SCMG Patient Satisfaction goals and quarterly progress reports to SCMG physicians, their staff and SCMG's Management Team. Works closely with SCMG physicians and their staff to understand their Press Ganey Patient Satisfaction scores and identify areas of opportunity for improvement. Assists physicians/ office staff develop action plans to address low scoring areas. Assist physicians in building a culture of service excellence within SCMG physician practices. Provides on-site training on patient satisfaction improvement techniques to physicians and their staff. Coordinates and facilitates patient satisfaction workshops for physicians and office managers. Maximum class size is 25 individuals. Assist in identifying patient satisfaction tools and reference material for SCMG's patient satisfaction page on the SCMG website. Responsible for accurate suvey report interpretation and problem-solving. The role of the Sharp Community Medical Group (SCMG) Network Management Specialist is to be the liaison to SCMG physicians and their staff for all health plans administered by SCMG. Patient Satisfaction is one way that the Network Management Department supports the SCMG physician practices. The Patient Satisfaction Specialist is responsible for communicating SCMGs Patient Satisfaction goals though out the SCMG network and internal SCMG staff. This position will work with the physician practices to improve their patient satisfaction scores. Sharp Community Medical Group, San Diegos largest group of private-practice physicians, is dedicated to providing high-quality, affordable medical care. The Sharp Community network includes more than 200 primary-care physicians and 500 specialists who practice independently in offices that are conveniently located throughout San Diego County to serve families in all communities. Sharp Community doctors admit to all Sharp hospitals and Rady Childrens Hospital. In addition, Sharp Community patients have access to urgent care centers throughout the county. Physical Requirements may be discussed at the time of interview Sharp HealthCare is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/D/V). Each new hire candidate who is offered employment must pass a physical evaluation, urine drug screen and pre-employment background checks before starting work. - 1-2 years experience is required - Customer service skills are required The Sr. Data Analyst coordinates administration, calculation, distribution and analysis of patient and family feedback. Position serves on various committees, and makes presentations to management on patient satisfaction analysis, trending and performance improvement. Meets with appropriate individuals to discuss and explain satisfaction data. Provides on-going support for questions related to interpretation of the data. This detail oriented contributor works independently, and as part of the Guest Relations Department, plays an important role in supporting a key function of the hospital. <description>Full-time 80 Day shift Experience is required The Patient Satisfaction/Sr. Data Analyst manages and coordinates the administration, calculation, distribution and analysis of patient and family feedback including complaint data. Position serves on various committees, and makes presentations to management on patient satisfaction analysis, trending and performance improvement. Microsoft Office Suite, SPSS, Internet applications are required. Experience in presentations, spreadsheets and responding to requests for ad hoc reporting is necessary. This detail oriented contributor works independently, and as part of the Guest Relations Department, plays an important role in supporting a key function of the hospital</description>

Summary: Performs administrative and clerical support for the Quality Division, including the Vice President of Quality, Director of Performance Improvement, Director of Education, Risk/Accreditation Manager, and Supervisor of Security and Guest Services. Provides administrative coordination and support for quality, education, and patient experience initiatives. Essential Job Responsibilities: A. Assists VP of Quality in coordination and support of patient experience initiatives for the organization including, but not limited to: --Coordinating, compiling, and trending customer input through focus groups, informal mystery shopper processes, follow-up calls, etc. --Organizing facility/department/program observations to assess the patient experience through the eyes of the customer, collaborating with staff and leaders to develop and implement action plans, and monitoring results --Developing and implementing hospitality initiatives, including coordination of volunteer roles to support initiatives --Coordinating ordering, inventory control, invoice reconciliation and payment for patient satisfaction initiatives and amenities including patient welcome and graduation gifts, coffee/supplies for outpatient waiting areas, etc. --Compiling patient satisfaction survey data and reporting --Developing mechanisms to post/share satisfaction results and commendations --Monitoring action plans and results for key initiatives --Supporting staff/leader customer service training initiatives --Role modeling exceptional customer service including assisting patients, employees, or visitors with problems, taking appropriate action, or referring individuals or messages to the appropriate personnel. B. Assists the Quality Division with data compilation, reporting, integration for patient satisfaction, clinical outcomes, patient safety, educational outcomes, etc. C. Assists Director of Performance Improvement in process redesign and process mapping efforts across the organization, including scheduling of meetings, clerical/mapping support, monitoring process improvement action plans and results reporting. D. Assists Education Department leadership and staff: --Developing needs assessment tools, and compilation of survey results --Developing and compiling educational effectiveness surveys and results --Development of staff, leader, and patient education materials including computerized and paper formats. --Provides general clerical support to Medical Education Coordinator and Nurse Educators, including supporting coordination of inservices, workshops, seminars, conferences, and associated training materials. --Assists Director of Education in exploring technology solutions for educational initiatives across the organization and network. --Assists Director of Education in administrative/clerical management of educational affiliation agreements, resident and student programs. E. Assists Manager of Accreditation, Compliance and Risk Management with coordination of meetings, meeting minutes, development of accreditation/compliance training materials, and coordination of accreditation visits. F. Assists Supervisor of Security and Guest Services: --Assisting with development and support of Guest Services' initiatives including orientation and training materials for Guest Associates and Operators. --Scheduling, record keeping, and follow-up of safety/security checks and reporting --Scheduling, record keeping, and follow-up of action items for environmental safety activities and disaster drills. --Ordering, inventory control, and invoice reconciliation/payment --Assisting with vehicle fleet monitoring and maintenance G. Performs general clerical support for the Quality Division: --Greets visitors, answers phones, and schedules meetings. --Provides clerical support including meeting minutes, creating/maintaining educational materials, faxing, copying, memos/other correspondence, fliers/inservice/meeting notices, room and audio visual scheduling and set-up. --Creates materials to support presentations, displays, etc. --Receives and distributes mail; maintains and orders supplies. --Maintains administrative records and files as required; supports development and maintenance of division policy and procedures. --Develops and maintains system to monitor budget and expenses. Assist in gathering data for performance evaluations. --Provides back-up for Kronos time keeping and sign-off procedures. --Assists division with any software/systems implementation Job Requirements: --Associate Degree in Business, Hospitality or Allied Health area. --College coursework and/or experience in hospitality or customer service industry. --Minimum 5 years previous work experience in an administrative support position. --Demonstrated organizational skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously, with exceptional accuracy and attention to detail. --Competent language and grammar skills with the ability to compose, edit, and proof minutes, letters, and other correspondence. --The competence to make independent decisions as well as preserve the confidentiality of special matters. --Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office, Adobe Acrobat, Share Point. --Advanced competency with Microsoft Excel and Power Point. --Experience compiling and organizing input from customer surveys, needs assessments, focus groups, and other input methodology --Experience in compiling and presenting data in meaningful formats. --Ability to type 70 words per minute. --Energetic, positive, collaborative "can-do" attitude and work style. --Experience in working with people of diverse backgrounds. --Physical Demands: o Able to exert up to 10 pounds of force occasionally (up to 1/3 of the time) o Able to lift, carry, push, pull, up to 10 pounds occasionally o Able to sit for the majority of the time, but may involve brief periods of time involving walking or standing. o Able to use keyboard frequently (1/3 to 2/3 of the time) Other Preferred Job Qualifications : --Knowledge in processing mapping and creation of algorithms --Knowledge of Press Ganey patient satisfaction surveying and reporting --Knowledge of UDS, ORYX, FIM and WeeFIM data and reporting Industry: Other Great Industries

<description>Patient Satisfaction Specialist Full-time 8:00am-5pm Day shift Under the direction of the Patient Services Workforce Strategist and the Senior V.P., Patient Services, provides assessment, design, support and coordination for achieving and sustaining Medical General Medical Center Patient Satisfaction goals. This role serves as a key liaison with Press Ganey and manages the tracking, interpreting and communicating patient satisfaction data, as well as training and facilitation of programs designed to enhance patient satisfaction. Utilizes education in multiple disciplines to deliver initiatives related to patient satisfaction to affect systems that promotes cooperation and success in this endeavor. Additionally, the Patient Satisfaction Specialist assists with the development, coordination and implementation of patient satisfaction orientated programs including, but not limited to Relationship Based Care, Patient Family Centered Care and evaluate and advise on patient satisfaction best practices. Requirements: Minimum of 3 years of clinical experience in a healthcare related field or 3 years or more of work related experience in the area of patient satisfaction, performance improvement or process improvement. Bachelor's degree in a healthcare or business related field or a level of knowledge usually acquired through the completion of a Bachelor's degree. Experience in data management, and analytics is strongly desired. Valid State of Maine Driver's license required. Additional Requirments / Information Job Capacity: Employee (full-time) Minimum Education Level: See Job Description Visa Sponsorship: No Related Industries: Professional Services</description><education>See Job Description</education>

<description>#61485 Patient Satisfaction Senior AnalystFiling Deadline:Wed 7/4/2012 UCSD or UC San Diego Health System Layoff from Career Appointment or Special Selection:Apply by 07/03/12 for consideration with preference for rehire. Eligible UCSD ACCES clients should contact their Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor for Special Selection; UCSD Health System Special Selection applicants must contact Linda Morgan. UCSD Layoff applicants must leave a message at (858) 534-6333 or call your assigned Sr. Employment Advisor; UCSD Health System Layoff applicants must contact Diane Schmidt to exercise preferential rehire status.DESCRIPTION: The Patient Satisfaction Senior Aanalyst plays a lead role in the patient satisfaction survey project management and other patient satisfaction activities for the Medical Center including the Press Ganey surveys, the HCAHPS survey, other internal surveys, development of Customer Service Standards, and other projects as identified internally or required via external regulations. The analyst actively advances UCSD's patient satisfaction/customer service program through team leadership and membership, data analysis and proactive problem solving. The analyst designs strategies for extracting and managing patient satisfaction/patient complaint data from disparate sources; aggregating and analyzing it to meet organization-wide patient satisfaction goal requirements and to identify areas for improvements; and disseminating patient satisfaction information medical center-wide including over 60 ambulatory practices, the Emergency Department, Inpatient Specialties and 15 Inpatient units at both the UCSD Medical Center Hillcrest and Thornton campus. The Patient Satisfaction analyst is the primary medical center contact for using patient satisfaction data to analyze data and determine if organization-wide and individual departmental patient satisfaction goal requirements have been met and to identify performance improvement opportunities. - The analyst responds to complex patient inquiries and exercises appropriate judgment in complex situations. - Supports Patient Rights and Responsibilities. - Role models excellent interpersonal communication skills and problem solving with a focus on teamwork and collaboration. - Serves as the database administrator and technical support person for the department. - Designs, manages, and maintains databases and computer systems which are vital to supporting department and Medical Center reports and programs at both sites. - Insuring HIPAA compliance for the database and department activitiesREQUIREMENTS: * A minimum of (3) three years of directly related analytical experience. * Bachelor?? s degree in health, public administration or a related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience. * Excellent analytical, project management and independent problem-solving skills. * Ability to communicate effectively with management, staff, physicians, and outside organizations. * Ability to exercise professional judgment in handling sensitive and confidential issues. * Ability to lead interdisciplinary teams. * Excellent organizational skill. * Experienced and knowledgeable with spreadsheets and database skills. * Have excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly both verballyand in writing and be able to articulate complex ideas for all levels of audiences. * Be a self-starter who is accountable and requires minimal direction and supervision; a person who is open to new ideas; and a creative and flexible individual who is comfortable working in a large, complex organization. * Possess the personal characteristics of professionalism, credibility, commitment to high standards, innovation, discriminating judgment and accountability.PREFERRED: * Master degree preferred. * Previous experience in an acute care hospital system. * Must be willing to work various hours and locations based on business needs. University of California, San Diego (UCSD) Health System is the only university-based medical facility in San Diego, providing leading-edge care in patient care, biomedical research, education, and community service. We have two university hospitals, a National Cancer Institute-designated Comprehensive Cancer Center, Shiley Eye Center, the Sulpizio Family Cardiovascular Center, and several outpatient clinics. UCSD Medical Center, Hillcrest is also a designated Level I Trauma Center and has the only Burn Center in the county. U.S. News and World Report??s 2010-2011 annual America??s Best Hospitals report ranks UC San Diego Health System among the best in the nation in five specialty areas: Diabetes & Endocrinology, Geriatrics, Orthopedics, Psychiatry, and Pulmonary. We invite you to join our dynamic team! Applications/Resumes are accepted for current job openings only. For full consideration on any job, applications must be received prior to the initial closing date. If a job has an extended deadline, applications/resumes will be considered during the extension period; however, a job may be filled before the extended date is reached. UC San Diego Health System is an Equal Opportunity / Staff Affirmative Action Employer that values a diverse workforce.</description>

Care presentations for Director and senior leadership delivery at the following New York Presbyterian meetings: * Key Personnel * Patient Centered Care Steering Committees * Board Meetings * Patient Description

Summary: Manages the daily operations of the Patient Centered Care (PCC) Department under the direction of the Corporate Director of Patient Experience. Manages the efforts of Patient Centered Care Specialists and responsible for the data production, communications and marketing programs to effectively represent PCCs products and services to internal and external customers. Participate in the planning and implementation of strategic initiatives that improve customer satisfaction and the overall patient experience at all NYP sites. Oversees the ongoing development and implementation of the Patient Centered Care curriculum of learning experiences and tools to support the We Put Patients First strategy.

Responsibilities: Department Operations:

  • Directs supervision of designated Patient Centered Care Specialists. Oversight of the quality, accuracy and timeliness of all work produced by the PCC Department. Supports the Corporate Director of Patient Experience in the PCC Department's efforts to ensure the highest quality Patient Centered Care through the development, Implementation and monitoring of standards, goals and metrics.

  • Serves as primary contact for internal customers in their service excellence efforts and requests for data, performance dashboards and related information. Manages the PCC Department's efforts on NYP HCAHPS Workgroups, PCC Teams and Service Line initiatives to understand available performance data and develop effective strategies and action plans to reach NYP goals. Communications and Marketing:

  • Collaborates with the Director of Patient Centered Care and internal customers to create and implement the PCC Communications and Marketing plan for the We Put Patients First strategy.

  • Leads and facilitates the implementation of the PCC Communications and Marketing plan.
  • Writes and oversees the production and distribution of Patient Centered Care communications and marketing publications, including (but not limited to): Leader Guides, NY Press articles, PCC Huddle messages, Care Champion newsletters
  • Creates Patient Centered Care presentations for Director and senior leadership delivery at the following New York Presbyterian meetings:
  • Key Personnel
  • Patient Centered Care Steering Committees
  • Board Meetings
  • Patient Centered Care Site Visits
  • Patient Centered Care Cabinet meetings
  • Other special events and meetings

  • Administers the Patient Centered Care Communications and Marketing budget as assigned by the Director of Patient Centered Care Patient Centered Care Learning Experiences:

  • Collaborates with the Corporate Director of Patient Experience, C.O.L.E., and internal customers to create and implement the PCC Learning and Curriculum plan for the We Put Patients First strategy.

  • Leads and facilitates the development and implementation of the PCC Learning and Curriculum plan.
  • Partners with Corporate Director, Patient Centered Care Specialists, and C.O.L.E. to create Patient Centered Care learning experiences as per the PCC Learning and Curriculum plan.
  • Schedules and oversees the delivery of Patient Centered Care learning experiences, including (but not limited to):
  • PCC learning experiences offered at C.O.L.E.
  • PCC learning experiences offered at NYP sites (e.g. Best Practice learning sessions, etc)
  • Off-site PCC learning experiences
  • Teaches Patient Centered Care learning experiences as needed.
  • Administers the Patient Centered Care Communications and Marketing budget as assigned by the Corporate Director of Patient Experience.
  • Performs all duties inherent to managerial role. Participates in hiring, training, evaluation and termination of assigned staff according to hospital policies and procedures.
  • Performs other special projects and duties as assigned.

Qualifications : Required:

  • Bachelors Degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, Health Education or other related area
  • Masters Degree or equivalent experience
  • 2-4 years experience in service excellence, healthcare administration, and marketing or education role, preferably in an academic medical center
  • Outstanding patient centered care focus and strong knowledge of HCAHPS and Press Ganey metrics and proven experience in the development of improvement strategies.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, PowerPoint and Windows-based computer programs and applications
  • Outstanding communication and public presentation skills
  • Self-directed, highly-organized, and able to work well with employees and leadership at all levels of the organization

NEW YORK  PRESBYTERIAN HOSPITAL, NEW YORK, NY 2004-2008Patient Centered Care Specialist, 2006-2008 Developed and supported institution-wide campaigns to increase patient and employee satisfaction, including measuring, monitoring, and analyzing survey data. Provided facilitation and consulting to senior executive leadership and Black Belts to develop action plans in alignment with hospitals strategic goals. Collaborated with multiple disciplinary teams to develop hospital wide report card, measuring and benchmarking performance. Analyzed Press Ganey patient centered care data to better evaluate and measure growth, development and performance.Key Accomplishment: Identified and implemented best practices across the organization, resulting in exceeding the Hospitals goal in patient satisfaction on the national rating scale.

Collaborate with PCC team and leadership to develop NYP's overall patient centered care strategy, goals, and objectives* Educate and assist all levels of management in understanding, implementing and sustaining patient and employee satisfaction initiatives* Implement strategic best practices and identify measures of success to drive patient and employee satisfaction initiatives* Develop tracking mechanisms/processes to promote sustainment and accountability for all implemented best practices* Analyze data trends and identify areas in need of enhanced oversight and customized interventions* Analyze the relationship between employee and patient satisfaction to identify areas in need of enhanced oversight and create customized interventions* Collaborate with PCC and ACN leadership to design and provide content for presentations for various meetings, including Board of Trustees, Senior Management, State of the ACN, and Annual State of Nursing Council* Designed and conducted ACN patient focus groups to assess the needs and satisfaction of patients regarding cultural sensitivity, communication, and patient education* Partner with various departments to ensure that clinical/operational process changes and the delivery of service excellence training modules are patient centered* Manage the ACN patient satisfaction survey process for 25 physician practices; manage relationship between NYP and survey vendor (Press Ganey)* Collaborate with PCC leadership to recruit, interview and orient patient centered care specialists* Other projects include: leading/co-chairing strategic workgroups including the PCC Care Champion and Quiet Times and Healing Environment subgroups and the ACN PCC Committee Meeting; partnering with Access Services, Strategy, and Columbia Doctors to improve patient access and to implement a program for patient and employee satisfaction; co-lead the Design subcommittee for the NYP Learning Partnership Board

NEW YORK  PRESBYTERIAN HOSPITAL, NEW YORK, NY 2004-2008Patient Centered Care Specialist, 2006-2008 Developed and supported institution-wide campaigns to increase patient and employee satisfaction, including measuring, monitoring, and analyzing survey data. Provided facilitation and consulting to senior executive leadership and Black Belts to develop action plans in alignment with hospitals strategic goals. Collaborated with multiple disciplinary teams to develop hospital wide report card, measuring and benchmarking performance. Analyzed Press Ganey patient centered care data to better evaluate and measure growth, development and performance.Key Accomplishment: Identified and implemented best practices across the organization, resulting in exceeding the Hospitals goal in patient satisfaction on the national rating scale.

Provided treatment to patients across the continuum of care from acute inpatient rehabilitation through home health and into outpatient programs.  Implementer for hospital's joint initiative with Press-Ganey focusing on patient-centered care through Comfort Professionalism and Respect.  Managed scheduling for 6-7 SLPs.  Shown initiative in assisting with effective ongoing implementation and integration of AceIt electronic medical records.

Multidisciplinary rotation program incorporating hands-on healthcare management experience in an academic medical center.Selected Rotation Experience:Dermatology Faculty Practice, Interim Practice ManagerDeveloped operational leadership skills by overseeing the operations of a practice comprised of 8 physicians and 15 staff.Implemented the use of Press Ganey in the practice and created a focus on patient centered care.Established evidence-based guidelines that increased access and reduced wait times for new patients.Created a workflow analysis and standardized registration process for non-clinical staff to increase efficiency of billing claims.Revenue Cycle/BillingAdvanced understanding of the revenue cycle management by observing every point of the revenue cycle.Assisted in the creation of a new report to capture missing charges in the practices, which allows managers to rectify charges.Press Ganey Representative, Department of MedicineAnalyzed reduction in collection rates due to low patient satisfaction scores and presented data to leadership and medical staff.Led a performance improvement initiative by facilitating weekly meetings to create a patient center model of care that increased Press Ganey scores, which was comprised of medical staff leadership and members of the senior leadership team.Annual BudgetRefined analytical skills while preparing revenue portion of the Department of Medicines $52 million 2013 budget.Improved algorithm for the projection of revenue used to produce billing volume for 150 physicians.

Regularly evaluated employee performance, provided feedback, and assisted, coached, and disciplined staff as needed. Managed 16 total staff members including dentists, dental assistants, hygienists, and patient service representatives.   Developed and managed budget and revenue expectations while actively seeking ways to eliminate or reduce expenses.  Skilled at change management. Successfully implemented multiple initiatives including advanced access and the transition to electronic dental records.  Increased customer service scores, as measured by Press Ganey, from 80.5 (2009) to 94.3 (2015); office ranked #1 in the organization for 2013, 2014 and 2015.   Chosen to participate in focus group to increase Press Ganey scores throughout the organization with implementation of transparency. Attended regional Press Ganey summit in 2015.  Chosen as a Mentor Manager to train and develop new managers within the organization. Included in current focus group to revamp and pilot new mentor program.  Currently serving as a project manager on an organization wide QI/QA project.

Reported directly to the Director of MarketingDeveloped and completed reputation management for numerous providersIncorporated Press Ganey review and rating system online to improve transparencyEstablished production schedules and communicated project status to shareholders and board of directorsUsed statistical analysis to determine staffing potentialFrequent use of marketing analysis, secondary research, and return on impressionsTracked and recorded RVUs, patient volumes, phone calls, engaged users, and campaign reach to present trend findingsProject management of various public relation events and exposOperated an official company page on Facebook to facilitate interactionAnalyzed ratings and programming features of competitors to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing strategiesBalanced extensive work schedule with full time academic credits

Responsibilities Responsible for the regional operations of seven physician practices consisting of Internal Medicine, Cardiology, Hematology Oncology, Family Medicine, Rheumatology, Rehabilitation and Infectious Disease Clinics. Proficient in the management of all clinic personnel including providers and mid levels through the preparation of clinic budgets, ensuring data accuracy, preparing financial analyses, handling complex customer service issues and maintaining LHP/staff communications. Primary accountability for the opening and closing of clinic offices and associated credentialing of practitioners. Establishes and maintains relationships fostering collaboration with local hospital leadership and the CHRISTUS Physician Group Corporate executive staff. Facilitates local development strategies through the recruitment efforts with provider candidates and regional interviewing. Drives performance improvement activities and models organizational transparency regarding Press Ganey patient satisfaction results by clinic and per region. Responsible for driving all quality initiatives including evaluation of monthly quality metrics, provider meaningful use, CMS audits and system goals.

Participating in shaping better transparency on Press-Ganey scores, to enhance physician education and improve processes and systems of care delivery, in order to ameliorate overall patient experience at NSLIJ. Representing and promoting the interests of neurosciences and critical care physicians, to maintain competency as the prime requirement for good clinical practice, while the Health System still focuses on the needed amelioration in our Press-Ganey scores. Aiming at reconciling the deontological aim of safe, appropriate, efficacious, timely, cost-effective and equitable care with also more compassionate pleasant but not complaisant care.

DUTIES: JOB QUALIFICATIONS: Required: 5-7 years of program management experience in strong customer service environment with demonstrated commitment to improving the patient experience. Bachelors Degree. Facilitation / Project Management of change initiatives across various levels of an organization. Solid presentation skills with a high level of energy and enthusiasm. Proven software competencies (Excel, Power Point, Access); highly skilled in Excel. Flexible/adaptable; ability to work with diverse group of healthcare professionals in a matrix environment. Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills. Desired: Previous experience with patient satisfaction vendors, Press Ganey and / or other. Knowledge of patient loyalty as a strategic growth initiative. ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Patient Satisfaction Data Analysis: Works with NM Analytics department to develop and distribute automated patient satisfaction reporting and dashboards through the EDW. Creates, distributes, and analyzes monthly patient satisfaction reports utilizing NMHC and vendor reporting tools (Press Ganey Online, EDW, etc.). Creates and completes ad-hoc patient satisfaction reports and presentations as requested by internal customers and departments. Pro-actively monitors patient satisfaction survey data and comments to identify trends, changes, and areas of opportunity. Press Ganey Account Management: Provides oversight and serves as the NMHC primary contact with the Press Ganey account team. Works closely with Press Ganey to pro-actively maintain accurate account maintenance including but not limited to census based sampling, data processing, survey customizations, special report requests, and onsite training and consulting. Patient Experience Programs Management: Provides administrative ownership for Service Recovery program including staff training, tracking, distribution, and ordering of all Service Recovery resources. Provides administrative ownership over Leadership Rounds program including session scheduling, attendance tracking, coding feedback forms, and collecting information from internal departments. Provides administrative ownership over recognition programs. Schedules, and coordinates monthly traveling trophy awards. Partners with departments across the system to improve on patient satisfaction priority issues. Attends staff or leadership meetings when applicable, rounds regularly on patients and staff. Works with NMHC system functions to implement programs and initiatives that support improving the patient experience (NM Academy, HR, Process Improvement, Analytics, etc.). Administrative Duties: Creates and maintains department purchase orders and processing of invoices for payment. Provides leadership on other departmental projects as assigned. Coordinates the sourcing and acquisition of specialty items upon request. Handles interdepartmental communications and administrative issues. Acts as a technical and informational resource for the department. AA/EOE

Acts as a technical and informational resource for the department. EOE Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.Required: 5-7 years of program management experience in strong customer service environment with demonstrated commitment to improving the patient experience. Bachelors Degree. Facilitation / Project Management of change initiatives across various levels of an organization. Solid presentation skills with a high level of energy and enthusiasm. Proven software competencies (Excel, Power Point, Access); highly skilled in Excel. Flexible/adaptable: ability to work with diverse group of healthcare professionals in a matrix environment. Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills.Desired: Previous experience with patient satisfaction vendors, Press Ganey and / or other. Knowledge of patient loyalty as a strategic growth initiative.

Reports directly to the Enterprise Chief Experience Officer (CXO) - a 496-bed tertiary hospital, an outpatient facility with 23 ambulatory care centers, 8 FQHCs/ School Based Clinics, 7 health sciences colleges and research centers. Leadership Accountability has included: Hospitality & Concierge Services, Greeters/Escorts, Valet Services, Guest Housing, Campus Services contracts (Valet, Curb Attendant, others), Volunteer Services, Service Excellence, Language Support, and Operations Improvement. In partnership with the CXO, led, executed and monitored the organizational approach to change leadership, operations/ service improvement, workforce/leadership development and operations management. Coached senior leadership and front-line employees on process improvement methodologies (i.e. Toyota Production System LEAN principles, Change Management) to develop internal champions to lead rapid improvement. Provided enterprise-wide service excellence educational sessions for employees, volunteers and medical staff enterprise-wide (3 curriculum tracks with continued education; approximately 5,000 employees/volunteers) that resulted in a reduction in patient complaints. Redesigned Language Support Services operations which promoted cultural sensitivity / awareness and aligned with healthcare diversity goals which resulted in a greater $500K profitable growth. Redesign the Volunteer Services operations that more than quadrupled the volunteer workforce in less than 6 months time frame. Project Sponsor for Press Ganey Census Based Survey Expansion & Optimization engagement which resulted in 70% voice of the customer capture and 50% reduction in response rate turn around. Improvement Efforts include: Enterprise-wide Customer Access Integration & Ambulatory Redesign (including Cultural Services integration), Emergency Department Transformation, and Registration Accuracy Improvement.

- Provided high level of support to patients, families, staff and students regarding the most appropriate medical information and referral assistance with local advocacy programs -Developed and implemented the New Admit Orientation program to orient patients and families to a 384 bed hospital institution to proactively address the concerns of the patient and family, set expectations of the experience to come and increase employee accountability across the continuum of healthcare - Proposed and implemented Quiet Time" in efforts to positively impact patient satisfaction scores and increase VBP revenue -Conducted daily rounds to assess the patient experience in both inpatient and clinical setting enabling the proactive addressing of concerns, setting of expectations, and increase patient satisfaction -Developed rounding surveys (inpatient) for Press Ganey's Point of Care survey tool -Consistently provided the appropriate services to staff to support their role within the family-centered care environment -Diligently partnered with advocacy organizations in order to achieve positive outcomes for the patients, families, staff and students of the Georgia Regents Health System -Provided support services for all components of the Patient-and Family-Centered Care (PFCC) to include Advisory Councils, Family Support and Service Excellence -Coordinated and supervised work-study students and volunteers which increased human capital to benefit PFCC programming and the Family Resource Libraries -Served as Ordering Lead thoroughly understanding financial components and accurately assisting in the handling of all financial transactions, a $18,000+ budget, data entry, and systematic tracking -Developed educational workshops based on the needs of the patients, families, staff, and students -Assisted with a variety of departmental social events (PFCC Conference, Patient Advisor appreciation /recognitions events, etc. -Communicated effectively with management and coworkers

- Designed a strategic plan for the hospital to implement 5 industry best practices (Leader Rounding, Purposeful Hourly Rounding, Beside Shift Report, No Passing Zone & Pride in Our Environment) using lean and leader standard work concepts- Developed a plan for all patients to be seen by a leader every day of their hospital stay, exceeding the system standard (one visit per hospital stay); leader rounding completion rate consistently exceeding 90%- Guided managers in developing department and unit-specific hospital patient experience plans outlining goals, targets and action steps for improvement- Selected by the site presidents to lead the system in the implementation of Press Ganeys On-the-Spot electronic rounding and point of care survey tool

Responsible for driving improvements for patients hospitalized in the nine-hospital, tristate health system based in Denver, Colorado. Support Chief Nurse Executives and other senior leaders to develop a high reliability culture focused on patient safety and experience and establishing a highly engaged workforce. Administer vendor contracts including Press Ganey and CipherHealth, to provide patient experience resources and tools in all patient care arenas.  Lead a system-wide collaborative focusing on improving safety, quality and outcomes for patients admitted to SCL facilities. Focal areas include development of nursing and clinical staff expertise in establishing effective, therapeutic relationships with patients, shaping a high reliability culture, improving pain management strategies for various patient groups, and enhancing the service orientation for providers and staff to improve the patient and family experience. Work closely with system risk, quality, safety, and human resources colleagues to develop and implement improvement strategies and establish associated leader and staff accountability for effective and consistent execution of best practices.  Attend quarterly meetings of the Quality and Safety Committee of the SLH Health System Board, providing updates regarding the performance of the system and participating hospitals.  Collaborate with system quality data and analytic services to develop actionable comparative and trend reports that enable system leaders to monitor the impact of patient experience improvement strategies on key measures, including Hospital Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems (HCAHPS) trends, Value-Based Purchasing status, and key metrics for measurement of safety, quality and outcomes.

product_name: Advisory Board iRound for Patient Experience
value: <description>Job Title: Executive Assistant - Patient Experience Location: Christiana Main Building City, State Newark, Delaware General Description: Christiana Care Health System is a non-for-profit, health system which includes two hospitals with more than 1,100 patient beds, a home health care service, preventive medicine, rehabilitation services, and a network of primary care physicians and an extensive range of outpatient services. Christiana Care Health System is currently recruiting for an Executive Assistant in Newark, DE. The Executive Assistant provides administrative support to the Vice President, Patient Experience and staff in managing the day-to-day operations of administrative functions within the department. PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Specific Responsibilities to support the VP of Patient Experience: * Supports key business accounts and acts as the liaison between the vendor and accounts payable to accurately and timely process invoices. * Serves as the back-up systems administrator for the iRound application, RL-Solutions and other new innovations. This includes frequent reporting of data. * Coordinates communications to our Patient-Family Advisory Councils. * Assures follow-up with any Patient/Family concern. General Administrative Functions/Responsibilities: * Provides secretarial support to VP, Patient Experience attends meetings and takes and types minutes, composes agenda, drafts and types correspondence, schedules meetings, maintains up to date filing systems, screens incoming calls and takes accurate telephone messages. * Schedules and manages executives calendar using e-mail calendar system and provides all pertinent information needed for scheduled appointments. Anticipates VP's needs and provides assistance to ensure manager is prepared for daily activities. * Screens correspondence/mail, sorts and prioritizes, bringing items for immediate action to VP's attention. * Provides assistance to the Department of Patient Experience managerial staff to achieve pre-determined goals and objectives for the department. * Greets visitors, ascertains nature of business, and escorts or directs visitors to appropriate individuals. * Demonstrate a sound knowledge base of appropriate departmental and hospital guidelines/policies and relay this information accurately and thoroughly to staff. * Ability to communicate between all levels of the healthcare team effectively, utilizing both written and verbal communication. * Schedules meetings including notifying attendees, reserving rooms, arranging meals and refreshments, equipment and other support materials. * Prepares requisitions and maintains supply inventory and materials, checks receipts for incoming materials, and processes invoices for payment. * Makes travel reservations, orders tickets, makes and confirms lodging and airline reservations, and prepares travel advance and expense reports. * Maintains time and attendance information for the department including timekeeping for payroll. * Communicate between all levels of the healthcare team effectively, utilizing both verbal and written communication. * Audits and maintains monthly budget sheets for accuracy. * Performs assigned work safely, adheres to safety rules and practices, and reports any unsafe activities, conditions, hazards or safety violations that may cause injury to oneself, other employees, patients and visitors. * Maintain an organized working environment. * Proficient in Microsoft Office and New Innovations. * Filing and typing functions as required and performs other related duties as directed. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: * Completion of a program in secretarial science or related field, Bachelor's degree highly desired * Four years clerical or secretarial experience. * An equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted * At least one year of experience supporting Executive level management preferred * Must be proficient in Microsoft Office suite Work Shift Day shift, No Rotation Position Type Clerical or Administrative Job Requisition #: 38667BR About Us Christiana Care Health System is an Award Winning Warrior Friendly Business. Christiana Care Health System is an equal opportunity employer, firmly committed to prohibiting discrimination, whose staff is reflective of its community and considers qualified applicants for open positions without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or expression, age, veteran status, disability, pregnancy, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.</description><experience>4 to 20+ years</experience><education>Bachelor's Degree</education>

product_name: Advisory Board iRound for Patient Experience
value:
Product Manager The Advisory Board Company www.advisory.com Recent Awards

Keywords: Product Management, SDLC, Agile, SaaS, B2C/B2B

Product Managers stand at the center of engineering, users and delivery for the Advisory Boards suite of SaaS technology products. The critical responsibility of the Product Manager is to provide full-time production-level support and leadership to the internal software Engineering, Quality Assurance and User Experience teams, providing use case insight, prioritization direction, subject matter context and all-around product direction.

This Product Manager role is working with Advisory Boards iRound technology, which enables collection and tracking of real-time information about the patient experience. This allows caregivers to intervene in the moment, thereby permitting service recovery before the patient leaves the hospital. As value-based purchasing takes hold in health care, improving the patient experience is increasingly important for providers, and we are excited about the impact this new technology will have for our membership.

The role includes, but is not limited to, managing and prioritizing defect and enhancement requests from internal and external customers, partnering with engineers on product releases, defining and troubleshooting user stories, developing a software product roadmap, and guiding production support. Working with the greater Product Management Team, cross-department collaboration with engineering, member services, marketing, and related constituents will be critical to both the Product Managers and the software products success.

What Youll Be Doing:

  • Organize, facilitate development of and manage to the software product roadmap
  • Partner with the SaaS product constituents to create the strategic vision for the software product and set immediate and future priorities for software development and service teams
  • Translate the roadmap into user defined requirements for product enhancements, including mockup designs and technical definitions
  • Conduct market and competitive research, host user interviews, and create key performance indicators to stay abreast of market dynamics and define implications to the software product roadmap
  • Serve as liaison between the business and technical development teams
  • Triage all incoming bug/defect reports and enhancement requests

  • Oversee software release and feature launches including, but not limited to:

    • Creation and execution of communication and rollout plan

    • Hands-on training of delivery team and internal engineers on new features or defect repairs

    • Hands-on training of sales and marketing team on new features or defect repairs

    • Produce member-facing product documentation, release notes and training documentation

    • Manage User Acceptance testing for all external and internal releases Must Haves:

  • Bachelors Degree.

  • 3+ years of practical Product Management experience delivering health care related software products in a B2B or B2C setting.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proven analytic skills and ability to translate market findings into new product/enhancement ideas.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage projects independently while meeting milestones on schedule.
  • Ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical audiences.

Even Better:

  • Prior experience working with Business Intelligence (or related) technology-based solutions that include some or all of the following elements: consumer-facing modules, mobile, medical group organizations.
  • Prior experience working within agile software development environment.
  • Prior experience collaborating with cross functional teams spanning Development, Marketing, and Sales.
  • Certification in a Product Management Framework (e.g. Pragmatic Marketing).

Perks (A Few Of Many):

  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance, dependents eligible.
  • 401(k) retirement plan with company match.
  • 20+ days paid time off and 10+ paid company holidays.
  • Daytime leave policy for community service (up to 10 hours a month).
  • Wellness programs including gym discounts and incentives to promote healthy living.
  • Dynamic growth opportunities with merit-based promotion philosophy.
  • Benefits kick in day one, see the full details here

About Us The Advisory Board Company (NASDAQ: ABCO) is a global technology, research and consulting firm partnering with 150,000 leaders in 3,700+ organizations across health care and higher education. We combine the expertise of our 2,200+ employees around the world to find solutions to the most pressing challenges in health care. Our performance technology products offer user-friendly, Web-enabled dashboard platforms with tremendous analytic capabilities that generate more than $500 million in realized value annually for our members. These solutions focus on strategically important areas, including physician alignment, revenue cycle, accountable care, and surgical profitability. We thrive on innovation and the knowledge that we are creating real change in an industry that matters to everyone.

Connect with Us Facebook LinkedIn Careers Twitter Company Twitter Community Impact Twitter

The Advisory Board Company is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability.

*LI *LI2

PI77639800",

<description>McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. It starts with the chain of events you initiate when you work with McKesson Pharmaceutical - a chain that extends across the country and results in millions of people getting more from their healthcare. As the leader in pharmaceutical distribution and supply chain management, McKesson Pharmaceutical delivers vital branded and generic pharmaceuticals, as well as over-the-counter products, to more than 40,000 customers in three primary segments: retail chains, independent retail pharmacies and institutional providers such as hospitals, health systems, integrated delivery networks and long-term care providers. We base our distribution excellence on electronic order processing, asset management tools, a commitment to Six Sigma methodology, order accuracy and supply chain safety. We work with our customers on solutions - including supply management technology, world-class marketing programs, managed care and repackaging products and services - that help them meet their business and quality goals. Our entire team works to ensure patients receive their medications efficiently and begin the process of healing. As the nation's largest pharmaceutical distributor, US Pharmaceutical is committed to driving total pharmacy health for customers and ensuring that customers receive the right drug at the right time, every time. This commitment is underpinned by McKesson's focus on providing customers with the industry's highest product availability, intelligent ordering capabilities and unmatched service accuracy. Position Description Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career. Responsible for investigating and resolving software and hardware problems of computer users by performing the following duties: - Provides issue resolution and for RelayHealth's patient portal. - Answers, evaluates, and prioritizes incoming telephone, voice mail, and e-mail requests for assistance from users experiencing problems with hardware, software, networking, and other computer-related technologies - Interviews user to collect information about problem and leads user through diagnostic procedures to determine source of error - Determines whether problem is caused by hardware, software or network - Handles problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution and follow-up for routine user problems and works with Subject Matter Experts on higher level technical issues - Logs and tracks calls using SAP Salesforce.com, and maintains history records and related problem documentation - Consults with programmers and business analysts to explain application errors and gather data for reporting application issues - Writes or revises Knowledgebase entries based on accuracy of data . Qualifications Minimum Requirements 1+ years experience in troubleshooting PCs - Competencies To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data; Designs work flows and procedures. Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others. Judgment - Displays willingness to make decisions; Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; Supports and explains reasoning for decisions; Includes appropriate people in decision-making process; Makes timely decisions. Motivation - Sets and achieves challenging goals; Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; Measures self against standard of excellence; Takes calculated risks to accomplish goals. Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments. Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure qualityEducation High school diploma, vocational training or equivalent Certifications/Licensure Physical Requirements General Office Demands Benefits & Company Statement McKesson believes superior performance - individual and team - that helps us drive innovations and solutions to promote better health should be recognized and rewarded. We provide a competitive compensation program to attract, retain and motivate a high-performance workforce, and it's flexible enough to meet the different needs of our diverse employee population. We are in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payers, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting. But we can't do it without you. Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission-whatever your title, whatever your role, you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company-and of healthcare. At McKesson, you'll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that's vital to us all. McKesson is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer - minorities/females/veterans/persons with disabilities. Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history. Agency Statement No agencies please. Please click here to Apply On-Line.</description><industry>Pharmaceutique</industry>

Job Description:

SONIFI HEALTH - IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT MANAGER

Are you looking for a career where you love coming to work because you feel like youre part of something special? Do you want to know that your hard work is appreciated and contributes to the overall mission of the company?

SONIFI Healthis a company that cares about fostering a great work environment and a fun, energetic, success-oriented culture because we believe our people are our most important asset. We offer a competitive salary and excellent benefits including health, dental, vision, 401K, paid time off, casual dress, onsite fitness facility and cafeteria in our Sioux Falls office, and much more. SONIFI is the leading content and connectivity solutions provider for the hospitality and healthcare industries and we are committed to maintaining the most dedicated, talented team in the business.

If this sounds inspiring we are currently seeking an** Implementation Project Manager**to join our team in a full-time, exempt position.

What youll do:

The Implementation Project Manageris responsible for managing internal and external projects related to the implementation of interactive patient television and tablet solutions for SONIFI Health. In addition to traditional project management responsibilities, this individual will manage relationships with our clients and internal stake holders, manage purchase order and invoice processes associated with projects and ensure compliance with all company and client processes and policies. Position requires travel to the customer location approximately twice per project. Projects are approximately 12-20 weeks in length and the project manager will be responsible for 6-8 projects at a time. In addition to customer implementation projects, the project manager will be responsible for managing some internal development projects.

What youll need:

  • A Bachelors degree in Project Management, or Business with a concentration in Project Management, and a PMP Certificate is preferred, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Must have at least three (3) years demonstrated project management experience.
  • Must have strong written, verbal, and inter-personal communication skills with the ability to give presentations and run meetings in person and through webinars and calls.
  • Must have strong initiative, organization and work follow-up skills.
  • Must have a desire to work with people and the ability to motivate and challenge all team members (internal and external) to meet commitments and schedules.
  • Must have strong analytical and problem solving skills, be organized, and pay close attention to details.
  • Experience with Microsoft Project, Outlook, Word and Excel as well as general computer competency for learning custom applications is required in this position.
  • Must have the ability to understand and communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

If this sounds like you, apply today and well review your qualifications to see if you might be the next great member of our team.

SONIFIknows the value of diversity and we are proud to be an EEO/AA employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.

For more information about Equal Employment Opportunity please visit: EEO Is The Law.

<description>Job Description: PATIENT ENGAGEMENT SYSTEM AREA MANAGER Pittsburgh, PA Healthcare Business Development is seeking qualified candidates for the position of Patient Engagement System Area Manager . This full-time, exempt position reports to the Regional Manager of Healthcare Accounts. Position integrates marketing, sales, service and support processes across all departments in the support of existing Healthcare accounts. Responsibilities include the coordination of resources and key problem solving on issues and opportunities with SONIFI Healthcare customers. Position manages the customer relationship (based on division strategy and guidelines) to ensure customer satisfaction resulting in increased customer loyalty and increased customer retention rates. Healthcare related experience is required. Candidates considered qualified for the position will possess the following minimum knowledge, skills, and abilities: EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE: Requires the following education and work experience: Minimum of a four year degree in a healthcare, business, technical or communications field. Minimum of one year experience working directly with the end customer. Or the equivalent combination of related education and/or work experience. QUALIFICATIONS: Exceptional customer service skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to interface effectively with all levels of management, employees and customers. Strong problem resolution, diplomacy, tact and negotiation skills required. Ability to read, understand and explain contract documentation; able to articulate basic technical concepts, such as product specifications. Meets deadlines, works with minimal supervision. Ability to multi-task, and prioritize tasks/projects. Works within established guidelines to make decisions. Proficient in Widows applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint; proficient in, or ability to become proficient in Salesforce, Clarify and Oracle. We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.</description>

Job Description:**ENTERPRISE SALES EXECUTIVE****SONIFI Health's**interactive patient technology inspires active patient participation along the care continuum for positive behavior change and improved outcomes. The system is delivered across multiple technology platforms including mobile devices, computers, and televisions at the bedside and in the home to improve patient and family experience while increasing hospital operational efficiencies.We are looking to add an **Enterprise Sales Executive**to join our Healthcare team in a full-time, exempt position.**SONIFI Health**delivers interactive patient engagement applications through the TV or tablet that encourage active patient participation along the continuum of care to promote healthy lifestyle choices and improved patient outcomes. Our solutions improve the overall patient experience while the patient is in a hospital or health system while benefiting our clients with improved patient satisfaction scores and ultimately better outcomes for their patients. We are looking for a senior level sales executive who can come in and build up an assigned territory of new business and expand the footprint of product solutions within assigned territory accounts.Some of the essential job functions include:* Sell **SONIFI Health**enterprise solutions into hospitals and large health systems/networks.* Meet or exceed assigned quota on a yearly basis in assigned territory or region.* Responsible for lead generation activities ensuring pipeline is full of sales opportunities.* Grow the existing client base by selling new products and services to them on a regular basis.* Manage leads, opportunities, and accounts in company CRM and ensure it is always up to date.* Report on a weekly basis status of the pipeline to assigned VP of Sales.* Demonstrate company products and solutions and be an expert in the technical conversation.* Participate in regular meetings with sales management and client service team members.* 60-80% travel expected.**What youll need:*** Minimum of 5 years experience selling in healthcare IT to hospitals and health systems.* Bachelor degree in business, marketing or nursing (masters degree a plus).* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Salesforce CRM software, and tablet technologies.* Verbal and written communications skills a must.* Experienced in giving professional presentations in front of CXO and large group settings.**SONIFI** offers a competitive salary and excellent benefits including health, dental, vision, 401K, paid time off and much more.Apply today and well review your qualifications to see if you might be the next great member of our team.**SONIFI** knows the value of diversity and we are proud to be an EEO employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.For more information about Equal Employment Opportunity please visit:EEO Is The Law.*Job Title:* Enterprise Sales Executive*Job Type:* Full-Time*Location:* Various US Major Metropolitan Cities, MULTIPLE b87a603d0e6b49ae8614df82f537045e

<description>Job Description: ENTERPRISE SALES EXECUTIVE SONIFI is the leader in innovative guest engagement solutions for the hospitality and healthcare industries, serving 500 million travelers in approximately 1.2 million hotel rooms annually. Our core solutions include: interactive television, mobility, Internet access, and Free-To-Guest along with unparalleled nationwide technical support and professional services. Job Description:**PROJECT MANAGER - IMPLEMENTATIONS****SONIFI Healths**interactive patient technology inspires active patient participation along the care continuum for positive behavior change and improved outcomes. The system is delivered across multiple technology platforms including mobile devices, computers, and televisions at the bedside and in the home to improve patient and family experience while increasing hospital operational efficiencies.We are looking to add a **Project Manager**to our Healthcare team in a full-time, exempt positionThe **Project Manager** is responsible for managing internal and external projects related to the implementation of interactive patient television and tablet solutions for **SONIFI Health**. In addition to traditional project management responsibilities, this individual will manage relationships with our clients and internal stake holders, manage purchase order and invoice processes associated with projects and ensure compliance with all company and client processes and policies. Position requires travel to the customer location approximately twice per project. Projects are approximately 12-20 weeks in length and the project manager will be responsible for 6-8 projects at a time. In addition to customer implementation projects, the project manager will be responsible for managing some internal development projects.**What youll need:*** A Bachelors degree in Project Management, or Business with a concentration in Project Management, and a PMP Certificate is preferred, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.* Must have at least three (3) years demonstrated project management experience.* Must have strong written, verbal, and inter-personal communication skills with the ability to give presentations and run meetings in person and through webinars and calls.* Must have strong initiative, organization and work follow-up skills.* Must have a desire to work with people and the ability to motivate and challenge all team members (internal and external) to meet commitments and schedules.* Must have strong analytical and problem solving skills, be organized, and pay close attention to details.* Experience with Microsoft Project, Outlook, Word and Excel as well as general computer competency for learning custom applications is required in this position.* Must have the ability to understand and communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.**SONIFI** offers a competitive salary and excellent benefits including health, dental, vision, 401K, paid time off, casual dress, onsite fitness facility and cafeteria in our Sioux Falls office, and much more.Apply today and well review your qualifications to see if you might be the next great member of our team.**SONIFI** knows the value of diversity and we are proud to be an EEO employer. Job Description:

SONIFI HEALTH - IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT MANAGER

Are you looking for a career where you love coming to work because you feel like youre part of something special? Do you want to know that your hard work is appreciated and contributes to the overall mission of the company?

SONIFI Healthis a company that cares about fostering a great work environment and a fun, energetic, success-oriented culture because we believe our people are our most important asset. We offer a competitive salary and excellent benefits including health, dental, vision, 401K, paid time off, casual dress, onsite fitness facility and cafeteria in our Sioux Falls office, and much more. SONIFI is the leading content and connectivity solutions provider for the hospitality and healthcare industries and we are committed to maintaining the most dedicated, talented team in the business.

If this sounds inspiring we are currently seeking an** Implementation Project Manager**to join our team in a full-time, exempt position.

What youll do:

The Implementation Project Manageris responsible for managing internal and external projects related to the implementation of interactive patient television and tablet solutions for SONIFI Health. In addition to traditional project management responsibilities, this individual will manage relationships with our clients and internal stake holders, manage purchase order and invoice processes associated with projects and ensure compliance with all company and client processes and policies. Position requires travel to the customer location approximately twice per project. Projects are approximately 12-20 weeks in length and the project manager will be responsible for 6-8 projects at a time. In addition to customer implementation projects, the project manager will be responsible for managing some internal development projects.

What youll need:

  • A Bachelors degree in Project Management, or Business with a concentration in Project Management, and a PMP Certificate is preferred, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Must have at least three (3) years demonstrated project management experience.
  • Must have strong written, verbal, and inter-personal communication skills with the ability to give presentations and run meetings in person and through webinars and calls.
  • Must have strong initiative, organization and work follow-up skills.
  • Must have a desire to work with people and the ability to motivate and challenge all team members (internal and external) to meet commitments and schedules.
  • Must have strong analytical and problem solving skills, be organized, and pay close attention to details.
  • Experience with Microsoft Project, Outlook, Word and Excel as well as general computer competency for learning custom applications is required in this position.
  • Must have the ability to understand and communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

If this sounds like you, apply today and well review your qualifications to see if you might be the next great member of our team.

SONIFIknows the value of diversity and we are proud to be an EEO/AA employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.

For more information about Equal Employment Opportunity please visit: EEO Is The Law.

Job Title: SONIFI Health - Implementation Project Manager

Job Type: Full-Time

Location: Sioux Falls, SD

Job Description:**SUSTAINING ENGINEER I****SONIFI**is the leader in innovative guest engagement solutions for the hospitality and healthcare industries, serving 500 million travelers in approximately 1.2 million hotel rooms annually. Our core solutions include: interactive television, mobility, Internet access, and Free-To-Guest along with unparalleled nationwide technical support and professional services.We are looking to add a **Sustaining Engineer I** to our team in a full-time, exempt position.The **Sustaining Engineer I** will ensure the reliable operation of the existing base of **SONIFI** system technology deployed in the field. Youll work closely within the Engineering team to troubleshoot and resolve field issues on IP and RF based systems while facilitating communications between the Engineering and Operations departments.Some of the essential job functions are:* Establish criteria for (and perform) the configuration and maintenance of servers, operating systems and support systems in both lab and production environments.* Design, configure and maintain systems monitoring, alarming, notification, and load balancing.* Assist with the installation of the **SONIFI** systems, associated equipment and the integration into existing systems and circuits at customer locations.* Provide level 3 support to Installations, Call Center, Field Service and Manufacturing teams for issues related to build, configuration and the support of both hardware and software systems.* Assist with the configuration and support of network equipment including but not limited to: Hubs, switches, routers, wireless networking components, firewall security systems, data cabling, RF cabling, DOCSIS equipment and network management software.* Work with the Call Center and Field Service to identify, determine impact of, and prioritize field issues related to **SONIFI**systems.* Works with **SONIFI**Engineering design and testing teams to identify solutions and drive issues to resolution.* Works with internal teams to deploy and monitor resolutions for issues once resolved.* Act as the primary interface between Engineering and other departments for technical issues and new technologies.* Author technical documents as well as reviewing new departmental, technical and procedural documentation.**What youll need:*** Four-year technical degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronic Engineering Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering or other relevant degree, or the equivalent combination of related education and/or work experience.* Minimum of 1-year experience with TCP/IP addressing, subnetting and LAN/WAN installation and support is preferred.* Familiarity with the Unix Operating System, Unix scripting, MySQL and PostgreSQL would be beneficial.* Previous experience working in a Hardware or Software Engineering environment with a focus on networking is preferred.* Must have excellent oral and written communication skills.* Must be able to prioritize and complete project tasks with minimal supervision.* Use of MS Word, Excel, Access, Outlook and PowerPoint is required.**SONIFI** offers a competitive salary and excellent benefits including health, dental, vision, 401K, paid time off, casual dress and much more.Apply today and well review your qualifications to see if you might be the next great member of our team.**SONIFI** knows the value of diversity and we are proud to be an EEO employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.For more information about Equal Employment Opportunity please visit:EEO Is The Law.*Job Title:* Sustaining Engineer I*Job Type:* Full-Time*Location:* Sioux Falls, SD 7a7a163efb3440ba857f57795f7fd806
