Job Description:

CORPORATE SALES MANAGER

SONIFIis the leader in innovative guest engagement solutions for the hospitality and healthcare industries, serving 500 million travelers in approximately 1.2 million hotel rooms annually. Our core solutions include: interactive television, mobility, Internet access, and Free-To-Guest along with unparalleled nationwide technical support and professional services.

We are looking to add a Corporate Sales Managerto our team in a full-time, exempt position.

What youll do:

The Corporate Sales Managereffectively demonstrates SONIFIs range of products via phone and web conference and sells solutions to our hospitality clients based on their hotels unique requirements. You are the owner and primary point of contact for current clients while identifying potential customers within your defined geographic region. There is limited travel with an aggressive base salary starting at $40K+ annually, as well as outstanding commission opportunities, your earning potential will be in excess of $100,000 annually with no cap! We focus on establishing long -term relationships, promote client satisfaction and maintain the overall reputation of SONIFI.

What youll need:

  • While a Bachelors degree is required, we will accept the equivalent combination of education and related sales experience; technology or hospitality sales experience is preferred all experience will be considered.
  • A desire to exceed your goals.
  • ROI based Sales experience; and other value added selling approaches with strong contract negotiation, product presentation skills and selling via the phone business to business.
  • Effective verbal & written communication and interpersonal skills.
  • The ability to multi-task and prioritize your work and commitments.
  • Proficiency in SalesForce, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
  • Basic knowledge of SONIFI technology based products is a plus.

SONIFI offers a competitive salary and excellent benefits including health, dental, vision, 401K, paid time off, casual dress, onsite fitness facility and cafeteria in our Sioux Falls office, and much more.

Report on a weekly basis status of the pipeline to assigned VP of Sales. Demonstrate company products and solutions and be an expert in the technical conversation. Participate in regular meetings with sales management and client service team members. 60-80% travel expected. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Salesforce CRM software, and tablet technologies. Verbal and written communications skills a must. <description>Writer Job Title: Writer Job Type: Full-Time Location: Sioux Falls, SD Job Description: WRITER SONIFI is the leader in innovative guest engagement solutions for the hospitality and healthcare industries, serving 500 million travelers in approximately 1.2 million hotel rooms annually. Our core solutions include: interactive television, mobility, Internet access, and Free-To-Guest along with unparalleled nationwide technical support and professional services. We are looking to add a Writer to our team in a full-time position. The Writer is responsible for developing internal and external written communication to accurately depict SONIFI , our products and services, and our position to employees, customers, potential customers, investors and business partners. This position is the "voice" of SONIFI's hospitality and healthcare divisions in external and internal communications. On a daily basis, the Writer will be challenged with a variety of tasks that require varying degrees of thought and positioning, while keeping SONIFI's message consistent. Some of the essential job functions include: Develop written content for sales purposes including website text, marketing materials, pitch decks, flyers, special offers, proposals, presentations, video scripts, and other pre and post sales collateral. Develop written content for external communications such as press releases, case studies, and social media. Develop written content for internal communications, including the corporate intranet, company-wide emails, presentations, and other materials. Create written content tailored to specific audiences (guests, hotels, board members, patients, hospitals, etc) for specific purposes (sales, education, etc). Create marketing language for campaigns and sales pieces. Establish, maintain, and ensure adherence to written brand and corporate standards in internal and external communications. Contribute to planning the communications calendar - setting monthly/quarterly/annual content themes that align with corporate initiatives, marketing campaigns, industry events, etc. Initiate cross-functional communication and use internal and external tools to research identify details needed for the accurate development of written materials. Collaborate effectively with team members to ensure presentation of communication strengthens our desired brand initiatives. Ensure message consistency across all communication platforms. What you'll need: Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, journalism, English, or related field and two to four years work experience in a similar function required. An equivalent combination of experience and/or education will also be considered. Must possess exceptional writing and editing skills of various styles of writing along with the ability to target different audiences. Must be able to edit and proofread material with skill, accuracy and meticulous attention to detail. Must be able to view things holistically and have the ability to assist in planning a cohesive communication plan. Bring a positive, inquisitive demeanor to the team with a zealous approach to deadlines. Strong organizational skills and ability to deliver projects on schedule. Experience in technology, hospitality, and/or healthcare industries a plus. SONIFI offers a competitive salary and excellent benefits including health, dental, vision, 401K, paid time off, casual dress, onsite fitness facility and cafeteria in our Sioux Falls office, and much more. Apply today and we'll review your qualifications to see if you might be the next great member of our team. SONIFI knows the value of diversity and we are proud to be an EEO employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran. For more information about Equal Employment Opportunity please visit: EEO Is The Law .</description><experience>2 to 4 years</experience><education>Bachelor's Degree</education>

<description>Company: Childrens Hospital of Los Angeles Facility: Childrens Hospital Los Angeles at Los Angeles Department: Family Resource Center The Getwellnetwork (GWN) Assistant is responsible for content management, setting up and monitoring pathway/system functionally and supporting utilization of the Getwellnetwork system. In addition, the GWN Assistant will support other duties within the Family Resource Center (FRC) such as supporting the production and tracking of patient education content and covering the FRC during business hours. Minimum Experience Required: Experience with video production/photography and learning systems is desired. Experience with interactive web-based service systems a plus.Bilingual language capacity in Spanish-English, Vietnamese-English, and/or other language strongly preferredEffective verbal and written communication skills. Knowledge of computer software including work processing, spreadsheet and presentation applications plus working knowledge of medical terminology. Ability to prioritize tasks. Strong customer serviceMust be willing to work evening/weekend hours as needed Minimum Education/Training Required: Associate degree from an accredited school, or an equivalent combination of related education and experience. Founded in 1901, Children's Hospital Los Angeles is one of the nation's leading children's hospitals and is acknowledged worldwide for its leadership in pediatric and adolescent health. Children's Hospital Los Angeles is one of only seven children's hospitals in the nation and the only children's hospitals on the West Coast ranked for two consecutive years in all 10 pediatric specialties in the U.S. News and World Report rankings and named to the magazine's Honor Roll of children's hospitals. Children's Hospital Los Angeles is a premier teaching hospital and has been affiliated with the Keck School of Medicine of the University of Southern California since 1932. Interactive Patient Care Manager- Get Well Network Facility: Bloomington OSF St. Joseph Medical Center Bloomington IL, 61704 Department: Schedule: full-time Shift: Variable Hours: full time/variable- see link below to apply Hours Per Pay Period: Referral Bonus: Job Details: * Do not apply here. Please submit resumes to Get WellNetwork. Below is the direct link to the position: https://getwellnetwork-openhire.silkroad.com/epostings/index.cfm?fuseaction=app.jobInfo&version=1&jobid=99 GetWellNetwork is a high-growth software company in the healthcare industry and is based in the Washington DC-area with employees located throughout the country. We pioneered the interactive patient care industry. Our clients are changing the nature of healthcare in America by using our tools to flip the model of patient care on its head. Our software applications empower healthcare providers, patients and families with information, tools and community needed along the patient journey to improve outcomes. Our employees are changing the lives of millions of patients and their families every day. If you consider yourself a rock star who loves working in a high-growth, dynamic environment filled with passionate employees then we want to meet with you, as we have your dream job! Opportunity: Dedicated Interactive Patient Care Manager A GetWellNetwork(R) Interactive Patient Care (IPC) Dedicated Manager is responsible for the daily operations and utilization of the GetWellNetwork system at a designated client hospital. The IPC Manager ensures client satisfaction by driving the interactive patient care blueprint for success agenda to achieve outcomes and ultimately improve patient care. The IPC Dedicated Manager is the liaison between the customer (Patients), the client (Hospital) and the GetWellNetwork Client Services team. GetWellNetwork is looking for a talented and enthusiastic Dedicated IPC Manager to support a client in Peoria, Illinois. Responsibilities: * Develop, manage and maintain excellent relationships with all nursing staff, hospital administrators and other key client contacts; Serve as primary point of contact for the client, providing superior customer service to patients, nurses, administrators, other staff members. Actively solicit staff and patient feedback; communicate results to appropriate representatives. * Assist in the development and execution of strategic and outcomes achievement plans for the account; Advise client on the blueprint for success, our IPC tools and their effectiveness regarding outcomes as well as the overall usefulness of the GetWellNetwork system. * Arrange and conduct twice yearly key executive meetings to review the strategic plan on ROI; Educate and facilitate participation in research. * Monitor client satisfaction and quality goals by facilitating bi-weekly, monthly and/or quarterly project status meetings with appropriate hospital representatives. Continuously communicate updates to hospital staff regarding all aspects of the use and status of system. * Drive utilization of the GetWellNetwork system by conducting quarterly account review meetings pertaining to account roadmap; conduct nurse and staff training, orienting them on the functionality and use of the system; actively participate in hospital staff nursing and steering committee meetings promoting interactive patient care. * Monitor system utilization daily; identify and address any hot spot" areas of underutilization; continuously work with staff to improve system utilization, as well as provide recommendations for improvement. * Serve as the project manager on all development, content and configuration requests for the hospital; oversee and ensure prompt resolution of operational issues/complaints. Execute and manage the action plan for implementing features and functionality to achieve strategic outcome objectives. * Create, audit and maintain system content or work with the Client Innovation team to create hospital specific content. Required Skills * Strong customer service, project management skills. * Excellent oral and written communication skills. * Must be willing to work evening/weekend hours as needed. Required Experience * Previous experience working within a hospital or other healthcare environment required. * Bachelor's Degree required.

Focused on an Improvement Project for the utilization and sustainability of the GetWellNetwork and capturing other resources of how in-patient education is done throughout the hospital Increased interviewing skills with staff and patients Received training and certifications in Emotional Intelligence, Crucial Conversations, and Coaching towards Higher Performance

Focused on an Improvement Project for the utilization and sustainability of the GetWellNetwork and capturing other resources of how in-patient education is done throughout the hospital  Increased interviewing skills with staff and patients  Received training and certifications in Emotional Intelligence, Crucial Conversations, and Coaching towards Higher Performance

Responsible for the daily operations and utilization of the Interactive Patient Care solution (GetWellNetwork) for inpatient and ambulatory facilities within Carolinas HealthCare System. Drive Interactive Patient Care blueprint for success to achieve outcomes and ultimately improve patient care. Serve as the liaison between patients, hospitals, administration, IT, and GetWellNetwork service teams.

This position is responsible for assuming the administrative and leadership oversight for the operational activities associated with the delivery of care and services within the Orthopedics and Physical Rehabilitation Division. The position supervises and supports 70+ direct reports in order to contribute to the overall goals of the unit and the organization. In addition, the role set the tone to ensure the adoption and assimilation of state of the art tools and technology. Responsible for interviewing, staff selection, evaluations, training, and scheduling of resources in order to provide the highest level of patient care.  Created and implemented standardized workflows that delivered Ready to Move processes for patient throughput out of the Emergency Department. This resulted in decreasing the admit time to patient in bed from an average of 180 minutes to an average of 60 minutes. Established measurable goals to improve utilization of the GetWellNetwork (GWN) by engaging hospital leadership and integrating GWN into the patient care process. In one year, utilization doubled as measured through this thru data-sharing, re-education, enhancements to the system, and competition. Managed workstreams that were instrumental in the clinical integration of the Intelligent Care System (Voalte, Hill-Rom, Sotera Wireless, TeleTracking, Get Well Network, hand hygiene, and RTLS). Provided post implementation oversight to ensure continued compliance and full adoption of technologies Directed the successful implementation Sotera Wireless (continuous vital signs monitoring for medical-surgical patients) which resulted in a 35% reduction of rapid response calls and 40% reduction in code blue calls  Championed the implementation of a new electronic medical record system (EMR). Participated in a team that included multiple disciplines in the capacity of a Super User during the implementation phase. Served as a Super User for sister hospitals (Silver Spring and Boise) implementation providing support to new users as they began to integrate the EMR into daily work flows.  Represented the Nursing Division in the planning, development, and implementation of a 7-floor, $145 million patient tower that was responsible for the layout of patient rooms, accessories, and support spaces. Represented the nursing division in the transition from a manual to fully automated medication dispensing system (Pyxis) which included coordinating user testing and training. Actively participated in the technology sub-group which successfully rolled out 7 different applications that improved efficiencies, patient safety, and outcomes.  Achieved the unit-based Hand Hygiene Award and retained this status for 6 months straight (with approximately 90% staff compliance).  Identified key elements required for a Daily Patient Report to satisfy operational reporting requirements  Developed and maintained unit budgets and consistently performed within targets Ensured compliance with regulatory requirements in particular Joint Commission Patient Care chapters Successfully implemented several process improvement (A3) projects that resulted in improved documentation, patient satisfaction, and staff satisfaction Early adopter of Interdisciplinary walking rounds which improved perception of communication between hospital staff and patients Mentored nursing students during their leadership course

<description>We're building something special here. We're planning the future for a company that is the future of health care. We're creating a culture where people are passionate about making lives better, willing to lend a hand and ready to have fun doing it. We are unique, we color outside the lines...we work hard and play hard. We're winners: 2014 Washington Business Journal's 50 Fastest Growing Companies, five time Inc. 5000 honoree and a 2013 Inc. Hire Power Award winner We are GetWellNetwork. Bring your passion, drive and knowledge of human resources and we'll give you the chance to flex your muscles working on projects that drive the human capital capabilities of our organization. Intrigued? Let's see what we can do together.We provide: - Meaningful projects for you to own - A fun team that ideates and iterates together - Inclusion in learning opportunities to grow your knowledge with practical application - A unique, laid back environment (and, yes...you can wear jeans to work) - A chance to see your work put to use About GetWellNetwork: GetWellNetwork, Inc. provides patient engagement solutions that help health care providers engage, educate and empower patients along the care continuum. Our patient-centered platform, delivered across multiple technology platforms including mobile devices, computers and televisions, enables providers to implement a revolutionary care delivery model called Interactive Patient Care- to improve performance and patient outcomes. The company further extends the value of existing IT investments by integrating seamlessly with electronic medical record and patient portal applications. GetWellNetwork is recognized by KLAS as the leader in the Interactive Patient Systems category. Learn more at www.GetWellNetwork.com .</description><requirement>You bring: - Current Master's degree educational journey in human resources, organization psychology or MBA with HR specialty - Desire to continue your learning journey in human resources - Love of getting your hands dirty digging into projects - Pride in seeing something through and making a concrete contribution - Passion for personal learning - A belief that two heads are better than one...collaboration wins the race Collaborative approach and strong with to be part of a fun team that ideates and iterates together - Ability to work in Bethesda, MD (we're walking distance from metro and there are parking garages)</requirement>

SUMMARY: Jobs in this family are responsible for developing, testing, maintaining, installing, and/or deploying of applications and related information technologies. In addition, they are responsible for the establishment, development, and promotion of standard architectures, as well as hardware and software components. This role provides consulting services regarding how to integrate information technologies into clinical and business processes and the effective application of industry and organizational technology standards. This position is an emerging information technology professional within the Systems Analyst family. This position participates in the implementation, testing, installation and support of clinical and business applications. Expected activities include but are not limited to:  modification of applications as needed to meet user requirements,  the definition and development of reports,  participation in application upgrades,  participation in the resolution of problems and issues associated with installed applications and related information technologies,  diagnosis of failures encountered in application software and related technologies,  quality control of all application implementations/enhancements prior to release to customers,  maintains an awareness of vendor and industry developments/plans in area(s) of responsibility, communication and  documentation of all relevant items and activities. QUALIFICATIONS:  Position requires at least 3 years of healthcare/business experience and a high school diploma or equivalent. A BA/BS degree in IS or Business is preferred.  May have an equivalent combination of education and/or experience in lieu of education and/or experience stated above.  Experience in Inpatient MyChart Bedside experience highly preferred. CERTIFICATION:  Epic certification is required within 9 months from offer, including 1 test retake. TRAVEL:  If Epic certification/training is required, this position may require travel for the first three to five months, which will include roughly one week out of town travel per month.EOE/AA, M/F/Disability/Vet

QUALIFICATIONS:  Position requires at least 3 years of direct experience and a high school diploma or equivalent. A BA/BS degree in IS or Business is preferred.  May have an equivalent combination of education and/or experience in lieu of education and/or experience stated above.  Experience in Inpatient MyChart Bedside experience highly preferred. CERTIFICATION:  Epic certification is required within 9 months from offer, including 1 test retake. TRAVEL:  If Epic certification/training is required, this position may require travel for the first three to five months, which will include roughly one week out of town travel per month.EOE/AA, M/F/Disability/VetCurrent Employees

Responsible for the management of nine individuals in an ever-changing healthcare environment; while ensuring optimaldelivery of technical services through architectural development and process maturation. Oversees the daily operations ofnetwork and telephony systems at over 40 locations across the Greater Cincinnati Metropolitan area. Facilitates thebusiness and IT goals of one of the top 50 hospitals in the nation by ensuring the hospital staff is able to provideoutstanding care, focused on patient satisfaction and safety.* Participated and provided network and telephony integration support for double upgrade to Epic 2010 and Epic 2014 inthe same weekend.* Evaluated and created design plan to rollout Telehealth enabling physicians to see their patients over the Internet andthrough mobile devices (tablets, mobile phones and PCs).* Provided Server Load Balancing design and configuration, along with assistance on DMZ security planning for "MyChart"rollout at Christ Hospital* Helped plan initial install and continually supported SharePoint environment by providing key networking andapplication performance analytics to optimize the end-user experience.* Created Remote Access policy, authored identity management process for vendor access and deployed CiscoAnyConnect for a secure, robust solution to all authorized users (internal and external).* Performed Trade-Off Analysis to enhance vendor selection process helping hospital find holistic secure communicationssuite; fully integrated bed management, nurse call, instant messaging, telephony and advanced alarm systems all to anapp that runs on Android mobile devices (Voalte).* Part of Campus Master Planning team that spent months planning and designing new, innovative Joint and SpineCenter; deployed multiple new technologies to include Epic Patient Information Monitors, Epic Welcome Kiosks, Voalte,Cisco Telepresence, 802.11ac wireless and much more.* Provided critical feedback and planning for integration of Cisco Unified Communications and Philips Emergin enablingNurse Call alerting to Cisco Wireless Phones.* Organized events and meetings with interdepartmental staff such as Clinical Engineering and the Physician Division toplan and coordinate initiatives, while also providing a platform for them to voice their concerns.* Evaluated Interactive Patient Care Systems (Skylight and Sonifi) to enable HD television and enhanced patientexperience at The Christ Hospital.* Worked directly with our Internet Service Provider (ISP) to develop and design a new Metropolitan Area Network (MAN)service offering enhancing connectivity to over 40 remote offices through low latency, high bandwidth links; this effortsaved The Christ Hospital over $160k annually.* Partnered with IT Security to create firewall, content filtering and intrusion detection/prevention solutions andstandardized architecture.* Created Standard forms, configuration templates and easy to use checklists for staff that enhances Network teamefficiency for initial installs, changes and ongoing system support.* Continually meet with Executive staff and Medical community to collaborate on needs and technology to provideinnovative patient care solutions.* Lead efforts working with business representatives to create a Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Plan fortelephony and network downtime.* Created Data Center Network Disaster Recovery plan; developed preliminary strategy and configuration schemeconnecting two Data Centers for shared storage, vMotion enhancements and deployment of redundant Epic Cache andEpic Shadow environments.* Worked with Revenue Cycle and IT Security to deploy secure Point of Sale and other payment systems across the HealthNetwork by identifying standards and creating deployment guidelines to ensure proper PCI compliance.* Designed Sizing Templates and Ordering Guides to aid in pricing Health Network and Hospital expansion, while alsoautomating the purchasing process.* Managed major voice upgrade from Cisco UCM 7.x to version 9.x.* Developed Telecoms Expense Management program at Christ Hospital; delivered savings of over $500k per year.* Migrated single data center in Troy, MI to two local data centers; moved to new Cisco Nexus 7000, Fabric Interconnect,Fabric Extenders and UCS infrastructure; added Disaster Recovery to second data center.* Designed architecture for MAN High Availability to increase uptime for prioritized locations and introduced Cisco PfR v3(iWAN) to take advantage of dual links.* Developed Capacity Planning Process to review metrics and analysis for our remote locations to ensure properallocation of bandwidth and hardware resources.* Managed other teams in IT; took over Field Engineering and Enterprise teams during absence of management in thoseareas to continue operational effectiveness.* Installed pilot of Riverbed Steel Central which isolated and found issues within the SharePoint environment; findingsreduced page load time by half.* Helped plan and implement Microsoft Azure and Office 365 Enterprise deployments.

DUTIES

This position is accountable for assessment, initiation, development, implementation and evaluation of education related to orientation, mandatory education, continuing education and professional development in specialty areas. This position works collaboratively with the nursing leaders to assess learning needs and develop education plans and assists with the management of compliance.

Responsibilities:

  • Maintains knowledge of, and complies with, all relevant laws, regulations and policies, procedures and standards
  • Actively participates in creating and implementing improvements to achieve clinical, satisfaction and/or efficiency outcomes
  • Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates competency based orientation and education programs
  • Performs appropriate clinical activities to ensure clinical competencies
  • Identifies department education/training needs annually
  • Initiates, develops, implements and evaluates education offerings for mandatory and continuing education
  • Contributes to the design and content of quarterly and annual mandatory education
  • Contributes to effective operation of skilled nursing facility education department to meet needs and expectations of Saint Therese and its customers
  • Assists with assignment, monitoring and evaluation of students involved in clinical affiliations
  • Develops and oversees in-services on new products, policies and procedures
  • Utilizes and leverages content experts to deliver engaging, evidence based educational material
  • Serves as a content expert in the design and delivery of policy and processes/workflow related to patient care initiatives
  • Ensures required educational records are being maintained and statistics are being calculated on an ongoing basis
  • Participates in nurse on-call two-week rotation to support nurses, TMAs, and NARs over telephone or in person. May also work shifts as needed for floor staff.
  • Other duties may include educational support to each Saint Therese campus
  • Performs all job functions within State and Federal regulations.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Licensed or appropriate for licensing as a Registered Nurse in Minnesota
  • Geriatric specialty is a plus
  • 3 years recent experience in a TCU/LTC setting
  • Experience in assessing, developing, implementing and evaluating educational programs (within the last 5-7 years)
  • Experience in development of eLearning modules and Learning Management Systems preferred
  • Experience as preceptor/clinical educator.
  • Demonstrated ability to initiate, develop, implement and evaluate educational offerings to small and large groups based on principles of adult learning
  • Knowledge of MDH and CMS standards as they relate to education and patient care
  • Strong computer skills, including skill in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
  • Analytical Thinking: Ability to Identify issues, obtain relevant information, relate and compare data from different sources, and identify alternative solutions
  • Ability to setup and use audiovisual equipment including data projectors, microphones, videotaping, and room audiovisual systems
  • Ability to use a computer and applications that are associated with performing basic work tasks (use a mouse, navigate in Windows, Outlook, etc)
  • Provides advice, feedback and development resources to improve the effectiveness of individuals and teams
  • Makes timely, informed decisions that take into account the facts, goals, constraints and risks
  • Skilled at getting individuals and teams to perform at a higher level and to embrace change, negotiates
  • Demonstrate abilities to participate in and collaborate with groups
  • Ability to positively manage and communicate change and to model appropriate behaviors to staff and others
  • High level of commitment to and success with effective customer service skills
  • Effective time management/prioritization and problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills

Special Knowledge, skills, and abilities:

  • Ability to effectively organize work flow with timely follow-through.
  • Role model of the highest quality of customer service and tact.

BUSINESS ANALYST Are you looking for a career where you love coming to work because you feel like you're part of something special? Do you want to know that your hard work is appreciated and contributes to the overall mission of the company? SONIFI Solutions is a company that cares about fostering a great work environment and a fun, energetic, success-oriented culture because we believe our people are our most important asset. We offer a competitive salary and excellent benefits including health, dental, vision, 401K, paid time off, casual dress, onsite fitness facility and cafeteria in our Sioux Falls office, and much more. SONIFI is the leading content and connectivity solutions provider for the hospitality and healthcare industries and we are committed to maintaining the most dedicated, talented team in the business. If this sounds inspiring we are currently seeking a Business Analyst to join our team in a full-time, exempt position. What you'll do: The Business Analyst is responsible for financial planning and management reporting for the Company. Some of the essential job functions include: Develop financial planning models for annual budgeting and periodic forecasting. Perform complex financial analysis on historical and projected performance trends. Create financial models for business opportunities/deals. Prepare management reporting, including weekly financial & operational performance metrics, business reviews, department reporting, and presentations to the Board of Directors. Perform ad hoc presentations and analysis. What you'll need: Master's degree in quantitative field (Finance, Business, or Economics). Minimum of 3 years of relevant financial experience. Robust analytical and problem solving skills to identify issues and present practical solutions. Perform in a technical, accuracy focused, and detail-oriented manner. Capacity to deal with conflicting priorities while delivering high quality work on schedule. Ability to develop and manage complex Excel models. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. If this sounds like you, apply today and we'll review your qualifications to see if you might be the next great member of our team. SONIFI knows the value of diversity and we are proud to be an EEO/AA employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran

Since opening in 1924, The Olympic has been the region's destination for prominent civic and social events, as well as honeymoons, birthday celebrations and in-city getaways. Summary of Responsibilities: Reporting to the Engineering Assistant Director, responsibilities and essential job functions as Senior Plant Mechanic on staff include but are not limited to the following: * Consistently offers professional, engaging and friendly service * Troubleshooting mechanical, plumbing, pneumatic and electrical systems * Provide PMs and service on Laundry Valet Equipment (Pressers, drycleaning, dryers and washers) * Assisting other engineers who perform daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annually PMs on HVAC (AHUs, EFs, SFs, Cooling Towers), Health Club (cardio fitness, pool & spa) and Kitchen (clean drains, grease traps, gas/charcoal burners, steam/water solenoids) Equipment * Monitor building systems via Siemens APOGEE Building Automation System and assist in performing routine maintenance on the controls for all HVAC Equipment * Perform Engineering Shift Duties as necessary Requirements: * Previous experience is an asset * Must speak, read and write English * Must be able to use computer for routine documentation/presentation and research solutions to problems (parts source and procedures) * Must be able to stand, walk 2/3 of the working shift which is flexible to meet the needs of the department and hotel * Ability to read and understand blue prints (A,S,M,P,E) * Ability to interpret a variety of instructions in either written, oral, diagram or schedule form * Previous experience in hospitality industry is an asset * Previous experience with pool and spa experience is an asset * 3 to 5 years of experience required working in an environment troubleshooting mechanical, plumbing, and electrical systems * Ability to troubleshoot and provide necessary electric repair and maintenance to motors, starters, breakers and associated equipment throughout the entire building. * Ability to provide PMs of all electrical equipment and updating of appropriate logs. * Ability to perform preventive maintenance in guestrooms such as FCUs on a 4-pipe system, TV on a central distribution Sonifi System, toilet/faucet/shower/drains, and telephone. * Ability to assist operating engineer on maintenance in central plant. * Ability to assist engineers on major shut downs for repairs. * Ability to assist on major drainage stoppage in entire building. * Ability to take meter readings, record temperatures and pressures in heating and cooling plant and analyze data to determine focused repair tasks. * Ability to respond to back of the house issues from kitchen, lockers room, employees cafeteria, executive offices, etc. * Ability to participate in energy conservation programs in the hotel. * Ability to calculate typical engineering formulas to determine discounts, proportions, percentages, area, circumference and volume, as well as water/air pressure differentials, CFM, GPM, and RPM * Graduate of Building Operator's Course Level I & II is a plus Physical Aspects of Position (include but are not limited to): * Constant standing and walking throughout shift * Periodic belly crawling, crawling through holes and small openings and crawling over and under pipes in restricted spaces * Able to use appropriate personal protection equipment to: * lift anywhere from 10 to 50 pounds routinely * knowledge to rig material handling equipment to maneuver equipment heavier than 50 pounds safely * work around noisy machinery, air compressors, motors, etc during operation * work around fumes or airborne particles * handle toxic or caustic chemicals * Wet or humid conditions inside as well as outdoor weather conditions Visa Requirements: Must be legally eligible to work in the United States.</description>

Primary Location

Engineering - Plant Mechanic I

Join the fantastic Engineering team at The Fairmont Olympic Hotel and contribute to up-keep the grand dame of Seattle.

Hotel Overview:The Fairmont Olympic is considered Seattles most celebrated treasure, and a premier luxury hotel. Since opening in 1924, The Olympic has been the region's destination for prominent civic and social events, as well as honeymoons, birthday celebrations and in-city getaways.

Summary of Responsibilities:

****Reporting to the Engineering Assistant Director, responsibilities and essential job functions as Senior Plant Mechanic on staff include but are not limited to the following:

  • Consistently offers professional, engaging and friendly service
  • Troubleshootingmechanical, plumbing, pneumatic and electrical systems
  • Provide PMs and service on Laundry Valet Equipment (Pressers, drycleaning, dryers and washers)
  • Assisting other engineers who perform daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annually PMs on HVAC (AHUs, EFs, SFs, Cooling Towers), Health Club (cardio fitness, pool & spa) and Kitchen (clean drains, grease traps, gas/charcoal burners, steam/water solenoids) Equipment
  • Monitor building systems via Siemens APOGEE Building Automation System and assist in performing routine maintenance on the controls for all HVAC Equipment
  • Perform Engineering Shift Duties as necessary

Employee Status

Qualifications:

  • Previous experience is an asset

  • Must speak, read and write English

  • Must be able to use computer for routine documentation/presentation and research solutions to problems (parts source and procedures)

  • Must be able to stand, walk 2/3 of the working shift which is flexible to meet the needs of the department and hotel

  • Ability to read and understand blue prints (A,S,M,P,E)

  • Ability to interpret a variety of instructions in either written, oral, diagram or schedule form

  • Previous experience in hospitality industry is an asset

  • Previous experience with pool and spa experience is an asset

  • 3 to 5 years of experience required working in an environment troubleshootingmechanical, plumbing, and electrical systems

  • Ability to troubleshoot and provide necessary electric repair and maintenance to motors, starters, breakers and associated equipment throughout the entire building.

  • Ability to provide PMs of all electrical equipment and updating of appropriate logs.

  • Ability to perform preventive maintenance in guestrooms such as FCUs on a 4-pipe system, TV on a central distribution Sonifi System, toilet/faucet/shower/drains, and telephone.

  • Ability to assist operating engineer on maintenance in central plant.

  • Ability to assist engineers on major shut downs for repairs.

  • Ability to assist on major drainage stoppage in entire building.

  • Ability to take meter readings, record temperatures and pressures in heating and cooling plant and analyze data to determine focused repair tasks.

  • Ability to respond to back of the house issues from kitchen, lockers room, employees cafeteria, executive offices, etc.

  • Ability to participate in energy conservation programs in the hotel.

  • Ability to calculate typical engineering formulas to determinediscounts, proportions, percentages, area, circumference and volume, as well as water/air pressure differentials, CFM, GPM, and RPM

  • Graduate of Building Operators Course Level I & II is a plus'

Physical Aspects of Position (include but are not limited to):

  • Constant standing and walking throughout shift
  • Periodic belly crawling, crawling through holes and small openings and crawling over and under pipes in restricted spaces
  • Able to use appropriate personal protection equipment to:

  • lift anywhere from 10 to 50 pounds routinely

  • knowledge to rig material handling equipment to maneuver equipment heavier than 50 pounds safely

  • work around noisy machinery, air compressors, motors, etc during operation

  • work around fumes or airborne particles

  • handle toxic or caustic chemicals

  • Wet or humid conditions inside as well as outdoor weather conditions

Visa Requirements: Must be legally eligible to work in the United States.

ABOUT FAIRMONT HOTELS & RESORTS

At Fairmont Hotels & Resort we offer our guests the finest hospitality experience in each of our destinations. And we know that, to offer our guests the best, we first need to offer our employees the best. That's why you'll find exceptional work opportunities - throughout North America and the Caribbean, Europe and Africa, the Middle East and Asia Pacific - as well as industry - leading training, career development, recognition and rewards. Fairmont Hotels & Resorts is a celebrated collection of hotels that includes landmark locations like London's The Savoy, New York's The Plaza, and Shanghai's Fairmont Peace Hotel. Our teams are guided by values of Respect, Integrity, Teamwork and Empowerment; we employ the highest ethical and quality standards, treating all colleagues with fairness and dignity. A community and environmental leader, Fairmont is also regarded for its responsible tourism practices and award - winning Green Partnership program. An exciting future awaits!

Programming for the web was a lot different than what I had been doing in 1999 and prior, but I caught on quickly and ramped up. Job description:Works with Radiology Informatics, IS Dept. and Biomedical Engineering Personnel medical records to ensure system support is provided. Responsibilities include: * informatics system administration including database management and backup; help call response; in-service training for users; image data acquisition monitoring; system hardware configuration and software loading functions; and expansion planning. assists with departmental policies and procedures, budget planning, performance improvement and quality control. * Directs and implements policies, procedures and protocols in defined imaging areas and assures staff compliance. * Implements radiation protection and safety standards to minimize radiation exposure to staff and patients. * Assures that assigned staff uses appropriate radiation protection and safety protocols. * Oversees quality control testing, equipment maintenance and trouble shooting. * Performs as a staff technologist in areas of defined expertise. * Maintains mandated continuing education requirements. * Performs workflow coordination; staffing and scheduling; participates in evaluating, hiring, disciplining an retention of staff. * Should have extensive experience in an Imaging Department. Experience: 1. Clinical experience in radiology ( 4 years or better) Radiology tech, scheduling department, PAC administration2. 2 years administrator in RIS application, meditech, Epic, or other RIS software systems3. Experience working with vendors and IT departments to trouble shoot problems and improve workflows.4. Experience with traditional transcription systems and voice recognition systems and the ability to work with end users including physicians to facilitate proper report creation. This includes building templates, macros, and other documents necessary to ensure proper billing. Systems include, Voice writer, Speech magic, Powerscribe 4.2 or Powerscribe 360.5. Experience working with HL7 interfaces including Nextgate, cloverleaf, and Meditech

Supporting a variety of Dictation/Transcription systems(including speech recognition technology powered by SpeechMagic).

As a Level 2 Support Analyst, my responsibility was to troubleshoot technical issues ranging from workstation hardware to server configuration items. My specialty was SpeechQ for Radiology utilizing Nuance's SpeechMagic.As the Integrations Manager, I was responsible for providing consultation for new and existing customers on the available options for integrating their current or future radiology systems (RIS, PACS) with Medquist's SpeechQ system.

Worked on: - Network-based digital dictation software and medical transcription system for PC or smart phones. - Speech recognition software integration with Nuance products (SpeechMagic or Dragon). - HL7 integration to exchange electronic health information. - PACS integration for the medical imaging technology with companies such as FUJI, GE, Siemens. - Integration with the clinical computer systems such as SystmOne, TalkingPoint or content management systems like Interwoven. - software debugging ...

RezZiliant provides the services of web-based electronic medical record storage and medical dictation/transcription. My current task is to implement or upgrade software components in the medical transcription service, such as a speech recognition server, a transcription client GUI, an interactive voice response (IVR) telephone server, and a fax server, using Microsoft .NET Framework, C#, VB.NET, WCF Web Services, WinForms, WPF, JavaScript, SQL, Dialogic ISDN-PRI board, Envox CT-ADE, Black Ice Fax SDK, TX Text Control SDK, and SpeechMagic Speech Recognition.
Installation and assistance of speech recognition and transcription software (Philips - Speechmagic, Nuance - Dragon NaturallySpaeking)
Development of the IMPAX Reporting application. An application allowing radiologists to do reporting using speech recognition.Development using C#, Windows Forms, Ecompas (ORM), SpeechMagic 6

Software Development of a Reporting System for a globally used Radiology Information System (RIS) using- C++ with Microsoft Word integration via COM incl. integration of speech recognition System SpeechMagic- ORACLE PL/SQL- C#- Java Swing
It system coordinator and product manager for SpeechMagic, SpeechMax, RIS, al dente, PASS etc.
Installation and maintenance of IMPAX RIS, Oracle Database, Nuance SpeechMagic, IMPAX Connectivity, IMPAX BI (based on Oracle BI) and IMPAX Scheduling.

<description>Crescendo Systems Corporation is a global leader in digital dictation, speech recognition (powered by SpeechMagic), transcription, authentication and workflow management systems for the healthcare, legal, insurance and law enforcement sectors. Since its inception in 1990, Crescendo has provided more than 2,000 installations totaling over 200,000 users worldwide. The company is present in Canada , USA , the United Kingdom , Netherlands , Australia , Hong Kong and South Africa . We are looking for an experienced ASP.NET developer to web enable our products. Our system allows user such as physicians and lawyers to make patient/customer related dictations which are then Speech recognized or transcribed from digital voice to text. To qualify for the position you must have a strong background in web application design and development, the ability to create and review requirement and design specifications, and a track record of delivering Quality products on time. Experience working with the Microsoft .NET framework, SQL Server, or three-tier application development is definite assets. Main duties: System / Application Architecture Internet Prog. (ex.: HTML, Perl, Java, ASP, XML) Object-Oriented Prog. (ex.: C++, Java, Delphi ) Required skills Technical expertise: Essential - Minimum 3 years of Object Oriented Programming experience in Windows (2000/XP) Essential - C#/C++ experience using Visual Studio 6.0, 2003, or 2005 Important - Experience using .NET, COM, DCOM, or ActiveX Important - Familiarity with three-tier or Web-based client/server applications Important - IIS, MMS Audio streaming General criteria: Essential - Bachelor in computer Science or equivalent Essential - Minimum or 3 years of programming experience Essential - Very good written and verbal communication skills Important - Bilingual English and French Start date: ASAP Salary: According to Experience Relocation/travel requirements: None Apply for this job</description><industry>Computer Software & Processing</industry><experience>3 year(s)</experience>

<description>Keine Dienstbelastung am Abend und Wochenende Im Auftrag unseres Mandanten, dem Bezirksklinikum Mainkofen / Deggendorf suchen wir Sie f_r die Radiologie, unter Leitung von Herrn Dr. Boewer. Als medizinisch orientierte Personal- und Karriereberatung ffnen wir Ihnen die T_r zu Ihrem Wunsch-Krankenhaus / Reha-Einrichtung. Wenn dieses Angebot nicht passgenau f_r Sie ist: Unsere Erfahrungen in der Vermittlung von ?rzten aller Fachbereiche und Funktionsstufen sind Ihr Vorteil. Die Radiologische Abteilung verfügt über eine Konventionelle Rntgendiagnostik (CR) mittels Buckytisch und Rasterwandstativ (Siemens Multix Top und Vertix Pro) mit Speicherfoliensystem (Agfa), Digitale Durchleuchtungseinrichtung (Siemens Axiom Iconos R200), 64-Zeilen-CT (Philips Brilliance 64), Ultraschall/FKDS, über interdiszipin_r genutztes Ultraschallger_t (GE Logic 7). Die Abteilung verfügt weiterhin über eigenst_ndige MRT-Diagnostik durch Kooperation mit einem MVZ. Schwerpunkte bilden neuroradiologische Untersuchungen sowie muskuloskelettale Diagnostik. Sie suchen eine neue berufliche Herausforderung mit mehr Lebensqualit_t? Die Abteilung kennt keine Rufbereitschaft, keine Wochenend- und Anwesenheitsdienste. Geregelte Arbeitszeiten und eine wertsch_tzende Zusammenarbeit bieten Ihnen individuellen Freiraum für persnliche und berufliche Entwicklung. Das Haus frdert Ihre Fortbildungswünsche. Die Dotierung der Position liegt über dem tarifvertraglichen Einkommen. Weitere Hinzuverdienste sind mglich, so durch Unterricht an der Krankenpflegeschule. Wir suchen das Gespr_ch mit Damen und Herren, welche sich für die Radiologie begeistern und eine neue Herausforderung wünschen. Interesse? Herr Michael Richter (Telefon 07141 - 2 ) freut sich auf Ihren Anruf und steht Ihnen auch am Abend bzw. am Wochenende für einen Gedankenaustausch zur Verfügung. Ihre Anfrage behandeln wir vertraulich - etwaige Sperrvermerke werden selbstverst_ndlich berücksichtigt. Wir freuen uns über Ihre Bewerbung vorzugsweise als Mail unter Wir beachten den Gleichbehandlungsgrundsatz, auf die Zusendung eines Fotos kann verzichtet werden. Als medizinisch orientierte Personal- und Karriereberatung ffnen wir Ihnen die Tür zu Ihrem Wunsch-Krankenhaus / Reha-Einrichtung. Wenn dieses Angebot nicht passgenau für Sie ist: Unsere Erfahrungen in der Vermittlung von rzten aller Fachbereiche und Funktionsstufen sind Ihr Vorteil. Selbstverst_ndlich ist diese Dienstleistung für Sie kostenfrei.</description>

<description>Crescendo Systems Corporation is a global leader in digital dictation, speech recognition (powered by SpeechMagic), transcription, authentication and workflow management systems for the healthcare, legal, insurance and law enforcement sectors. Since its inception in 1990, Crescendo has provided more than 2,000 installations totaling over 200,000 users worldwide. The company is present in Canada , USA , the United Kingdom , Netherlands , Australia , Hong Kong and South Africa . We are looking for an experienced C#/C++ Software designer to join our Software team involved in the development of the Crescendo Windows based transcription and dictation system. The system allows Authors(such as Physicians, lawyers, etc.) to make patient/customer related dictations which are then Speech recognized or transcribed from digital voice to text. The system includes many ancillary sub-systems for distributing, accessing and electronically sign the stored reports. There are also interactive interfaces to other computer information systems. The system includes as well a variety of work flow processing, management control, accounting, configuration and housekeeping functions associated with managing and running the system in large hospitals and legal firms. To qualify for the position you must have a strong background in Windows application design and development, the ability to create and review requirement and design specifications, and a track record of delivering Quality products on time. Experience working with the Microsoft .NET framework, SQL Server, or three-tier application development are definite assets. Required skills: Technical expertise Essential - Minimum 3 years of Object Oriented Programming experience in Windows (2000/XP) Essential - C#/C++ experience using Visual Studio 6.0, 2003, or 2005 Important - Experience using .NET, COM, DCOM, or ActiveX Asset - Experience with Microsoft SQL Server database Asset - Familiarity with three-tier or Web-based client/server applications General criteria Essential - Bachelor in computer Science or equivalent Essential - Very good written and verbal communication skills Essential - Proven track record in Windows Application Software Development Important - Minimum or 3 years of C#/C++ programming experience Important - Bilingual English and French Start date: ASAP Salary: According to Experience Relocation/travel requirements: None Apply for this job</description><industry>Computer Software & Processing</industry><experience>3 year(s)</experience>

Responsibilities: Work within a team to develop web-based and Windows Forms applications using Microsoft technologies in a fast paced environment. Experience & Education: 3-5 years developing web based applications. 3-5 years developing Windows Forms applications. Must have Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field. Job Requirements: Skills: Self motivated requiring little management supervision. Works equally well in team environment or on individual assigments. Understands full SDLC and related processes. Strong software testing skills. Ability to write clear & understandable documentation. Strong communication skills needed to understand internal customer's needs and fulfill their expectations. (this is not a help desk position) Ability to communicate efficiently with non-technical people to explain processes. At least 3-5 years experience programming with the following Microsoft Technologies Platforms: C# ASP.NET .NET Windows Forms SQL Preferred Skills /Not Required: LINQ AJAX Javascript Telerik ASP.NET Controls TxTextControl Nuance SpeechMagic SDK Philips Audio SDK HL7 Visual Studio SubVersion SQL Server Administration Windows/200x Server Administration IIS Administration Employment Type: Contractor Industry: Computer Software, Consulting

product_name: Advisory Board iRound for Patient Experience
value: <description>Responsibilities: JOB RESPONSIBILTIES: Facilitates Patient Complaint Management, including receiving complaints and concerns from patients, visitors, and staff. Coordinates the investigation and analyzes the complaint/concern with appropriate parties and departments. Involves Risk Management when a possible liability is introduced; issues are summarized and compiled for reports to management and for future improvement for resolution. Provides support on various projects and activities to facilitate the integration and effective use of Patient Experience tools on an ongoing basis. Provides educational support to staff, leaders and physicians using documented Patient Experience tools and activities. Meets with patients regularly to listen, ask questions related to their experience and collaborates with staff to ensure individual patient needs are proactively met (e.g. Welcome Rounds). Supports staff in the facilitation of Service Recovery opportunities responding to the needs and concerns of patients, families and other customers. Primary facilitator of the Service Recovery Team in the Patient Experience Advisory Board (PEAB). Helps facilitate recognition activities including leveraging patient comments and compliments received. Participates in continuous quality improvement activities and teams. Participates in supporting the organization's vision, mission and values and adheres to DeKalb Medical Standards of Behavior. Performs other duties as assigned to meet the goals and objectives of DeKalb Medical. QUALIFICATIONS Minimum Education, Experience and Licensure Required: Bachelor's Degree Preferred Skills, Knowledge and Abilities: Content expert having in-depth knowledge of the current patient satisfaction survey process, tools and data. One of the primary resources for understanding the internet based tool and provides educational support to new and current users. Strong interpersonal relationship skills, including conflict negotiation mediation, problem solving, time and project management. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong organizational skills and attention to detail</description>

product_name: Advisory Board iRound for Patient Experience
value:
Responsibilities:

JOB RESPONSIBILTIES:
  1. Facilitates Patient Complaint Management, including receiving complaints and concerns from patients, visitors, and staff.
  2. Coordinates the investigation and analyzes the complaint/concern with appropriate parties and departments.
  3. Involves Risk Management when a possible liability is introduced; issues are summarized and compiled for reports to management and for future improvement for resolution.
  4. Provides support on various projects and activities to facilitate the integration and effective use of Patient Experience tools on an ongoing basis.
  5. Provides educational support to staff, leaders and physicians using documented Patient Experience tools and activities.
  6. Meets with patients regularly to listen, ask questions related to their experience and collaborates with staff to ensure individual patient needs are proactively met (e.g. Welcome Rounds).
  7. Supports staff in the facilitation of Service Recovery opportunities responding to the needs and concerns of patients, families and other customers. Primary facilitator of the Service Recovery Team in the Patient Experience Advisory Board (PEAB).
  8. Helps facilitate recognition activities including leveraging patient comments and compliments received.
  9. Participates in continuous quality improvement activities and teams.
  10. Participates in supporting the organization's vision, mission and values and adheres to DeKalb Medical Standards of Behavior.
  11. Performs other duties as assigned to meet the goals and objectives of DeKalb Medical.
QUALIFICATIONS Minimum Education, Experience and Licensure Required:
  • Bachelor's Degree Preferred
Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
  • Content expert having in-depth knowledge of the current patient satisfaction survey process, tools and data.
  • One of the primary resources for understanding the internet based tool and provides educational support to new and current users.
  • Strong interpersonal relationship skills, including conflict negotiation mediation, problem solving, time and project management.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

Options: Apply for this job online

Refer a friend to this job

Company Description:

Moving Beyond the Ordinary

As an experienced healthcare professional you have many options in your career. At DeKalb Medical, we rise above ordinary healthcare into the realm of extraordinary, and we are seeking healthcare professionals just like you who are committed to exceptional service. The unique talents and specialized skills of our people continue to earn our patients trust, every day.

DeKalb Medical is more than just a hospital. We are a not-for-profit health system, comprised of three hospital campuses, known for our premier clinical services, the latest technological advances and a caring and highly trained staff. Our energized environment fosters innovation and collaboration with our clinical team members ensuring a warm, caring environment.

Our commitment to attracting and retaining the best people include offering our employees great benefits and a variety of educational and professional development opportunities at all levels. We are committed to helping our employees grow with an extensive and comprehensive in-house continuing education program, tuition reimbursement, loan repayment and scholarships help our employees further their education.

<description>The qualified candidate will be an energetic person, ready to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment. Individual is responsible for administering and processing subpoena and medical record requests, answering inquiries regarding request status and handle overall administrative tasks when required. Friendly and cordial communication is required with clients and employees. Ability to research, review and copy medical records for subpoenas, using a variety of systems including SILO, Insync EMR and legacy Billing Systems The ability to testify in court as to the accuracy of medical records and how they are maintained. Contact attorneys as needed for additional information to accurately and efficiently process attorney requests. Create and send medical record invoices in a timely manner. Abide by HIPAA rules and regulations and maintain confidentiality regarding medical records The ability to maintain friendly, cordial relations with all clients and employees; maintain a positive work atmosphere by acting and communicating in a manner that results in a positive work relationship with customers, co-workers and managers. Maintain department quality and production goals Ability to help train new employees Ability to comply with ATI standards of operations Ability to adhere to the Core Values of the Company Required Skills and Abilities Required Skills Detail oriented; Approachability; Comfort around higher management; Compassion; Composure; Conflict management; Creativity; Integrity and trust; Priority setting; Problem solving; Time management; Timely decision making; Microsoft Office; The ability to organize and manage multiple priorities; Strong customer orientation; Excellent interpersonal and communication (both oral and written) skills; Excellent presentation skills; Strong team player</description>

Friendly and cordial communication is required with clients and employees. * Ability to research, review and copy medical records for subpoenas, using a variety of systems including SILO, Insync EMR and legacy Billing Systems * The ability to testify in court as to the accuracy of medical records and how they are maintained. * Contact attorneys as needed for additional information to accurately and efficiently process attorney requests. * Create and send medical record invoices in a timely manner. * Abide by HIPAA rules and regulations and maintain confidentiality regarding medical records * The ability to maintain friendly, cordial relations with all clients and employees; maintain a positive work atmosphere by acting and communicating in a manner that results in a positive work relationship with customers, co-workers and managers. * Maintain department quality and production goals * Ability to help train new employees * Ability to comply with ATI standards of operations * Ability to adhere to the Core Values of the Company Required Skills REQUIRED SKILLS * Detail oriented; * Approachability; * Comfort around higher management; * Compassion; * Composure; * Conflict management; * Creativity; * Integrity and trust; * Priority setting; * Problem solving; * Time management; * Timely decision making; * Microsoft Office; * The ability to organize and manage multiple priorities; * Strong customer orientation; * Excellent interpersonal and communication (both oral and written) skills; * Excellent presentation skills; * Strong team player Required Experience * 1-2 years related experience processing or handling medical record requests/inquiries * Microsoft Word and Excel ATI is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome job applications from qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, ancestry, family care status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or any other lawfully protected status. Minorities, women, disabled persons, and veterans are encouraged to apply. It is the policy of ATI, as an equal opportunity employer, to attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability or veteran status.

Making calls to doctors & scheduling the presentation with them for our care product i.e. electronic medical record software (InSync EMR).Handling customer with sales inquiry & providing solution to their requirement.Selling the product to the customer as per their requirements.Achieving the sales targets given monthly basis.Trying to initiate new services & products sale such as Medical transcription, etc. to spread the product knowledge to every client.Assist the customer till process from inquiry to conversion is done.Confirming the sales to be falling under healthy marketing strategy for Company with better prospect through one generated client by spreading positive word of mouth for the product.Actively involved in the discussion and suggestion towards the improvement of sales process.Handling 3 Business Development executives team.Giving training to new employees who joins in Presales department as Business Development Executive.To do Quality Analysis of my own team & guiding them on calls.Sending Quality Analysed Reports to Team Leader.Searching for innovative ideas and implementing the same in the day-to-day work to improve sales & to get the lead converted into sale.Trying to avoid inconvenience to client by keeping the daily track of follow-up so the client don't need to give us call back for scheduling the presentation.Achieving monthly targets in sales.Try to perform consistently well in every month.

Maintain Patient Records Using EMR System, InSyncComprehensive History Interviewing Skills For New PatientsSchedule Appointments, Handle Cancellations and ReschedulingArrange Referrals To SpecialistCall in Prescriptions

Overseeing therapeutic exerciseThermal and electrical modalitiesMaintaining clinic health standardsFront desk activities including patient scheduling and new patient chartingFamiliarity with 'insync' EMR system

Assisted physician and staff in office operations, preparation for patient appointments, and digitization of lab and imaging reports . Mastered electronic medical record programs such as EMR and InSync. Developed standard operating procedures for office procedures and maintained collection of patient materials. Counseled patients one-on-one in health topics during physician office visits (i.e. xeno-estrogen, glycemic index, Mediterranean dieting).

Scheduling Patients and Checking Patients in and out, Taking Patients vitals and obtaining the information in the EMR, Lab Procedures, Obtain Chief complaints and information for a HPI, Injections, Bandaging, Set up sterile Trays, Electrocardiography, Ordering Supplies, Prior Authorizations and Referrals, Experience using Insync EMR, EOB, Entering CPT and ICD - 9 codes into an electronic Claim Form, HIPAA & OSHA Compliant.

IGVR (Powered by SpeechMagic) Designed and developed voice enabled report creation module to make report generation easy for Radiologists. Responsibilities: I was involved in interacting with Nuance SpeechMagics support and development team in understanding the SpeechMagics interface and integrated it with the Radiology Information System (ImageGrid RIS) Technologies: C#, JNI, VC++, Java, SpeechMagic API, Visual Studio 2008, SQL Server 2008

Worked on:- Network-based digital dictation software and medical transcription system for PC or smart phones.- Speech recognition software integration with Nuance products (SpeechMagic or Dragon).- HL7 integration to exchange electronic health information.- PACS integration for the medical imaging technology with companies such as FUJI, GE, Siemens.- Integration with the clinical computer systems such as SystmOne, TalkingPoint or content management systems like Interwoven.- software debugging ...

Working with a team of highly skilled peers, developers, and business teams, I provided quality assurance support for a world-class radiology information system. This requires a strong knowledge of a variety of Radiology department workflows and how they apply to the design of the software.- Manual testing- Some automated testing- Prepare / revise test plans, test scripts, release notes, help, service documentation.- Ownership of manual regression test documentation- Use of requirements gathering tool- Use of test script tool- Use of test execution tool- Use of defect tracking software- Install, configure, upgrade, and test server / client software- Set up and maintain Windows OS test environment- Work with Oracle database- Work with Nuance SpeechMagic- Provide remote support to clients and colleagues- Familiar with HIPPA and MQSA requirements as applied to the RIS application.

As a Level 2 Support Analyst, my responsibility was to troubleshoot technical issues ranging from workstation hardware to server configuration items. My specialty was SpeechQ for Radiology utilizing Nuance's SpeechMagic.As the Integrations Manager, I was responsible for providing consultation for new and existing customers on the available options for integrating their current or future radiology systems (RIS, PACS) with Medquist's SpeechQ system.

Working with a team of highly skilled peers, developers, and business teams, I provided quality assurance support for a world-class radiology information system. This requires a strong knowledge of a variety of Radiology department workflows and how they apply to the design of the software.- Manual testing- Some automated testing- Prepare / revise test plans, test scripts, release notes, help, service documentation.- Ownership of manual regression test documentation- Use of requirements gathering tool- Use of test script tool- Use of test execution tool- Use of defect tracking software- Install, configure, upgrade, and test server / client software- Set up and maintain Windows OS test environment- Work with Oracle database- Work with Nuance SpeechMagic- Provide remote support to clients and colleagues- Familiar with HIPPA and MQSA requirements as applied to the RIS application.
Installation and maintenance of IMPAX RIS, Oracle Database, Nuance SpeechMagic, IMPAX Connectivity, IMPAX BI (based on Oracle BI) and IMPAX Scheduling.

Software Development for a web solution of a globally used Radiology Information System (RIS) as aOracle ADF rich web application with integrated TX Text Control text editor and speech recognition workflow using Nuance SpeechMagic.

Speech Recognition expert,Supporting G2 Speech Medispeech, Nuance SpeechMagic, Dragon Medical products, SQL server based applications, HL7 and many other PAS/RIS integrations.In addition to the previous role, Lead trainer and tester, and internal trainer for new staff.

<description>MRI Radiographer - Rayscan Imaging Rayscan Imaging is a comprehensive radiology practice located in Sydney's South West for over 35 years. <description>Priority Area Lead: Professor Stephen Wood Cognitive neuroscience and mental health research are two major strengths of the School of Psychology, and we seek to appoint an outstanding scientist whose research will contribute to one or both of these disciplines. Although we anticipate that the home will be Psychology, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to work closely with colleagues at the University Hospitals Birmingham, with mental health services and clinics across the West Midlands, and with the emerging Institute of Translational Medicine. The Birmingham Fellow will have access to an impressive toolkit of facilities including an extensive clinical test library, 3T Philips MRI scanner, and compatible EEG and TMS (single-pulse and repetitive) equipment enabling joint fMRI/EEG or fMRI/TMS recording, transcranial electrical (tACS, tDCS) devices for cortical stimulation, MEG and high-field strength (7T) MRI access via our partner University (Nottingham), visuomotor tracking station complete with eye and limb-movement monitoring devices, a bimanual force-controlled robotics arm, DNA sequencing and genotyping services, advanced mass spectrometry, and excellent access to both clinical and non-clinical populations across the life span. The Fellow would be appointed jointly to the schools of Psychology, Computer Science, Bioscience, or Sport and Exercise Science and have close engagement through Birmingham Health Partners and the Institute of Translational Medicine.</description>

<description>CT/MRI - Philips and/or Siemens Service Engineer About the Job CT/MRI Service Engineer - Charlotte, NC A major medical imaging service organization is looking for a Philips or Siemens trained CT/MRI Service Engineer for the Charlotte, NC area. The company is growing and they are looking for a Field Service Engineer to be a liason between the hospitals and the company covering hospital and medical imaging accounts in North Carolina. There is unlimited growth potential for the right person! There may be occasional but minimal overnight travel required for this position. Requirements and Qualifications At least 3-5 years of service experience on Philips or Siemens CT and MRI systems, older and newer systems. Factory training would be a plus! Good general troubleshooting and electro-mechanical skills. Excellent customer service and communication skills with nurses, doctor, technicians, etc. within a hospital setting. Must have a valid driver's license. Must be able to travel throughout the Southern California area. Occasional overnight travel may be required. An Bachelor's or Associate's degree in Electronics or a related field is highly desired but not mandatory. Background checks will be performed.</description>
