<description> Medical Imaging Solutions (MIS) is the premier provider of medical imaging systems and services in North America. Our knowledge and experience with medical imaging equipment is unparalleled; the expertise of our engineers and the professionalism of our service is the differentiating factor. It's an attitude that has allowed us to become the leading supplier in this industry . . . rapidly growing our client base as well as our portfolio of service offerings.   MRI/CT Field Service Engineer - Must have Philips experience/All other brands a plus  Location:  Woodstock, GA  Job Type:  Direct Hire  Posted On:  7/25/11   POSITION SUMMARY : Taking sole responsibility and ownership for their assigned site, the FSE will maintain an exceptional, open working relationship with every customer ensuring their needs and expectations are superbly met. Consistent customer satisfaction is key by following up with phone calls to ensure satisfactory work performance and operation. The FSE  will be able to recognize both minor and major problems and take appropriate measures to remedy these issues immediately. The FSE will thoroughly know their customers needs as well as any other sites the customer may own or operate. The FSE will take every opportunity to provide our exceptional services to every customer to the fullest extent possible. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Specific duties and responsibilities will include, but not be limited to: 1.       Ability to service multiple CT and MRI systems of various makes, models and manufacturers, while demonstrating working knowledge of the theory and operation of CT and MRI systems. 2.       By gathering necessary data including image quality, patient criteria, protocols, and operators assessment, a system diagnosis will be applied. 3.       Ability to understand and maintain the working knowledge of CT and MRI exams and performance, demonstrating the ability to analyze satisfactory outcomes. 4.       Ability to logically troubleshoot and document imaging systems, using  the most effective, minimal resources  to return the imaging system to it ??s appropriate diagnostic state. 5.       Apply a working knowledge of electronics by concisely identifying defective components and circuit boards used in our service base. 6.       Ability to repair circuits and circuit boards consistent with best practices established in field service repair. 7.       Ability to identify operational system software problems with a demonstrated capability of diagnosing problems quickly and attaining necessary, available software for their locations. FSE completes data back-up having proper resources to recover lost data as needed.  QUALIFICATIONS / REQUIREMENTS:          A BS in Electrical Engineering or Electrical Engineering Technology preferred, or equivalent work experience.          Minimum 3-5 years related experience servicing and troubleshooting CT and/or MRI systems. Preferred experience servicing: GE, Phillips , Siemens, Toshiba and Hitachi systems released within the last 7 years.          Willingness to travel within 4 hours of home site, travel may also be required to cover other regions as needed. Candidate may be required to work irregular, flexible hours including weekends and/or late hours.          Requires strong verbal and written skills.          A valid driver ??s license required.          Must submit to a drug test.          Candidate must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction.          Must be able to maintain and keep up to date and organize reports such as site reports and internal service records.          Must possess excellent customer service skills.          Must be able to communicate frequently and effectively with customers to ensure problems/issues are 100% resolved with follow up contact.          Must be able to work as a member of the local team to provide efficient service delivery to all accounts within assigned area.          Must have a solid, stable work history          Candidate must be able to meet the physical demands of the job. Jobs often require standing, walking, sitting, climbing, balancing, kneeling, stooping, crouching and crawling. It also requires lifting and moving test equipment and materials up to 50 lbs daily. DESIRED CHARACTERISTICS:          Excellent analytical and communication skills with the ability to communicate complex technical issues in an easy to understand manner          Mature,  professional and courteous attitude          Team player. Able to share expertise and knowledge with other team members. Adapts to the team and encourages team spirit.          An aggressive ??self starter ? with the ability to perform duties without constant oversight Working relationship with these departments: VP of Operations, Regional Service/Sales Managers, Service Support Team and Logistics/Parts Team Medical Imaging Solutions has an excellent benefit plan including:          Salaried position commensurate with knowledge, experience and skills          Excellent benefits package available ? (Health, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401k, LTD)          2 weeks paid vacation (1 st year)          Company car or car allowance provided          Performance based bonus plans  Please send resume to Jim Bates at jbates@medicalimaginggroup.com or fax to 770-592-9491      Apply</description><education>Associate Degree</education>

JOB SUMMARY Performs diagnostic magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) studies under the direction of the MRI Medical Director and in accordance with hospital guidelines. Responsible for operating all systems for routine studies and performing all duties related to scanning and image processing. Consistently follows proper patient screening/care protocols and provides accurate documentation associated with each exam while supporting expedited patient throughput and diagnosis. EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS Graduate of an approved school of radiologic technology or; Bachelors degree plus 6 months clinical hands-on MRI training. EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS Must have at least 2 years of clinical experience in Radiology or have a Bachelors degree plus 6 months clinical training in MRI. CERTIFICATES, LICENSES AND REGISTRATIONS REQUIRED Graduate of radiologic technology schools must be registered by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) and certified by the State of Texas. Others must have a Bachelors degree plus six months training and must have degree or diploma plus certification of competency in MRI hands-on training. SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED Should demonstrate a high level of maturity with demonstrated self-confidence and ability to make decisions. Must competently operate MR and accessory equipment of varying vendors and demonstrate ability to advance skills with software and hardware upgrades. Skill set must include identification of pathology with resultant change in imaging protocols as required.

MRI/CT Field Service Engineer - Must have Philips experience/All other brands a plus Location:Woodstock, GA Job Type: Direct Hire Posted On: 7/25/11 POSITION SUMMARY : Taking sole responsibility and ownership for their assigned site, the FSE will maintain an exceptional, open working relationship with every customer ensuring their needs and expectations are superbly met. Consistent customer satisfaction is key by following up with phone calls to ensure satisfactory work performance and operation. The FSE will be able to recognize both minor and major problems and take appropriate measures to remedy these issues immediately. The FSE will thoroughly know their customers needs as well as any other sites the customer may own or operate. The FSE will take every opportunity to provide our exceptional services to every customer to the fullest extent possible. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Specific duties and responsibilities will include, but not be limited to: 1. Ability to service multiple CT and MRI systems of various makes, models and manufacturers, while demonstrating working knowledge of the theory and operation of CT and MRI systems. 2. By gathering necessary data including image quality, patient criteria, protocols, and operators assessment, a system diagnosis will be applied. 3. Ability to understand and maintain the working knowledge of CT and MRI exams and performance, demonstrating the ability to analyze satisfactory outcomes. 4. Ability to logically troubleshoot and document imaging systems, using the most effective, minimal resources to return the imaging system to its appropriate diagnostic state. 5. Apply a working knowledge of electronics by concisely identifying defective components and circuit boards used in our service base. 6. Ability to repair circuits and circuit boards consistent with best practices established in field service repair. 7. Ability to identify operational system software problems with a demonstrated capability of diagnosing problems quickly and attaining necessary, available software for their locations. FSE completes data back-up having proper resources to recover lost data as needed. QUALIFICATIONS / REQUIREMENTS: A BS in Electrical Engineering or Electrical Engineering Technology preferred, or equivalent work experience. Minimum 3-5 years related experience servicing and troubleshooting CT and/or MRI systems. Preferred experience servicing: GE, Phillips , Siemens, Toshiba and Hitachi systems released within the last 7 years. Willingness to travel within 4 hours of home site, travel may also be required to cover other regions as needed. Candidate may be required to work irregular, flexible hours including weekends and/or late hours. Requires strong verbal and written skills. A valid drivers license required. Must submit to a drug test. Candidate must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction. Must be able to maintain and keep up to date and organize reports such as site reports and internal service records. Must possess excellent customer service skills. Must be able to communicate frequently and effectively with customers to ensure problems/issues are 100% resolved with follow up contact. Must be able to work as a member of the local team to provide efficient service delivery to all accounts within assigned area. Must have a solid, stable work history Candidate must be able to meet the physical demands of the job. Jobs often require standing, walking, sitting, climbing, balancing, kneeling, stooping, crouching and crawling. It also requires lifting and moving test equipment and materials up to 50 lbs daily. DESIRED CHARACTERISTICS: Excellent analytical and communication skills with the ability to communicate complex technical issues in an easy to understand manner Mature,professional and courteous attitude Team player. Able to share expertise and knowledge with other team members. Adapts to the team and encourages team spirit. An aggressive self starter with the ability to perform duties without constant oversight Working relationship with these departments: VP of Operations, Regional Service/Sales Managers, Service Support Team and Logistics/Parts Team Medical Imaging Solutions has an excellent benefit plan including: Salaried position commensurate with knowledge, experience and skills Excellent benefits package available (Health, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401k, LTD) 2 weeks paid vacation (1 st year) Company car or car allowance provided Performance based bonus plans Please send resume to Jim Bates at click on Apply Online button or fax to</description>

CT/MRI Service Engineer - Charlotte, NC

A major medical imaging service organization is looking for a Philips or Siemens trained CT/MRI Service Engineer for the Charlotte, NC area. The company is growing and they are looking for a Field Service Engineer to be a liason between the hospitals and the company covering hospital and medical imaging accounts in North Carolina. There is unlimited growth potential for the right person! There may be occasional but minimal overnight travel required for this position.

  1. Background checks will be performed.

Atlantis Medical: are currently looking for a HCPC registered MRI &CT Radiographer to work within a Diagnostic Centre which offers the best equipment including Open and Extremity MRI scanners,Philips 1.0T Panorama and GE 1.5T Optima MR430s and the GE Discovery CT750HD, which is the world's first high definition low-dose CT scanner.You will be providing an efficient and professional radiographic service, maintaining a high standard of patient care and participating in service activity within all specialised areas.As a senior member of staff, you will also be involved in staff training and assisting in the day to day running of the radiographic areas. This is a permanent, full time role with an excellent salary offered of up to 36,000, depending on experience. Key Requirements: Bsc in Radiography or equivalent Full HCPC registration Must have post graduate experience working in MRI and CT Experience in administering IV Contrast Cardiac MRI and Cardiac CT experience desirable Excellent communication and empathy skills Ability to work under pressure For more information contact Jackie Cloake

<description>Per Diem MRI/CT/Xray Technologist needed, hours and days varied. Job Purpose:Determines patient condition by completing Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) studies; Computerized Axial Tomography (CAT) Scanning; operating Radiologic Equipment to produce radiographs presenting them for diagnosis. Duties:* Greets patients by confirming patient identification; reviewing MRI/CT/Xray request; checking for special instructions; confirming anticipated services with patients.* Gains patient cooperation by reducing anxieties; providing explanations of MRI/CT/Xray procedures; explaining equipment; answering questions. * Provides pleasant environment within the scanning suite by maintaining order; assuring the availability of reading materials; providing extra blankets; monitoring the condition of patients within the department. * Safeguards patients during procedures by recognizing and initiating treatment of allergic reactions; recognizing fear and offering comfort; maintaining emergency equipment within the scanning suite.* Conducts MRI/CT/Xray studies by positioning patients for optimum scan efficiency; instructing patients as to what they must do during the scan to obtain optimum results; conferring with physicians to determine the proper setting for the scanner.* Minimizes radiation to patient and staff by practicing radiation protection techniques; using beam restrictive devices; applying knowledge of exposure factors.* Maintains production and quality of MRI/CT/Xray studies by following established standards and procedures determining necessary adjustments for optimum results; forwarding completed studies to radiologist for interpretation. * Maintains computerized axial tomography equipment by ensuring that both the computer and radiographic equipment are operating properly; initiating the computer into its proper program and starting the x-ray equipment; reporting any hazardous conditions or equipment breakdowns; following operating instructions; troubleshooting problems; performing preventive maintenance; calling for repairs.* Ensures operation of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) equipment by completing preventive maintenance on all magnetic resonance or positron imaging equipment, including the scanner, operating console, CRT screens, and associated peripheral equipment; following manufacturer's instructions; troubleshooting malfunctions; calling for repairs; maintaining equipment inventories. * Prepares patient for radiological procedure by positioning patient; adjusting immobilization devices; moving equipment into specified position; adjusting equipment controls to set exposure factors.* Minimizes radiation to patient and staff by practicing radiation protection techniques, using beam restrictive devices, patient shielding, and knowledge of exposure factors.* Protects patients and employees by adhering to infection-control policies and protocols; following drug protocols in case of reactions to drugs, such as contrast media, administering first aid, and using the emergency cart.* Maintains production and quality of radiographs by following established standards and procedures; developing radiographs; observing radiographic results; making necessary adjustments.* Keeps MRI/CT/Xray supplies and patient drapes ready by inventorying stock; placing orders; verifying receipt; collecting and processing laundry.* Maintains safe, secure, and healthy work environment by following and enforcing standards and procedures; complying with federal and state legal regulations.* Documents patient MRI services by completing patient record charting; generating charge slips.* Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.* Enhances organization reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.Skills/Qualifications:Must be Licensed, Performing Diagnostic Procedures, Use of Medical Technologies, Radiologic Technology, Physiological Knowledge, Customer Focus, Verbal Communication, Informing Others, Dealing with Complexity, Analyzing Information. Equipment: MRI - Philips Panorama 1.0 Open CT - Marconi MX8000 4 slice Xray-Fluoro - Siemans Gigantos Xray - GE MonitrolCompensation based on experience. Apply</description><education>Certification</education>

The incumbent may operate a 1.5 or 3.0 Tesla Philips MRI scanner or a 1.5T GE MRI scanner in the conduct of clinical and research acquisitions and reconstructions. <description>Position Highlights BASIC FUNCTION: Position responsible for administering MRI examinations and ability to perform in other complex modalities. Ability to take simple extremity and spine x-rays is preferred. Evening shift. Will take call every other week, Mon-Fri. May be asked to work an occasional weekend. Experience with Philips 3-Tesla preferred. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: 1. Graduate of an approved School of Radiological Technology. 2. Registered MRI Technologist by the American Registry of Radiological 3. Minimum of 1 year experience as a MRI Technologist I. 4. Able to work Day or Evening Shift Mon - Fri 4. Experience with 3 Tesla and Philips MRI preferred. 6. 11P - 7A call is available but not required. 7. Demonstrates commitment to the Partners-in-Caring process by integrating both Behaviors and Operating Principles in all internal and external customer interactions. Performs duties with accountability, competency, innovation, collaboration, compassion and respect to create the best possible outcomes with exceptional customer experiences. PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES: 1. Prepares patients for MRI exam, explains procedure and ensures technical quality. 2. Demonstrates ability to perform diagnostic radiological examinations in other complex modalities. (CT, Special Procedures, Ultrasound, etc.) 3. Reports any accidents, complaints or equipment malfunction to the Supervisor/Manager. 4. Ensures safe care to patients adhering to policies, procedures, and standards, within budgetary specifications, including time management, supply management, productivity, and accuracy of practice. 5. Participates in P.I. activities established by Imaging Services. 6. Takes emergency call within the department. 7. Promotes individual professional growth and development by meeting requirements for mandatory/continuing education, skills competency, supports department-based goals which contribute to the success of the organization; serves as a mentor and resource to less experienced staff/students. 8. Performs other related duties as directed.</description>

The UBC MRI Research Centre within the Department of Radiology, invites applications for a part time (50%) Research Associate with the possibility of extension after three years.The applicant must hold a PhD in Physics with a strong research background with a thorough knowledge of magnetic resonance using a 3.0 Tesla Philips MR scanner.The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to conceive, initiate, organize and manage MR research projects and provide support for a wide scope of MR researchers.A thorough knowledge of image analysis software is required particularly MATLAB.Preference will be given to those individuals who have experience with multi-echo T2 relaxation and MR spectroscopy, along with direct interaction with MR scanner vendors. The individual will be the dedicated Clinical Scientist for the UBC MRI Research Centre and will be a part of the UBC MR Research Group and will liaise with researchers using the UBC MRI Research Centre's 3.0 Tesla Philips Achieva and Ingenia MR scanners. This individual will collaborate with and assist in the development of innovative research programs for Philips Healthcare in the use of all MR techniques. The position will commence 2nd April 2017. This is a part-time (50%) three-year term appointment subject to annual renewal. Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. UBC hires on the basis of merit and is strongly committed to equity and diversity within its community.We welcome applications from visible Especially Minority group members,women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, persons of minority sexual orientations and gender identities, and others with the skills and knowledge to productively engage with diverse communities.All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

<description>Massachusetts Veterinary Referral Hospital (MVRH) has an immediate opening in our Emergency and Critical Care department for an experienced veterinary technician.   Our  26,000 square foot building, located just outside of Boston, is home to one of the premier referral and emergency centers in New England. The hospital is well equipped including a 1.5 tesla Philips MRI, CT scanner, digital radiography, ultrasound, endoscopy, fluoroscopy, parenteral nutrition compounding system, mechanical ventilation, complete on-site diagnostic laboratory (including blood gas and coagulation analysis), comprehensive surgical facilities and a dedicated ICU department. Our emergency department consists of 14 internship-trained veterinarians who provide high quality care 24-hours a day in support of our 3 critical care specialists.  In addition, we currently have specialists in behavior (1), cardiology (3), emergency and critical care (3), neurology (2), ophthalmology (2), internal medicine (4), radiology (3), dermatology (1), physical therapy and surgery (4).  In addition to meeting the technical requirements, the right candidate will have a strong desire to work in a busy team environment and a commitment to developing long-term working relationships.  Candidates must have a positive attitude, possess excellent communication skills, be able to collaborate with others, and deliver exceptional client service.  We offer competitive salary, paid time off, health, dental, and life insurances, short & long-term disability, flex spending account, 401k, CE allowances, uniforms and employee pet discounts.   Qualified applicants please contact us at: hr@ivghospitals.com  Apply</description>

Long Island Veterinary Specialists is seeking an oncologist, cardiologist, and dentist to join our growing team of specialists. Our veterinary specialty center is a 20,0 square foot facility with a dedicated area for chemotherapy and in-house clinical pathology services. We have a well-established clientele and a fully equipped ICU staffed 24 hours. Our staff of 150 dedicated professionals enjoys working amongst specialists in a variety of disciplines including Ophthalmology, Dermatology, Surgery, Neurology, Radiology, Internal medicine, and Oncology. We have maintained residency training programs in a variety of disciplines including: Surgery, Internal Medicine, Neurology, Critical Care, and specialty interns. Our diagnostic technologies include a G.E. Logitec U/S, Storz HD endoscopy system, Philips 3 Tesla MRI, Philips MX80 multi detector CT scanner, medical infrared imaging, and two digital radiography suites. Our surgical technologies include a cavitron ultrasonic surgical aspirator (CUSA), MHF-1 intra-operative ultrasound scanner, and a Storz intracranial endoscopy system. Radiation therapy is provided on-site by our electronic brachytherapy program and is supported by physicists, oncologists, and radiation oncologist. We have a dedicated ultrasound for cardiology and in-house fluoroscopy suite to facilitate pacemaker placement. While Long Island is known for its pristine beaches, including Fire Island National Seashore and the Hamptons, a lesser known treasure is the vineyards of the islands east end. More than 40 vineyards cultivate the grapes in the sun-drenched region. Long Island also boasts one of the finest state park systems in the country. Fifteen parks offer outstanding golf courses, tennis courts, and horseback riding trails. With more than 1,180 miles of shoreline, Long Island is one of the worlds premier boating and fishing destinations. Close proximity to New York City (30 minutes by car or train) affords unique cultural and recreational opportunities. Board certified specialists or candidates who have completed residency training are encouraged to apply. Interested candidates should send a letter of interest and CV to: Dominic Marino, DVM, Dip. ACVS Chief of Staff Long Island Veterinary Specialists 163 South Service Road Plainview, NY 11803 dmarino@livs.org Board certified specialists or candidates who have completed residency. NOTES: 3 openings

Long Island Veterinary Specialists in Plainview, NYis seekinga Board Certified Internistto join our growing team of specialists. Our veterinary specialty center is a 30,000 square foot facility with a dedicated area for diagnostic procedures. We have a well-established clientele and a fully equipped ICU staffed 24 hours. Our staff of over 150 dedicated professionals enjoys working amongst specialists in a variety of disciplines including Behavior Medicine, Dermatology, Internal Medicine, Neurology, Ophthalmology, Sports Medicine and Rehabilitation, and Surgery. Our diagnostic technologies include a GE LOGIQ Vet S8 Ultrasound, Storz HD endoscopy system, Philips 3 Tesla MRI, Siemens Sensation 16 multi-detector CT scanner, three Idexx blood lab stations, and two digital radiography suites. We have dedicated ultrasound for internal medicine and an in-house fluoroscopy suite. Board Certified Internal Medicine Specialists with a minimum of one year of ultrasound experience are encouraged to apply. Interested candidates should send a letter of interest and CV to: Brian McKenna Hospital Administrator Long Island Veterinary Specialists 163 South Service Rd. Plainview, NY 11803 T: 516-501-1700 ext. 330 bmckenna@livs.org http://www.livs.org YourMembership. Category: Veterinary, Keywords: Veterinary Specialist

We currently have specialists in behavior, cardiology, emergency and critical care, neurology, ophthalmology, internal medicine, radiology, dermatology, physical therapy and surgery. The University Of Texas Southwestern Medical Center, Department Of Radiology, Division of Translation Research in Dallas is seeking an Assistant Professor level candidate. This position will provide technical expertise for the performance and analysis of Clinical Research studies on the Multi-spectral CT (Philips IQON SDCT) as well as develop their own independent research program in the area of material decomposition studies of endogenous molecules or specific targeted exogenous contrast agents. Collaborating with industry site scientist to create required documentation for IRB submissions and annual reports required as part of the collaboration between our industry partner (Philips Healthcare). This position is involved in the education of graduate students, post-doctoral trainees, and clinicians. The candidate is expected to prepare formal presentation of research activities both internally as well as at national and international conferences. This position will prepare and produce written documentation of research activities for manuscripts for publication in peer reviewed journals. The candidate should hold a PhD in Radiological Sciences or a related field and background in Engineering and Physics. Experience in photon counting methods is desirable.

<description>The Department of Radiology, Division of Radiation Oncology at the Medical College of Georgia (MCG), Georgia's premier Health Sciences University is recruiting a full-time Chief of Radiation Oncology. Candidates should be board certified and have five to ten years of experience in clinical care. The ideal candidate would have extensive clinical and administrative experience in an academic center. The Georgia Radiation Therapy Center is a large, free-standing facility operating four linear accelerators. A Necleotron HDR after-loader, a Philips Gemini TF PET-CT (16 slice) and a Philips Brilliance CT Big Bore are located in the Georgia Radiation Therapy Center. MCG ranks in the top ten medical schools in basic science grant revenue per faculty member and is located in historic Augusta, Georgia, a mid-sized city with diverse recreational and lifestyle opportunities. Salary and faculty rank are commensurate with experience and ability. The position also includes a generous fringe benefits package (i.e., including but not limited to Professional Liability Insurance Coverage, Home Owners and Auto Insurance, Disability Insurance, Health and Dental Insurance). A newly established cancer center has ambitious plans for growth in basic, translational, and clinical cancer research. The campus offers excellent core facilities including cell and small animal imaging. Additional information is available at www.mcg.edu, or from the Chair of the Search Committee, James V. Rawson, MD, Chair, Department of Radiology. Applicants must apply online at www.mcg.edu/facultyjobs/ for this position; utilize requisition number 4077 and include the Department of Radiology when submitting your application. The Medical College of Georgia is an equal employment, equal access, and equal educational opportunity and affirmative action institution. It is the policy of the University to recruit, hire, train, promote and educate persons without regard to age, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status.</description>

<description>The University of Tennessee Health Science Center, Department of Radiation Oncology, is recruiting for a full time board certified/board eligible Radiation Oncology Medical Physicist at the Associate Professor level (non-tenure track). The candidate must be highly motivated in pursuing an academic career in Medical Physics. Responsibilities will include patient care, teaching and clinical research. External grant funding is encouraged. The Department is affiliated with The West Clinic, and Methodist University Hospital and The University of Tennessee West Cancer Center. Radiation Oncology Services for Methodist Le Bonheur Healthcare include a facility in Midtown at Methodist University Hospital and a remote location in Germantown. The midtown location has 2 linacs (Siemens Oncor and Elekta Synergy), an HDR suite (Nucletron), and a CT big bore simulator (Philips). We use Philips Pinnacle Treatment Planning System with Mosaiq treatment software at both locations. We also use Nucletron Oncentra Brachytherapy Planning System for the HDR suite in Midtown. We provide external radiation treatment (including IMRT, IGRT and VMAT), HDR Partial Breast Brachytherapy (60/yr), HDR Vaginal Cylinder Brachytherapy, HDR Tandem and Ovoid Brachytherapy (70/yr), Prostate Brachytherapy (35/yr), and Eyeplaque (80/yr). Our Germantown location is located in a freestanding clinic at 1381 South Germantown Road. This location has one linac (Elekta Synergy) and a CT big bore simulator (Siemens). We provide external radiation treatment (including IMRT, IGRT and VMAT) at this facility. We have 4 fulltime physicists including a Chief Physicist, a Board Certified Staff Physicist, two Junior Physicists, three Board Certified Medical Dosimetrists, and a PRN Junior Medical Dosimetrist which service both locations. Applicants must have a commitment to diversity and equal opportunity. Interested candidates should send a letter of interest, at least 2 letters of recommendation and a Curriculum Vitae to Dr. Matthew T. Ballo, Professor and Chairman, University of Tennessee Health Science Center, Department of Radiation Oncology.</description><industry>Higher Education</industry>

Assumes some of the project management responsibilities of assigned tasks.</description><requirement>Experience documenting business requirements and test cases, performing testing, updating test results, logging defects, tracking defect fixes, and coordinating user acceptance testing throughout the Software Development Life Cycle QA experience with one or more of the following a plus: Kony, HP ALM: Quality Center, MDLIVE, Epic: Cadence, Ambulatory, MyChart, Care Everywhere, Interconnect Web Services Responsive web pages, telemedicine, Epic web and citrix-based applications, geofencing/wayfinding, iOS/Android mobile apps, and externally public APIs Experience in healthcare applications as typically acquired in 3 to 5 years. Demonstrated technical and/or business experience. Demonstrated increasingly responsible professional growth. Software implementation experience using diversified product lines of information systems is preferred. Strong problem and issue resolution experience. Proficient at specifying user requirements. Strong understanding of different software development life cycles (waterfall, iterative) and contemporary software quality assurance processes and automated tools. Understand business requirements and abstracts into data quality rules. In-depth knowledge of industry standards to support business requirements. Knowledge of health care operations and structure, general requirements in an integrated delivery system, and use of information system applications in the practicing health care environment is preferred. In-depth of knowledge of life cycle of application environments. Thorough understanding of hospital inpatient, clinic outpatient operations, and/or financial software along with understanding the technical environment of product lines for which they are responsible is preferred. Leadership skills. Ability to be involved in multiple projects at the same time. Excellent organization skills; and ability to prioritize multiple activities and objectives in a rapidly changing environment, and deliver quality service. Collect data from analyst and apply QA methodologies to generate measurements that relate to business rules and metrics. Work closely with health care application users, vendors, and technical professionals. Committed to providing exceptional customer service and responding to user needs in a prompt, courteous manner. Project management skills. Strong analytical and critical thinking skills. Exceptional written, verbal and presentation skills with the ability to communicate complex technical issues in terms clearly understood by technical and non-technical audiences. Strong skills in word processing, spreadsheet and presentation computer programs, preferably Microsoft. Influence others without direct lines of authority. Strong collaboration and consulting skills. Self motivated, self-directed and independent thinking as well as an effective team player.</requirement>

Managed development of Sutter Health's first mobile application for iOS, Android, and tablet, tracking usage via Google Analytics and Tag Manager.Leads the 30-person cross-functional app team. Helps develop the app strategy and works with executive project sponsors and clinical leadership to define business needs, requirements and features. Oversees a large budget and relationships with two developers, negotiating contracts. Spearheads application improvements.Drives the vendor application selection process for a wayfinding (hospital navigation) vendor. Led Sutter selection of video/telemedicine platforms, co-authoring an Enterprise Application Plan.Directs the integration of MDLIVE (telemedicine) with Sutter Health's EPIC EHR, managing a 20-person team. Improves patient engagement overseeing integration of MDLIVE with Sutter Heath's call center (Sutter Physician Services), while leading an 18-person team and managing the project budget.Analyzed data from numerous Sutter Health financial and clinical MS Access and SQL databases, presenting findings via Excel pivot tables, charts and graphs to support initiatives and aid decision making.Performing company review for Sutter investment and partnering opportunities, completing due diligence audits. Prepared physician competitor heat maps to outline M&A opportunities.Helped develop the Sutter retail strategy for partnering with pharmacy chains and MDLIVE to implement a virtual telemedicine urgent care provider platform. Garnered senior leadership buy-in, created workflows and delivered analytic support.Focusing on the top 10 specialty care service lines, compiled internal and OSHPD (Office of Statewide Health Planning and Development) data, conducted analysis utilizing Excel and wrote a 100-page annual report for senior leadership during 2010 through 2012.

Manage the development of Sutter Health's first mobile app which is launching in January 2015 Manage the integration of MDLIVE with Sutter Health's EPIC electronic health record. Manage the integration of MDLIVE with Sutter Heath's call center to provide customer engagement. Provide and maintain information that facilitates high-quality strategic and business decision-making. Utilize knowledge of healthcare industry, business development and strategic planning methodologies, quantitative analysis techniques, software technologies and monitoring reporting systems across Sutter Health to better understand patient flow, utilization and resource demand in a proactive manner to efficiently produce high-quality end products that meet the needs of internal customers and the Strategic Partnerships/Strategy & Business Development team. Synthesize information from a variety of sources, utilizes statistical and forecasting models, formulates hypothesis, suggests alternatives, and keeps the departments data sources updated and accurate.

Working on Next Generation Vendor Neutral Archive project - a joint development agreement between UPMC Enterprises and GE Healthcare.Performed clinical discovery and financial analysis to understand the impact of implementing GE Healthcares Centricity Clinical Archive and associated tools at UPMC Hospitals.Worked with clinicians at UPMC across 8 medical specialties to understand gaps in current medical imaging workflows and build use case scenarios for Media Manager application and Zero Footprint viewer (ZFP DICOM and XDS) for GE Healthcares Centricity Clinical Archive.Performed competitive analysis of other third party imaging devices, viewers and PACS being implemented at UPMC Hospitals and understand how cross departmental imaging workflows and telemedicine at UPMC can be enabled by GEHC products.

The goal of this Enterprise project is to implement a standardized Physician Organization (PO) diagnostic instrument/image application platform and integrate these offices with Houston Methodist. This requires a detailed inventory of current PO imaging devices, databases, workflows and 3rd party systems in 130 PO clinic locations (1000+ Providers). With the site information we'll formulate and execute a plan to consolidate these devices and 3rd party systems into the GE Centricity Clinical Archive (CCA) - a Vendor Neutral Archive. This project parallels the Health System Epic eHR implementation; at the conclusion of both initiatives, Houston Methodist will be a fully integrated electronic Health System.Current state: Houston Methodist hospitals major archives include the GE Centricity Enterprise PACS, GE Radiology RIS and PACS systems, a Cardiology PACS and the Digisonics DigiView cardiology system. Not all services and devices are integrated; many function in a stand alone capacity. The PO has numerous disparate legacy and client server PACS systems, dozens of freestanding diagnostic devices and a mixture of medical records schemas; however, the PACS are all IHE compliant.Scope -future state: Build and implement the Centricity Clinical Archive (Vendor Neutral Archive) by converting the existing GE Enterprise PACS into the VNA archive. All existing archives must be reconciled to a new Epic MRN then migrated. The PO PACS systems will be consolidated-migrated to the VNA. St. Joesph's & St. Catherine's radiology PACS will be migrated to the VNA. 35 existing cardiology disparate DigiView databases will consolidated into three (Echo/Vascular/Cath) & will be integrated with the VNA. In early 2017 the 3 DigiView databases will be consolidated & migrated to the Siemens Syngo system. We're implementing the GE MUSE & MARS systems; these will integrate with the VNA. Viewers: the GE Universal Viewer (diagnostic interpretations) & the GE Zero Foot Print viewer (view only).

Analyze the current state of imaging storage and 3rd party Cardiology systems at all HM hospital and PO clinic locations and based on that analysis, implement a plan to consolidate these archives and 3rd party systems to a Houston Methodist Health System standard archive by service line and integration of these imaging systems with the new health system image management solution  the Epic integrated GE Centricity Clinical Archive (CCA) which is an enterprise solution for high imaging data availability via the GE Universal (UV) and Zero Foot Print (ZFP) viewers.All Radiology systems and devices will consolidate and integrate with the HMH GE Radiology CPACS-IMS archive which is the HM Short Term System (STS). The HM Long Term Archive (LTA) for Radiology and Cardiology systems is the CCA which is linked to Epic. The Radiology CPACS-IMS and Cardiology systems will forward DICOM images to the CCA. The UV will be used by interpreting physicians and ZFP will linked to Epic.The scope is to develop and standardize existing Houston Methodist hospital and PO clinic Radiology and Cardiology systems/archives into enterprise wide applications by standardizing archives for PO and hospital clinicians, further develop a common application platform (GE CPACS) that is already in use at HMH and further develop the new HM enterprise Epic integrated GE CCA imaging system to standardize clinical utility and for high image availability. This design improves efficiency, IT security and IT support. The objective is for this Phase II work effort for each hospital and clinic to be completed prior to the assigned HM Epic go-live date for that site.

<description>Job Number 2593842 Business GE Healthcare Business Segment Healthcare Technology and Medical Innovation About Us GE is the world's Digital Industrial Company, transforming industry with software-defined machines and solutions that are connected, responsive and predictive. Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, GE delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry. About Us: GE {NYSE: GE} works on things that matter. The best people and the best technologies taking on the toughest challenges. GE operates in over 160 countries and employs more than 300,000 people worldwide, finding solutions in energy, health and home, transportation and finance to build, power, move and cure the world. Not just imagining. Doing. Business Overview: At GE Software, we are creating technology and solutions to enable social, mobile, analytical and cloud capabilities for the Industrial Internet. The Industrial Internet is an open, global network that connects people, data and machines. It's about making infrastructure more intelligent and advancing the industries critical to the world we live in. At GE, we believe it's about the future of industry?"energy, healthcare, transportation, manufacturing. It's about making the world work better. Stay connected with us. Join our Talent Community! How to Apply To be considered for a future position, please submit your resume/CV via the GE Careers website http://www.gesoftware.com/careers/ Equal Employment Opportunity GE Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcomes diversity. GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Posted Position Title Sr Software Manager Career Level Experienced Function Engineering/Technology Function Segment Applications and Software Location(s) Where Opening Is Available United States U.S. State, China or Canada Provinces Illinois City Barrington Postal Code 60010-3076 Relocation Assistance Yes Role Summary/Purpose As a Senior Software Manager of our Centricity Clinical Archive/Vendor Neutral Archive software engineering team, you will apply your knowledge of management, agile software development methodologies, agile best practices and proven processes to deliver a quality software product on budget, with in planned schedule with superb quality. Essential Responsibilities In this role, you will: Demonstrate very strong technical leadership and people management skills including solid communication and analytical skills with thorough understanding of product development and successful problem definition, decomposition, estimation and resolution Influence decision making through active partnership with cross-functional teams Manage strategic business partnerships and relationships through Technical, Financial, Contractual and Relationship management Own and manage the multiple rapid prototyping and product development budgets Coach, mentor and lead a diverse group of lean/agile software and user experience engineers Work with product owners across the businesses to understand market needs & vision; quickly translate that vision into demonstrable software Quickly define and deliver working software prototypes Work with product owners and architects to develop multi generation software technology plans Work directly with customers to understand business and technical needs Drive increased efficiency across the teams, eliminating duplication, leveraging product and technology reuse Support process improvements which guide the development, sustaining & support activities Work cross functionally with other business departments to align activities and deliverables Drive world-class quality in the development and support of products Keep project data relating to tracking and financials current Deliver resource strategy and plans, including use of 3rd parties/partners, etc., in support of development and support activities Plan and manage budgets related to scope of team Communicate effectively both within immediate team and GE leadership. Ensure team receives consistent messages and has clear understanding of business direction, strategy and results Build a world class software development team to consistently deliver complex software platforms and research projects of varying size and duration Qualifications/Requirements Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or in "STEM" Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) or equivalent related degree. A minimum of 12 years of professional experience including experience executing and on time delivery of quality software products in an agile software development environment, leading agile teams, successful collaboration with cross functional teams including work with product management function and driving agile best practices OR Master's degree with 10 years of experience including experience executing and on time delivery of quality software products in an agile software development environment, leading agile teams, successful collaboration with cross functional teams including work with product management function and driving agile best practices. Eligibility Requirements: Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen Must be willing to travel Must be willing to work out of an office located in Barrington, IL Additional Eligibility Qualifications GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen. Desired Characteristics Recognizes patterns and complexity in problems. Extracts decomposition algorithms, and strategically plans how to execute programs by understanding how best to decompose to expose / protect against risk Defines product vision. Lays out product roadmap. Maps current requirements to industry trends, analyses competition trends Demonstrates mastery of the intricacies of interactions and dynamics in Agile teams. Demonstrates advanced understanding of Lean Six Sigma principles (e.g., Black belt certified). Guides new teams to adopt Agile, troubleshoots adoption efforts, and guide continuous improvement. Provides training on Lean / Agile. Drives elimination of inefficiencies in coding process. Teaches XP practices to others. Actively embraces new methods and practices that increase efficiency and effectiveness Prioritizes projects based on an assessment of competitive needs. Anticipates areas of competitive vulnerability and offers plans to mitigate them Evangelizes new technology, predicts trends, and identifies new opportunities based on trends. Acts as industry expert by participating in defining standards and open source initiatives Creates a culture of customer focus and high performance to drive innovation. Creates and pitches value for the GE investor while balancing that with the sometimes competing value for the external customer. Continuous engagement with focus on GE strategy for customer satisfaction Establishes framework for a culture of successful collaboration by defining a common understanding of who has decision rights and accountability, and how collaboration and transparency are rewarded Establishes vision, Identifies and champions internal/external best practices, tools, and ideas to improve execution and quality. Drives an organization of efficiency, accountability and ownership Able to verbalize what is behind decisions and downstream implications. Continuously reflecting on success and failures to improve performance and decision-making. Understands when change is needed. Participates in technical strategy planning Uses critical thinking skills and disciplined approaches to help leaders and leadership teams resolve issues and define solutions. Evangelizes and contributes to the GE standards for critical thinking best practices and methodologies across the enterprise. Defines new critical thinking methods. Engages with external thought-leaders and communities on analytical and critical thinking methodologies Excellent communication skills and the ability to interface with senior leadership with confidence and clarity Evangelizes the notion that anything worth doing takes repeated effort and failure. Drives the organization toward a continued excitement of attaining the vision and goal in the face of resistance Innovates and integrates new processes and/or technology to significantly add value to GE. Identifies how the cost of change weighs against the benefits and advises accordingly. Proactively learns new solutions and processes to address seemingly unanswerable problems</description>

The goal of this Enterprise project is to implement a standardized Physician Organization (PO) diagnostic instrument/image application platform and integrate these offices with Houston Methodist. This requires a detailed inventory of current PO imaging devices, databases, workflows and 3rd party systems in 130 PO clinic locations (1000+ Providers). With the site information we'll formulate and execute a plan to consolidate these devices and 3rd party systems into the GE Centricity Clinical Archive (CCA) - a Vendor Neutral Archive. This project parallels the Health System Epic eHR implementation; at the conclusion of both initiatives, Houston Methodist will be a fully integrated electronic Health System.Current state: Houston Methodist hospitals major archives include the GE Centricity Enterprise PACS, GE Radiology RIS and PACS systems, a Cardiology PACS and the Digisonics DigiView cardiology system. Not all services and devices are integrated; many function in a stand alone capacity. The PO has numerous disparate legacy and client server PACS systems, dozens of freestanding diagnostic devices and a mixture of medical records schemas; however, the PACS are all IHE compliant.Scope -future state: Build and implement the Centricity Clinical Archive (Vendor Neutral Archive) by converting the existing GE Enterprise PACS into the VNA archive. All existing archives must be reconciled to a new Epic MRN then migrated. The PO PACS systems will be consolidated-migrated to the VNA. St. Joesph's & St. Catherine's radiology PACS will be migrated to the VNA. 35 existing cardiology disparate DigiView databases will consolidated into three (Echo/Vascular/Cath) & will be integrated with the VNA. In early 2017 the 3 DigiView databases will be consolidated & migrated to the Siemens Syngo system. We're implementing the GE MUSE & MARS systems; these will integrate with the VNA. Viewers: the GE Universal Viewer (diagnostic interpretations) & the GE Zero Foot Print viewer (view only).

<description>The VA New Jersey Health Care System (VANJHCS) in East Orange, NJ is recruiting for a full-time board certified Radiation Oncologist. The East Orange VA Medical Center is the only VA Radiation Oncology facility in New Jersey. This exciting opportunity includes clinical radiation oncology, teaching responsibilities and clinical research. The Radiation Oncology Department was completely renovated in 2009 to create a patient friendly environment. There is a large conference room that is available to support groups, nutritionists, social workers, psychologists and others supportive of cancer patients. The practice participates in clinical trials. On average, the facility treats 20 patients per day. Join a staff with 3 other Radiation Oncologists, 2 physicists, 8 rad techs and many other interdisciplinary staff The Radiation Oncology Service has an excellent reputation offering state-of-the-art equipment and technologies, such as Elekta Infinity Linear Accelerator, Siemens Oncor Linear Accelerator, Philips Big Bore CT Simulator, Varian Calypso system, Elekta Nucletron HDR and LDR systems, Philips Pinnacle Treatment Planning System, Elekta Monaco Treatment Planning System, MIM Maestro system, Elekta MOSAIQ EMR, Philips Vereos PET/CT (on order), and VMAT, IMRT, IGRT, 3DCRT, 4D, SRS, SBRT. The most common disease sites treated are prostate, lung, head and neck, esophagus and GI. The breast service is increasing yearly. The introduction of the lung cancer screening program in the VA is expected to increase the number of patients suitable for SBRT. The out-patient clinic sees new consults, on-treatment patients, follow-up appointments and procedures. Calypso beacons or gold fiducials markers for prostate localization are placed in the Radiation Oncology Department by a Radiation Oncologist. It is an ACR Accredited Radiation Oncology Program and our cancer program is accredited by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. The program is a residency training site for the Rutgers Robert Wood Johnson Medical School Department of Radiation Oncology Residency Program. The residency position is funded by the VA. VA physicians practice medicine more and spend less time on business tasks. Enjoy an environment that supports an interdisciplinary care team approach that delivers state-of-the-art medicine using some of the most advanced medical techniques and technologies in the nation. Enjoy a good quality of life with access to New York City, the beautiful beaches of the Jersey Shore and the Pocono and Catskill mountains. VA ensures and encourages a healthy work/life balance. VA does so through predictable scheduling, reduced paperwork, the elimination of billing hassles, and lifting the burden of liability coverage. VA offers a comprehensive benefits package and malpractice insurance coverage is provided at no cost to you. Educational loan repayment may also be available. If youd like to be contacted by someone about this opportunity, please feel free to e-mail your CV to Julieann.Torres@va.gov and Ill be happy to connect you with the appropriate individual(s) who can then speak with you specifically about the opportunity. The Veterans Health Administration (VHA), under the Department of Veterans Affairs, serves the needs of America's Veterans by providing primary care, specialized care, and related medical and social support services. To accomplish this mission, VHA strives to be a comprehensive, integrated health care system that provides excellence in health care value, excellence in service as defined by its customers, and excellence in education and research. Join VA -The Best Care-The Best Careers. View Full Employer Profile</description>

Successfully delivered the SWASH programme, which is a consortium of four Trusts (Portsmouth, Southampton, IoW and Salisbury), where the NHS is the prime contractor. Philips delivered a highly secure Primary and Secondary Data Centre, the N3 links to the data centres, the Central and local VNA solution from Acuo, and undertook data migration from the legacy PACS systems. This was effectively all completed in six months. Phase 2 is currently being developed and will allow Trusts to share image and studies across the consortium based on XDS technologies provided by Forcare.My role was to project manage the programme for Philips, ensuring the scope, plans and quality assurance met the contract requirements. In addition I was responsible for driving the implementation of SWASH Phase 1, managing the external stakeholders at the consortium and Trusts, overseeing subcontractors and controlling the risks and issues.

Job Description: **_ _** **_Position Highlights:_** * The IS Analyst works as a member of the Clinical Information Services team to implement and/or support the PACS applications; General Electric Centricity PACS, Siemens SyngoDynamics PACS, Acuo Vendor Neutral PACS Archive, Mmodal Fluency Voice Recognition system, Merge CVIS/Hemodynamics, GE DMS/Hemodynamics, and other clinical applications requested by Rush. * Supports the roll-out of new functionality by participating in end-user design/validation sessions, user acceptance testing, training module development, integrated testing and command center support. * Supports live applications and sites by sharing on-call support, monitoring helpdesk tickets and designing enhancement and optimization solutions. **_Position Responsibilities:_** * Accomplishes tasks with minimal supervision. Monitors own progress and results. * Actively suggests changes that enhance IS operations or customer service. * Guides Associates. Demonstrates experience in specific technologies, applications or platforms. * Responsible for requirements gathering, system builds, and workflow analysis. * Defines tasks, deliverables and estimates the effort required to accomplish them. * Communicates clearly and effectively with Customers to obtain results. Is able to communicate user needs and requests to IS management. * Contributes to technical documentation or end user manuals. * Informally assists others in learning about the IS or business environment. * Demonstrates business or technical expertise through outside learning opportunities (formal training, associations, business groups, etc.) * Understands basic heath care industry concepts. * Has a broad knowledge of application/infrastructure integration and data flow. * Able to articulate Customer business problems. * Identifies and actively participates in areas for improvement within departments and Rush. **_Position Qualifications Include_**_:_ * * **Knowledge:** * Minimum 2 years of experience. * Experience with one or more of the following applications required: General Electric Centricity PACS, Siemens SyngoDynamics PACS, Acuo Vendor Neutral PACS Archive, Mmodal Fluency Voice Recognition system, Merge CVIS/Hemodynamics, GE DMS/Hemodynamics * Experience working in hospital or other health care organization strongly preferred **Skills:** * Experience implementing industry best practices to drive optimized operations. * Excellent communication skills with technical and clinical audiences * Excellent analytical skills. * Exceptional organizational skills to facilitate work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment. **Abilities:** * Able to articulate customer business problems. * Able to work with systems utilized by one's area. * Command of common office tools (eg Microsoft Office Suite, Visio, e-mail) **_Company Highlights:_** **_ _** * Ranked among the top academic medical centers in the country, Rush University Medical Center is an outstanding place to enhance your career. Everything we do centers on one goal: improving patient care. * Rush is a not-for-profit health care, education and research enterprise comprising Rush University Medical Center,Rush University, Rush Oak Park Hospital and Rush Health. * Leading academic medical center, acute care hospital w/ 664 licensed beds * Rush offers a competitive salary, valuable healthy living benefits to include: health, dental and vision to help you maintain and improve your health. Rush also offers several ways to invest in your future. Whether you're saving for retirement or a child's education, Rush offers benefits to help you make the most of your money now and in the future. * As one of the most popular cities in the nation, Chicago is a cultural, historical and diverse city. Located on the shores of Lake Michigan, Chicago in known for its nearly 200 distinct neighborhoods and its extensive park systems, along with its sports teams, museums and vibrant theater community. Rush is an equal opportunity employer. Position provides administrative, coordinating and technological support for the IM department by sending radiologic images over WAN and LAN between centers and to radiologists. Works to ensure all record requests are fulfilled in an appropriate manner and all patient records are accurately maintained. * Creates a positive experience for every customer, every day by believing in and practicing the CDI Experience * Answers questions that radiologists may have about exams that were performed * Assists radiologists with entering outside reads, networking and assigning cases following the appropriate guidelines (ie not assigning an exam until all images, current and prior, have been received by the reading radiologist * Assists in training new associates * Assists with updating and maintaining pertinent step-by-step guidelines * Burns CDs as requested and duplicates films as requested * Checks ACUO, eFilm and computers for proper function, ie networking errors * Checks department voice mail and email in a timely manner * Checks FusionRIS for each site and modality for "pending manual association' * Checks the library for any re-film (or CD burn) exams when needed * Checks the library ensuring that exams are filmed/burned to CD and distributed accordingly * Checks with on-call radiologist concerning exams that need to be networked to their homes on a daily basis * Communicates with attorney and insurance companies regarding patient records * Communicates with patients to ensure they receive the records they have requested * Communicates with referring physician offices by giving them verbal reports of transcribed medical reports * Distributes the reports to the various interoffice locations (Billing Office, study files, etc.) * Edits CareStream and ACUO patient information ensuring for proper image identifiers are correct for the reading radiologist * Ensures accurate and timely filing of patient medical reports and films and retrieval of same * Ensures that after hour reads are setup for the radiologist that is to read the scan * Ensures that 100% of all read/call or STAT studies have a radiologist secured, are read and are called/assigned to the referring physician on the day of the study (follow the appropriate P&P) * Files and organizes the courier lists of outgoing films and reports * Finds and retrieves outside films for doctors, technologists, and research * Follows all HIPAA guidelines for release of information * Follows up with radiologist if previous day's exams not read * Forwards images and paperwork to appropriate radiologist and location * Imports CDs, copies and/or digitizes films of outside read exams and networks them to the appropriate radiologist as needed * Knowledgeable and competent in utilizing digitizers * Knowledgeable and competent in utilizing on software and programs, ie ACUO, eFilm, etc. * Maintain and distribute RadPeer reviews monthly; enter RadPeer input online * Merges duplicate accounts while ensuring that the current patient information is correct * Performs duties as assigned by management and as required to operate the business as determined by CDI * Prepares the daily duplicates and reports for delivery by the various courier services * Prints reports and documents location for outside comparison films * Replenishes department office supplies including fax machine and printer paper * Restores previous exams and request outside prior exams for comparisons * Ships all other items leaving clinic using preferred shipper as needed * Troubleshoots FusionRIS, ACUO, Carestream and eFilm issues * Uses personal and/or company vehicle to pick up and deliver medical records and other packages to referring physician offices and other customer offices in the local market area as required Category: N/A

incoming and outgoing medical report requests are processed on a daily basis * Answers telephone requests for patient files from referring physician offices and patients * Prepares the daily duplicates and reports for delivery by the various courier services * Files and organizes the courier lists of outgoing films and reports * Ships all other items leaving clinic using preferred shipper as needed * Finds and retrieves outside films for doctors, technologists, and research * Communicates with attorney and insurance companies regarding patients * Communicates with patients to ensure they receive the records they have requested * Follows all HIPAA guidelines for release of information (20%) Technological Support * Copies CD's of outside read exams when needed * Forwards images and paperwork to appropriate radiologist and location * Assists Radiologist Assistant with entering outside reads, networking and assigning cases * Checks ACUO, eFilm and computers for proper function * Troubleshoots FusionRIS, ACUO and eFilm issues * Checks FuisonRIS for each site and modality for pending manual assignment * Checks with on-call radiologist concerning exams that need to be networked to their homes on a daily basis * Ensures that after hour reads are setup for the radiologist that is to read the scan (10%) Administrative Support * Checks department voice mail and email in a timely accurately Ensures all patient data is entered into information systems completely and accurately Ensures patients are advised of financial responsibilities, appropriate clothing, preparation kits, transportation and/or eating prior to appointment Communicates to technologists any scheduling changes in order to ensure highest patient satisfaction Understands how and when to roll phones on and off answering service Alerts other clinics of phone problems that are passed along to your clinic Handles overflow calls for other centers within market to ensure uninterrupted exam scheduling for referring offices Maintains an up-to-date and accurate database on all current and potential referring physicians Obtains and enters new referring physician information in computer system data base and passes along to marketing for follow up Arranges transportation and hotel accommodations for patients when appropriate Provides back up coverage for front office staff as needed (i.e., rest Assists radiologists with entering outside reads, networking and assigning cases following the appropriate guidelines (i.e. not assigning an exam until all images, current and prior, have been received by the reading radiologist ? Checks ACUO, eFilm and computers for proper function, i.e. networking errors ? Checks department voice mail and email in a timely manner ? Checks FusionRIS for each site and modality for pending manual association ? Checks the library for any re-film (or CD burn) exams when needed ? Checks the library ensuring that exams are filmed/burned to CD and distributed accordingly ? Communicates with patients to ensure they receive the records they have requested ? Communicates with referring physician offices by giving them verbal reports of transcribed medical reports ? Distributes the reports to the various interoffice locations (Billing Office, study files, etc.) ? Edits CareStream and ACUO patient information ensuring for proper image identifiers are correct for the reading radiologist ? Ships all other items leaving clinic using preferred shipper as needed ? Troubleshoots FusionRIS, ACUO, Carestream and eFilm issues ? Ability to effectively communicate with patients and staff using excellent interpersonal and communication skills ? Ability to effectively handle multiple tasks and frequent interruptions ? <description>Center for Diagnostic Imaging (CDI), headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota for more than three decades, partnered with Insight Imaging in 2012 to create one of the nations largest radiology providers for fixed site and mobile diagnostic imaging and interventional services. Together we have 116 retail imaging centers, 128 mobile units and operate in more than thirty states. Our organization will serve nearly a million patients in 2013, offering a wide range of screening, diagnostic and interventional procedures that complement each communitys needs, in collaboration with radiologists, healthcare providers, hospitals and health systems. We are currently seeking a full-time, Health Information Associate to join our center in Winter Park, FL. This position will be Monday-Friday 10:30 am - 7:00 pm. JOB SUMMARY: Position provides administrative, coordinating and technological support for the Image and Records Services department by sending radiologic images over WAN and LAN between centers and to radiologists. Works to ensure all record requests are fulfilled in an appropriate manner and all patient records are accurately maintained. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Creates a positive experience for every customer, every day by believing in and practicing the CDI Experience Answers questions that radiologists may have about exams that were performed Assists radiologists with entering outside reads, networking and assigning cases following the appropriate guidelines (i.e. not assigning an exam until all images, current and prior, have been received by the reading radiologist Assists in training new associates Assists with updating and maintaining pertinent step-by-step guidelines Burns CDs as requested and duplicates films as requested Checks ACUO, eFilm and computers for proper function, i.e. networking errors and troubleshoots as necessary Checks department voice mail and email in a timely manner Checks FusionRIS for each site and modality for pending manual association Checks the library for any re-film (or CD burn) exams when needed, ensuring that exams are filmed/burned to CD and distributed accordingly Forwards images and paperwork to appropriate radiologist and location, including on-call radiologist on a daily basis Communicates with attorneys, insurance companies and patients regarding records requests Communicates with referring physician offices by giving them verbal reports of transcribed medical reports Distributes reports to the various interoffice locations (Billing Office, study files, etc.) Edits CareStream and ACUO patient information ensuring for proper image identifiers are correct for the reading radiologist Ensures accurate and timely filing of patient medical reports and films and retrieval of same Ensures that after hour reads are setup for the radiologist that is to read the scan Ensures that 100% of all read/call or STAT studies have a radiologist secured, are read and are called/assigned to the referring physician on the day of the study (follow the appropriate P&P) Files and organizes the courier lists of outgoing films and reports Finds and retrieves outside films for doctors, technologists, and research Follows all HIPAA guidelines for release of information Follows up with radiologist if previous days exams not read Imports CDs, copies and/or digitizes films of outside read exams and networks them to the appropriate radiologist as needed Maintains and distributes RadPeer reviews monthly; enter RadPeer input online Merges duplicate accounts while ensuring that the current patient information is correct Prepares the daily duplicates and reports for delivery by the various courier services Prints reports and documents location for outside comparison films Restores previous exams and request outside prior exams for comparisons Ships all other items leaving clinic using preferred shipper as needed Uses
