<description>Job Summary We are currently seeking a Medical Records Associate. This role is a job sharing role where you would work in medical records from 9:30am-3:00pm and Tele-radiology/IC from 3:00pm-5:30pm. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBLITIES: Creates a positive experience for every customer, every day by believing in and practicing The Experience (65%) Medical Records Administration Ensures that all incoming and outgoing medical report requests are processed on a daily basis Answers telephone requests for patient files from referring physician offices and patients Prepares the daily duplicates and reports for delivery by the various courier services Files and organizes the courier lists of outgoing films and reports Ships all other items leaving clinic using preferred shipper as needed Finds and retrieves outside films for doctors, technologists, and research Communicates with attorney and insurance companies regarding patients Communicates with patients to ensure they receive the records they have requested Follows all HIPAA guidelines for release of information (20%) Technological Support Copies CD's of outside read exams when needed Forwards images and paperwork to appropriate radiologist and location Assists Radiologist Assistant with entering outside reads, networking and assigning cases Checks ACUO, eFilm and computers for proper function Troubleshoots FusionRIS, ACUO and eFilm issues Checks FuisonRIS for each site and modality for pending manual assignment Checks with on-call radiologist concerning exams that need to be networked to their homes on a daily basis Ensures that after hour reads are setup for the radiologist that is to read the scan (10%) Administrative Support Checks department voice mail and email in a timely manner Follows up with radiologist if previous day's exams not read Replenishes department office supplies including fax machine and printer paper (5%) Performs other duties as assigned Location 050 - Alexandria, MN Status Full-time Requirements SUMMARY OF QUALIFICATIONS: Required: High school diploma or equivalent Minimum 1 year Microsoft Office experience Data entry experience Proficient with using computer systems and typing Preferred: Previous medical records experience Bilingual HIPAA knowledge Be a part of something bigger -- join our team in transforming lives through remarkable service. CDI is a national provider network of medical imaging and related services. Through our collection of partnerships, we deliver our trademark customer service and high-quality services to enhance patient care in more than 35 states, offering a wide range of screening, diagnostic and interventional procedures that complement each community's needs. CDI is an EO Employer/Vets/Disabled. CDI is an equal opportunity employer; applicants are considered without discrimination with regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or other statuses protected by state, local or other applicable laws. This policy extends to all aspects of employment, including recruitment and hiring. CDI and its associates have an employment relationship, which is known as employment-at-will. This means that either CDI or an associate has the right to terminate the employment relationship at any time, for any reason with or without cause or prior notice.</description><experience>1+ years</experience><education>High School or Equivalent</education>

Job Summary: Position is responsible for working on the Corporate Infrastructure Team. This person will be a member of team that manages PACS, VNA, Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, file and print, ILM, System Center, SQL, application servers, Exchange 2007, OCS, VMware, and various collaboration systems, In addition, the Corporate Network, Storage (ie SAN, NAS), Desktop, and Service Desk all fall under this team. Essential Duties: Responsible for enterprise-wide software distributions including: PACS administration VNA support Building and deploying software distribution packages for designated applications based on System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM). Upgrade/Update software to latest version Deploy new software applications Designing and implementing test plans for software applications and patches on all desktop images. Completing necessary debugging procedures to rollout applications error-free. Developing support procedures, technical documentation, other related documentation, and training Technical Support personnel in the use and support of new products and systems. Works directly with business unit managers in the development, implementation and deployment of enterprise wide software distribution. Ensures software deployment will meet required business criteria. Proactively reviews and resolves assigned escalated trouble tickets from Technical Support. Also effectively communicates the resolution of end-user problems to the designated Technical Support team members to ensure user satisfaction and productivity. Assumes lead technical engineer position during escalated issues when necessary. Responsible for guiding Technical Support team members in providing creative solutions to end-user problems, questions and troubleshooting techniques Independently manage assigned projects and coordinates all tasks to other project team members. Create and maintain desktop and laptop master images. 2nd Line Support Provide 2nd line support to Desktop Support team members, on-call support, and internal customer support as assigned Maintaining Archiving Policy Region and country specific May be hospital specific Deleting studies when requested Access control 2nd tier Support for external software installation including: Firewall settings Proxy Settings VPN Connections Meet with and answer questions from external IT departments Standard application and computer support in the product group as assigned Assist in filling out security request forms from hospitals Liaison with shared services when developing and implementation of new technology Documentation Ensure that each facility / group is keeping and maintaining the necessary documentation Assist with developing standard corporate documentation Working knowledge of VMWare Virtual infrastructure and other virtualization technologies. Supporting Duties & Responsibilities: Infrastructure Administration and Support Work with team members in implementing proactive server monitoring, performance monitoring, and application tuning using the corporate tools, such as Microsoft System Center, Solar Winds, and Cacti, Acuo and MedWeb. Assist with implementing, securing, maintaining and supporting Windows based services, including AD, DHCP, DNS, SQL Server, IIS, Acuo and MedWeb and Exchange. Performs related duties as required. Job Specifications: Requires the ability to PACS administrator: ensures timely and complete capture of (DICOM) image data into the PACS system. manage network transmission , and exceptions handling. Technical Engineering Support: Support for the implementation, integration of PACS and VNAsystems. Optimize & Monitor: Optimize configuration settings for performance and reliability. Setup and optimize monitoring of PACS and VNA Analyze System Trending: You will provide systems statistical trending and analysis, server capacity and threshold testing, systems documentation maintenance. Problem Solving: Provide technical expertise for resolving critical production systems issues. You will also work with other teams or members to troubleshoot complex support issues, identify root causes and develop mitigation options. Your desire to improve, evolve and revolutionize the systems and processes you are exposed to will drive towards 99.9+% service availability goals Use independent judgment in making critical project decisions Install, assemble and configure server hardware / software Strong verbal and written communication skills, including working with external customers in the healthcare field, including physicians. Strong communication, organization, and documentation skills Strong customer service skills to deliver quality results in a demanding environment. Strong people and communications skills are the PACS administrator''s most important quality. Individual must interact extensively with internal customers including: all levels of management, business and IT, as well as external customers, and is required to act in a professional and confident manner. Good understanding of processes around IT Service Management Self motivator possessing a high sense of urgency and a high level of integrity Experience with Windows 2003 servers in a mid- to large-size production environment Administration and engineering skills for all Windows services including AD, WINS, DNS, DFS, and DHCP Thorough knowledge of Windows security policies. Some knowledge of application packaging products (eg Install Shield / Wise Package Studio, etc.) Demonstrates previous experience in a senior server engineering and support role. Working knowledge in VBScript, VB.NET Some knowledge of MSSQL Stored procedure and SQL Reporting Services Skills And Abilities: A bachelor''s degree in a related health-care discipline or information systems discipline is required. A master''s degree in a related field is strongly preferred. CPAS-Technical, CPAS-Clinical, CPIA or CPSM certifications are preferred. four or more years of related experience in health-care project management is preferred. This position requires a self-driven, passionate and experienced System Engineer to support enterprise scale monitoring and reporting Must be proficient with Imaging software and techniques such as Ghost, Altiris, and Sysprep. Working knowledge of Microsoft SCOM and Active Directory administration; desired. Administration and engineering knowledge of the following: Exchange 2007, Office Communication Server, Blackberry Enterprise Server, VMware ESX, Active Directory, IIS. Working Climate: Tasks involve the ability to exert light physical effort in sedentary to light work, but may involve some lifting, carrying, pushing or pulling of objects and materials of weight up to 25 pounds. Disclaimer: This job description indicated the general nature and level of work expected of the incumbent. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the incumbent. Incumbent may be asked to perform other duties as required.

<description>Position Highlights: The IS Analyst works as a member of the Clinical Information Services team to implement and/or support the PACS applications; General Electric Centricity PACS, Siemens SyngoDynamics PACS, Acuo Vendor Neutral PACS Archive, Mmodal Fluency Voice Recognition system, Merge CVIS/Hemodynamics, GE DMS/Hemodynamics, and other clinical applications requested by Rush. Supports the roll-out of new functionality by participating in end-user design/validation sessions, user acceptance testing, training module development, integrated testing and command center support. Supports live applications and sites by sharing on-call support, monitoring helpdesk tickets and designing enhancement and optimization solutions. Position Responsibilities: Accomplishes tasks with minimal supervision. Monitors own progress and results. Actively suggests changes that enhance I S operations or customer service. Guides Associates. Demonstrates experience in specific technologies, applications or platforms. Responsible for requirements gathering, system builds, and workflow analysis. Defines tasks, deliverables and estimates the effort required to accomplish them. Communicates clearly and effectively with Customers to obtain results. Is able to communicate user needs and requests to IS management. Contributes to technical documentation or end user manuals. Informally assists others in learning about the IS or business environment. Demonstrates business or technical expertise through outside learning opportunities (formal training, associations, business groups, etc.) Understands basic heath care industry concepts. Has a broad knowledge of application/infrastructure integration and data flow. Able to articulate Customer business problems. Identifies and actively participates in areas for improvement within departments and Rush. Position Qualifications Include : Knowledge: Minimum 2 years of experience. Experience with one or more of the following applications required: General Electric Centricity PACS, Siemens SyngoDynamics PACS, Acuo Vendor Neutral PACS Archive, Mmodal Fluency Voice Recognition system, Merge CVIS/Hemodynamics, GE DMS/Hemodynamics Experience working in hospital or other health care organization strongly preferred Skills: Experience implementing industry best practices to drive optimized operations. Excellent communication skills with technical and clinical audiences Excellent analytical skills. Exceptional organizational skills to facilitate work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment. Abilities: Able to articulate customer business problems. Able to work with systems utilized by one's area. Command of common office tools (e.g. Microsoft Office Suite, Visio, e-mail) Company Highlights: Ranked among the top academic medical centers in the country, Rush University Medical Center is an outstanding place to enhance your career. Everything we do centers on one goal: improving patient care. Rush is a not-for-profit health care, education and research enterprise comprising Rush University Medical Center, Rush University, Rush Oak Park Hospital and Rush Health. Leading academic medical center, acute care hospital w/ 664 licensed beds Rush offers a competitive salary, valuable healthy living benefits to include: health, dental and vision to help you maintain and improve your health. Rush also offers several ways to invest in your future. Whether you're saving for retirement or a child's education, Rush offers benefits to help you make the most of your money...now and in the future. As one of the most popular cities in the nation, Chicago is a cultural, historical and diverse city. Located on the shores of Lake Michigan, Chicago in known for its nearly 200 distinct neighborhoods and its extensive park systems, along with its sports teams, museums and vibrant theater community. Rush is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.</description>

Radiology Applications Support. Primary support for Radnet, GE Centricity (versions: 3.1, 3.2, 4.0.3) PACS, Powerscribe 360, Radwhere, Acuo VNA. Secondary support for Syngo.Via, Vital Enterprise, and other related imaging applications.
Support and configuration of Acuo VNA/Deconstructed PACS. Data migration from local PACS to enterprise VNA. Integration with modalities, Visage viewer, Powerscribe, and Epic.

Ensure efficient and effective operations of Mckesson Radiology, Merge Cardiology PACS, Acuo VNA and Nuance PowerScribe 360 for three medical centers and three regional hospitals. Act as liaison, oversee and coordinate existing and new digital imaging initiatives with Radiology and Cardiology departments. Data maintainer for ITS Meditech module and oversee Mckesson/Meditech PACS interface. Provide PACS support to end users.
Provide ongoing and upgrade support for PowerScribe 360, Acuo VNA and Visage 3d Image Viewer.

Key IT resource for implementation and support of medical imaging applications including Merge FusionRIS, Merge Efilm DICOM viewer, VNA-Acuo Technologies, iCAD for Womens Imaging, and referring physician portal. The Radiology Systems Analyst I, under general direction, is responsible for build of system administration parameters that promotes efficient workflows for Radiologists and Radiology Technologists, responsive and proactive management of data and image integrity, and provides effective training in the use of technology for order, image and clinical reporting. They will also act as a liaison between Radiology and other departments related to enterprise digital imaging initiatives and other computer applications that enhance the quality of patient care.The role requires knowledge of PACS system application and technology platform, PACS system administration industry administration standards, dictation and voice recognition technologies and how they interface with PACS and RIS, informatics technologies, and radiologist and radiology technologist workflows and practices.The Radiology Systems Analyst I assists the Radiology Systems Analyst II, III, or Supervisor in interpreting business needs and requirements and translate those needs into the development and/or enhancement of technologies. In addition, this role provides analytical expertise to information systems end users with the overall objective of improving the use of technology functionality, i.e. enhance work flow, optimize business processes and identify appropriate systems solutions.ScheduleRadiology Systems Analyst I position plans and provides the ongoing support of the PACS, RIS, voice recognition and other supporting imaging systems. This includes daily monitoring and troubleshooting with physicians and operational staff, project management for system upgrades, integration testing and new physician or staff training. This position is also responsible for the implementation of new systems and identifying new avenues of efficiency that can be gained from these or existing technologies.Mon  Fri - 2nd shift (3:30pm  12:00am)Requirements Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Health Information Systems or equivalent work experience in business or related field required At least 2+ years relevant experience in an Information Services or Radiology/Cardiology Department Prior experience with hardware and software implementation, network infrastructure and project management is preferred Excellent verbal and written communications skills Strong coordination, facilitation, consultation and conflict resolution skillsRadiology Specific Requirements Understand and comply with all enterprise and IS departmental information security policies, procedures and standards Support the integration of information security in the development, design, and implementation of Hospital Technology Resources that process, transmit, or store CHOP information Support all compliance activities related to state, federal regulatory requirements, healthcare accreditation standards, and all other applicable regulations that govern the use and disclosure of patient, financial, or other confidential information Support and maintain all existing radiology applications (ACUO, ISite, SCIMAGE, Powerscribe, internal and external storage) and all other applications as assigned Maintain and support all desk top and At Home machines for clinical staff Project support and testingDepartment Specific Job Responsibilities May be required to travel to/from and work in the various CHOP locations, including patient care areas. May be required to travel for mandatory certifications. May be considered a Health Care Worker which would require mandatory vaccinations/screenings. Demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of computer systems, radiology applications and interfaces. Strong communication and customer service skills Analyzes and resolves complex system integration problems. The ability to identify and solve complex problems independently and multi-task in a dynamic environment Demonstrates an advanced understanding of the CHOP business functions.Additional Technical Requirements Proficient skills in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Power Point, etc.). A demonstrated knowledge of cross application/system workflow and data relationships is required. Proficient skills in basic computer technology support.The incumbent shall demonstrate behaviors consistent with the core values in support with Children Hospital of Philadelphia and the Mission and Philosophy of Radiology Department.All CHOP employees who work in a patient building or who provide patient care are required to receive an annual influenza vaccine unless they are granted a medical or religious exemption.

Successfully delivered the SWASH programme, which is a consortium of four Trusts (Portsmouth, Southampton, IoW and Salisbury), where the NHS is the prime contractor. Philips delivered a highly secure Primary and Secondary Data Centre, the N3 links to the data centres, the Central and local VNA solution from Acuo, and undertook data migration from the legacy PACS systems. This was effectively all completed in six months. Phase 2 is currently being developed and will allow Trusts to share image and studies across the consortium based on XDS technologies provided by Forcare.My role was to project manage the programme for Philips, ensuring the scope, plans and quality assurance met the contract requirements. In addition I was responsible for driving the implementation of SWASH Phase 1, managing the external stakeholders at the consortium and Trusts, overseeing subcontractors and controlling the risks and issues.

Clinical Imaging Application Specialist - Remote (Plano, TX)Dell is seeking a Clinical Imaging Application Specialist to join our team. This position would work with a team primarily based remotely, and with client hospitals and their referring physician community across the United States. We prefer a candidate local to the Dallas/Ft Worth area, but will consider the right non-local applicants. Regardless of location, this is a virtual position and the candidate needs to be comfortable and experienced with delivering services in such an environment.As a Clinical Imaging Application Specialist , you will work with a team of specialists supporting the archival storage and distribution of radiology reports and images to care providers and systems across a large multi-site health systems. Your primary role is to directly address problems and questions from application users; monitor the operation of the application; and, provide day-to-day maintenance updates to the application configuration and user profiles. You will work closely with application leaders, clinical imaging vendors, technical infrastructure teams, PACS Administrators and care delivery staff.Role Responsibilities- Rapidly become an expert in the operation of the application with minimal formal training- Receive, record and address application issues reported via telephone; email or through an incident reporting system- Work with application vendors on issues requiring further assistance to resolve- Test new application updates and releases- Administer promotion control procedures for application updates to test and production systems- Compose and broadcast application alerts to the user community when warranted- Review and process system access requests- Monitor key system logs on a daily basis- Work with PACS Administrators to resolve image and report transmission reconciliation errors- Prepare and deliver remote application briefs and training utilizing PowerPoint and other presentation tool- Coordinate and implement non-DICOM data storage in the archive application- Report detailed status of activities and application issues on a scheduled Requirements- Undergraduate degree and 4 years, or Graduate degree and 2 years of experience with clinical image viewing applications- Command of MS Office products- Strong experience with the support or delivery of clinical healthcare applications and services- Exceptional verbal, written and customer communication and support skills- Successful history of accomplishments in a team environment- Ability to prioritize and manage work in a fast-paced environmentPreferences- 3 years providing support for clinical imaging applications (PACS/CPACS) - Fully familiar with the clinical workflow and care delivery process in clinical imaging delivery environments - Specific experience with the Merge iConnect Access and Share applications - Understanding/experience with the Acuo VNA Application - Health Care or Information Systems related advanced degreeCompany DescriptionWith more than 100,000 team members globally, we promote an environment that is rooted in the entrepreneurial spirit in which the company was founded. Dells team members are committed to serving our communities, regularly volunteering for over 1,500 non-profit organizations. The company has also received many accolades from employer of choice to energy conservation. Our team members follow an open approach to technology innovation and believe that technology is essential for human success.Why work with us?- Life at Dell means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology.- When we see something that could be improved, we get to work inventing the solution.- Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships.

<description>Job Title: Information Systems Analyst II - PACS Job ID Number: 25006-72597 Facility: SUPPORT CENTERS Department: I/S - AMBULATORY CORE City: Oak Brook State: Illinois Hours per pay period: 80 hours Shift: Day Qualifications: BA/BS in Business or Computer Science or related field is a plus; or equivalent experience (3-4 years) in Information Systems Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills; demonstrated technical, analytical, and problem solving abilities; excellent tam player; and customer service orientation. Extensive travel to Advocate sites is required: and occasional out-of-town travel is required.24-hour/7 day a week on-call support is required. Job Description: The Information Systems Analyst II will manage the daily maintenance and project implementation activities for the ACUO VNA (Vendor Neutral Archive)long term image archive system, GE radiology Centricity PACS, Merge Cardiology PACS and Digisonics Maternal Fetal Monitoring PACS systems. Additional responsibilities: 1) Ensure proper data integrity within each system by debugging and resolving production issues. Manage & resolve daily patient demographic, exam, image reconciliation exceptions and issues. 2) Assist in leading and executing PACS system deployment initiatives with current state/future state design, build, test, implementation, post implementation transformation and system adoption project phases. 3) Document site specific nonstandard design and interdepartmental workflows used within current radiology imaging department and PACS systems. Assist in designing and implementing improved future state workflow and necessary design changes to the PACS systems. 4) Audit and where needed develop procedures for proper PACS system and application change control policies Education Experience: same as IT Analyst II, but also: Prior PACS Administration experience a plus. *Clinical Imaging Application Specialist - Remote (Plano, TX)* Dell is seeking a Clinical Imaging Application Specialist to join our team. This position would work with a team primarily based remotely, and with client hospitals and their referring physician community across the United States. We prefer a candidate local to the Dallas/Ft Worth area, but will consider the right non-local applicants. Regardless of location, this is a virtual position and the candidate needs to be comfortable and experienced with delivering services in such an environment. As a*Clinical Imaging Application Specialist*, you will work with a team of specialists supporting the archival storage and distribution of radiology reports and images to care providers and systems across a large multi-site health systems. Your primary role is to directly address problems and questions from application users; monitor the operation of the application; and, provide day-to-day maintenance updates to the application configuration and user profiles. You will work closely with application leaders, clinical imaging vendors, technical infrastructure teams, PACS Administrators and care delivery staff. Role Responsibilities* *- Rapidly become an expert in the operation of the application with minimal formal training - Receive, record and address application issues reported via telephone; email or through an incident reporting system - Work with application vendors on issues requiring further assistance to resolve - Test new application updates and releases - Administer promotion control procedures for application updates to test and production systems - Compose and broadcast application alerts to the user community when warranted - Review and process system access requests - Monitor key system logs on a daily basis -Work with PACS Administrators to resolve image and report transmission reconciliation errors - Prepare and deliver remote application briefs and training utilizing PowerPoint and other presentation tool -Coordinate and implement non-DICOM data storage in the archive application - Report detailed status of activities and application issues on a scheduled Requirements* *- Undergraduate degree and 4 years, or Graduate degree and 2 years of experience with clinical image viewing applications - Command of MS Office products - Strong experience with the support or delivery of clinical healthcare applications and services - Exceptional verbal, written and customer communication and support skills - Successful history of accomplishments in a team environment - Ability to prioritize and manage work in a fast-paced environment Preferences* *- 3 years providing support for clinical imaging applications (PACS/CPACS) -Fully familiar with the clinical workflow and care delivery process in clinical imaging delivery environments -Specific experience with the Merge iConnect Access and Share applications -Understanding/experience with the Acuo VNA Application -Health Care or Information Systems related advanced degree /Company Description//With more than 100,000 team members globally, we promote an environment that is rooted in the entrepreneurial spirit in which the company was founded. Dells team members are committed to serving our communities, regularly volunteering for over 1,500 non-profit organizations. The company has also received many accolades from employer of choice to energy conservation. Our team members follow an open approach to technology innovation and believe that technology is essential for human success./ /Why work with us?/ - Life at Dell means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology. - When we see something that could be improved, we get to work inventing the solution. - Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships. **Job:** **Application Management-Svcs IT* **Title:** *Clinical Imaging Application Specialist - Remote/Plano, TX* **Location:** *TX-Plano* **Requisition ID:** *15000SN2*

Ensures that current policies and procedures comply with regulatory requirements. Disaster / recovery and downtime procedures are updated and communicated. Responsible of the coordination, testing, upgrades and management of the clinical information systems as they relate to the practice of radiology/cath lab. These systems include but are not limited to: RIS - Radiology Information System Dictation system (s) MRS - Mammography Reporting System Teamsite - Health First Web Product PHS - Pathways Scheduling System HMI - McKesson PACS system Fuji  Synapse PACS SCM / XA / KBC- Clinical documentation systems CD - Communications Director With guidance from Director/Manager and Radiologist input, grows RIS/PACS functionality to align with the evolving needs of the department, not limited to upgrades, expansions, and process improvement. Actively participates on committees, councils, task forces and professional organizations where appropriate to meet the clinical needs and ongoing process improvement of the department. Develops and maintains written clinical information systems procedures to be approved by the department director. Coordinates the development, monitoring and presentation of Process Improvement Projects. Maintains professional growth by participating in approved educational programs and activities to ensure the knowledge of current trends, practices and development in technology and performance improvement. Serves as a liaison between Diagnostic Imaging, Information Technology, external vendors, field engineers, and tele-assistance entities, and various departments working in close proximity with all associates in Diagnostic Imaging and Information Technology to insure communication on all clinical issues. Plans and implements training programs for new associates and physicians. Provides ongoing continuing education regarding any information system upgrades. Serves as a resource to the Radiology Managers, Associates and Physicians for issues related to Information Technology. Demonstrate thought knowledge and ability to coordinate clinical design to support departmental strategies. Accurately and promptly analyze requests related to project implementation and /or project changes; Encourages innovation. Reviews monthly project plans and reports to appropriate committees as evidence in minutes and/or written documentation. Prepares and presents to management monthly volume data sourced from RIS. Knowledgeable in Current Procedural Codes/Diagnosis Codes for proper charging and automation of RIS rules/parameters to coordinate their transition to the corporate revenue cycle. JobRadiologyOrganizationHolmes Regional Medical CenterPrimary LocationUnited States-Florida - Brevard County-MelbourneShift TimesVariable BS degree in area of specialization or other related field, preferred. 5+ years system experience. 3 years project management experience. Thorough knowledge in the utilization of PC desktop applications. Excellent leadership skills. Excellent project management skills. Demonstrate proficiency in the use of project management tools. Organizational skills; ability to prioritize work and manage time. Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously. Ability to analyze complex tasks, systems and problems. Determine possible solutions and design, implement and evaluation the most effective solutions. Ability to motivate and promote cooperation and understanding among team members. Ability to work tactfully and effectively with team members, vendors and the user community. Ability to make presentations to large groups. Must be able to respond to call within 30 minutes.

Imagine waking up excited to come to work, at a place where you have the opportunity to serve others. You make a difference - and have fun doing it! People are drawn to Women's Healthcare Associates because of our values-driven culture.Performs a variety of clerical support activities to assist providers and clinical staff in providing quality patient care, related primarily to our PathWays program.*This is a40 hr/week position. High school diploma or GED required. Medical office experience required, preferably in an OB/GYN medical group practice. Demonstrated advanced knowledge of medical practice management scheduling software. Knowledge of medical terminology and medical insurance practices. Knowledgeable in Microsoft Office products (Word, Outlook). Proven effective verbal, listening and written communication skills. Ability to multi-task and prioritize efficiently. Strong organizations skills with high attention to detail. Must be able to successfully complete a background check. Women's Healthcare Associates, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Works in collaboration with the OB Coordinator to successfully pass off PathWays scheduling responsibilities after initial OB visit. Schedules OB patient group visits in the PathWays model of care. Maintains a consistent schedule for PathWays patient tracking and follow up. Runs daily, weekly and monthly reports on PathWays patient visit status. Reviews previous day's appointments to ensure each PathWays patient has a follow up visit if needed. Contacts patients to assist them in scheduling missed or canceled appointments when appropriate. Co-facilitates PathWays group sessions. Helps set up and breakdown meetings. Provides back-up support to schedulers and patient services representatives as delegated. Updates patients' demographics in EMR system. Orders records from outside sources. Assists with referral reports and facilitates urgent referrals as requested. Takes phone messages efficiently and routes them in a timely manner to the appropriate certified medical assistant, nurse or clinician. Returns routine or non-clinical phone calls as delegated. Processes, copies and/or addresses lab letters, appointment reminders, after visit summaries, no show notices and other routine mailings to patients. Communicates with other clinician offices, hospitals and other outside sources as delegated. Performs radiology appointment scheduling for all outpatient exams. Communicates all exam preparation, exam protocol, and procedure information to patients, physicians, or office staff. Obtains and distributes clinical documentation, patient history and compliance documents coordinated with procedure. **Essential Functions** * Schedules outpatient procedures for services and obtains complete information as required for pre-certification, authorization, and referral. Reschedules appointments when necessary. * Coordinates various imaging procedures to eliminate exam conflicts with multiple type studies. * Performs medical necessity checks using ICD-9 diagnosis codes and radiology procedures for payor requirements. * Communicates proper exam preparation for all services at time of scheduling. * Submits images to Radiologists for biopsy determination, coordinating the scheduling with appropriate departments once determination is made. * Assists with lab screenings and alert offices of lab needs. * Maintains the storage, retrieval and distribution of outpatient radiology written orders and clinical information. **Physical Requirements** Works in a fast-paced office environment. Requires the ability to concentrate on moderate detail with constant interruption. Continuous telephone use. The ability to sit in one place for extended periods of time required. Walking, standing, sitting, reaching and lifting up to 25 lbs required. **Education, Experience and Certifications** High School Diploma or GED required. Previous radiology or scheduling experience required. Completion of medical terminology courses required if no scheduling experience. PC computer experience required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills required. **Posting Notes:** Not Applicable **Carolinas HealthCare System is an EOE/AA Employer**

Performs radiology appointment scheduling for all outpatient exams. Communicates all exam preparation, exam protocol, and procedure information to patients, physicians, or office staff. Obtains and distributes clinical documentation, patient history and compliance documents coordinated with procedure.

Essential Functions

  • Schedules outpatient procedures for services and obtains complete information as required for pre-certification, authorization, and referral. Reschedules appointments when necessary.

  • Coordinates various imaging procedures to eliminate exam conflicts with multiple type studies.

  • Performs medical necessity checks using ICD-9 diagnosis codes and radiology procedures for payor requirements.

To be fully engaged in providing Quality/No Harm, Customer Experience, and Stewardship by: Development and implementation of information technologies and systems that function as art of patient care services. Coordinates a variety of activities for the performance improvement of both information systems and patient care processes. This includes developing, communicating, education, maintaining and supporting systems, processes and procedures required to support the needs of the Diagnostic Imaging Department.Primary Accountabilities Maintains responsibility for implementation, follow through and evaluation of system projects through user feedback and performance improvement tools. Maintains responsibility for clinical competencies, mandatory requirements and professional licenses, required to provide coverage for all radiologic procedures. Ensures that current policies and procedures comply with regulatory requirements. Disaster / recovery and downtime procedures are updated and communicated. Performs annual policy review and if required new policies are written. Ensure proper maintenance of systems equipment at sites. (Cleaning PACS CPU units, Monitor calibrations.) Responsible of the coordination, testing, upgrades and management of the clinical information systems as they relate to the practice of radiology/cath lab. These systems include but are not limited to: RIS - Radiology Information System Dictation system (s) MRS - Mammography Reporting System Teamsite - Health First Web Product PHS - Pathways Scheduling System HMI - McKesson PACS system Fuji  Synapse PACS SCM / XA / KBC- Clinical documentation systems CD - Communications Director With guidance from Director/Manager and Radiologist input, grows RIS/PACS functionality to align with the evolving needs of the department, not limited to upgrades, expansions, and process improvement. Actively participates on committees, councils, task forces and professional organizations where appropriate to meet the clinical needs and ongoing process improvement of the department. Develops and maintains written clinical information systems procedures to be approved by the department director. Coordinates the development, monitoring and presentation of Process Improvement Projects. Maintains professional growth by participating in approved educational programs and activities to ensure the knowledge of current trends, practices and development in technology and performance improvement. Serves as a liaison between Diagnostic Imaging, Information Technology, external vendors, field engineers, and tele-assistance entities, and various departments working in close proximity with all associates in Diagnostic Imaging and Information Technology to insure communication on all clinical issues. Plans and implements training programs for new associates and physicians. Provides ongoing continuing education regarding any information system upgrades. Serves as a resource to the Radiology Managers, Associates and Physicians for issues related to Information Technology. Demonstrate thought knowledge and ability to coordinate clinical design to support departmental strategies. Accurately and promptly analyze requests related to project implementation and /or project changes; Encourages innovation. Reviews monthly project plans and reports to appropriate committees as evidence in minutes and/or written documentation. Prepares and presents to management monthly volume data sourced from RIS. Knowledgeable in Current Procedural Codes/Diagnosis Codes for proper charging and automation of RIS rules/parameters to coordinate their transition to the corporate revenue cycle. To be fully engaged in providing Quality/No Harm, Customer Experience, and Stewardship by: Development and implementation of information technologies and systems that function as art of patient care services. Coordinates a variety of activities for the performance improvement of both information systems and patient care processes. This includes developing, communicating, education, maintaining and supporting systems, processes and procedures required to support the needs of the Diagnostic Imaging Department.Primary Accountabilities Maintains responsibility for implementation, follow through and evaluation of system projects through user feedback and performance improvement tools. Maintains responsibility for clinical competencies, mandatory requirements and professional licenses, required to provide coverage for all radiologic procedures. Ensures that current policies and procedures comply with regulatory requirements. Disaster / recovery and downtime procedures are updated and communicated. Performs annual policy review and if required new policies are written. Ensure proper maintenance of systems equipment at sites. (Cleaning PACS CPU units, Monitor calibrations.) Responsible of the coordination, testing, upgrades and management of the clinical information systems as they relate to the practice of radiology/cath lab. These systems include but are not limited to: RIS - Radiology Information System Dictation system (s) MRS - Mammography Reporting System Teamsite - Health First Web Product PHS - Pathways Scheduling System HMI - McKesson PACS system Fuji  Synapse PACS SCM / XA / KBC- Clinical documentation systems CD - Communications Director With guidance from Director/Manager and Radiologist input, grows RIS/PACS functionality to align with the evolving needs of the department, not limited to upgrades, expansions, and process improvement. Actively participates on committees, councils, task forces and professional organizations where appropriate to meet the clinical needs and ongoing process improvement of the department. Develops and maintains written clinical information systems procedures to be approved by the department director. Coordinates the development, monitoring and presentation of Process Improvement Projects. Maintains professional growth by participating in approved educational programs and activities to ensure the knowledge of current trends, practices and development in technology and performance improvement. Serves as a liaison between Diagnostic Imaging, Information Technology, external vendors, field engineers, and tele-assistance entities, and various departments working in close proximity with all associates in Diagnostic Imaging and Information Technology to insure communication on all clinical issues. Plans and implements training programs for new associates and physicians. Provides ongoing continuing education regarding any information system upgrades. Serves as a resource to the Radiology Managers, Associates and Physicians for issues related to Information Technology. Demonstrate thought knowledge and ability to coordinate clinical design to support departmental strategies. Accurately and promptly analyze requests related to project implementation and /or project changes; Encourages innovation. Reviews monthly project plans and reports to appropriate committees as evidence in minutes and/or written documentation. Prepares and presents to management monthly volume data sourced from RIS. Knowledgeable in Current Procedural Codes/Diagnosis Codes for proper charging and automation of RIS rules/parameters to coordinate their transition to the corporate revenue cycle. JobRadiologyOrganizationHolmes Regional Medical CenterPrimary LocationUnited States-Florida - Brevard County-MelbourneShift TimesVariable BS degree in area of specialization or other related field, preferred. 5+ years system experience. 3 years project management experience. Thorough knowledge in the utilization of PC desktop applications. Excellent leadership skills. Excellent project management skills. Demonstrate proficiency in the use of project management tools. Organizational skills; ability to prioritize work and manage time. Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously. Ability to analyze complex tasks, systems and problems. Determine possible solutions and design, implement and evaluation the most effective solutions. Ability to motivate and promote cooperation and understanding among team members. Ability to work tactfully and effectively with team members, vendors and the user community. Ability to make presentations to large groups. Must be able to respond to call within 30 minutes.

Communicates all exam preparation and procedure information to patients. Communicates exam protocol to physicians and office staff. Highly effective verbal and written communication skills req.</description>

Req ID : 1333 Position Number: 00123161 Employment Type: Part Time Shift: Day Shift Details : Standard Hours: 4.00 Department Name: Radiology - Pathways Schedulin Location: CMC - NorthEast Location Details: Job Summary Performs radiology appointment scheduling for all outpatient exams. Communicates all exam preparation, exam protocol, and procedure information to patients, physicians, or office staff. Obtains and distributes clinical documentation, patient history and compliance documents coordinated with procedure. Essential Functions - Schedules outpatient procedures for services and obtains complete information as required for pre-certification, authorization, and referral. Reschedules appointments when necessary. - Coordinates various imaging procedures to eliminate exam conflicts with multiple type studies. - Performs medical necessity checks using ICD-9 diagnosis codes and radiology procedures for payor requirements. - Communicates proper exam preparation for all services at time of scheduling. - Submits images to Radiologists for biopsy determination, coordinating the scheduling with appropriate departments once determination is made. - Assists with lab screenings and alert offices of lab needs. - Maintains the storage, retrieval and distribution of outpatient radiology written orders and clinical information. Physical Requirements Works in a fast-paced office environment. Requires the ability to concentrate on moderate detail with constant interruption. Continuous telephone use. The ability to sit in one place for extended periods of time required. Walking, standing, sitting, reaching and lifting up to 25 lbs required. Education, Experience and Certifications High School Diploma or GED required. Previous radiology or scheduling experience required. Completion of medical terminology courses required if no scheduling experience. PC computer experience required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills required. Posting Notes: Not Applicable Carolinas HealthCare System is an EOE/AA Employer Job Overview Date Mon, 26 08 2013 00:00:00 GMT

Req ID: 38943 Position Number: 00123161 Employment Type: Part Time Shift: Day Shift Details: Mon - Fri (shifts will vary between the hours of 7a to 6 p) Standard Hours:4.00 Department Name: Radiology - Pathways Schedulin Location: CMC - NorthEast Location Details: Job Summary

Performs radiology appointment scheduling for all outpatient exams. Communicates all exam preparation, exam protocol, and procedure information to patients, physicians, or office staff. Obtains and distributes clinical documentation, patient history and compliance documents coordinated with procedure.

Essential Functions
  • Schedules outpatient procedures for services and obtains complete information as required for pre-certification, authorization, and referral. Reschedules appointments when necessary.
  • Coordinates various imaging procedures to eliminate exam conflicts with multiple type studies.
  • Performs medical necessity checks using ICD-9 diagnosis codes and radiology procedures for payor requirements.
  • Communicates proper exam preparation for all services at time of scheduling.
  • Submits images to Radiologists for biopsy determination, coordinating the scheduling with appropriate departments once determination is made.
  • Assists with lab screenings and alert offices of lab needs.
  • Maintains the storage, retrieval and distribution of outpatient radiology written orders and clinical information.
Physical Requirements

Works in a fast-paced office environment. Requires the ability to concentrate on moderate detail with constant interruption. Continuous telephone use. The ability to sit in one place for extended periods of time required. Walking, standing, sitting, reaching and lifting up to 25 lbs required.

Education, Experience and Certifications

High School Diploma or GED required. Previous radiology or scheduling experience required. Completion of medical terminology courses required if no scheduling experience. PC computer experience required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills required.

To be fully engaged in providing Quality/No Harm, Customer Experience, and Stewardship by: Development and implementation of information technologies and systems that function as art of patient care services. Coordinates a variety of activities for the performance improvement of both information systems and patient care processes. This includes developing, communicating, education, maintaining and supporting systems, processes and procedures required to support the needs of the Diagnostic Imaging Department.Primary Accountabilities Maintains responsibility for implementation, follow through and evaluation of system projects through user feedback and performance improvement tools. Maintains responsibility for clinical competencies, mandatory requirements and professional licenses, required to provide coverage for all radiologic procedures. Ensures that current policies and procedures comply with regulatory requirements. Disaster / recovery and downtime procedures are updated and communicated. Performs annual policy review and if required new policies are written. Ensure proper maintenance of systems equipment at sites. (Cleaning PACS CPU units, Monitor calibrations.) Responsible of the coordination, testing, upgrades and management of the clinical information systems as they relate to the practice of radiology/cath lab. These systems include but are not limited to: RIS - Radiology Information System Dictation system (s) MRS - Mammography Reporting System Teamsite - Health First Web Product PHS - Pathways Scheduling System HMI - McKesson PACS system Fuji  Synapse PACS SCM / XA / KBC- Clinical documentation systems CD - Communications Director With guidance from Director/Manager and Radiologist input, grows RIS/PACS functionality to align with the evolving needs of the department, not limited to upgrades, expansions, and process improvement. Actively participates on committees, councils, task forces and professional organizations where appropriate to meet the clinical needs and ongoing process improvement of the department. Develops and maintains written clinical information systems procedures to be approved by the department director. Coordinates the development, monitoring and presentation of Process Improvement Projects. Maintains professional growth by participating in approved educational programs and activities to ensure the knowledge of current trends, practices and development in technology and performance improvement. Serves as a liaison between Diagnostic Imaging, Information Technology, external vendors, field engineers, and tele-assistance entities, and various departments working in close proximity with all associates in Diagnostic Imaging and Information Technology to insure communication on all clinical issues. Plans and implements training programs for new associates and physicians. Provides ongoing continuing education regarding any information system upgrades. Serves as a resource to the Radiology Managers, Associates and Physicians for issues related to Information Technology. Demonstrate thought knowledge and ability to coordinate clinical design to support departmental strategies. Accurately and promptly analyze requests related to project implementation and /or project changes; Encourages innovation. Reviews monthly project plans and reports to appropriate committees as evidence in minutes and/or written documentation. Prepares and presents to management monthly volume data sourced from RIS. Knowledgeable in Current Procedural Codes/Diagnosis Codes for proper charging and automation of RIS rules/parameters to coordinate their transition to the corporate revenue cycle. Performs radiology appointment scheduling for all outpatient exams. Communicates all exam preparation, exam protocol, and procedure information to patients, physicians, or office staff. Obtains and distributes clinical documentation, patient history and compliance documents coordinated with procedure.

Essential Functions
  • Schedules outpatient procedures for services and obtains complete information as required for pre-certification, authorization, and referral. Reschedules appointments when necessary.
  • Coordinates various imaging procedures to eliminate exam conflicts with multiple type studies.
  • Performs medical necessity checks using ICD-9 diagnosis codes and radiology procedures for payor requirements.
  • Communicates proper exam preparation for all services at time of scheduling.
  • Submits images to Radiologists for biopsy determination, coordinating the scheduling with appropriate departments once determination is made.
  • Assists with lab screenings and alert offices of lab needs.
  • Maintains the storage, retrieval and distribution of outpatient radiology written orders and clinical information.
Physical Requirements

Works in a fast-paced office environment. Requires the ability to concentrate on moderate detail with constant interruption. Continuous telephone use. The ability to sit in one place for extended periods of time required. Walking, standing, sitting, reaching and lifting up to 25 lbs required.

Education, Experience and Certifications

High School Diploma or GED required. Previous radiology or scheduling experience required. Completion of medical terminology courses required if no scheduling experience. PC computer experience required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills required.

The Sr. Financial Analyst is an individual who is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and summarizing the financial implications of clinical practice. The Analyst develops conclusions and recommendations regarding historical, on-going, and prospective aspects of hospital operations, with a strong, future-oriented focus on the information needs of management in carrying out decision making responsibilities. This person should possess excellent analytical skills with a clear, practical understanding of the needs of both clinical and financial users. This individual will be instrumental in the development and maintenance of accurate procedure level cost information and will apply their knowledge of cost accounting principles to budgeting and case mix reporting for management decision making purposes. Responsibilities: 1. Focus on the development and analysis of information used in the decision making process, providing effective, meaningful feedback to managers charged with directing and controlling operations in order to facilitate both short and long term strategic initiatives.     Develop accurate and timely information used in analyzing current operations, problem resolution, and decision making.     Gather, summarize, and report on cost benefit data that can be measured and used as input to strategic decision making. 2. Serve as a financial resource regarding the use and development of the Allscripts EPSi Financial Decision Support System:     Work extensively with clinicians, educating them regarding the availability and use of case mix, budgeting, and cost accounting information.     Assist managers and clinicians in the planning and business development process.     Assist clinicians in the ongoing analysis of clinical practice patterns, including the review of cost reduction opportunities as well as clinical pathway development. 3. Assist with the organization and coordination of the annual capital and operating budgets.     Develop and educate managers and on budget processes     Coordinate departmental support of budgeting efforts 4. Organize the development of cost accounting and budgeting data in the Allscripts EPSi system, including:     File Extracts and Building     Data Validation and Enhancement     Data Integrity Issues 5. Champion the development of financial structures within the Allscripts EPSi system, which includes file building, data validation, process development, and financial reporting.     Develop a knowledge of the content and structure of the transactional system applications that provide data to the Allscripts EPSi system. Continually review these systems for refinements. 6. Provide guidance on the use of the Allscripts EPSi system as an expert-user, by promoting system benefits throughout the organization. 7. Champion the development of Key Performance Indicators used to measure the efficiency of resource expenditures as well as the effectiveness of hospital operations. 8. Assist with the ongoing analysis of information systems and data integrity issues and activities.

Were a nonprofit, regional healthcare network with two hospitals, numerous outpatient medical offices, a multi-specialty medical (physician) group, home healthcare services and hospice care, as well as heart, cancer and emergency services. Our leadership is dedicated to putting patients firsta cornerstone of our mission, vision and valuesas we deliver top-quality healthcare.From our extensive facilities in Whittier, California and Downey, California, PIH Health serves more than two million residents in Los Angeles and Orange Counties and throughout the San Gabriel Valley.The Financial Analyst works closely with the VP of Finance and other Finance Managers on a wide range of analytical projects, covering all facets of the organizations operations, including two hospitals, numerous clinics, and a large physician group practice. Strong people skills are essential in order to effectively communicate and engage with clinical personnel on a regular basis. This position requires an excellent working knowledge of all Allscripts EPSi modules or comparable software applications in order to perform various financial and operational analyses.Required Skills The ability to analyze financial data, develop and discuss financial, operational, and clinical metrics with both management and clinical department heads. Ability to create dashboards and charts on the EPSi portals. Must be highly-organized, have the ability to multi-task at all times and generally work autonomously with minimal direction. Strong communication and computer skills. Working knowledge of Allscripts, EPSi application is a plus Required Bachelors degree in Accounting or Business Administration with an emphasis or major in Accounting. A minimum two (2) years progressive work experience in private industry is required. Strong communication and computer skills required. Excellent working knowledge of MS Windows and Office Suite required. Preferred CPA certification with 2-3 years major public accounting work experience is desirable, but not required. Previous experience as a business analyst or senior accountant at a medium to large company is desirable. Hospital or healthcare work experience preferred. Beyond the benefits that come with working for the area's leading community healthcare provider - one that also recognizes the need to ensure patient safety and comfort - you'll enjoy an extremely competitive compensation and benefits package. We are an equal opportunity employer and seek diversity in our workforce. EOE M/F/D/V The ability to analyze financial data, develop and discuss financial, operational, and clinical metrics with both management and clinical department heads. Ability to create dashboards and charts on the EPSi portals. Must be highly-organized, have the ability to multi-task at all times and generally work autonomously with minimal direction. Strong communication and computer skills. Working knowledge of Allscripts, EPSi application is a plus

<description># **Business Systems Analyst/EPSI, Business and Finance IT Systems (34141')** **Category:** IT **Job Type:** Full Time **Schedule:** Days **Location:** Palo Alto, CA **Req:** 34141 # **Job Description** Technology isn't just an enabler; it's a leader in making the vision and mission of Stanford Health Care a reality'. We have a unique opportunity to take amazing ideas and make them real with the organizational shift in IT delivery, with the partnership with IT innovators across the world, with the creation of a health plan, with the expansion of the Stanford Health Care network and the building of a new hospital that will redefine health care The Finance Systems Analyst will serve as a technical contact of the EPSi and other Finance applications and their related environments'. This role will perform system administration, maintain SQL database, Add/Modify tables/Stored Procedures, install patches, plan and perform system upgrades, Provide tier'-2 support of applications, Perform daily monitoring of production jobs, and overseeing integration with other systems'. Performs duties including system administration, software installation, and technical configuration management of all finance (EPSi, Kaufman Hall') applications'. Assist in the planning and design of new products and system solutions Provide operational support including after hours and on'-call for system maintenance and operations Plan and coordinate patching and upgrades through existing change control and documentation processes Coordinate application support with other information technology teams including Infrastructure, Integration, Reporting, and the help desk Install and upgrade new environments, product lines and applications; apply application and environment patches Troubleshoot EPSi and other Finance Applications problems and work within Allscripts/EPSi and ERP team standards and guidelines Monitor/maintain operating system logs, files systems and directories and coordinate maintenance with Windows, and DBA support teams'. Review system configuration and design options in order to make appropriate recommendations for system maintenance requests ~DICE~ # **Job Qualifications** Qualifications Education: Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience 4 or more years of progressively responsible and directly related work experience in healthcare or technology related work environment'. Experience with 2 major Enterprise level implementations or upgrades preferred Demonstrated expert level experience with the following: Windows Server 2008/12, SQL scripting skills, SQL Server tools (SQL Management Studio, T'-SQL, SSIS, Team Foundation') Our IT Services (ITS') department's strategic intent is to build the digital future of leading edge and coordinated care'. We provide technology for all of our health system employees and clinics and also directly to patients through new digital health offerings - collectively serving more than one million patients each year'. Driven by lean management practices and a strong culture of partnership, innovation, continuous learning and improvement and empathy, we work to deliver the best technology with the highest levels of service and a premium end user experience'. At ITS, colleagues are passionate about working in partnership with their customers to develop solutions that will not only improve employee and provider workflows, but also make a positive impact on patient lives'. SSIS, Crystal Reports, WebI, Qlikview, SQL, Oracle, SQL Server, joins, subqueries, unions, Data, DDL, tables, views, ETL, mapping, DML, T'-SQL, Epic, Clarity, Compass</description>

Verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. Overview: Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver worldclass outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information. The primary purpose of this role is to help ensure product quality through the planning and execution of functional testing. This person will report to the QA manager within the Development organization. May have direct involvement in manual or automated test efforts or in developing and managing compliance to standards for process or product quality. Depending on the need and skill level, there may be more technical and/or planning and leadership dimensions to this role. Responsibilities: Represent the QA team within an agile scrum team responsible for development and maintenance of a portion of the software platform. Scrum team members generally include testers, developers, and a business analyst. Aid in developing acceptance criteria for user stories in order to assure testability. Write test scripts and execute them during the sprint to verify acceptance criteria is met. Work directly with developers and business analysts to resolve issues found during testing. Maintain a set of regression test cases and perform regression testing per release schedules. Create defects during testing and track them through re-testing to closure. Qualifications: Academic and Professional Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in a relevant program of study required Relevant professional memberships or certifications desired Experience: Minimum 3 years of experience in software testing and troubleshooting or 5 years experince in healthcare IT with a desire and ability to learn testing Self-starter, ability to pick up concepts and functionality quickly, willingness to learn Effective written and verbal communication Technical proficiency Attention to detail and persistence in finding issues Knowledge of the software development lifecycle Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of accounting principles (GL, Budgeting, Costing) ideally in a hospital setting Experience in the healthcare industry Solid understanding of SQL, preferably Microsoft SQL Understanding of test automation concepts, hands on experience a plus Experience in an Agile software development environment Experience with large amounts of complex data Testing experience in a cloud environment Experience with testing / defect tracking tools Travel Requirements: None Working Arrangements: Office based position in Chesterfield, Missouri. Relocation Assistance will not be provided. Work is performed in a standard office environment with minimal exposure to health or safety hazards A person working at this level would be based from one of the primary development and testing locations and would maintain regular working hours appropriate for the location At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 post-acute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, including holidays, vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, company paid life insurance and retirement savings. Business Systems Analyst/EPSI, Business and Finance IT Systems (34141)

  • Category:Information Technology

  • Job Type:Full Time

  • Schedule:Days

  • Facility:Palo Alto

  • Req:34141

Job Description

Technology isn't just an enabler; it's a leader in making the vision and mission of Stanford Health Care a reality. We have a unique opportunity to take amazing ideas and make them real with the organizational shift in IT delivery, with the partnership with IT innovators across the world, with the creation of a health plan, with the expansion of the Stanford Health Care network and the building of a new hospital that will redefine health care

The Finance Systems Analyst will serve as a technical contact of the EPSi and other Finance applications and their related environments. This role will perform system administration, maintain SQL database, Add/Modify tables/Stored Procedures, install patches, plan and perform system upgrades, Provide tier-2 support of applications, Perform daily monitoring of production jobs, and overseeing integration with other systems.

Performs duties including system administration, software installation, and technical configuration management of all finance (EPSi, Kaufman Hall) applications. Assist in the planning and design of new products and system solutions

Provide operational support including after hours and on-call for system maintenance and operations

Plan and coordinate patching and upgrades through existing change control and documentation processes

Coordinate application support with other information technology teams including Infrastructure, Integration, Reporting, and the help desk

Install and upgrade new environments, product lines and applications; apply application and environment patches

Troubleshoot EPSi and other Finance Applications problems and work within Allscripts/EPSi and ERP team standards and guidelines

Monitor/maintain operating system logs, files systems and directories and coordinate maintenance with Windows, and DBA support teams.

Review system configuration and design options in order to make appropriate recommendations for system maintenance requests

~DICE~

Qualifications

Qualifications

Education: Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience

4 or more years of progressively responsible and directly related work experience in healthcare or technology related work environment.

Experience with 2 major Enterprise level implementations or upgrades preferred

Demonstrated expert level experience with the following: Windows Server 2008/12, SQL scripting skills, SQL Server tools (SQL Management Studio, T-SQL, SSIS, Team Foundation)

Our IT Services (ITS) department's strategic intent is to build the digital future of leading edge and coordinated care. We provide technology for all of our health system employees and clinics and also directly to patients through new digital health offerings - collectively serving more than one million patients each year. Driven by lean management practices and a strong culture of partnership, innovation, continuous learning and improvement and empathy, we work to deliver the best technology with the highest levels of service and a premium end user experience. At ITS, colleagues are passionate about working in partnership with their customers to develop solutions that will not only improve employee and provider workflows, but also make a positive impact on patient lives.

SSIS, Crystal Reports, WebI, Qlikview, SQL, Oracle, SQL Server, joins, subqueries, unions, Data, DDL, tables, views, ETL, mapping, DML, T-SQL, Epic, Clarity, Compass

This position will need comprehensive understanding of Finance and Decision Support concepts. Experience using tools such as Allscripts EPSI is preferred. This position will be required to work closely with Financial Services and be able to understand budget, actuals, accruals, revenue cycle, productivity, and more. This position will need to lead efforts to integrate various raw data sources and build various financial analytical solutions to assist fiscal department management in decision making. Harris Health System benefits program is designed to provide you with more flexibility and choices in meeting your specific needs. Harris Health System benefits program allows you to protect your income in case of illness, death and disability, and to help you save for retirement. It is the policy of Harris Health System to provide equal opportunity for all applicants for employment regardless political affiliation, race, color, national origin, age, sex, religious creed or disability. Applicants may request any reasonable accommodation(s) to participate in the application process. Harris Health is a nationally recognized health system comprising three teaching hospitals and an extensive network of ambulatory care centers serving the people of Harris County, Texas, since 1966. Staffed by the faculty, fellows and residents from two nationally ranked medical schools, Baylor College of Medicine and The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth), Harris Health is the first healthcare system in Houston to receive the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) designation for its network of patient-centered medical homes. Each year, Harris Health provides more than 1.8 million total outpatient visits through its more than 40 ambulatory care facilities. Additionally, Harris Health sees more than 177,000 emergency visits at its Level 1 and Level 3 trauma centers and 35,000 hospital admissions through its three hospitals: Ben Taub, LBJ and Quentin Mease. Established by voter referendum to enhance the level of charity care available in the community, Harris Health System has often received national recognition for serving those in need and for its achievements in operational excellence, such as being named to the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 Most Wired Hospitals lists by the American Hospital Associations Hospitals & Health Networks magazine. Additionally, Harris Health System is pleased that each of its three hospitals  Ben Taub, Lyndon B. Johnson and Quentin Mease  achieved Pathway to Excellence designation by the American Nurses Credentialing Center.
