<description>Job Title: Decision Support Manager - Hospital Financial Management Job ID: 25312 Galveston Location: Full/Part Time: Full-Time (40 hours) Regular/Temporary: Regular Min Qualifications Bachelor s Degree in accounting, finance, business administration, or related field. Minimum of five years of experience in health care or related experience with a heavy emphasis in one or more of the following areas: financial analysis, financial reporting, financial operations, budgeting, database management and cost accounting. Minimum of five years of experience with the Eclipsys (TII) Decision Support System and/or Allscripts EPSi. Job Summary: Under general direction of the Associate Director of Finance, responsible for the day-to-day activities in the supervision of the maintenance, auditing, planning, organization and control of all activities necessary to ensure the timely and accurate collection and dissemination of information related to the Eclipsys (TII) Decision Support System and/or Allscripts EPSi. Salary Range From $61,887 to $102,113 annually Specific Job Related Duties - Provides supervision of and direction to staff - Provide performance evaluation of staff to the Associate Director of Finance and acts as a guidance resource for staff - Reviews and coordinates analyses including but not limited to profitability, cost, net revenue and utilization - Acts as the primary point of contact for all correspondence with the Allscripts EPSi help desk regarding all software issues - Assists and directs staff with particularly complicated analyses - Maintain and ensure the ongoing operational integrity of the Allscripts ESPi's files and databases - Coordinate system testing and implementation of system enhancements and updates - Work with staff to investigate inadequacies of feeds to the Allscripts EPSi system and develop more efficient and accurate methods for capturing necessary information - Supervise the loading and processing of data for the Allscripts EPSi system on an ongoing basis - Supervise the auditing of the Allscripts EPSi system data back to all feeder systems to ensure data integrity - Perform complex in-depth and large volume analyses of profitability, utilization, costing by service line, DRG, etc. - Prepare standard and complex customized reports for both internal use and as required for external agencies - Supervise the development of training programs for new and current users of Allscripts EPSi system - Ability to multi-task, prioritize workload and respond to urgent requests - Adheres to internal controls and reporting structure Preferred Skill/Competency - Experience should demonstrate advanced technical skills necessary to oversee Allscripts EPSi system operations - Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, Crystal Reports, database management, cost accounting, health care finance and hospital financial systems - Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills Equal Employment Opportunity The University of Texas Medical Branch at Galveston is an equal opportunity, affirmative action institution which proudly values diversity. Candidates of all backgrounds are encouraged to apply.</description>

<description>University Hospitals (UH) is a community-based healthcare system which serves patients at more than 150 locations throughoutNorthern Ohio, including seven wholly owned and four affiliated hospitals. Committed to advanced care and advanced caring, UH encompasses the regions largest network of primary care physicians, outpatient centers and hospitals. The network also offers specialty care physicians to treat almost every disease and condition, skilled nursing, elder health, rehabilitation and home care services, and occupational health and wellness. University Hospitals is the second largest private sector employer in Northeast Ohio and is within the top five largest private sector employers in the state ofOhio. Position Summary/Essential Duties: * Manage Decision Support Team in the maintenance and development of the Allscripts Sunrise EPSi Decision Support System across all UH System Hospitals & Satellites. * Foster and Champion a High Performing Department that is seen as a Best in Class model internally and externally. * Ensures the integrity of the data is intact, is translated into useful, actionable information, and is interpreted appropriately by customers. * Develops reporting solutions and analyses for management and senior leadership.Must work with Finance, Administrative, and Physician Leadership to build custom reporting including Dashboards, Standard Monthly/Weekly/Daily Reporting in a timely, repeatable fashion. * Collaborates with Institute Leadership in defining Institute Reporting views in EPSi. * Must understand the details and intricacies of the Decision Support System but keep a strategic, consultative approach. * Lead implementation of Professional Billing Data into EPSi to enable Physician Costing, and Combined Professional/Technical Cost & Profitability Reporting for employed physician groups. * Responsible for Quarterly Product Line Reporting, Physician Chair Reporting, Various Dashboards, key role in Institute Reporting. * Manages the Annual Volume & Revenue Budget Process for all Hospitals via Strategic Product Budgeter (SPB) in EPSi. * Ability to interact, on behalf of the Vice President, with all hospitals, departments, physicians, and outside organizations in financial affairs. * Manage EPSi Decision Support system for the Hospital System, including upgrades, enhancements, special projects, beta testing, & new development.Partners with vendor (Allscripts) and internal resources (IT&S) to help drive EPSi functionality enhancements & changes. * Acts as a thought-leader at UH and in the Decision Support Community to drive change necessary to meet increasing demands and pressures in healthcare. * Provide training to users and expand user base throughout UH. * Directly oversees staff members, andis responsible for ensuring their work output is satisfactory and their concerns are resolved.Is responsible for all hiring and related personnel decisions, completing routine performance review evaluations, training, scheduling, and the like. * Ensure data integrity of system and enhance reporting capabilities of EPSi Decision Support system * Provide guidance, direction, reporting, and analytical expertise regarding EPSi, data requests, & business planning * Produce quarterly Product Line Reporting, Physican Chair Reporting for Hospital System; Collaborate & Consult with Institute Leadership on Institute Reporting * UH annual volume & revenue budget model in EPSi (SPB) - all hospitals * Provide training to end users on the various uses or the system (costing, reporting, etc... ) * Develop & maintain costing methodologies & standards in EPSi * Monitor weekly/monthly production related activities (ETL process) * Serve as a resource and advisor on special projects and business plans that propose new and revised services for UHC patients Experience & Knowledge: * Seven to ten years progressive work experience required. Finance/IT/healthcare/management experience preferred. * Spreadsheet, graphing and analysis experience and familiarity with mainframe and client-server environments desirable. * Ability to develop and implement new systems and procedures as needed. Special Skills & Equipment Knowledge: * Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Oracle General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Billing Systems, Healthcare Reimbursement Methods. * In depth knowledge of Decision Support Software (Allscripts Sunrise EPSi) preferred. * Extensive knowledge of Excel required. * Excellent organizational, analytical and problem solving skills required. * Excellent verbal and written communication skills required. Education/Expertise: * Bachelor''s Degree in Accounting or Finance required. * Masters Degree in Business Administration preferred. Required Credentials, License and/or Certifications: * CPA Preferred. University Hospitals is proud to be an equal opportunity employer</description>

Title: Financial Analyst - Decision Support Analytics Location: TN-Nashville-Crystal Terrace Job Number: 1506045 Description VUMC Finance is seeking a Financial Analyst to support the Decision Support Analytics team. This is a system-wide role that will provide services to all hospitals, clinics and physician practices. This position will collect information from the cost accounting system and develop financial reporting. Key Functions . Serve as support resource for the cost accounting system and maintenance. . Identify opportunities for improved data capture and accounting practices, and actively work with responsible parties to enhance the integrity and utility of decision support information. . Conduct ongoing data integrity audits, including follow-up with source system administrators. . Periodically review allocation statistics for indirect overhead and adjust as needed. . Conduct ongoing reviews to identify new/revised patient care activity and establish the corresponding RVUs. Experience: 2 years preferably in a healthcare environment and system experience with Allscripts EPSi or similar decision support systems is strongly preferred. Qualifications: Job requires Bachelors and 2 years of experience or the equivalent. Preferred Qualifications . Preferred education would be in Accounting, Industrial Engineering, or Healthcare Administration. . A minimum of 3 years of related experience is required. Healthcare experience is preferred. . Cost accounting experience is preferred. . Experience with Allscripts EPSi or similar decision support systems is strongly preferred. Job: Accounting and Finance

<description>An excellent opportunity has arisen for an experienced IT Systems Manager to join The Royal Marsden based at Sutton, Surrey with occasional travel to our sister site at Chelsea. The post holder will implement, manage and further develop the use of the Trust's Electronic Document Management and Vendor Neutral Archive solutions (EDM/VNA) acting as a focal point for IT support and change across the EDM/VNA system. This is an extremely exciting time to join The Royal Marsden as we introduce strategic initiatives that underpin our vision, purpose and values. This post provides an excellent opportunity for you to use your specialist skills, knowledge and experience of EDM/VNA solutions to maximise the value of these technologies within a healthcare context. These will include:  Substantial experience in technical management of a complex, enterprise EDM/VNA system  Expert skills in developing custom electronic forms and workflows  Strong understanding of related systems and technologies such as PACS, DICOM and XDS  Knowledge and experience of the Lexmark EDM/VNA product suite is desirable Attention to detail and an understanding of how IT can be used effectively and safely in a clinical environment are important. Flexibility in working patterns will be required, for example to support system upgrades. An ability to schedule your own work, to complete set tasks and meet tight deadlines are also essential requirements. You will therefore need to have excellent interpersonal, organisational and communication skills. You should be a good team player with a flexible and pragmatic approach to problems as the role will involve working within a multidisciplinary team to develop the systems and the surrounding IT service. Full EDM/VNA systems management and ITIL training will be provided if necessary to the successful candidate. For further details / informal visits contact: Michael Horan, Application Development Manager 020 8661 3448 IT.Recruitment@rmh.nhs.uk</description>

<description>An experienced PACS Administrator is required to work for a busy prestigious private healthcare organisation based in Central London. The ideal candidate would be a qualified radiographer with PACS administration experience. Although candidates with radiography qualifications are preferred, PACS Administrator's without clinical qualifications may be considered. Whilst this is a private sector client, candidates with NHS experience will be considered. Any experience of administering Agfa PACS and Lexmark VNA's would be a distinct advantage as is the ability to hit the ground running. The client may consider offering either contract or a permanent position for the right candidate. This is an excellent opportunity to work for a prestigious high profile organisation in an excellent location. Please send your CV in the first instance stating notice period and salary expectations on all applications. PACS People is acting as a recruitment business in relation to this role.</description>

DescriptionThis position requires 2+ years of IT experience with Radiation Oncology system applications. Direct experience in implementing and supporting a treatment planning system and Oncology record and verification system is required. Prior work with Radiation Oncology applications like Elekta Mosaiq, RaySearch Ray Station, Phillips Pinnacle, Pipspro, Radcalc, Varian RPM, Elekta Versa, MIMvista, Sun Nuclear, and Tomography is required. General familiarity and competency with HL7, Dicom, Citrix, server administration, basic networking, storage concepts, IT security, system administration, diagnostic displays, and PCs is required. Prior clinical experience as a certified Radiation Therapist or Dosimetrist a plus.Exposure to any of these applications is also a plus: Epic, Fuji PACS, Agfa PACS, McKesson PACS, GE PACS, Hologic, Merge PACS, Powerscribe 360 VR, Agfa Talk VR, 3D imaging applications, Synapse Cardiology PACS, Lumedx Apollo, Hemodynamic Systems, Muse EKG, Qsight, Scottcare,and Paceart, Lexmark VNA, or Agfa Enterprise Management suite. This position requires demonstrable project management experience, excellent communication and presentation skills (both verbal and written) and the ability to work with users of all skill levels. Must have the ability to work well with a team. The applicant must be willing to provide support in a 24/7 environment which will include rotating on-call support duties during off hours, weekends and holidays. Work schedules may include some after hours and weekend assignments based on project demands.QualificationsBachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management or a related field (or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience) required. 2 or more years of experience in directly related job functions required.

Infection Hygiene in North Jutland looking at. March 1, 2017 one medical secretary for maternity cover approximately 1 year. In Infectious Hygiene consists of a section leader with the daily management as well as 14 health nurses and three secretaries.Infection hygiene is divided into two teams, a hospital and a primary team.Hospital team serving hospitals in the region, while the primary team carries MRSA assessment, treatment and guidance in both the second and the primary sector.Primary Team also provides infection hygienic advice to the municipalities where there is cooperation agreements. Your tasks will include include: Writing outpatient memos, correspondence or documentation in accordance with applicable regulations Telephone contact with patients, families, citizens, practitioners and other partners Requisitioning and ordering of samples in WW-Bakt Event-patient for MRSA team Meeting activity, including the planning, conduct, report and follow-up Secretariat services of hygiene nurses and section leader Participation in other Secretariat tasks Expectations for the applicant: We want you to have an approved training as a medical secretary There will be an emphasis on the following competencies: Knowledge of health and / or the region Experienced in AS400 / PAS, including Reference waiting time Distinct flair for IT Skilled in MS Office Knowing the PRI, eDoc, ILS Online and like the region's administrative systems written articulate Is systematic and result-oriented in the solutions. Is flexible and open to different tasks. The applicant must be able to work independently and make decisions, have good interdisciplinary collaboration skills and be able to grasp different tasks at the same time. We offer: Working in a creative and challenging academic environment and close cooperation with the other employees in Infection Hygiene Varied work on many levels A work environment with opportunity for professional and personal development Participation in the organization of this task in the Secretariat Wage and terms of hire Appointment is on agreement terms. For more information about the post, please section leader Jens Yde Blom, tel .: 97 66 50 09 or secretary Anna Krogholm, tel .: 97 66 06 49th Application deadline is 15 January 2017.Interviews scheduled for the week 4th
